column1: Text

I just want to say that this place is near perfection. Like  ... You don't get just good food you get a really good experience as well.The dishes are just so flavorful it really doesn't matter WHICH dish you select.

For a while now, my friends have been raving that ToT is the best steak house they have been too, so I've long anticipated going. I can definitely see why they feel that way. The experience had its unique highlights, one low spot and a swift recovery from that. (Skip to the last paragraph for the tl;dr version.)First, parking.... dropped my two friends off at the front door and was told "good luck". Parking lot seems undersized, but I quickly found a spot on the other side of the restaurant that wasn't too bad.We were early, so we took a seat in the waiting area where there are TVs, free popcorn / chips / fountain drinks, and the bar. My friend and I ordered some Old Fashioneds which were super sweet and not the best, but also not the worst we've ever had.Our other two friends arrived, one of which was celebrating her birthday. Not much more  time went by before we were being seated.As you walk through, take time to look around and appreciate all the art and imagery on the walls. We got sat in a smaller section of the dining room where one wall is all wine storage. The atmosphere is definitely on point for a top-notch Texas steak restaurant.We placed our food orders and got two unique experiences. The first, and one I liked the most, was being walked to the meat counter to choose our cuts of meat. I chose my filet and my friends were sharing a Tomahawk. They stab a numbered tag in the meat so you know it's yours when it comes out. The second unique part is the Salad Bar. I was less excited for this, but it's cool you get to build your own salad and make a healthy green dish as unhealthy as your heart desires.I added a side of Mac & Cheese and Asparagus dressed in Hollandaise Sauce. My bacon wrapped filet came and looked yummy.... except it wasn't the medium I requested but rather, on the verge of well done. I let our Server know and he apologized profusely. Then a Manager came out to apologize. I think the table next to me even apologized. So many apologies. They fired me a new steak that came out quickly, and was cooked correctly. However..... they forgot the bacon wrapping. Oh well, I want to eat! My sides were quite yummy although the hollandaise on the asparagus wasn't as tasty as I would of hoped. Good thing I enjoyed my sides, because they brought me two more of the same, for free, for messing up the steak. They brought the Birthday Girl a free dessert. My meal also came with a free dessert as part of their apology, so their recovery was effective. I can be bought off with food. Shouldn't be a surprise.Overall an easy 4.5 Stars. Awesome atmosphere, top notch service. Great experience choosing your own cuts of meat, and cool concept with the salad bar (if you're not feeling lazy). Though they made a mistake over-cooking my filet, they quickly fixed it and gave me enough freebies to make sure I was full and satisfied. Everyone else at my table loved their food and the service. Would definitely go back.

A Houston institution- you haven't lived here until you've been at least once. I've been several times but my husband never had so decided to let him see for himself on our wedding anniversary what the fuss is all about. Let's start with the obvious: I hate they don't take reservations. I think everyone does! However with ample seating, snacks and drinks it's bearable. I had the stuffed chicken and husband had a ribeye. I think next time I go I'll just get the salad bar, that place is heaven. My husband was very happy with his steak and no complaints from him. We got a complimentary dessert for our anniversary which was sweet. It was huge! All in all a great dining experience to mark a special occasion.

The best steakhouse in Houston.  Steaks, trimmings and service are top shelf.  I wouldn't bring a first date here -  your next date couldn't top it!Finest steaks cooked to prefection.  Everything about this restaurant is classy. Free parking and easy freeway access.  Wait staff the best in town, efficient and you never have to wonder where they are, nor are they in your face.

First time here and they don't take reservations, but have a nice waiting area with chips and salsa, soda and popcorn. The food here is VERY GOOD, your meal comes with a salad which is also delicious. The atmosphere was chill and family oriented. Dress code can be very casual to business and this place is kid friendly. If you're looking for a great steak this is the place to go!

Oh how I love Taste of Texas let me count the ways....I love you for your devilish Melba toasts with insanely good cherry jam and cream cheese. It's not my fault I have 3 plates of them.I love you for your Brussels sprouts with bacon jam that give a girl flutters just thinking about them. I love you for your bone in ribeye that's never dry and with crisp seared edges, dripping with juice (oh god how can anyone avoid beef?) I love you for the salad bar that's always bountiful.I love you for those spiral cheese breads that are so yummy I almost get too full....almost!I love you for the good service and always leaving snacks out for us while we wait for a table.But most of all, I love you for selling that damn cherry jam, for which my life would be incomplete without.

One of the nicest decors in all of Houston. The rich wood grain chairs and pillars with granite bartops. The salad bar is very well put together. Refrigerated plates all fresh veggies and plenty of GREAT options. I would literally go back here just for the salad bar.  The steak was extremely tasty. Although a touch overdone but I assume that's just based on the COMPLIMENTARY bacon wrap on my 10oz filet. Grilled shrimp was also very pleasing. Well prepared and Charred grilled shrimp as well as grilled veggies with plenty of that smokey goodness. The sides were a bit underwhelming. The asparagus was overdone to the point the asparagus spears had little to no snap or crunch. The Mac and cheese was well presented however the gooey cheesy goodness you think of with Mac and cheese was just NOT there. The Texas au gratin potatoes were also less than impressive.   The butter and cheese were just super greasy. All In all the entrees and salad bar are worth the cost alone. The sides on the other hand do need to be recalibrated.

I'd heard a lot about this place, but had never been. So this visit to Houston my family decided we wanted a good steak place....although I don't eat beef.....but I was sure they'd have other options here. What my mother constantly raved about was the salad bar here......sounded good to me.What a really cool place this is! Huge dining area...loved the high ceiling Texas ranch resort feel to the place. Service is definitely top notch from the time we entered through the doors and all through our meal.....everybody was so nice to us. Our server was so nice and friendly and did a great job making sure we were happy throughout.As I'm not a steak eater....plus it was getting rather late this evening, I decided to eat healthier....focusing on the salad bar, and so decided on the Salad bar with Grilled Chicken. Others ordered prime rib, fillets, salmon, etc. For appetizers we ordered to share the Crab Cakes and Stuffed Mushrooms. Oh, before I forget, we were served a melba toast like bread with a cream cheese and berry spread......and oh boy!.....this was so good! I never asked others how their meal was, but I did overhear my brother comment that his prime rib was not very tender.....I wonder if it had something to do to the lateness of the evening and that one of the servers came over to tell him that there was only an end cut of meat left? As for my grilled chicken....it came after I had already gone one round at the salad bar, and finished. I thought the grilled chicken breast was good......just right with a nice big salad. The salad bar was impressive....not so much its size, but the quality of salad offerings we could choose from.....I particularly appreciated that the plates are kept in a cooler so that our salads remained cool....everything at the salad bar was really fresh and yummy.....however, it was a bit late in the evening so I just went for one round. Oh, I did try one of the stuffed mushrooms.....yum.......and some crab cakes......eeerm, tasted a bit fish to me, but the crab meat were nice big chunks....my brother and mother liked them.I never expected us to order any desserts after all this food, but my mother insisted on a Chocolate Cake which wasn't on the dessert tray.....our server had informed my mother that they did still have some, but it was a very big slice...too big for just her, and nobody else wanted any,.so she settled for the Key Lime Pie......too sweet for me.Overall a very pleasant dining experience .......good food, excellent service, wonderful ambiance.

Amazing!!! The staff was incredible, the food delicious, the ambiance was Texas. What a perfect way to finish our vacation. When a company puts pride in product and invests in their staff first there is nothing but excellence coming out.

This place is fantastic.  The waiting area is very well organized, you received a ticket number which can be seen through out the screens outside and inside.  There's complimentary snacks such as chips, salsa, drinks.  Great waiting area, the salad buffet is amazing.  The streak is superb, really can't go wrong with this place.  Great decor and ambiance.  Definitely worth 5 stars!

I have been wanting to try this place FOREVER, but I've heard mixed reviews and that kept me from coming in. Flash forward to my cousin graduating college, we wanted to take her somewhere to celebrate and she wanted steak so here we came! So this place does not take reservation, we waited an hour for a table for 7, but it was definitely worth the wait. For appetizers we ordered the quail wrapped with jalapeños in bacon and the baked Brie. Holyyyyy baked brie! I could of eaten it by itself and been satisfied. I'm usually not a fan of quail because it can get super dry if not cooked correctly, this was not the case! The quail was super juicy and had amazing flavor! I thought it was really cool that they let you go back to the meat counter to pick your steaks. I chose the rib eye cooked medium (next time, I'm coming for that tomahawk!). It came with the salad bar and mashed potatoes as my side. The salad bar had such a big variety of different greens and extra toppings. I would of liked a bigger selection of cheese for the salad, but that wasn't a big deal. Once my steak came out and I took a bite, I could have cried. It was soooo good! Tender and juicy with the perfect amount of salt and pepper. I drowned it in the butter they top the steaks with and ugh, pure perfection. Dessert. I don't even know how we even had room for it. My son and I shared the vanilla ice cream in a toffee cone, we also had bites of the apple pie, and huge chocolate cake! I'm sad I never came to this place sooner, but I'm glad I finally got to try it. Worth the wait, the money, the everything, this could possible be my new favorite steakhouse!

Went for my Birthday..I knew I wanted to go for my birthday 2 months ago..been on a count down. Arrived early...2:45 because they open at 3:00 on Sunday and I wanted to be seated right away..(I'm old now and hate waiting) Was seated right away as soon as family members arrived. Always nice atmosphere there for me and very relaxing. Most importantly, the filet I ordered was incredible as it always is. If you have never been, don't miss the salad bar or the bread/honey butter is a must. As it was my birthday  dessert was complimentary and quite tasty. Family there made it even more special. I will always go there when I want a great steak. To top it off, for the first time in history, my recently graduated daughter, (GO COOGS !!) picked up the tab..miracles never cease....Service was great also.....like I say, Get in..Get out...Enjoy
Had my 30th birthday dinner here. Food was delicious and service was awesome! Thank you for making my birthday dinner a wonderful experience!
Center cut filet cooked to perfection! And please try fried shrimps, they re just amazing!

Had to come to work in Texas for a month, and absolutely had to have a steak. Really did not want to go a Saltgrass chain store, I wanted a something a little more authentic. I found Taste of Texas on yelp so I thought I would try it bout. I've been there twice now and both times it did not disappoint. The service is great and very helpful and friendly. I ordered a Tomahawk both times and I highly recommend them. I did not go to their butcher shop on my first visit, but made it a point to go on my second try. Adam C showed me and my party the finer points of choosing a steak and what makes a great steak. It was very informative and he actually was very helpful in selecting prospective steaks to eat. Their salad bar is amazing and worth the visit alone. All in all I highly recommend this place.

Been wanting to try Taste of Texas for awhile. In fact, I had to convince my wife we should dine here as we made our way from Austin to Houston. She gets weirded out by places where the carpet actually smells like 15 years of cuisine. The dining area (even with carpet) is quite nice. Possibly a bit dated when compared to the way upscale steakhouses (modern vibe) have progressed over the years. What really impressed me initially upon being seated is the amount of staff they have on the floor. We were immediately greeted by what I would guess was the section manager followed by our server. The amuse bouche was a nice touch pairing whipped cream cheese and a spicy pepper mixture similar to what Fischer and Weiser makes in Fredericksburg, TX. Small garlic toast is also provided. I actually thought this was the bread offering having not seen the well stocked salad bar. We both selected 6 ounce filets as our protein choice. Me being escorted to the meat case to choose my own while the wife freshened up. After tagging my steak, onto salad bar heaven complete with 3 different bread choices. Amazing cheese rolls, jalapeno cornbread, and mini loaves were over the top delicious. We both made it back to the table with salads we personalized courtesy of the near endless combinations available. Nice touch on the cold plates; shaving the blocks of cheese takes some practice. Mrs. Rooster noting the sun dried tomatoes and caprese salad with mini mozzarella balls was here favorite. I also enjoyed the Caesar dressing; wished I would have made room for the creamy cactus dressing as well. Our steaks arrived cooked to our desired temperature. We both had selected the green beans with toasted almonds and bacon based on our servers recommendation. I think this was the only foul of the entire meal. It seemed they were blanched and the topping added afterward. Imagine them being sautéed in bacon grease. Bacon bits were really tough to eat too. Not knocking a star off because this basically is a personal preference. Will be back!

Solid steakhouse. I love the experience here. The main downside is that they don't take reservations; however, they have a back room with free cokes, chips and salsa, and popcorn while you wait. If you've never been there before, make sure to tell them it's your first time and they will set you up with a great experience.

My boyfriend and I came here for our year anniversary and loved it! From the wine to the amazing salad bar to picking out our own steak and then how amazing everything tasted! Our server was awesome and took care of us great! Definitely will be back

DELIGHTED , I'm so satisfied with my dinner ! The tomahawk steak was seasoned well and packed with flavor the appetizer of my choice is gonna be the potato soup because Ive had a lot of bad potato soups nut this potato soup surpassed all expectation with striding colors. we went there with family to celebrate my son 13th birthday , he got  complementary dessert even know we were stuffed.The bathrooms had tvs in the mirrors !!!! this is how people get hemorrhoids LOL . BUUUUUTTT I did get to watch the astros v bluejays while washing my hands (awesome).what made the experince good was everything (that includes the astros beating the bluejays ). if you have small children that cry,whine, scream or make lots of noise youll get  kicked out there policy is children can be seen not heard ! and ... WARNING  this is a upscale classy place so proper attire is required !

It's amazing how busy Taste of Texas gets - I told my family we should get there well before 5:30 to beat the Saturday crowd; we got there at around 5:40, and we ended up waiting about 20 minutes. No reservations at ToT, so you either gotta wait it out or get lucky! Fortunately, they offer complimentary soft drinks outside, and for extreme wait times, they serve light bites.Once you're in, this place is packed. ToT has an upscale feel to it, but by no means is it exclusive. Obviously you come here for steak, and it's worth it, especially with a lovely trip to the salad bar. You put exactly what you want in your salad (if it doesn't taste good, that's your fault), and the bread is delicious, too.Steaks are, of course, excellent - if it isn't, send it back! Service is top-notch, and you can even ask for a cute commemorative photo if you so desire. Kiddos get a bandana (to take home!) and a cowboy hat (not to take home) for props...I wanted that bandana and cowboy hat, and they were more than willing to acquiesce!ToT is most definitely on the higher end of Houston dining, but I'd say it's worth the splurge periodically. You don't ever have to dress to the nines like other steakhouses (although you certainly can!), yet you still get a quality steakhouse experience for the most important thing: steak!
Perfect place to have steaks. I've tried many other places, this is the only time I was impressed by the steaks. Very tender. Love it.

This steakhouse is my family's go-to when we are craving steak. The ambience, the service, the salad bar, the entrees, the sides and the desserts are all perfect. My only complaint is that the wait time is typically 1-2 hours during normal dinner times. They do offer drinks, chips and salsa, and popcorn for you to enjoy while you wait, so it's not that miserable of a time. The indoor waiting area also features a bar. The outdoor waiting area is roomy as well, but it still gets crowded.The salad bar is amazing. Full bar of toppings and cheeses that you can cut yourself. But five out of five stars is for the bread. Oh my lawddd the Parmesan rolls are to die for!The most ordered items for our family includes the Ribeye with garlic butter, Porterhouse with garlic butter, or the Cowboy one. Literally. Melts. In. Your. Mouth. The flavor is perfect and the garlic butter doesn't take away from the steak taste.Try not to fill up on the salad, cause your steak entree also comes with sides and a dip for your table. We've tried the baked potato, asparagus with hollandaise, macaroni and cheese, and normal fries. All are pretty standard, but that's not what you're here for, right?Our waitress checked on us frequently and refilled our waters often. Their staff are always smiling and polite, as expected from a classy restaurant. Don't be afraid if it's your first time cause they will guide you through everything! Superior experiences, superior food, superior service.

No reservations, but the waiting process isn't too painful, as there is a space with tables and complimentary chips and dips, soft drinks, and popcorn, plus a cash bar.All our food was delicious, and I just think that the value per dollar you get here is excellent - huge salad bar (which included massive blocks of cheese - yum! - and bread), you can go back to the "butcher shop" to pick out which cut of meat (it's like a mini field trip!), and you get a side with your steak (seems like most places charge you extra).  Service was excellent - they made sure to ask if we were celebrating a special occasion, and a manager came by to check on us as well.Food details: We got filets, Brussels sprouts with bacon jam, macaroni.and cheese, and the Snickers cheesecake - all were delicious.  I've also had their chocolate cake, which is great (as long as you are a chocoholic fan), but if I had to choose, I would pick Snickers cheesecake every time!

I'm from metro-Detroit, MI.  Perhaps I was giddy from just landing at the airport less than an hour ago but I found this place fabulous...especially the bathroom, lol.  First the atmosphere, then the food and finally we'll get to that bathroom.  My best friend that grew up with me in Michigan has now lived in the Houston area for over 25 years.  She is a 4th grade school teacher; she takes her class on a trip to this restaurant every year.  The owner comes out and educates the class on how to run a business and most importantly how to be persistent, that success mostly doesn't come overnight. It was Christmas time when we arrived so the normal Texan decor was replaced with a lot of festive decorations.  The place is huge with a variety of dining stations.  There is a cute little store where you can purchase coffee, pecans and other Taste of Texas original items.   My friend said she loves getting the soup and salad for a meal so I went along and did that as well. The potato soup was a meal in itself. It was so creamy, filled with a lot of potato's and bacon.  It was the best potato soup I have ever had.  The salad bar was filled with fresh items. There were two huge cheese blocks where you could shave your own cheese to add to the salad or to just cut and eat with the bread or crackers. At the salad station there were several types of bread in the form of buns.  There was also a large selection of fresh cut fruit.  You will need a Texas size stomach to eat at this place. Before hitting the road to drive out to the gulf coast we paid a visit to the restroom.  While in the restroom I kept hearing what sounded like someone giving cooking instructions. Finally I noticed there was a tv playing in the mirror.  What a novelty...at least to this simpleton it was! So much of a point of interest to me that I took several pictures of me near the tv in the mirror...in the bathroom.  The other ladies in the restroom agreed that it was quite the cool addition to a restroom to have a woman in the mirror telling us how to cook, LOL!   We talked about the mirror, the holidays, our families, where we lived...it turned into an impromptu party as few left and more came in. Good times; thanks Taste of Texas.

If you want a great steak, come here. It's a little on the expensive side, but you pay for these experiences. I ordered a large juicy and delicious medium rare steak with lump crab meat. The steak of course was delicious, but the lump crab meat was the highlight for me. It was so soft to the bite and moist. Every bite I took I just wish it would have it replenished.I also ordered my steak with bacon wrapped around it. This one.. I never know why I get it because I don't think it pairs well, but really bacon tastes good on its own so why not?Have a glass of red and you'll just have a good dining experience. They let you pick your own piece of meat in the back. Salad bar has a gazillion options to choose.

I must say, this restaurant provides a great experience. The decor is interesting and I love that they set their expectations on dress code and child behaviors. This is a steakhouse and as a non-beef/pork eater, I can't comment on the steak. However, everyone at my table exclaimed about how magnificent their steak came out. We did have one issue of the steak not being the cook of their choice (wanted medium and it came out well), but it was immediately rectified and the manager came over and was very genuine in his apologies. I had the marinated grilled chicken, which was plated beautifully and was juicy and tender. I will say, I believe that they put so much focus on perfecting their main entrees (steaks/chicken/etc.) that they seem to neglect their side dishes. I had the garlic mashed potatoes, mixed vegetables, and macaroni and cheese. I love eating garlic mash and these definitely need improving. They were not creamy as I expected. They looked/tasted more like something you would get from a cafeteria versus an "upscale" restaurant. The mac and cheese was eatable. It came in a deep dish and had a very thin layer of mac and cheese. This was also not creamy like I imagined it would be. The cheese was grainy and tasted like it was previously shredded, which may not be a problem for some, but I prefer creamy mac and cheese.Lastly, the bread choices have potential. They baked so much of it that it sits up there on the cold side. Even in the warmer, the bread is not as warm as it should be. The cheese bread is the tastiest and the jalapeño cornbread is second best.P.S. the salad bar was amazing!! Everything was so clean and fresh. I appreciate a good salad bar.

This place embodies all that is great about Texas in one giant restaurant- friendly people, generous portion sizes, and good steak. I don't think the prices are too bad for how much steak you get, but even though it was good steak, it was just that and nothing more. The most amazing part about this restaurant is probably the waiting area, which has free soda, tortilla chips, and popcorn.

We came here on December 22 for my boyfriend's family Christmas tradition of eating at Taste of Texas with the decked out decorations all around the restaurant. This was my first time coming to this restaurant so I didn't know what to expect. Don't think any other restaurant could out-decor this place as it is the most festive restaurants I've ever seen. Being so close to Christmas and everyone's on holiday, we had a 2 hour wait for our table. Luckily, we snagged a table and munched on the complimentary chips/salsa and popcorn while we waited.When we were seated, the service is exceptional. Our waiter was very attentive and provided anything we needed. I had said something to my bf that I was deciding between two different red wines (while the waiter was like 10 feet away) and next thing you know, the waiter was bringing out two glass samples of the two wines I had mentioned. He had overheard me somehow in that busy/chattering restaurant.The salad bar is awesome. The bread is awesome with cinnamon butter. I really appreciate that this is included and you have access to it any time and repetitively! I ordered the 6 oz filet medium rare. It comes out on a cattle plate with a tag on it, which i thought was cute. While the flavor and texture was on point, my steak was at a medium/medium well state. It barely had pink in it. It was still super tender and juicy though and the seasoning was perfect. My bf ordered the 16 oz ribeye medium rare as well, and it looked like a medium. Next time, i'll probably have to order one level down in order to get the doneness I'd prefer. For sides, I got the brussel sprouts with bacon jam. I'm not a fan of bacon, which is shocking that I would order this, but the brussel sprouts didnt' taste like bacon, it was more of the sweet taste that that jam gave to the dish.Dessert... YUM. My bf and I shared the snickers pie. It is so delicious and rich. At one point, I jokingly was hitting my bf's fork away from the pie and later, the waiter gave us a to-go box with ANOTHER SLICE of snickers pie "for my bf's birthday". He mentioned he saw us "fighting" for pie and gave us another slice!!! But in all seriousness, there's no way i can eat more than a slice of that pie, it's so rich. I gained my work out this morning back from that pie itself.All in all, exceptional restaurant (minus the wait). Awesome food and service.

I have been coming to this amazing steak house for over 30 years.They once had a smaller place over on Memorial Drive.The owners are obviously still very active in the operation.The manager Chuck has been there over 35 years!!! Wow!The very best salad bar in Houston with home baked cornbread and assorted rolls to compliment the salad bar.The steaks are incredible and last time I enjoyed the tortilla soup and the salmon.We were celebrating a birthday and they even offered complimentary desert. OMG on the Snickers cake!They took a photo and the waiter put it in a nice card with a personal Thank You.The price was very reasonable considering we had Silver Oak wine with our meal.Can't wait to go again tonight to celebrate with great friends!Joe

Great restaurant for special occasion celebrations. The tomahawk ribeye is outstanding, 38 ounce with 14" bone = meat for a week. Make sure you ask to pick your own cut to Taylor to your liking. The Texas Manhattan is a nice complement.

This is my favorite steakhouse in Texas. They pretty much have everything right: the service, the price, the salad bar and the meat! The only drawback is that they don't take reservations and it's so popular that you really have to go at an off hour or you'll spend a lot of time waiting. I guess it's not too bad as far as waits go because they provide you with free soda or iced tea and chips & salsa for you to nibble on while you wait.

First time visitor was a guest to someone else.. From the ambience to the wine selection the customer service, the steak and lobster that I had.  this place was top-notch for any type of dinner! highly recommended; although on the pricey side but well worth it I didn't have to pay as my lady friend lost a bet thinking theTexans were going to win!

The atmosphere didn't have a typical steakhouse feel to it, it was really laid back but, the waiters and waitresses treated us like we where in a 5 star steakhouse.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the wine list is shown on an iPad. The food was good, but nothing to write home about. I had the t-bone steak while my husband had the New York strip.  However, he enjoyed the steamed broccoli more than the steak.

This place get very busy on the weekend so try to come early around 5ish 6 latest.Took my hubby and parents here for the first time and they love it.Don't get appetizers cause it can get you full really fast. Salad bar come included with your meal. They have cheese block and assorted bread. The cinnamon butter is so yummy.Do ask to go to the butcher shop to see the meat.We ordered the Tomahawk medium rare. Perfecto, taste soft and juicy. Definitely worth order if you come here. Dessert apple dumplings with cinnamon ice cream is a great ending to a perfect meal

I always feel underdressed at this place when I come here to eat. A couple of my customers like to eat here at lunch and since I am usually working in the middle of the day when we do lunch I look like the construction guy I am when I go. The inside of this place is very nice with some interesting displays on the wall in case you have to wait for seating. The food is top notch, great salad bar and the rest of the menu is great as well. It is pricey (for me anyways) but not as expensive as some steakhouses I've been to. I like the location just off the 10 as well.

First time going to this location after being recommended it since I'm a steak lover. We got there luckily before peak dinner hours arrived that we got seated right away. **Service is amazing here, they really make you feel special no matter who you are**I came in super casually dressed in shorts and everything but I was happy with the level of service that was delivered. Since it was my first time, they told me about their specials and how things worked there. When you order a steak, you actually get to come to the area to choose your own steak cut which I thought was cool. And also you have this amazing salad bar that you gain access to for ordering a steak. I ordered the Cowboy Steak since I wanted to try something different, and I got it topped with their Garlic Butter. Make sure you get it!!! 5/5 dish came out perfect, sizzling with flavor. Their loaded baked potato was amazing along with their Mac and cheese. To top things off, since it was my birthday they also brought out a complimentary dessert to my choosing and got a picture taken with a birthday card! **5/5 Snicker Cheesecake. This is probably their most popular dessert for is reason, it's awesome. For the amount of money that we paid and the level of service and amazing food, it's definitely worth it if you want to celebrate a special occasion here!

This place is unpretentiously amazing! The whole setup is absolutely Texas Steakhouse and although you're seated pretty close to the next table it still feels cozy.I admit that when I walked in I was incredibly skeptical as the place was packed and with a long queue. Got me thinking if it was just a touristy spot or something.We had to wait about an hour for a table but it was done in a really nice waiting room with seating and free flow of drinks (non alcoholic but you can pay for some), tortillas and popcorn. Can imagine someone eating and drinking so much here that they won't even need to order any main meals.Got out seat and was led to the free salad bar. I would pay just to have salad here! The salad is amazing and great selection of everything including with huge blocks of cheese that you need to shave on your own. The freshly baked breads would shame some bakeries.So far so good...I was having such a good time/meal that I was worried that the steak might ruin everything.Absolute unfounded!I ordered the NY Strip, sort of my go to cut for any steakhouses that I first visit. Medium Rare and spot on cooking with great charring on the outside. Great meat cooked right, It's so simple yet done wrong so often. I really wanted to try the Ribeye and tomahawk, perhaps next time I will.This place is legit. Great food and exceptional dining experience. I'll be back for more!
Nice place for occasion or birthday. Best steak house.Excellent service.Good location in Katy What a great place and the asmosphere inside of it. I will definitely come back here on my birthday.
Love this place .. deff on the expensive end but usually good things ain't cheap.Place has good vibe, great service & the Steaks are amazing.

There are restaurants that you go to once and think afterwards ... " It was Good " However once in a blue moon you get Greatness at its Best and feel dumb from it only being your first time there. I can assure you Taste of Texas is Great. The Salad bar, the drinks and the food is on a scale I have only experienced once in the past 25 years. When we first entered (Saturday at 8:30) we were told the wait was 90 minutes in reality it was only 45. I would change anything as it was a wonderful. They also have some pretty amazing desserts but the portions are so big there was no room for that.

Through the eyes of a life long Bay Area resident, this is the quintessential Texas steakhouse experience. From the moment the front doors open to reveal the deer, bear and other wild animal carcass, to the moment your Californian eyes lock in with rifles and handguns on display, it screams Texas.I was absolutely impressed with the old world decor and the intimate, romantic feel of the restaurant. The host is dressed in suit and tie and kindly walked us to our table, which is an excellent touch. On to the food, which in my eyes, was he absolute star of the show.Salad bar:Fresh, crisp, ice cold greens with endless toppings and countless dressing options. If you were starving, you could easily fill up on the salad bar and that would be a huge mistake. RIght next to the salad bars, there are two warming boxes of freshly baked breads. Again, you would be making a giant mistake of you fill up on bread. Grab a few to try, take a bite of each and let them go.Just let it go!!Cow:I think it's fairly obvious to all that I did not spend countless hours researching Steakhouses in Houston to spend all my time and energy talking about salad, decor and guns. I did the homework to enjoy the top cow in the town.Cowboy SteakThis 24 oz. "bone-in" ribeye steak was served medium rare, exactly as I asked for it. Slathered in house hotel butter and served on a giant metal plank. The very first bite melted as I attempted to chew. The second bite was better than the first and on and on it went. By far, hands down, the absolute best steak I have ever tasted in my life. At a nickel under 50 bucks, that's a steal of a price. I've paid $75-$100 for steak in Vegas and none of them match this side of cow.

I had one of the most amazing steaks of my life here. I was recommended this place from a friend and this place definitely did not disappoint. I came here with my bf and we both had a great experience. First off, the vibe and the service was top notch. The ambiance is very classy, but still had that southern feel to it. My waiter, Joe W, was SO helpful. He was very good at explaining the menu, and when we told him were heading to Austin the next day, he gave us so many recommendations of things to do there and even wrote some of them down. All the steaks on the menu looked awesome but I opted to go with the 24 oz cowboy steak (cooked medium rare) with lemon pepper and herb butter garlic sauce. The meal also came with a salad bar buffet and one side (I chose garlic mashed potatoes). We were able to go into the backroom and choose the cut of steak that we wanted, and Joe was great with giving us advice on which one to choose.When Joe brought the food out, he made us cut into the steak first to make sure that it was cooked to our liking. And when I tasted it.... OMG THE HERB BUTTER GARLIC SAUCE WAS SOOOOOOOOO GOOD. It complimented the steak so well and the steak was cooked perfectly and so juicy. My bf got a 16oz NY strip and that was delicious as well. The garlic mashed potatoes was also very good, especially since I'm a garlic lover. I totally underestimated how big a 24oz steak would be and I was only able to eat half of it. When we told Joe that we were staying in a hotel, he put our leftovers in a microwave safe container and gave us extra utensils. 5 stars for ambiance, food, and service!!
Aged beef was truly amazing!The portions were perfect to big! Quality presentation The only thing is they need bigger tables!

For out of state/country visitors, Taste of Texas is my go-to steakhouse to give them, truly, a taste of Texas. The experience can be defined by a homey warm atmosphere, excellent servers who go above and beyond, delicious foods and an impressive salad bar, and the message through it all: welcome.Upon walking in, there's warm wooden tones throughout and an expansive dining area with high ceilings. It has a Southern Texas feel to it. There's a nice waiting area with plenty of seats with popcorn and soft drinks.Once seated, the server provides menus. There are menus in other languages for international visitors! If you're from out of town, be sure to mention because they will come by and adorn them with cowboy hats and bandanas for a picture. They print and put the picture in a nice "Taste of Texas" greeting card for the visitors to take home. The bandana is also a gift.The salad bar is quite impressive, with two blocks of cheese at the end and delicious breads. The salad area is well maintained and clean. The server will take you to the butcher's corner and let you choose your steak. We also got to get a mini kitchen tour to see where the magic happens!I enjoy steak, but I don't like eating enormous amounts, so I shared and filled the rest of my appetite with the salad bar. After finishing off the delicious main entrees, the server gives you a sneak peak of all the desserts, which all look scrumptious. I personally like the ice cream in a sugar basket.The restrooms are worth visiting. There is a TV screen playing within the mirror, which I found quite modern.Overall, the experience is perfect. Easy parking, very service-oriented staff, great Texan atmosphere, neat picture & bandana gifts for the visitors to Texas, and delicious steak.

There is only one location and it is in Houston - 10505 Katy Fwy, Houston, TX 77024. This is the place to go to when you want a superb steak experience but not have to get too dressed up. The decor is western theme but the food is classy. I always order the Ribeye by the once, you are able to go to the butcher shop which is near the kitchen to select your cut, it is then tagged and cooked to your satifaction.Steaks or seafood this place will not let you downI gave them 5 stars but the only downside that I could think of is they do not accept reservations and most of the time there is a wait time from 30min to 2 hours depending on the night. Maybe one  day they will change that process

Taste of Texas is 1 part delicious food and 1 part experience. Great selection of steaks (tomahawk is especially good) and sides. The salad bar is next level. It is so fresh and delicious. The warm rolls are soft and tasty. The dessert tray features so many great items it's hard to pass one up, even though your still in a food coma.

This steakhouse is one of our go-to places when we celebrate a birthday in the family. Here you can find the greatest selection of steaks, meats and a pretty awesome salad bar with lots of toppings and choices to choose from.The ambiance is very romantic and intimate, which deserves it's high praise for a steakhouse restaurant. One of a kind in the Memorial area in Houston, Taste of Texas has been a tradition for me and my family.While the wait time may be long, it is still worth the wait as you enjoy the other amenities in the restaurant facility. The menu has a great selection of food from steaks, seafood, chicken and the salad bar! If you have never been there before, for your first visit, please get the Tomahawk Ribeye Steak. That will make your first experience memorable!

I really intended to get a picture but when the food comes and it's this good you just want to eat. Be sure to order something with a salad or add it on. The salad bar is fantastic but at the end they have 2 blocks of cheese almost 2 ft tall to carve from that. Next to that is hot fresh bread with your choice of Butters. The cinnamon butter is my favorite. But don't fill up here the best is yet to come. If your feeling Brave they have a 38oz Tomahawk Bone in Ribeye.However I was there for a lunch and decided to keep it light with the Grilled Tenderloin Medallions. Six ounces of grilled Certified Angus Beef tenderloin medallions served over bordelaise sauce and topped with fried onion strings. Served with fresh asparagus, a baked blue-cheese stuffed tomato. It was cooked medium rare and was tender enough to cut with a butter knife. Very juicy and very full of flavor.Another favorite at the table was the Marinated Steak Skewer.Charbroiled beef tenderloin flavored with a spiced pineapple marinade. Served with wild rice, grilled vegetables. There were so many grilled vegetables each person had to get a to go box.The service was as excellent as the food.

We had an anniversary lunch today with Jay as our server. He is the MAN! I will ask for him again for sure! Jay was attentive, intuitive, welcoming and accommodating. He was friendly, offered us a free dessert and a pic to commemorate our day. Our food- 6 oz filet and potato along with salad bar. The filet were so tender, cooked perfectly. The salad dressings tasted fresh made, real bacon and the works. We arrived before noon and the waiters were waiting for us, so we were seated immediately. There are other waiter helpers waking around, everyone was very nice and helped each other out. Oh and we had the key lime pie for dessert and ordered a slice of heaven to go. The food and service experience was exceptional. Completely worth the money!

Just arrived in Houston and my first thoughts secondary to business was that I need to find a good steakhouse! Three words... Tomahawk Ribeye Steak! Tomahawk rib eye is for the serious carnivore: 38oz of bovine hanging off your plate complimented with a pool of garlic or blue cheese butter. I'm a garlic guy so I chose that! The meat was tasty and well seasoned! Service was superb and the atmosphere was great! It is considered a casual restaurant but most folks here do dress up for dinner. Come early cause they don't take reservations. Going by our server, the place has been an institution for over 4 decades. I can see why!
Great cocktails, I had a center cut with crab meat and it was fenomenal. The customer service was top notch. A bit pricey but you really get it back in quality and service. Will come back

Our 2nd visit. Waiting time was max 15 min. Very crowded as always.We got a better place than previous time. Lucky me !We ordered a Texas mule (10.95 dollar) and a Carmel Apple cocktail (9.95 dollar) which were ... p e r f e c t  made.I went to the (free) salad bar where was enough choice to choose something healthy. It was fresh and tasty.My husband had the Cowboy steak (55.95 dollar) and I had the Grilled Shrimps (29.95 dollar). Our waiter was Carlos DE. He (and the service in general) was perfect.We will come back in the future.

What can I say? As a Texan, we LOVE our steak and this one is top notch - one of the best, if not the best, in Houston. I love love love the decor and the service! Southern charm and hospitality at it's finest. We come here for special occasions, like anniversaries and birthdays. They do not take reservations so if you come on a night close to a holiday, expect a wait - but it is worth it!The salad bar is fresh and awesome. We love going to the butcher to look at our meat of choice and it comes out stellar. The taste is delicious and presentation is great. I actually price compared the $/oz. and to my surprise, as popular as this place is, they have the best price around town. Can't beat it and can't say enough about this Texas treasure.

First time at Taste of Texas was pretty great. Excellent service, good food, and a delicious drink. I think the only thing that separated this from 5  was the ambiance was a little dated for my liking, and steak houses have BIG competition in Houston. It was good - but not out of this world. With that being said - I would go back.

So being a New Yorker, I wanted to see where this place stacked up next to Peter Lugar's. I'll tell ya the food was absolutely delicious. They don't take reservations, only walk-ins-even though we were a party of 10, we were seated almost immediately on a Sunday night. The decor is beautiful. Western, wood/cabin feel with dimmed lights very Texas. Our server Vera was amazing and very accommodating. It was super fun to be able to walk into the butcher's shop and actually pick out the meat. Vera was very informative and patient-she took her time to explain the different types of meat and how best to choose them. The salad bar is great, there is a lot of variety. The bread is very good. The side dishes however, seemed to have an overpowering taste. My sauteed spinach was drenched in garlic and that kinda killed the flavor I chose for my filet mignon. So in conclusion, this is a great steakhouse/porterhouse but Peter Lugar's is still number one in my book.

Taste of Texas is true to its name. Quality steaks, great service, awesome salad bar, and gigantic desserts make this a favorite of my family. Wait time: expect to wait on a typical weekend. There's a full service bar and complementary soda fountain, popcorn, and chips and salsa to munch on! They will give you a number and you wait until that number is displayed on the many reader boards. Salad bar: most entrees come with unlimited trips to the salad bar. This is one of the main reasons why my family keeps coming back, the salad bar is delicious. The topping selection is fresh and the dressings are different and flavorful. The asiago rolls and cinnamon butter are my favorites. Cornbread and white rolls are also available. Then to top it off, there are huge chunks of cheese and fresh fruit! Steaks: the real deal. All the cuts are fantastic but I usually get the filet mignon. Try it with garlic butter or bacon wrapped for extra flavor! Sides: again they're all great, but I really love the brussel sprouts with bacon jam! Savory and delicious! The green beans and asparagus are always perfectly seasoned for a lighter choice. Desserts: they are very generous with desserts and also ask if you are celebrating a special occasion. Even if it's not on the house, the prices are very reasonable for the size of the dessert. My personal favorites are the creme brulee, pecan pie, and key lime pie! There's a reason why this place is always packed and people keep coming back! The food is delicious and served with true Texas hospitality.

What a fun restaurant to go to for a steak night. I have to admit, Taste of Texas isn't my top to go place for steak, but I will choose this place for its atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, their steak/food is good, but houston has many good steakhouses.I love taking people to this place for a Texan experience. They will make you wear a Texas cowboy hat and a bandana bib if you're not from Texas. Staff are super friendly and professional, as you would expected. There's no reservations so you will just have to show up and wait. The waiting room has free soda drinks as well as other snacks. Both times that I was here, I didn't have to wait more than 15 mins.For the food, I always get the filet mignon with garlic butter sauce on top. My husband got his without the sauce and I think it's definitely better with the sauce. The husband and family loved the unlimited salad bar. And it's always fun to pick out your steak. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about steaks so he recommended which steak to pick based on how we wanted our meat cook. Overall a great place for a nice meal and I really enjoyed taking my family here for my bday celebration. PS: free dessert for your birthday!

By far my favourite steakhouses of all times. They greet and treat you like royalty to the end of your meal. I had different kinds of steak both my times of being here with my boyfriend. 1) First steak was the Poterhouse Steak grilled medium rare in which I ate it all by myself :D (it's pretty huge). They grill it to perfection and the waiter or waitress actually give you the option to go and pick out which slab of raw meat you want as your steak. Since this was our first time there, we kindly let our server choose the meat because of his better judgement. Minutes later, it came out so juicy and succulent that I just couldn't stop swallowing it down piece by piece until it was all gone. Then as we were standing up to leave, we see this other waiter bring in this HUMONGOUS piece of grilled steak with it's bones still attached to it. I kindly asked the table next to us what they just ordered and they said it was the Tomahawk Ribeye. I just knew I had to try that steak the next time I came here.2) So a few months after, it came to our second time visiting for a special celebration. And to celebrate this celebration, me and my boyfriend spilt between the Tomahawk Ribeye because for one, it's freaking HUGE and two, the waiter recommended that we share it. Although I satisfied my craving for this steak, it was not as good as I thought it would be. It was too rough for my taste as I had to chew it a lot for me to swallow. It was a good experience nonetheless.My favourite? Hands down, the Poterhouse. (Got me drooling again)Will I come back? Heaven's YES. (For another special occasion)

"The best steakhouse in Houston", doesn't come around that too often. So needless to say, I was super thrilled to finally get a chance to visit. The restaurant itself is huge, with beautiful, rustic design both inside and outside.After the host sat us down, she offered us the wine menu on an iPad which I thought was pretty cool. One little thing I noticed is that they ask if it's your first time there or if there's any special occasion that brings you to the restaurant. I assumed they ask so they can lend a hand to make it even more special. After our waiter - Coby (super nice and professional) took our order, he asked us to proceed to the complimentary salad bar. Everything was very fresh and delicious!Onto the main dishes, I ordered the Rib eye (first item on the steak menu) plus one jumbo crab cake with a side of mac n cheese. And we also got a Center Cut Fillet with a side of sweet potato fries. My steak was cooked beautifully, perfect temperature, wonderful seasoning. It enhanced yet did not overpowered the flavor of the meat. The mac n cheese was very rich and creamy, touch of crunchiness with a thin layer of bread crumbs. I wish the crab cake was as heavenly good as the steak, it was just a little too cheesy for me and the consistency was a little softer than I imagined. And the lemon plus the hollandaise sauce really overpowered the flavor of the crab meat, too much acidity did not correctly enhance the cake, instead making it a little salty.I had to skip desert because I was stuffed with the steak plus the mac n cheese, and the delicious salad that the restaurant offers. A wonderful experience It was, I look forward to visit Taste Of Texas again to try out more food from their menu.

In town for a conference and a friend took us here for dinner.  Outstanding!  The atmosphere was unique and the service absolutely spectacular.  The salad bar had everything you could have ever wanted; and then the entree arrived.  Timed perfectly I might add.  Had the prime rib, wife had the filet mignon with crab and Bernaise sauce.  Cooked to perfection with au gratin potatoes.  A must repeat; a great experience with old and new friends.

Our server keep rushing us, the restaurant is not even full yet! Because we are Asian and not so good at listening, she talked fast and frowned when she need to repeat it again when we don't get it. Steak is nice but not enjoying the experience. Will never go there again.

We frequent this place and have always had a great experience. The wait can be long at times but they do it right by having the best waiting area of any restaurant. There is a full bar, nachos, popcorn, and tea/sodas to consume while waiting.The staff has always been really exceptional, always explaining the process well and are on top of drinks; food ordering at your pace. Overall I think the staff are people that really care about good service and making people feel welcomed. You don't always get that at fancier steak restaurants. I almost always get the filet with a loaded baked potato. This come with the salad bar, fruit bar, cheese block, and bread. The steak is almost always spot on (with the occasional send back for adjustment) and the salad bar is as good as it gets. I've had several other dishes (Pecan crusted chicken, burger, chicken sandwich, French dip) but the steak is really why you go here. I've split a larger (10 or 14oz) steak with my wife and she'll order the salad bar only. This is a very reasonable way of getting basically 2 steaks for slightly more cost. Highly recommended!
Favorite steak restaurant hands down! We love their amazing salad bar and the steaks melt in your mouth!

"A Taste of Texas and a side of Jesus Christ."We didn't like the fact that ToT plays Christian music!  The server threw away half-eaten appetizer and didn't deduct it from the check (she never asked if I wanted it wrapped up). The service, food, and menu selections were good.NO MILITARY DISCOUNT.

Great food. Great service. We went to Houston for a weekend trip and decided to stop here for dinner. It was on Sunday and very busy. The place was very nice. The server was nice and friendly. We were asked to choose meat. They had a good salad bar. Dessert was good.

Just finished up lunch here and figured I would finally write a review after numerous other trips (work in the area and this is always a top choice for celebration lunches, etc...). Taste of Texas is a fantastic place to bring visitors to Houston. It's basically all the Texas stereotypes amalgamated into restaurant form and - oddly enough - it actually works for them. It's a good atmosphere and the decorations on the walls definitely give off an old cowboy town vibe. However, I'll hear people dub it the  "Best Steakhouse in Houston" and that's where I have to disagree. Do they do steak well? Absolutely. All of their cuts are top quality, and you can't go wrong with the cowboy ribeye or any of the center cut filets. Their salad bar is fantastic and offers a good selection of toppings (get the cilantro vinagrette - best dressing, by far), as well as cheeses and breads (can't beat a warm roll with cinnamon butter). I think their sides do tend to struggle, but since most the emphasis is placed on the beef, this isn't necessarily a huge deal and their desserts are also pretty solid (try finishing a piece of Snickers pie on your own, I dare you). I also can't fault the service, as their servers are always very accommodating and handle things professionally and promptly. What gets me is that at some point I think you are paying a little too much for the atmosphere. Having eaten at some of the other prime steakhouses in Houston (B&B, Pappas, Vic and Anthony's), I think Taste of Texas wins in the gimmick department and I don't think that is necessarily worth paying for. If you have out of town guests - absolutely bring them to Taste of Texas. They'll get a kick out of the place and enjoy a mighty fine piece of beef while they're at it. So, overall, I think Taste of Texas is a solid restaurant. They cook a good steak and offer other good options, as well, but at the price point, I think you're better suited to going to one of the other fantastic steakhouses in Houston and getting a less cheesy steakhouse experience, especially if you're a Houston resident.

oh.my.goodness!!!!!What is there not to like about this place?! My ONLY complaint is the very small area when you first come in through the doors to get to the desk to be seated. People love to just stand there and it gets extremely crowded. Food: wonderful, fresh, hotI have only had steaks here, haha!!! Small toasts brought out with the jelly spread is wonderful. Quail bites are amazing. Salad buffet is wonderful. They offer cheeses, bread, and different types of salads and dressings. Steaks are to die for. Lemon pepper seasoning and garlic butter spread are free!! Other places would charge you to add these items to the top of your steak. Sweet potato was wonderful. My drink was always full. Manager came by to each table. Cheesecake and coffee was wonderful. I have also had their ginormous chocolate cake. Wonderful but really should be shared by at least 4 people, lol!
My favorite steakhouse in Houston! Believe me it doesn't get any better than this place. The salad bar, the steak, and the service are spot on. I love going here and I highly recommend it.
The steak is very juicy and I suggest two girls to share one, otherwise you will be so full~~Don't miss the dessert! The chocolate mousse is soooooo delicious?

Does it get any better than this?  Perhaps the finest steakhouse I've ever been to.  Remarkable quality and value.You get to hand pick your own steak from their in-house butcher.  All steaks are well-aged.  The price of the steak includes sides and salad.  I highly recommend the cowboy steak.The steak is well aged and flavorful.  Perfectly cooked to order.  Perfectly seasoned.  Easily beats other higher-priced steakhouses.The salads (buffet style) are excellent as well.The service is top notch.  The vibe is casual and family friendly.

When I found out we were coming to Houston my first step was to find a steakhouse to eat. I immediately saw Taste of Texas and was super excited to come and eat here. And our experience was amazing, not only was the food delicious, but the service was outstanding. Good food is not enough to make an experience worth coming back, it is a total experience and we got that here. The desserts were so good, the snickers pie was my favorite. Thank you for making our 1st day and meal in Houston a moment to remember and to come back to!

I had dinner here last night. Arriving right before 6pm was perfect as there was no wait for a table, though slightly surprising as it was for 11 people. Two children were in the group, and the waiter asked if we would like the steak cut up for them. We happily said yes and the waiter observed one child smaller than the other, and cut the steak slices accordingly. It was a very nice personal gesture. Drinks also remained full, though a small pitcher generally accompanies the drink so even if our waiter wasn't on top of everything, it wouldn't have been an issue. The food was delicious, and perfectly cooked! I had the salad bar, which also carries fresh fruit and rolls. Then I moved on to the Baked Potato Soup, which was very creamy, soft, and had cheese stringing from every spoonful. I could not get enough of this! Finally, I had the Gold Burger with a side of steak fries. This was very filling, tasted great, and the end to a very memorable experience. Every time I've ever been to this restaurant has been exceptional, with this visit being no exception. The manager visited our table at the end to make sure everything was delicious, to which we couldn't stop bragging about the food or the waiter. We will be back for more!

We had a case of the Mondays and decided to treat ourselves to a deluxe take-out order at Taste of TX.I ordered the NY strip and he got the Cowboy Steak, both cooked med-rare.  I was a little concerned about the steak being overcooked en route home, but I was not disappointed; both steaks were still just right.Bonus tip: they will still allow you to visit the salad bar for to-go orders so you won't miss out on the jalapeño corn bread.

Famous houston steakhouse where family and friends take visitors to. Pretty steep prices, would suggest splitting a steak and enjoying the fresh salad bar. Steaks are quite delicious, especially the filet in the garlic butter (specialty). Tried the ribeye which was very good.Came here during a nonbusy time, which is critical. I hear the wait can take 3+ hours, and there is a waiting room with free popcorn, chups n salsa, and soft drinks. But still i wouldnt eanna wait that long.

I'm very sad to write this and give this 2 stars, but unfortunately I feel Taste of Texas  service has changed over time. My husband and I visited a couple of weeks ago, and when we go, we don't usually buy the steaks, because we prefer the chicken dishes or soups. With that being said, I feel that they definitely treat you differently if you aren't spending $100+. I understand this is a high end restaurant, my family and I have been coming here for years, but I am disappointed in the fact that I can see the difference with how some waiters will treat you, depending on what tip they will get at the end of the meal. When I used to come with my family and I would get just the soup & salad, I found it admirable that the waiters or waitresses in the past would still treat you like a customer who was purchasing a $40+ steak, but they have lost that quality over the years.

This is a great place to go for a healthy lunch  with lots of options . The salad bar is full of delicious items to pick from and my best dressing is the garlic cilantro . In addition you get some of the best cheese bread that is included in your lunch . All this for only 11.99$ what an amazing deal .We ordered two appetizers ; shrimp and the spinach dip which was a great choice .Plenty of food for lunch .

One word... AMAZING!!! This was our second time here and yet again they didn't disappoint! Our waitress was SUPER...sorry, I don't remember her name. Love the salad bar...and the warm breads are a bonus! Mother's Day was wonderful!

Can you say awesome! I am so full right now, my body says stop but my mouth just wants to keep chewing. I had the 24 oz cowboy steak medium rare. This was a huge piece of meat but it was seasoned well and cooked perfectly. I also got a crab cake added on, this was good but the cheese to crab ratio was off. Nevertheless, it was still delicious. My boo thang also had the tomahawk. Thats like 38 oz of meat that was absolutely delicious. I choose the baked potato with all the fixings as my side and although good a tad dry for my taste. Overall, I came for the meat and it did not disappointed. I would rank them up there with del friscos except cheaper. They will have to step up thier service, which wasn't bad its just not on del friscos level. The sides also need work, but i would most definitely be back!

One of the first restaurants my girlfriend and I visited when we moved to Houston. We got a recommendation from a friend and I had just finished paying off my student loans from undergrad so we went out to celebrate.We got the Texas Quail Bites to start off. My girlfriend wasn't overly thrilled with the idea of eating quail, but I thoroughly enjoyed them. They were juicy and wrapped in delicious crispy bacon. Whenever you need to make something irresistible, just add bacon, right?I got the Cowboy Steak and my girlfriend got the Center Cut Filet. The best part of ordering the steak is that they take you into the kitchen area and let you select the exact steak you want. They stick a little metal number in the steak and then when it comes out prepared you know it's yours. The flavor was amazing, I didn't even need the butter they provided with the steak.While you wait for the steak to cook, they have an extensive salad bar (that could honestly be a meal in and of itself). They have everything you could possibly want from a salad bar including the super grains and kale. They have whole blocks of cheese to slice yourself and fresh breads. Everything on the salad bar is unlimited!! Just so much amazing food, I guess everything really is bigger in Texas! Do yourself a favor and visit Taste of Texas.

This has become one of my family's favorites for a nice meal out. I originally took my dad and the family here for his birthday and my mom liked it so much we came to back for Mother's Day weekend!The only thing that irks me is that they do not accept reservations. I hate waiting for food... but they make waiting extremely comfortable. They offer chips and salsa, popcorn, and free water/soft drinks while you wait! They sometimes walk around with small hor'dourves as well. Beware holidays can be grueling... We thought we would beat the crowd having dinner at 5 PM on the Saturday before Mother's day but it seemed like other families had the same idea as well. Our wait time was quoted 1-1:30 hours but it turned out to be only an hour. Make sure you pay attention to the number screens which is how you know when it's your turn to be seated. I don't think you could wrong with any steak here. Steaks have always been cooked to our liking. If you like a more tender steak then get the center cut filet which is probably my favorite cut here. No complaints with the salad bar as the ingredients are fresh and neatly presented. The rolls, cheese pinwheels, and jalapeno cornbread are delicious and you can stuff yourself with these from the salad bar. Portions are generous here. Our family can share 2-3 steaks and order 1 or 2 extra salad bars for a nice full meal that is less on the wallet!

Average food for incredibly high prices. The service was great (we got a free dessert for a birthday) and the salad bar was one of the best I've had - it's even better than Brazilian steakhouses I've been to.I've definitely had better throughout Houston. Yes, the portions are huge, but when you consider how much bone and fat they have, it makes the prices unreasonable. We ordered the porterhouse and shared it, but a lot of it was tough to chew or just plain fat. The meat's flavor itself wasn't tasty either, it was sometimes dry and bland.
*UPDATE* Mrs. Hendee called me and was very sweet and apologetic. It shows great character when a business can actually reach out to fix and address issues of their customers.
damn good piece of meat!  Steak was cooked to perfection. the service was impeccable, loved everything about the place with the exception of the decor.Will visit many times over... on pay day.

This restaurant is really popular in Houston! They don't accept reservation but you can wait in front of the restaurant from 3pm. The servers are polite and do their best to serve you. It's a good place to celebrate with our family. Good atmosphere and good food especially steak which is famous. After ordering the food , they would bring you to the meat room to choose your steak and mark it.First time visit restaurant, they will free to take a picture to you with cowboy hat.
I want to give a big thank you to Norman Faust. When we came yesterday he really made us feel welcome and at home thank you to the waiters that help serve us as well we will differently be back

This is by far, one of the best steakhouses in Houston!   It's gotta be the largest. They have the largest salad bar I've ever seen,  you won't be left wanting.. although you may be full before your entree since the salad bar also includes cheeses you can slice, fruit, and various breads to choose from(the ones shaped like small loaves of bread are the best...those are my weakness) along with the most delicious cinnamon butter I've ever had.I order the marinated steak skewer which comes on a bed of rice with grilled veggies.   If you still have room for dessert... there are so many yummy ones to choose from but my fave is the Slice of Heaven.   ( creamy fluffy and light white mousse on one side and chocolate mousse on the other enclosed in chocolate trim with raspberry sauce, with a huge star shaped sugar cookie on top.If you have a bday to celebrate they always bring out a dessert with a big sparkler and take a Polaroid picture as a momento.  If you're in a hurry during lunch or dinnertime peaks be ready for a long wait.. no reservations taken.   One good thing is they give out sodas while you wait.
Great place to eat but minus one star for the lack of enough parking and long wait times.

This place is on my Houston top 5; if you're in for steak, it's definitely one of the two spots to go to.Service is A+ from begining to end. Prices are fair amd food... Well... Either if you're a big fan or nor of steak, you will enjoy it greatly! But, if you like your steaks, make sure your server takes you to the back to make your pick! It's worth it.Every dish is made classic style so you wont have any unexpected surprises. Also, with your meal, you get to enjoy a great salad bar.Enjoy!

First time here. It was amazing. Can't say enough good things. The wait staff really caters to you and makes you feel special. The salad bar is really good. I especially liked the different breads. I had the center cut fillet and it was cooked perfectly,  hot, tender and flavorful. For my side I had the baked sweet potato which I really enjoyed and I also sampled the brussel sprouts with the bacon jam, they were amazing! I really, really enjoyed this restaurant. Defenatly a special occasion place for sure.
This is my first time here and I thoroughly enjoyed the meal. Had 16oz ribeye medium well. So juicy and well flavored...

This is our special occasion place to go! It's right down the street and the only negative is they don't take reservations. They have a huge separate dining space almost just for waiting. They offer free soda drinks and popcorn while waiting. There are tables, TV's and a full bar in the waiting area. The salad bar is huge and the options are plentiful. They have huge rolls and different choices of butter. My favorite entree is the prime rib. I have tried several sides and my favorites are the asparagus and baked potatoes. They give free desserts on your birthday so save room for that. The creme brûlée is my favorite and the key lime pie is huge. You can't go wrong with entrees here or service.

I would not recommend Taste of Texas. They have no flexibility to accommodate handicapped persons needing specific accommodations, including a reservation so that Metro Lift services can be used. I'm sorry, "our policy is..." does little to meet the needs of some customers. If you don't know how Metro Lift (Metro with lift services for wheelchairs) works, they drop off and pick up 30 mins before or after the designated time. We needed to be in and out in order to meet Metro's s schedule. I will never eat here again. Perry's, McCormick & Schmick's, Truluck's... Anywhere, but here! Not very ADA friendly.Ps. Perry's - Memorial City was graciously accommodating.

I love going to Taste of Texas. Their salad bar is delicious! I love mixing salad with chopped eggs and caesar dressing. When you order a steak here, they give you the option of having your server pick out a steak for you or being able to pick out a steak for yourself. What I mean by this is, if you choose the option of picking out your own steak, your server will escort you to the back where their selection of raw steaks are held and you can examine the steaks and make your selection. For those who don't have a clue how to choose steaks, like myself, the server does a great job of explaining how steaks are chosen: explaining marbling, etc.I've gone to taste of Texas numerous times in the passed year and they've only over cooked a steak once. It was my boyfriend's prime rib. I understand prime rib is usually pre cooked and that it is up to the chef to slice off a good piece. The chef cut off an overcooked piece and needless to say, my boyfriend was disappointed. We were out with my family and he didn't want to make a big deal out of asking the waiter for another piece and dealt with it. Other than that, they usually do a good job of cooking their steaks.

Quite simply one of the best in the world. When it comes to Taste of Texas, its pure elegance, and pure deliciousness. This is an experience for your tastebuds, and your tastebuds will thank you for it. The quality of their beef is top notch, and they offer a variety of cuts for you to choose from. The cook of the steak is phenomenal, along with the presentation, and the service. The bill for most people is the tough part to get past. However, my bill was nearly $100/person, and i walked out feeling like i got a good value for my money. Yes, it is expensive, but if you want the best, you've got to pay for it.

Taste of Texas is by far one of the best steakhouses we've ever tried. This is our second time here since 2012. We order the Tomahawk Ribeye, 38oz of goodness with a 14" bone sticking out. We're from Orange County and we have ordered this cut before in different restaurants and it is pricey ($120 & up) in California, but here it's $60 and worth it! They also have a pretty awesome salad and cheese bar. For all of you foodies out there headed to Houston, TX in the future and want to have an excellent steak, trust me...this place is so good you'll want to come back for more. Our servers name was Sam C., he was great! He brought us to the back butcher kitchen to pick out our Tomahawk steak.

Lets start the review by saying this place absolutely amazing. Let's start with atmosphere. This place has a great atmosphere, and it's fit for any special occasion. It has a very upscale feel but not to a point where you can't have a causal dinner with family or friends.Service The service was absolutely amazing. Our server, Joe, was attentive and great at what he does. He had complete knowledge of the bar drinks and food menu. Immediately after we were seated by our hostess, he started us with a couple of waters while we looked at the cocktail menu. We ordered an appetizer while looking at the menu. Our meals came with a delicious salad bar, so while we got our salad the server was doing his thing and getting our appetizer and drinks ready. Upon arriving back to our table our drinks were already there. About 2 minutes later, our appetizer came out. We had had a good 15 minutes in between the appetizer and entree which was perfect timing. After receiving our meals, we were asked if it was a special occasion. We said no, but it was nice sentiment. While eating our meals he was always checking back, but not being pushy, which is always great. After eating he boxed our leftover food which was a nice touch. Overall 5 stars on service! (ask for Joe)FoodThe food was to die for! My husband had the New York strip which was great. We were even offered to pick our steak out. It was cooked to his exact specifications and was seasoned perfectly. It came with garlic herb mashed potatoes and a salad bar. The salad bar was actually great as well. You make it yourself, but everything is fresh and delicious. I ordered the herb marinated grilled chicken with sautéed vegetables and sautéed spinach. Everything was great and hot! The glaze that came with my chicken was just right for the meal. It was a cranberry honey glaze I believe. As far as the food was concerned I loved it and say 5 stars. In conclusion, I have no complaints and loved my experience. I will definitely be back in the near future. Also Joe was an amazing server, so if you get him be prepared for a great experience.

I had been craving big Texas juicy steak for like 2 weeks. My husband brought me here for our anniversary on Saturday and I ordered the cowboy steak. Jesus Christ that steak was the best steak I've had in my life. I had them put the herb and butter seasoning on it and whoooaaaw!!! To die for!! I love spicy with my food so I ordered roasted jalapeños . They smelled wonderful. Our server Gus was great. Only reason I remember his name is bc we have the same name. I will be coming back agian when I'm craving steak bc they satisfied my taste buds.

I liked that I got to choose my steak, however, the steak was cooked with absolutely no flavor. I chose a nice hearty tomahawk steak. The searing was beautiful and I thought the garlic butter would help but it was just very greasy and bland. The steak definitely needed more salt and pepper. Not what I was expecting. I brought the tomahawk steak home and cooked it myself. The quality of the meat was good and the service was fantastic but the food was only mediocre for a $$$ steak restaurant.

If I could give more stars I would !! Exceptional service, and food! Even though we had to wait an hour it was so worth it we ate popcorn, chips and salsa and free fountain drinks and and had bar area with tvs for anyone interested. I myself sat and conversed with family over popcorn. The waitstaff and house staff were so polite,professional, patient and kind. This restaurant is ran like a fine oiled machine. The food was superb my party of 11 that was with a mixture of littles and adults ordered an array of items from the menu. One thing that stood out was the tomhawk steak perfection !! My waiter Jacob was the excellent!!!! He made this birthday girl one happy camper!! We will be back very soon!!

Sadly, TOT just isn't what it used to be.Atmosphere is terrible for a place for a "good steak" - kids running rampant, no control.  Sorry this used to be a nice place to take a date and enjoy a great meal.  Now you're dealing with people that are wearing cutoff shorts -seriously!!!??? I've seen better dressed folk at a Carnival cruise line buffet; just sad.That being said, I would give higher marks for the food, but apparently the kitchen ran out of salt and pepper.  I received a perfectly cooked 14oz fillet but it had NO salt or pepper or any seasoning...again, just sad.For a "steakhouse" of this purported caliber, and serving quality aged angus beef, its almost a crime to jot season the meat!!I will NEVER be back and will tell everyone I know to avoid this place at all cost, unless you're taking the kids out for an overpriced version of Ryan's or Sizzler.
