This is the best restaurant I've ever been to. The service is always amazing and the food is incredible. I've probably been there 50 times over the last 20 years and each trip is a treat. Heck, I took my wife there for our first date and we've been married almost 14 years now!Favorites are the free cheese bread, the jalapeño stuffed shrimp, and of course, the steaks. My wife frequents Napa California and is always pleased with the wine selection. Many top California vineyards are represented. Best part for me is that even though it's an amazing restaurant, there is no dress code. If you go for a birthday or anniversary they will often times offer you a free dessert to share. Very nice.

I have been to Taste of Texas severaltimes and have always had a phenomenal experience. The staff is so nice and attentive. We've always been asked if we are celebrating a special occasion and everyone always makes a fuss. I love the free dessert and photo, such a nice touch. The old school vibe is fun, the food is excellent and for the experience, I feel the price is fair.

I've been coming here since they opened. I never eat red meat bit this place is great for their salad bar and plenty other things. I usually come for the salad bar the potato soup is great too. I had the Texas Punch cocktail today and it was fabulous not to sweat just right.

So glad I got to dine here for my friend's birthday. They have the best salad bar at a steakhouse ever! Their bread and butter selections are so good!For entreé, I ended up getting the beef tenderloin salad because I was in a mood for a nice, refreshing salad with some meat and shrimp on the side because I wasn't in the mood for a big, hearty slab of meat. Those calories add up, man. My salad turned out to be very delicious. Then my boyfriend ended up getting the 16oz New York Strip steak and maannnn, that thing had so much garlic butter smeared, it looked very tasty. I didn't end up finishing my food, as always, so I packed it to-go and ordered some desserts. I got the Slice of Heaven and my friend got the Cheesecake and it looked like the cheesecake wasn't that important because they didn't finish it but the Slice of Heaven was pretty tasty and they liked it. Since it was my friend's bday we sang happy birthday and they took a picture of us then gave us each a little greeting card saying thank you for dining with them. Wow that's southern hospitality right there. Definitely coming back to try a hearty steak this time!!

One of the best steakhouses in Houston. I gave it 4 stars because of the long wait, otherwise it would hv been a 5 star. It's a well known fact that you wait at least 30mins any day between 6-730pm at the Taste of Texas. They do offer free drinks, chips, salsa and popcorn at the waiting area. The salad bar is very clean with a variety of fresh selection of dressing and vegetables, and fresh warm bread available. Our waitstaff, Jason was very polite, explained to my boys the different steak cuts and invited them to pick the steaks from the kitchen. Our Tomohawk steak was a more rare that we wanted and was redone to our liking. To make up for this, we were given a complimentary dessert of our choice. Could not ask for a better service, not to mention good food.

Had heard a lot about Taste of Texas.There really isn't much to say about this place.Amazing service, food that surpasses your expectations, and just a great atmosphere.This is now my place for steak (especially the fillet!).  Salad bar is plentiful, and the breads (with different butters) are to die for.

Thank you to the amazing team at Taste of Texas! We had (as usual) a wonderful experience, our waiter misheard our order, but quickly fixed it. The manager Jay, stopped by and apologized and ensured we were still having a great experience. Thank you!

Havent been here in years! Went with my gma today for a belated bday celebration....man have they stepped up their game on service! The wait staff diligently work together as a TEAM ! Its amazing...my drink was never below half way, a dirty dish never sat on the table,  they are very attentive, and the food matches! Course theyve always had good food, but you dont always find such amazing staff...keep up the good work guys!

Dinner today with a friend at 6 pm. INstant seating. Service best I've had in a looong time. Courteous, efficient and attentive. Never an empty glass. Not to mention constantly replenished salad bar and excellent dinne. We Alison had dessert and Irish coffee. Yum.

Perfection of a restaurant. Everything was excellent!! Great service, salad bar is fresh with plenty of choices, bread is addictive. We had beef medallions and grilled shrimp. Decoration is very nice and cozy. Perfect place for special ocassion and worth every $$$ you spend. Cory, our waiter was professional and personable and attentive to our needs. General manager stopped at table to welcome and chat with us. We will be back !!

A big steak lover, I was so looking forward to eating here for the first time. Everyone has told me great things about the place and its gotta be good when its this busy and you have to wait all the time right? So the waiting area is cool and all, with nachos and drinks. Pretty short wait on a weekday night, maybe 10 minutes. The salad bar was like the most amazing thing I have ever seen. I'd come here just for that even... and the appetizers were all on point. Then I got to choose my steak, the texas cowboy rib eye, added butter on top. I have to admit I was slightly disappointed in it. It seemed rather bland and dry, a tad bit overcooked so it was on the stiff tasteless side. It was seasoned too lightly for my taste, and the meat was too tough and chewy for my liking. The price is fair, but it doesn't stand up against some of my favorite Houston steak houses. The key lime pie is good though. Not sure I would come back here, though the service is amazing, the vibe is great, just the steak was whatever. Maybe it was just a bad day, who knows. But it certainly did not live up to the hype.

This was my first time to Houston and it was only a one day trip for me. I found this restaurant on Yelp and I must say, this is one of the best restaurants I have been to in a long time. Great experience from the minute I stepped in.
I love this family-owned steak house!! Best salad bar in town. Service is awesome! Steaks are juicy.

What drew us here was The Tomahawk, which is a 30-something ounce ribeye steak. We are in constant search of a good steak, and honestly, we always feel extremely let down. Usually because of the quality of food, but also because steak is not typically cheap. We have not been able to find a place with an awesome ambiance, great service, and most importantly, great food! Until today! We made the trek from Austin to Houston, just to test out The Tomahawk. We were lucky enough to get there right around the time they opened, literally minutes before the storm of people appeared. We were seated in a timely manner. The server, Michael, was very attentive and showed us around the menu. We got a cocktail called The Hendrix Cooler. It was divine. We also got the shrimp appetizer, which was the least impressive item on our table, but still delicious. Our huge steak came with one side, garlic mashed potatoes, and a salad from the massive salad bar, which offers a plethora of choices. We added on a second side Dallas, as well as an order of the sautéed mushrooms. After ordering, we were escorted to the back to CHOOSE our own steak.Overall, the food was amazing. The bill came out to about $115, before tip. For literally the first time ever, we did not leave a steak house feeling extremely disappointed. On top of all of that, the manager came by our table to thank us for making the trip, and offered us a complementary dessert. Of course we were busting at the seams, but we did choose the pecan pie to take to go. (Kind of wish we would have listen to Michael, and chosen the Snickers cheese cake, but hey.) Michael also put our food in a container, and wrapped up the huge bone for our dog. We literally do not give five stars. Ever. But the food here, as well as the service we're completely outstanding. We never go to Houston, but we now have a reason! Side note: This steak is totally shareable. We left with more than half of it.

Brought a client here the other night and what a great meal. The wait is always a bit of an issue but if you plan on it there is no problem.  Great steaks, cold beer and delicious desserts.  We had the turtle cheesecake and it is a two night dessert.  It's so rich you can eat on it for two days.

Good lord sweet Jesus the best steak I've ever had and I'm from Cali. If I could give them 10 stars I would, where do I begin? The customer service was excellence(he deserved that huge tip) the salad bar is all you can eat so fresh and so many choices I loved, they take you to the back to select what cut you prefer and u can see which marbling you like, surprisingly my bill was so cheap for 6 people I expected at least 1k but was only $330. I would def come back here and already recommend all family and friends when they are around Houston Texas. Hopefully I can find one as good out here!
COWBOY RIBEYE OMG!Jalepeno-fried Shrimp to die for!The best Pecan Pie I've ever had!!!Great service too!

Both of the times I came here were for a birthday dinner. Before this I really did not enjoy eating steak as much as I do now. My friends raved about this place and I pretty much have to agree with what they were saying. Service is excellent. If you go on your birthday, you'll get a free printed out photo of you and your party, as well as a free dessert! I got the center cut filet with garlic butter which comes with a side and a trip to the salad bar. The meat is so tender and flavorful..... Yumz. Craving it right now. My personal favorite side is the Mac and cheese. So yummy and oozing of cheeeeeesiness.
My employer treated us to lunch and it was delicious!!!  The food was phenomenal as was the service the parking was scarce but I guess that's what happens during the peak of lunchhour on a Friday.

Now this is a Texas steakhouse ! I've heard nothing but positive regarding this place and  finally got the opportunity to go.The parking is their free lot so no issue there . As you enter you are hit with classy meets Texas (if that makes sense); I mean there's guns and even a bear  but crowd is dressed proper and the service is top notch.But where this place excels is where it matters most...the !steak. For appetizer I had the tortilla soup  which I feel is worth skipping; not a great start .    You get the opportunity to choose your own steak which is fun little tidbit and boy is the steak delicious  ! The 14oz filet is up there in my personal favorite (and if you see my reviews I've been to many all over the u.s.). Topped with melting butter that adds to an already exquisite steak cooked properly, I have no complaints . Also on the menu is the ridiculous 38oz tomahawk  t bone . My brother ordered it and finished it proving the taste must have been good. Side was the mac and cheese that won't disappoint . Not  the best I've tried but again it will satisfy. Important to note each side is personal size not a la carte.    Each steak entrée comes with complete salad bar and it's a top notch one with great variety including dinner rolls. For dessert we had the apple dumpling with cinnamon ice cream; good not great but worth trying. I would probably go with something else next time.                                                             Overall: great steak!!!! The best of the best steak!!! Great dessert menu and excellent  salad bar that comes with your steak entré.    It's probably 4.5.stars overall (side dish good not great , soup was eh, dessert was good not great) but the steak is 5 stars all the way Cheers!

"Blown Away!" That is exactly how I feel after my wife just tried this place for the first time.Vibe: casual, spacious, comfortableFood: fresh, tasty, properly portionedService: attentive, genuine, kindI think TofT's salad bar is better than Whole Foods, Salata & Sweet Tomato. Food was perfectly cooked with light seasoning to compliment the natural food flavors.  Bravo to the owners, management team and staff for creating such an unforgettable experience.

Meat Fest!  I hadn't been here in 20 years and would love to go back tomorrow.  Perhaps the best ribeye I've ever had.  Impeccable service and a really cool atmosphere.Took one of my teammates here and as an ex D1 Lineman, he can take down some serious protein.  Well, the 37oz tomahawk was a challenge but it ended up being toast.  I had a 22 oz Ribeye and the thing was absolutely perfect.We'll need some serious gym time to offset this night!  Great crew, awesome food and thankful for such a great night.

Very low key establishment but do not overlook this place. Plenty of parking in the back. Go in and get a reservation card and wait roughly 45-60 min on a busy night. Right off the bat, great service! Our server Robbie made us feel comfortable and we had a great time for our bachelor party. The manager came by to say hi as well and was really nice.ONTO THE FOOD! BEST BEST BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD! I would eat Taste of Texas over any fancy steakhouse in California any day. Everyone had their steaks perfectly cooked, it's amazing how consistent they are. I loved that they take you back to the kitchen to pick out the exact steak you'll be eating. Robbie was great in explaining the difference between a lean and a fattier steak. Also their tomahawks are on point! This place has great value for what you pay for, their salad bar has great quality. Their fruits and pineapples are perfectly sweet and delicious as well. The goto place if you are in town and love steak.

I seldom use yelp to add a review but I just had to today. I went to Taste of Texas for the first time with friends and I didn't really know what to expect. I typically go to the steakhouse's that offer reservations and have valet service (I know that makes me sound snooty but I only go to these places a few times a year, so calm down ppl). Anyway, Del Frisco's,  Pappas Bros Steak House and Ruth's Chris had nothing on this! Oh my goodness, it was sooooo fantastic. So on to the details.. We arrived on Thursday evening around 7:00. NO PARKING ANYWHERE. We drove around the huge parking lot a few times when we eventually drove to the bed bath and beyond next door and walked over. (It was actually closer to the front door than their parking) Next, we received a number and were told it'd be a 15 min wait. Not too long considering how busy they were. There are lots of areas to sit and they had these monitors that post the diners number when their table is ready. When we were seated, Anthony introduced himself as our waiter and gave us a moment to look over the menus. My friends and I all ordered the 38 oz Tomahawk Ribeye with a side dish for less that $60. It also comes with a complimentary light salad bar and bread/cheese. My friends and I know not to fill up on salad when we came for the good stuff. We didn't have to wait too long before our ridiculous piece of meat came out and it was BEAUTIFUL! Now, my friends and I looked pretty silly attempting to eat this beast and I also heard the neighboring tables comment on the steaks when they were setting them on our table. First bite OMG... so juicy and flavorful. They offer some butterherb and other things you can put on top of the steak but I'm just a salt and pepper kind of girl. No need for me to mask the flavor of a well cooked piece of meat. Anthony is such a great waiter, he kept checking on us several times throughout our dinner to make sure we had everything we needed. He was very conversational too, which is always appreciated. My friends and I kept joking about how they were going to pack our leftovers to go and Anthony told us he had a method to this madness. The 3 of us ending up walking out of the restaurant with 3 togo boxes with a bone wrapped in foil sticking out of the box. FYI, this whole meal including tax and gratuity cost us $270 which came out to $90 a person. The same meal at another steakhouse would have easily cost us $350 or more. Just saying....

This was a great steak house experience my friend and I both came in for just a weekend and wanted a great Texas steak. I'm from Arizona Chandler that is and other guest from Atlanta it was a great experience picked out our steaks staff and manager was greatest service ever I say 200% and yes it was worth the cost. I had the cowboy and he had the porterhouse. Cost doesn't matter if it bomb.! This what we do on a regular Enjoy and check it out when in H-town!

Great atmosphere and service, food was so-so.  I'm a big eater and appreciate good restaurant and a good piece of meat. When my steak that I ordered medium rare came out cooked incorrectly I was a little skeptical about what is happening in the kitchen.

5 stars and this is why...This is officially my ultimate favorite place to eat in Houston! Just pulling up to the restaurant has a major grand entrance. Ample parking always available. Depending on when you go there may be a wait. Usually on the weekends for dinner time you will have to wait approximately 20 minutes to 30 minutes before getting a table. Having said that you won't feel the way as you do at most other places as they have a very comfortable waiting lounge. The waiting lounge consists of complementary beverages popcorn chips and TVs as well as a full bar.Upon being seated the waitstaff is extremely attentive and quick! They have great knowledge of the menu, And are always pleasant. they have a large selection of steaks, but we always order the fillet. You have the option of going into the  kitchen area and picking out which steak you would like. No joke, the steak always comes out cooked to perfection! I highly recommend the Lemon pepper rub and the garlic butter. Upon ordering a steak entrée, it buys you a trip to the salad bar. And let me tell you about the salad bar! It is possibly the best in town! It also has a bread selection that consists of cornbread dinner rolls and another cheesy bread.The dessert menu is off the chain! I don't care what you order when you go there but you have to order the snickers cheesecake! Ahhhh mazzzzz inggggg!!!! Every time we've been here our experience always gets better and better! Shout out to Paul our server! If you have business meetings or guests from out of town this is the perfect place to bring them! Make sure to mention that they are from out of town for a special souvenir. They will truly get a taste of Texas!

This used to be my first choice to eat steak out and celebrate special occasions. We live in Bryan College Station so we drive 100 miles when we choose to dine there. They have a top notch salad bar that is quite expensive when ordered by itself. Now on to the steaks. It is nice to go into their "Butcher Shop" and select your steak however be prepared for the high priced options from which you select. They offer you the option to have your steak served on a sizzling metal plate. Sounds like a good idea and makes for nice presentation however you need to beware that your steak will continue to cook while on this sizzling metal plate while you are trying to dine. In other words, it will end up being well done no matter how you desire it to be prepared.They do not explain this and thus after paying $50- $60 for your choice steak it will be very disappointing to cut into a steak that you ordered med-rare to find that it is well done and thus dried out and tasteless. It is frustrating even more when they agree to bring you out another steak after you have consumed over half of the first steak that was over cooked.  Because your spouse had ordered a different item, you sit like a toad while you wait the additional 15-20 minutes for your second steak to be brought to your table. Instead of them offering to just not charge you for the over cooked steak or charge you only 50 % they bring you the second steak which you end up taking home and reheating it the next day in the microwave and having it be tough and dried out because it was not eaten freshly cooked. Do not waste your time contacting the owner as she will only call you and make excuses by telling you that they have over 70 cameras throughout the facility and their review of the videos reveal that everything was to their standards and they made things right by bringing you the 2nd steak at no charge even though it was 20 minutes after your initial complaint and your partner had already finished their meal while you waited for the 2nd steak to be cooked. By that time, you are no longer interested in eating your 2nd steak much less taking it home and re-warming it in a microwave and it being like a piece of rubber. When she tells you repeatedly that they have videos all over the restaurant and it appeared from their video  review that you and your spouse had a pleasant evening from the facial expressions they saw on the video, it makes you a bit uncomfortable thinking if they monitor you that closely, then you may not want to enter the bathroom as you may be on video. The owner felt they make things right because they got their money and do not care whether you had a pleasant dining experience especially if it was a special occasion. I took her comments and response as an insult. They could have offered a gift card to replace the steak and remove that charge from that evenings ticket rather than provide you another steak which will ultimately be overcooked when reheated at home the next day. Thus, I will not be returning for any occasion especially any special occasion. I would encourage others to be wary of their policy on making things right with a Customer. The owner pushed up to me that they serve 1000 customers per day as if numbers mean everything. It does not say much about Customer satisfaction as eventually all people will eventually get frustrated if they experience what we experienced on our 43rd wedding anniversary. The owner is more interested in making excuses and using her extensive video system to ensure she has a basis for her excuses. I encourage you to celebrate your special occasion at the many other restaurants in Houston that know what true Customer Service means. It should mean Customer Satisfaction and not owner satisfaction that they sent the Customer away full but not satisfied.

Well let's see here I would say we are well overdue on visiting this restaurant we normally come here about once a year or more but for some reason I have not been last couple of years don't know why exactly just haven't been as for the restaurant they've got a terrific's salad bar I actually used to know the guys son who designed and built it.As for the steak I like that you can actually go to the meat locker and pick out the one you want.Very good bread which is always a plus with my wife she loves the place is well we both decided recently that we will be going back soon almost went last week with a group but my wife said no way since we were picking up the tab on that event you are looking at about $50 per person could be more if you add alcohol to the mix.
best steak on the planet and salad bar phenomenal!!!! its soooo great i visited twice in one week!!!!

Food was great, by far the best steaks and service I've received at a steakhouse. The only SERIOUS issue is upon arriving a waitress took our drink and relayed it to the waiter assigned to our table. The waiter verified with us and my girlfriend told the waiter which bottle of wine we wanted. This was a 60-70 dollar bottle of wine. The waiter then brought the wrong bottle out ( yes my mistake I should've verified for yet a 3rd time but nooope that's the plan on the 3rd time just when your getting impatient and you tell them yeah yeah yeah that's it....that's when they're gonna bring you the wrong bottle). He then proceeds to pour the bottle while we exchanging some small talk about how broke we are as college students and how we're just here to enjoy splurging before going back to school (oh they assist in the splurging) I enjoy my meal, the center cut filets  are to die for. Meanwhile thinking to myself damn this is some good wine. Ordered some bacon wrapped grilled quail also amazing. Salad bar was phenomenal, it almost seems like your full before the stakes even get there. ......and still this bottle of wine was going down smooth. We finish our meal and wait for the check only to be hit with the HOLY ***** $389 tab?!?? Oh the bottle was $256 "sorry for the mix up". What can you do tho it's a fancy place, you get he good ole swap, and you've already drank the bottle. Great place, won't be back again sadly. Be sure to check your bottle over and over again.

This place is amazing.. There are 3 places I would take my family or anyone from out of town to have the true Texas steak-house experience, this is my number one choice..The food is phenomenal, the salad bar is excellent and fresh, the service and wait staff on point... Second best Ribeye in Houston, Best salad bar, best bread, best desserts.the bad -  they won't take reservations and you have to wait forever to get a table on a weekend evening.

We were told the wait time is around 60-90 mins, but we were able to sit about 40 mins, and they even have the waiting area with free drinks with popcorns and chips.  Service is A+ and we ordered T-bone, Porterhouse, and Slow grill Prime Ribs, all taste very very good with additional sauce need it.

Visiting Houston on a Texas roadtrip and knew we had to find the best steakhouse while we were here. After lots of researching on Yelp, chose Taste of Texas and have zero regrets - amazing dinner!!Our server was Henry, I can't imagine having a better experience and he was a main part of it. Super friendly and helpful, not only with the menu but with Texas information as well.  If you have him as a server you are in for a treat! For starters- the salad bar. Seems silly to review a salad bar, but this one truly was different. Fresh variety of ingredients, including bars of cheese at the end to garnish the salad. Rolls with apple and cinnamon butter that melt in your mouth. I had grilled chicken - yes at a steakhouse, but it was delicious. My boyfriend had the NY strip steak with crab meat - he was in love. He could have even chosen his steak if he wanted to. Side dish recommendation - Brussels with bacon jam. Oh. My. Goodness.  Yes it's a tad on the pricy side, but you definitely get what you pay for and you know that going in.  An amazing experience.

This place NEVER disappoints. Every time I have friends or family visit from Canada I take them here. The food is outstanding, and the staff are professional and well trained. The parking lot is pretty big and the decorations for Christmas are a must see! Only con: there can be a long wait time, so don't wait to go until you are starving. My definite go to spot!

Great from the moment you walk in, valued as a customer  pampering you all the way, everybody greets!!110% and beyond going the extra mile.Our host and waitress Anna walked us to see different cuts, took pics, gave us a free bandana for good Texan feel..the steaks and all are to die for!!

Five stars alone for the food! So good! I could eat here every week and I'd never get bored. The salad bar is great because it also has fresh fruit and different types of freshly baked bread. I filled up on salad and bread, so I couldn't finish my entree. My steak was cooked to perfection though. I thought it was cool that you get to hand pick your steak from the back.The service is definitely five stars. Everyone was so friendly. Our waitress helped me pick out my steak because I told her I had no idea what to look for in a steak. One of the best steaks I've ever had! The only downside is the bill at the end. Even though it was a bit expensive, I'd definitely come back for more.

My husband and I had dinner today at this restaurant and it was absolutely a TOTAL FAIL!!!! We waited over an hour to be seated then we get to our table and order our steaks and they did not make the steaks as we ordered them!!!!  They burned my steak, the manager came over and said they can remake my steak but it was going to take awhile. I said no thank you, we waited all this time and you want us to wait another hour to make my steak because you all did not cook it the way we  asked in the first place, no!!! Then my husband asked for them to box up his food because he did not want to eat if I was not going to eat, so it ruined our whole evening. I will never visit this restaurant again.
The food and service was Great. We were Celebrating one of my Sons Birthday. Michael our waiter was Awesome and the wine, food and ambiance was Wonderful! It was Fun evening.

Service: Impeccable. Really some of the best service ever, let alone at a steakhouse.Food: Tomahawk is a massive, juicy, and best piece of steak to share. They bring you to the kitchen and let you pick your steak. You need to try it al least once in your life and it's one of the best prices I've seen. If you're sharing, just order an extra salad bar. Dessert: Since it was my birthday, they give you a choice of dessert. I picked the snicker cake. It's a lot and definitely for a chocolate lover.

My first visit to Taste of Texas and it's a very impressive restaurant.  It's very clear that management understands customer service.  We went for an early dinner, arriving within minutes of opening.  They were already packed!     If there's a wait for a table, which frankly, isn't unusual, they provide free soft drinks, iced tea and popcorn.  Fortunately, we were taken to our table immediately.  Water and bread were brought out immediately, along with a server to take our drink order.We explained we were there for our anniversary, and were told that we could have a complimentary split of champagne (their house) or a free dessert.  Then, the different cuts of steak were explained and we were taken to the "butcher" shop where we could actually choose the steak we would be served.  The steaks are "tagged" so you know you are served the steak you selected.All steaks come with the salad bar which is the basic salad  bar, enhanced with choices of blocks of cheese to shave and a baked roll section.  The bacon bits were the real deal and freshly fried and crunched.  My wife and I chose a large T-bone to share and ordered an extra salad bar and side.  We had plenty of food to share.The steak was a bit disappointing.  Well prepared, but under-seasoned in my opinion; and more thin than we expected.  I have no doubt it was the weight as described, but I'd have preferred a smaller slab and a thicker cut.  Still, it was juicy and tender.  If you can, save room for dessert....they are decadent.  Worth the calories for the extra 30 minutes on the treadmdill.Our server was what puts Taste of Texas in another level.  Attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable, unhurried, smiling - no pretense you might normally expect from a relatively high end steak-house.  Remember, steaks start around $50 and go up from there.I did feel the floor managers looked like armed Secret Service agents.  They stood - non indiscreetly - in each dining area, wearing black suits, shirts & ties whlle whispering into their wrist radios.  I'm sure they were surveying tables to alert servers to low water, or a customer in need of something; but it was a bit unnerving.  They need to find a way to smile and blend in a bit better.  Still .... Taste of Texas is a locally owned treasure.  No chain restaurant.  Family owned...and a focus on service and quality.  There's a reason why the parking lot was full when the doors opened.

Excellent food, excellent service. I have gone for lunch meetings and only ordered the salad bar and was very satisfied. More often we order steaks and never have they been over cooked. My husband likes his well done, and they have graciously cooked it more upon his request. There dessert menu is out of this world delicious. I like my coffee hot and they always have a cup ready. Highly recommend this restaurant for all occasions.

Great decor and service, salad bar was great quality and quail appetizers were good.  Waiting area is very nic with snacks.  The tomahawk ribeye itself, however, missed the mark big time.  Significantly over seared with the associated bitterness and dried out crust while the inside bordered on being raw and cold.  It hadn't been salted/seasoned with anything or rested properly and was oddly bland.  I'm not suggesting they actually did this, but it very much reminded me of what happens when someone tries to grill a partially frozen steak.  The 38oz description is misleading as they are counting the huge bone hanging off of it as part of the weight -- it's big but no where near 38oz of meat, maybe 24-28oz.  It's normal to include bone weight but the bones they leave on these are gigantic, even by tomahawk ribeye standards.  We may try again but disappointing this time around.

My wife and I have been coming to Taste of Texas for 30+ years and absolutely love the restaurant. There is only one of them--it is not a chain and the Hendee Family are wonderful!!! Nina and Edd have hired first class General Managers who hire a stellar wait staff. It is the best restaurant anywhere we've ever been. The staff are family and they treat you as you were part of their family. You can receive periodic newsletters by email and the perks are fantastic!!! From the Salad Bar, to the Butcher Shop where you can pick your own steak. Now living in San Antonio, we'll be back on our anniversary and my wife's birthday, but you will never be disappointed in Taste of Texas!!!!! UPDATE: Just had dinner in San Antonio with Stephen and Olga Edelstein on 05/13/2014 at Kirby's ( a San Antonio Steakhouse) because they were here Mother's Day. Stephen, now retired from Taste was on of their Senior General Managers!!!! Thank you Stephen and Olga for the dinner and fellowship!!!!Philippians 1:3

I visited tonight and was completely blown away by my experience! The restaurant is very nicely decorated and the ambience is very tasteful. We arrived at 6:30 and there was already an hour wait for two people, but the waiting area is very comfortable and large, and you even get free drinks and snacks to munch on while you wait. We ordered a fillet and a New York strip, both with the lemon seasoning and garlic butter, and they were AMAZING! The salad bar, which is included with the steaks, was very fresh and high quality and offered WAY more options than most places. The homemade bread was also delicious. The mac n cheese and broccoli were perfect as well. The prices are extremely reasonable for the quality and quantity of food provided! The service was great! Everyone was very friendly and professional, and the attention to detail was outstanding. We will definitely be back!

Oh my... If anyone go away hungry there is something wrong with them!   One of the best steaks I've ever had.  I like you pick your own out & salad bar is pretty damn good too with all the great bread!  Amazing!

They don't season their steaks enough here. They rely on their "signature" sauces to top the steak for the flavor of your liking. Most of the steaks are basic grilling..not super juicy yet not dry. They always cook the steak to my request, but I always feel something is lacking.The salad bar is on point. Those asiago cheese rolls are dangerous.Wine is way overpriced for the brands they serve.Service is always superb. If you pay close attention,  management is running around non stop to ensure customer satisfaction.All desserts look divine, but the snickers cake is some of the best dessert in town. It reminds me a lot of Cheesecake Factory.Overall, this is a good family steakhouse. Not fine dining, but a step above the other chain restaurants around town.

7 years of living in Houston and I FINALLY get a chance to experience Taste of Texas a few days ago.  My long wait was worth it though:  steaks are quite phenomenal especially with the lemon garlic seasoning on it to give you that extra punch.  I ordered the 6 oz center cut which turned out smaller than I thought.  I always forget how small 6 oz can be.   I would recommend sizing up to the 8 oz which is cheaper by the ounce if you do your math!  Our group also got the bacon wrapped quail appetizers which were so crispy and savory, I am starting to salivate just thinking about it.  The grilled shrimp dish also looked delightful as well if you are not a steak person.  I would definitely eat here everyday if I could but I don't think my wallet would approve.  I also highly recommend going at 3 pm any day (opening hour) so you avoid the long wait that everyone else complains about.

I was blown away by the quality of food and service. They have a butcher shop in the back where you can pick your cut of meat which makes this a fun and unique dining experience. Steak was cooked to perfection and the salad bar was awesome. They also give you a side with your steak. The wait can be long, but they have a good size waiting room with tables, TV, bar, and provide complimentary snacks/softdrinks. I've been to several steakhouses all over the world and have never experienced this level of service. I would give more stars if I could. Highly recommend.

Our waitress Christian was amazing.  She was  friendly and nice,  very upbeat she also was a wealth of information on the restaurant and different items on the menu.  We ordered the monster rib cowboy steak and split it.  There are no words it is beyond incredible. I want to go back and just do the soup and salad bar only next time.  The salad bar had a bunch of yummy choices.They also have a very nice wine selection.  The only negative is place looks out dated and very tired.  But that will no stop me from going back its  really good.

Great great great place! The wait was super long (2 hours) but well worth it.  I have not experienced many waiters/waitresses as detailed as these were. Every second here was what any restaurant should be able to give you when dining.  While we waited we had complementary popcorn, and drinks. Our waiter had to serve over 15 people and he did it effortlessly! He was very polite, skilled and knowledgeable about everything on the menu from the appetizers to the desserts. The drinks were pretty good and once our food was ordered, it didn't take very long for everyone to get there meals once we ordered.  The tour of the salad bar and the pick you own cut steak won me over!  Any place that takes the time to care for their customers like that is admirable and I love it! All of the food came out hot and smelled like Heaven.  The prices are a bit on the high side but I can't complain about that.  Like the old saying goes "you get what you pay for". It was a truly enjoyable evening and I will be returning at least once a month.

We love this place! We come here 2-3 times a year as a family and there's never a time that we don't enjoy the food and our experience as a whole. Sure, the wait time is usually long as they don't take reservations but their waiting area is the bomb (great ambience, free chips & salsa, pop corn and iced tea). You can also order cocktails while waiting. The salad bar is very good and the service is excellent! Totally worth the money! It's become a family tradition for us to come here every year and we will continue to do so.

Exceptional steak. I've had steak here before but this was the best steak I have ever had. Exceptional service and spectacular food. I would also recommend the salid bar which has a wide verity of salid a breads and dressings.

Omg!! This place is not only so good but a great place for dinner. No matter what you order here you won't go wrong. If the wait is long, it's worth it! If your like me that likes the little things, you will appreciate picking your own steak for dinner.  kind of pricey but we'll worth it.

I love so many things about this restaurant!1. The waiting section is awesome! It's a big room with a bar and lots of tables/seats for you to hangout while waiting. There are also free popcorn and water/sodas!2. The staffs are friendly and accommodating. The manager/supervisor came and check up on us...a very nice gesture. 3. Food & Drink- Porterhouse steak (5/5) - I got it with the garlic butter rub and it was amazing! The steak was juicy, tender and perfectly cooked medium! - Prime Rib (5/5) - I stole some pieces from my boyfriend plate and man it was soft and rich! - Quail bacon wraps (4/5) - Crab cake (5/5) - It was rich in flavor and just perfect.- Salad bar (4/5) - It's veggies and fruits are fresh! There are also a variety of toppings and I LOVE the cilantro vinaigrette (I have yet to see this anywhere else!) - Blackberry Mark (5/5) - This cocktail was perfect! It was refreshing and not that sweet, but man it's a creeper (either that or I'm a lightweight).By far, my favorite steak house!

Came here on a last minute decision for dinner with friends and family. I was glad they accepted my gym attire. Our group was huge but luckily they sat us down in less than an hour. This review is mainly for me and I am not speaking for the whole group. The ambience of the restaurant was very nice and fitting to the name : Texas. The restrooms were clean and a bit luxurious. Clean restrooms in an expensive place is a must. They have a separate bar area and even a wine room. We sat in nice long table and there was enough room for everyone. Our party was about 14 people. Ok onto the food. I had the cowboy 24 oz ribeye which was highly recommended. They let you pick your steak and you can also get yourself a salad plate with assortments of breads. My bf picked it for me and we shared the salad. I really enjoyed the complimentary tiny toasts and the cinnamon butter that you can get for your roll from the salad bar. The food came out in a reasonable time for big group. It was suggested to eat the steak medium rare so I ordered mine medium rare. However, it didn't come out that way. It was more cooked like medium and my bf confirmed this. Everything else was fine. The best part, the waitress and manager was very accommodating. This is why I give 5 stars because they both personally came to me and apologized and offered me a new steak to go and a dessert to make up for the mistake. The kind waitress. April was nice enough to recommend the chocolate cake and boxed all my food to go. I was very pleasant surprise about the customer service. That alone makes me want to come back and try their other items on the menu. P.S. The chocolate cake was pretty rich, moist and delicious!

Long Story Short, THE BEST STEAK EXPERIENCE ever.Not only the steak, the whole experience was amazing. Nice waiting area, very organized, and nice staff. Chips/Salsa, pop-corn and iced tea were available in waiting area, but keep in mind that you're here for steak not chips and salsa.Our waitress was very nice and as soon as she understood that it's our first time in their restaurant and we're not from texas, she brought us cowboy hats to take a picture. We got a very nice free printed copy with our bill btw.You have the amazing option to go to butchery and select your cut of meat. they'll put a small metal plate number on the meat to ensure you're getting the exact piece of meat that you've selected.Salad bar was full of fresh greens, but, again, you're here for steak so don't get excited with all these fresh vegetables and greens and don't fill up your stomach.Steak was perfectly cooked, exactly how we ordered them. tasty, juicy and tender. I don't remember anything other than enjoying every single bite until I was full.It was a joyful night and It worth every penny that we paid.

If you truly want a taste of Texas, you need to come here. While receive a  premium selection of steaks and entrees, you also get the experience of a museum. History is calling your name from every corner of the restaurant... including the bathroom. If I could afford it, I would honestly come here everyday. Expect to pay a premium for this fine dining experience. However, it's worth every penny. I only feel bad for the cows.

Ambiance:  Worth 4.5 stars. The atmosphere is great. You are immediately greeted by nice hostesses upon entry. The decor is beautiful. I just stood there, looked around & took a minute to take it all in. I am a sucker for a beautifully decorated place. Process:  5 stars. They take you on a quick tour of the salad bar & explain your options. Next, you are escorted to the kitchen area to choose your steak. Last, you are escorted back to your table. Service:  When I went on a weekday, service was awesome. Our waiter was very attentive & even let me design my own meal. Food:  3 stars. Yes, I am the girl that had seafood at a steak restaurant. And, boy did I regret that. The grilled shrimp was nothing to write home about.  I've had much better flavor at other places. My date had the Ribeye topped with garlic butter & it was delicious (not 5-star delicious but still good).  Ruth Chris' steaks are waaaaaaaaay yummier!  The salad bar was ok. Everything was fresh & the area was clean. The best thing about it was the BREAD!  Oh M Gee!  That butter cinnamon bread is amazing. I think I ate 3 or 4 of those. Yum!All in all, it was a good dining experience and I do plan to return. However, like others have stated, I do find this place a bit overrated.

The salad bar was the highlight of the night.  We had drinks that could not have been made more perfect. The drinks were absolutely amazing! The steak however, left more to be desired. For such a highly rated restaurant, I would have expected nothing less than a delicious meal. Bland is The Taste of Texas.

I love coming here ....been here a couple of times this year and the steaks are always  good.   The decor is very classy...and if you have to wait, there is a waiting room with free chips , salsa and drinks......the salad bar is always  awesome....the staff is good ...the prices are a little steep at 45 bucks per person but its worth it . .

My favorite place to eat a steak in Houston without having to get all dressed up!!  TofT has the best bang for your buck steaks as well.  They are Angus steaks as the menu claims and they have a nice variety of cuts as well.  Service is always excellent and if you're a first timer, you may get your picture taken with a cowboy hat and red bandana.  You do have to give the hat back though!I always order either the pre-sized ribeye or the order by the ounce ribeye, currently $2.35/oz.  To get the best value, choose a steak larger than 24oz and eat it all yourself if you come hungry like me, or share with your date.  It's cheaper to buy 1 big steak and cut it, than to buy 2 individual steaks. ....assuming you're both wanting the same cut.I'm not thrilled with any of the sides, except for the loaded potato.  They are all just overcooked from what I've experienced.The salad bar is always good, pretty fresh, decent variety of ingredients and well stocked.  I'll sometimes just get 2 servings from the salad bar and only eat a little of the steak.  I think they have the 2nd best salad bar in Houston, behind fogo.

Oh. My. God. I fell in love with this place the minute I walked inside. My husband decided to take me here for a nice date night, and we were not disappointed. Brandon was our server, and he was just so sweet, accommodating, and explained everything for us first-timers. The drinks are extremely strong, which was a nice surprise, and I loved their cocktails. I got the steak medallions that came with asparagus and a bleu cheese stuffed tomato. Let. Me. Tell. You. That tomato was so heavenly, wow. My mouth had a party. My husband got a T-bone steak with garlic mashed potatoes. I, of course, had to try his mashed potatoes, and...best garlic mashed potatoes, ever. You can actually taste the garlic, hallelujah. Amazing food. Their salad bar...I just wanted to spend the night there with all the amazing selections. Honestly, I'd come back just to get to taste everything in the salad bar. The hot bread area, with so many different kinds of bread! I was in bread heaven. Finally, dessert was decadent. My husband got the snickers pie, I swear I think he teared up at how delicious it was. I got the slice of heaven: chocolatey goodness. Manager came to our table to check on us and if we enjoyed everything, and I just beamed up at him, lol. This is our official date night restaurant! Thank you Brandon, and ToT for such a wonderful night. We'll definitely be back to visit again!

Taste: I had the 24oz. Cowboy Ribeye with Herb Garlic Butter and Au Gratin Potatoes for my side. It tasted pretty good, I'd give this steak a 4 on a steak scale of 1-5. The only reason I don't give it a 5 is because somehow certain pieces of the steak tasted bland but overall it was still a great steak. Make sure when you eat your steak to dip each bite of steak in the Garlic herb butter. Au Gratin potatoes are amazing and in my opinion the best side that they have to offer. Price: $50 for the 24oz. Ribeye that comes with a side is a very fair price in my opinion. You definitely get your money's worth. Not to mention they have an amazing salad bar. Service: Because they are so busy it may take your waiter some time to get to you but even with how crowded this place is the service is still pretty great. Again this place gets very very crowded and they do not take reservations last time I checked. When I got to the restaurant all of the parking was taken but fortunately we found a parking spot 5 minutes later. Wait times can be anywhere from 45-75 minutes, the lady in front of me had a wait time of 105 minutes. So make sure to get here early.

Taste of Texas is absolutely amazing. From your first step through those doors to your last juicy bite, you are treated like VIPs. There is really nothing I can complain about.The restaurant is very Texan with very rustic and ranch-like atmosphere and plaques and trinkets of Texas history all throughout. Clean, of course, even the bathrooms deserve to be visited. The seating is great for any party size. The restaurant has many different areas that each boast a different ambiance. You can go into the more open part of the restaurant with high ceilings, or more intimate rooms for those celebrating a special event.The service here is always top notch. You are welcomed by pretty much everyone, and are immediately taken care of once you sit down. First timers get a quick but thorough run-down of the menu and just how everything works. The wait staff is always accommodating and attentive without being overbearing; they are there not just to serve you, but to ensure you enjoy your experience to the fullest.Taste of Texas boasts an impressive salad bar with a plethora of different greens, pastas, cheeses, dressings, and toppings. You'd think the restaurant had their own Sweet Tomatoes in it. The bread and butter are all so good too. Just make sure you don't stuff yourself too much before your steak comes.Oh yeah, the steak. To die for. Whatever cut of meat you decide to choose will be aged, seasoned, and cooked perfectly to your liking. And for those who are really particular with their meats, Taste of Texas allows you to go back there and hand pick exactly which piece you want on your plate. The meat melts in your mouth. You also have the option of ordering sides, toppings, and butters to compliment your steak.For the steak maniacs out there, you can get their Tomahawk steak with is a bone-in excessively massive cut of meat. I'm probably wrong, but it's something like 40 oz. Just HUGE. Of course they have their non-beef proteins like chicken and fish, but honestly I haven't ever gotten anything other than steak.So for anyone who loves steak, is looking to celebrate a special occasion, or just wants to enjoy a very nice meal, Taste of Texas is the place to go. Yes, on the pricier side, but definitely worth it..especially compared to other steak houses. They offer excellent service with amazing food, and is my top choice for premium steaks.

Parking lot is small and gets packed. 20 minutes to get a spot but ITS SO WORTH IT. Complementary chips and salsa, soda, popcorn and tea while you wait for a table. Service is attentive. Hey brought me a pitcher of diet soda so I could refill my own Diet Coke. Salad bar is yummy. Food is cooked to your absolute liking and they have you check it as soon as it comes out. My kids enjoyed it, the adults enjoyed it. The manager visited our table and was very gracious and kind. We will be back. Yum.

My favorite steak house in Houston (although B&B Butchers is a close second). Old Texan ambience with an amazing salad bar, bread is to die for and you can pick your steak before they cook it. Meat is awesome and tender and not over spiced. Great steakhouse!

It was my first time eating here and I must say that it was quite the experience. It was my first time choosing my own steak, and our waiter Jacob was very professional and accommodating as he helped me through this process. The salad bar was to die for, the steak was grilled to perfection, and the free dessert that I chose for it being my birthday was great. Everyone was dressed to impress, and the ambiance had a dim lit cozy feel to it. It is definitely a place I would love to visit again.

The wait is ridiculously long but on the plus side you can eat snacks while you wait. The center cut steak is the best don't even think about ordering anything else it's so juicy! First time they'll let you wear cowboy hats and give you bandanas to take back. Great place for a birthday dinner.

This is one of best Steakhouses in Houston.  Although the prices are rather high, you get a lot for your money. Unlike other high end steak places, a huge salad bar and "sides" come with the meal.  They are not al la carts.  Great food and great service.Hint:  Go early or expect a long wait.

IMO the best casual steak house in Texas.I love that I can pick the cut of meat, as they have a wonderful selection!  I love how friendly, casual and inviting this place is!  It's truly a wonderful experience every time I get to go!  It's warm and great for the holidays :)I LOVE the salad bar and the bread and cheese selection.  The last time I went, I had the bone in ribeye and it was sooooo tasty.  I usually get the prime rib, which is always buttery smooth and super thick.  I don't think I've ever tasted anything here that wasn't mouth watering.

The perfect night! Our waiter was so formal and nice and the food was incredible! We ate way too much salad bar, it was just way too good with all the topping, cheese and fresh bread. Martinis were great too. The best part by far was the tomahawk steak, 38 oz of juicy hot steak-unbelievable! And we got to choose it which added a nice touch to the experience. Also, you absolutely HAVE to try the bacon jam Brussel sprouts... they are something straight from heaven. I love this place and I wish I could go every day! The only bad thing about it was the 2 hour wait which was expected, but totally worth it!

Very unique steak restaurant portraying the old Texas with beautiful decor and a grand hall...I was quite impressed upon walking into this place, free popcorn, nachos and soda while you wait....their steaks no matter which one is $40 plus but it's worth it for the experience, a lot of variety in steaks and you get to go to their butcher shop to choose it....I personally don't know how to pick out a steak so just had my server do the honors....the steaks are HUGE, don't expect to finish one yourself, after eating at this place I didn't want to have steak for a long time, overall the steaks were juicy but just a tad too salty for my liking, their signature sauce was the garlic butter....excellent customer service here, our waiter took the honors of getting is cowboy hats and taking a picture for us....salad bar was included with each order Wouldn't come back often but mostly for special occasions, a definite try for new comers though

I know most people come here for the steaks. However, I am not a steak person. I took a chance and ordered the pecan crusted chicken. It was delicious and I would definitely order it again. They have a salad bar that is very nice. Great atmosphere and service. The only thing I would change if I could  would be the parking situation, very cramped during peak hours but thankfully they have valet.

I like this place alot. I have been here, and paid for some large means with family on Birthdays, ect..  However , we ate here on Sunday night and we felt sick.  It is Tuesday and still a bit queezy.  Bring that both of us shared 2 steaks, it seems that one must have been the culprit.  I will not give up on the restaurant as I enjoy it when I am in the area, but not a good experience for the $ 160 dollars laid down for a meal that night.

I had heard from several people that I needed to try this place. We are big fans of steak and were looking to be impressed. We were not here. This place is huge and the atmosphere is a little weird. They have a very large room where they have patrons wait for tables, where you can get sodas and popcorn on the house. That is a neat feature, but at the same time, it feels a bit commercialized and weird. Once we sat down, we were kind of let down by the food. Everything was just ok, and for what you pay there, it should "wow" you. It doesn't. It's just ok.

A coworker and I came here after a long day of travel and loved everything about it! From the friendly staff to the meat it was an incredible experience. The best part of this place is you get to go pick your own piece of meat out. If you are looking for some Texas charm and a good steak this is the place to go!

Really had a great experience at Taste of Texas. The staff was extremely courteous and our waitress Valentina was very attentive. It's a pricy steakhouse, worth every penny. You get to go to the butcher and pick out your specific cut of steak, the dinners include an awesome salad bar and 1 side. The steak was perfectly cooked- get the garlic butter topping, its spectacular! My only critique is that I ordered the white cheddar mac n cheese, and didn't care for it. It wasn't very flavorful, and the texture was a little off. Our waitress quickly exchanged it for garlic mashed potatoes that were great. Homemade breads on the salad bar were super tasty. Oh, and you MUST have the snickers pie. Ganache bottom, chopped snicker bars, creamy cheesecake, and graham cracker crust with whipped cream. Its the.bomb.

We knew when we came to Houston that we want to visit an "upscale" local restaurant and this one won. We went on a Monday during lunch Aron d 2. Our server was Robert and he was phenomenal. He walked us through the menu and gave us his recommendations on steaks based on what we told him we liked. After deducting the cowboy, he walked us to the butcher to select our steak and gave us a custom number. With my steak came a salad bar and it was great! Even was able to get different bread options (asiago cheese, regular roll & jalapeño cornbread). The entree came out after about 20 minutes.  I like my steak medium and it was cooked perfectly. To me, it wasn't very flavorful (compared to Houston's) but I enjoyed it nevertheless. Robert was very personable and we stayed behind for an extra 15 minutes getting to know him and vice versa. I would go back for the service but not the food necessary. Still a great place!

This is our favorite spot for every Soecial occasion in our family, especially birthdays. On January 5th; however. I asked for cowboy steak, instead  I got a 10oz prime rib. Tough and hard.Honestly, it was my birthday and this waitress, was rude frim the very beginning. This is not my first rideo at Taste of Texas. My family and I have been here at this place since 1992. When I asked the waitress if I can have a sauce, she told me I could go myself and get it from the bar. Not the salad bar, but the waiting area.  Very cut dry, just rude. Then my husband I proceeded to choose our meat, We did. When, my meal was out to my surprise the waitress brought out the wrong cut. She thought I did not my meats, and said,that is your peace. it was not, it was my birthday and I was very sad about this. Because I really wanted to have a cowboy steak. It is one of the most juiciest, most delicious piece of meats.  I have also had the tomahawk ribeye, oh my Lord! Worth every penny! But, it's just me, so I said no this is already big enough. But, it was not. The supervisor offered to change it, I had only taken two bites of it, but it was really rough and tough. Then, they brought me A 14 ounce center cut filet. It was good, but sadly not what I wanted. She was the worst waitress I have ever had at taste of Texas. But not bad for so many years of great service and great food. So, tomorrow we celebrate my oldest so s birthday. I am hoping the same DOES NOT hapoen.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!! Ok so we waited for about 2hours for a table comes to found out, this place is pretty popular! This place is great even if you don't care for steak, (I know, there are some "TEXANS" out there that don't like steak, weird right?) there's a great fireplace, waiting area, gift shop and TWO bars. The salad bar alone is to die for. The steaks were juicy and melt in your mouth. The chicken was also delicious. We had a great waitress who made our first experience pleasant. Yes, expect a pretty pricey menu but you honestly get what you pay for.

Decided to give Taste of Texas another shot after the steak nightmare that was my last visit. I was a little gun shy about ordering a steak, so I got the hamburger. :::::Sigh::::: It was completely void of any flavor. The steak fries were completely under cooked as was my wife's steak. The salad bar was the only highlight, again. We didn't send anything back, didn't even say anything about the problems with the meal, it just wasn't worth the drama. I guess this place just isn't for me. After the meal, I was taking a photo (with my phone) of the logo on the steak knife, it looks like The Alamo. Our waiter started to clear the table, and tried to jerk the knife out of my hand, while I was clearly trying to take a photo. I told him he could have it in just a second, when he ever so politely told me the knives were available for purchase at the front of the restaurant. Thanks for thinking I was going to steal your knife, and making me feel like a thief!

Try their New York Strip Sirloin. Yes sir...that's an order! It's one of their classic steaks. You can pick your steak from the fridge so choose wisely. When asked, don't be afraid to add lemon pepper seasoning. It will add a nice layer of salty goodness to your steak, nothing harsh. The waiter will recommend a wine pairing. Trust them. They won't do you wrong. If you have room and feeling festive try some of their dessert. Any dessert item is exceptional. A meal here will make good memories.

If you want you can choose your cut and steak in the back ask your server! For special events like birthdays they will take a picture of you and give you a printed copy! Texas Au gratin potatoes:-very cheesy and buttery Cream brûlée -love it! No lemon or tart taste, creamy, fresh, smooth under the layer of caramelized sugarSnickers cake I think? -delicious, and looks amazing Steak-highly suggest you choose what you want in the back! So you can choose how much fat you have. Of course you have to have fat for flavor! Salad bar is awesome!

Nothing better than this place! They have a wonderful waiting area with free popcorn and soda and a bar! It is always busy so be aware! When they flash your number on the illuminated signs threw out the area you go to the desk and they take you there. (If you are 16 you are still put in the kids area, thats why its 4 stars). There food is amazing and A++ quality servers, if you have little ones they will take them back into the kitchen to see food prepared and to pick out their steak. Once dessert comes they take a plate of every dessert on it to your table! All desserts are wonderful but i must recommend snickers cheese cake or the 'slice of heaven.' It is a restaurant like no other and truly deserves its rating!

I was in town for a wedding & came here per recommendation of some friends of family who are locals. Safe to say, I was not disappointed!Atmosphere: The restaurant was relatively large with dim lighting in the dining area. I noticed some people had to use a flashlight on their phone in order to read the menu. The decor, however, was nice & really made you feel like you were in Texas. Although I think the restaurant's intent was to lean slightly more towards the formal side as far as dress goes, the majority of people were in casual/business casual dress.Food: AMAZING! I ordered the 38 oz. tomahawk ribeye (medium rare) & it was cooked perfectly! Once you figure out what steak you want to order on the menu, the waiter invites you into the front of the kitchen to hand pick which steak you'd like them to cook for you. More fat? Less fat? It's all up to you!  The all you can eat salad bar had many options as well as unlimited rolls, jalapeño cornbread, etc. The complimentary cinnamon coffee was great too! The only downside was that I ordered regular fries, but they ended up serving me lukewarm sweet potato fries, so I just went with it.Service: Excellent! Our waiter was polite, answered all our questions sufficiently, & checked on us frequently. The steak came out fast! I was pleasantly surprised when the manager came & introduced himself to us while making sure that everything was satisfactory.Overall: 4.5/5I hate to be the guy that complains about the price, but I personally think everything was slightly overpriced (our 38 oz. steak including a 2 foot long bone was $60). But it could have something to do with the fact that there was an all you can eat Brazilian steakhouse right down the road for $47.99/person. Also, our order was mixed up. Nevertheless, I'd definitely come visit again & would highly recommend it to anyone in need of a massive, perfectly cooked steak (& who can afford it)!

Since Texas is known for their steaks, it was only proper that steak would be my first meal in Texas.Be prepared to wait.  Our party of two waited about 20 minutes on a Thursday at about 8pm.  You're given a number when you check in with the hostess.  Pay attention to the screen.  It displays your number, but it's not called out.  On the plus side, check out their waiting area by the bar.  There are complimentary soft drinks, chips and salsa and popcorn to enjoy while you wait.My girlfriend and I split the stuffed mushroom caps (6 pieces, $13.95) for an appetizer.  The mushrooms were stuffed with crabmeat and topped with brie.  Delicious and a recommended starter.  I'm not much of a red meat eater so I went with the 6oz center cut filet ($37.95) mainly because of the size (their steaks come as big as 38 oz).  I ordered it medium rare and it came out perfect.  It was served on a silver cow plate and topped with garlic butter.  What's nice is that you're given the option of going to the kitchen and picking out your choice of meat.  That way you can pick a slab with the marbling of your choice.Included with the steaks is a side and their salad bar.  The salad bar had an assortment of salad, fruit, and bread options.  Nothing too special about it in my opinion.  For my side, I went with the asparagus with hollandaise sauce (4 pieces).  Being that I opted for the smaller cut of meat, I ordered the side of steamed lobster tail ($19.95).  It was cooked perfectly and served with a side of melted butter.  It was the perfect amount of food for me, but not enough room for dessert.  Service was good.  Our server was friendly and kept our glasses of wine coming.  Entrees were served in a syncronized manner.

I am absolutely blown away by Shawn's service. I had been looking at houses all day long and had already gone to the gym, needless to say I was not dressed up to eat lunch but was very hungry. He treated me like I was somebody important to him. No, I didn't order the most expensive item on the menu. I just had a wonderful lunch with my daughter who I never get to spend time with. Thank you so much Shawn for giving me such great customer service. I will definitely be back.

Ridiculously expensive. $20 for two beers with tax and tip. The salad bar is "included" which basically means it's priced into the cost of you steak.The steak was good, but contrary to the opinion of other reviewers, they are not cooked correctly. There are grill marks - for show. What makes a good steak is a nice, dark, browned, crispy exterior, the "maillard reactions" (browning, carmelization) that makes grilled, fried, or otherwise browned foods so good. This is true whether the steak is rare, or well-done - the exterior should always have a nice dark crust. These steaks had very little of that, just grill marks, despite being served on a hot metal plate shaped like a cow that I guess is supposed to keep the steak warm and imply that it's sizzling hot. It is not, however, hot enough to crisp the exterior, and only hot enough to continue cooking the interior of the steak to the desired internal temperature.This seems like a place for families and non-foodies to have a "fancy" dinner. The salad bar was good. But the price for what I ate was just outrageous. I've been to good restaurants where I could have gotten two steak dinners, with a better cooked steak, for the price that I paid for this one dinner.

My entire family loves The Taste of Texas!!  We are comfortable bringing our three-year-old into the restaurant. She enjoys the popcorn while we're waiting, coloring on the menu and lots of visual items around the restaurant to play I spy.  Our favorites are the T-bone steak, bacon jam brussels sprouts, salad bar, hamburger, Snickers pie, ice cream sundae.  GO HUNGRY!!

Is the steak worth the wait? Some will disagree, but to me it's not worth the trouble of finding parking and then waiting an additional 90-120 minutes just to be seated. By the time you leave your house and your steak arrives, you could have driven to HEB, purchased an expensive USDA prime cut beef, lit some candles, took a bubble bath, grilled your steak, eaten it, and then watched an entire episode of Breaking Bad while indulging in an ice cream sandwich for half the cost. You can't avoid this wait time either by trying to make reservations because they don't accept any! (Having no reservations is more cost effective for restaurants since there are less empty tables. The less empty tables, the more money that flows in). Granted, your wait time may be quicker on less busier nights or with a smaller party. When I went with a party of 8, we ended up waiting almost two hours. Sure we munched on the free chips, salsa, popcorn, soda, but in the end we started eating at 9:00 PM which is pretty darn late for dinner in my book. Not to mention, it's not healthy to eat large portions and heavy meals late in the day. Perhaps it was just a busy Friday night and the entire city decided to eat steak when I went. If you do go, just make it there way earlier than when you plan on eating.The good news is that once you have ordered, the salad bar is all yours to feast upon. The salad bar offers a colorful array of fruits, vegetables, and cheeses (the cheese block is huge!) for anyone who enjoys eating healthy or just want to feel less guilty for later. The funny thing is that my favorite items from the  salad bar are the freshly baked rolls and corn breads. Delicious! As for steaks, I ordered the T-Bone steak for $47.95. As the menu describes, it's "twenty ounces of the classic combination of filet and New York strip. Well-trimmed and aged 'bone-in' for flavor and tenderness". After ordering, we were led to the back room where we got to choose our cuts of meat by stabbing it with a pin and tag. The steak came out just the way I wanted which was medium rare. Delicious piece of meat, cooked well, juicy, tender, and more than what I could eat in one sitting. I took the rest home for later and even brought the giant bone with me to give to a dog. Service is generally good here, but we have had rookie waiters/waitresses before. They usually offer nice wines to pair with steaks, speak professionally, and are tentative. Would I choose to dine here again? No, but if someone else was paying or friend/family wanted to go, then sure. The wait is not worth my time. Other than that, Taste of Texas offers great food and service at a fancy price.

I always thought of Taste of Texas as being way too expensive to ever eat at.We decided to hit it up for lunch, thinking the lunch menu would be cheaper.Nope..no lunch menu.  Just as expensive as ever.So I opted for the smallest cut of prime rib (which was still ~$30).The salad bar trip the meal comes with is awesome.  Don't forget to get rolls/bread/butter/etc.The prime rib was good, but I've had prime rib at a lot of places and it did not make me feel it was so much better than any other place I've had it for (for $~10-$15 less).The service on the other hand was really annoying.Upon walking in there was almost literally a wall of 20+ servers waiting for people to come into the restaurant to be served.  This is great and all, but I don't want to see them all, go hide somewhere.  I don't like feeling like I'm having to say excuse me to employees when walking into a restaurant.After were seated, no less than 4 different people came to the table to greet, or drop off, or rearrange something on the table in the first five minutes we were there.After placing our order and sitting back down from our salad bar excursion, we were interrupted by people "just checking" on us, no less than once every 5 minutes.  Seriously.  This is too much.  Between conversation being interrupted constantly to having to answer different people about if we needed more water or something was just too much.I know it sounds like I'm complaining we got too much service, which is not the case, we were simply bugged in between getting good service.  Way annoying.I know someone is going to say I should have tried a $100 steak or something to have really gotten the experience, but the fact is for two people eating the smallest cut of prime rib, mid-day at lunch it still cost $115.  So...I still think I should have really felt impressed and awed by the food at the price, and instead left wondering what all the fuss is about.

Excellent "family" steals house but believe me, this is not the Ponderosa that my own family went to growing up! Not so cheap. Much better steaks. And really good salad bar. Done. I did see a lot of families with little kids dining  which begs the question: how do they pay for this?? LOL.

WOW.  Just wow... we waited roughly 2 hours to get seated... (i don't know if i'll wait for that long again, but the time went by fairly quickly)  Please note that this place does not take reservations.  However, while waiting they have soda, chips/salsa, popcorn and sometimes appetizers for people waiting... all for free!while waiting, grab a menu and look over what you're going to order so when you get seated you can order asap.  after getting seated, i asked them if i could order the ribeye.  the cool thing about the ribeye is that, you get to go back into the kitchen and pick your meat.  the ribeye is 16oz minimum and its 2.35 per oz... after 24 oz it goes down to a buck every oz after 24.  you get to pick if you want your steak lean cut or marbleized.   very cool that you get to watch them cut and tag your steak.if you order an entree, it comes with a salad bar... (if you just want the salad bar by itself, i believe its about 10 bucks).  the salad bar is legit.  lots of fresh veggies and lots of different dressings to pick from.  there's also a block of cheese you get to pick at.  and not to mention the bread!  the bread with the different types of butter are to die for!the steak took about 20 mins to come out.  and when it did, it looked like a beast. i ordered a 23 oz steak and when it came out, it looked like a beast.  i asked for medium rare and it came out just perfect.  the lemon garlic butter was on point.  the steak was juicy and tender.  the steak also came with 1 side.  i opted for the potato au gratin.  very delicious choice.  i heard this place has excellent dessert, but by then i was too full to continue. i guess since they have a soda machine on the waiting side, i think soda is free here.parking is a bitch during prime time...

So I hit up taste of texas again, and I'm choosing to update my review because my experience wasn't as good as the time before. While the service was phenomenal as is expected of an upscale restaurant, the steak left something to be desired. The ribeye I ordered wasn't seasoned at all besides the blue cheese butter on top - I firmly believe a good steak should have a base of salt and pepper at the least. I felt like I was served a $30 steak for $50 - I suppose I paid for the experience.... which has since worn off.

It was my husband and I's first time here. One word to describe our experience- PHENOMENAL!! JJ was our waiter. He was the absolute best!! Atmosphere is very relaxing. Food is superb!! We will be returning...

I really enjoyed Taste of Texas, there was nothing that I tried that I didn't enjoy. This is a steakhouse but they serve other items as well. Taste of Texas does not take reservations and gets pretty busy but the wait isn't too long. One of my favorite things about this place is the ambiance and the pick out your own steak option. Although it's a little pricey the dress code is pretty casual and laid back. Bring your appetite and give them a try, you won't regret it

Even though I am not a huge meat eater, I always enjoy my visits to Taste of Texas. They are on the pricey side but it's a nice location to celebrate those special occasions with loved ones. In fact, I was first introduced to this place a few months back because of a friend's birthday dinner. But I have made several returns to ToT ever since because their salad bar was pretty impressive and watching my friend try to finish a 48 oz steak added to my night's entertainment as well.During my last visit I decided to try their soup and salad bar option and being that I am typically not a fan of soups, their Baked Potato Soup is a must try! It was rich, creamy, and it changed my mind about soups. I have also tried their steaks before and I like that they allow their customers to go pick out their cut of meat. The ribeye by the ounce that I ordered that night was accompanied by a side of a grilled Portobello mushroom. However, I was not a huge fan of the mushroom. In addition, while you are waiting for your table to be ready...I love that this establishment offers snacks (i.e., popcorn and chips with salsa) and soda to make the wait time go faster. (Nobody wants to deal with a hangry customer!!). They have a lounge area with a bar, but it usually fills up pretty quickly. Their staff offers great customer service and are always pleasant.  I can't wait to go back to Taste of Texas to try the other items on the menu that they have to offer. :)
Over priced is my concern. Food is good, but not $50 worth good. To me, for $50 per person, they could do better.

My husband and I are visiting from NY. We are very hard to impress and this place certainly did it. Unbelievably friendly and knowledgeable waiter recommended perfect choice of steak and wine.
