Portions are huge. Steak was perfectly done. Unfortunately did not have any room left for desert,  have to go back .

Old school steakhouse with an awesome atmosphere and delicious steaks. I always enjoy coming here and being treated like a king by the excellent waitstaff. With a massive salad bar, all you can eat fresh bread, and very generous portions of food, if you leave here hungry, that is on you. The only drawback is the wait can exceed an hour at times and they do not accept reservations.

Where should I begin! By far the best Steak house in Houston.  I love the ambiance and the atmosphere. I ordered the New York Strip , Oscar Style with spinach. Steak was excellent and not over cooked. I can't forget the salad bar and for dessert, we had the snicker cheesecake. It meal was well worth the $200 I spent. I plan to go back in the coming weeks.

My mother and I dined here one day during the week. Soon after they opened it seemed they were immediately swamped as we went during lunch hours. I believe it may be best to make reservations prior to arriving otherwise you may have to wait, especially if its a large party. We both ordered the pecan crusted grilled chicken, which was stuffed with spinach and came with green beans and rice pilaf. It also came with a salad and complimentary rolls. The salad bar is a 'fix it yourself'. Everything was fresh and neatly put. The food was amazing, the salad was amazing and the service was superb. Our serve was great also! In fact, after we finished eating the manager came out to shake our hands and see how much we enjoyed our meals. Very kind and rare. This is hidden gem that our city is blessed to have. I would definitely return!

So after much discussion and picture viewing of the steaks here, I decided it was time to pay a visit again! I went here when I was in high school, which meant I didn't know better on what to get, and I probably got the cheapest thing here. This trip, I splurged a little because of a birthday occasion. (Complimentary dessert for special occasions!)-Wait time: Wasn't bad on a Friday night around 7pm. The wait was 30-40 mins and we had drinks at the bar with their complimentary popcorn, chips and sodas.-Service: Our waiter, Michael, was a sweet heart! He definitely was the realest of the real when it came to really enduring our experience. From encouraging us to at least visit the meat area to pick our cut since it was my boyfriend's first time, to no shame in asking for to-go boxes, even for our leftover bread! Entrees come with an all you can eat, which was awesome, but I didn't want to fill up on it.STEAKS: -Cowboy: This steak was huge...I picked the cut that had a medium amount of marble. I ordered medium rare - rare, since I feel the medium rare is too cooked while the rare isn't cooked enough. Man...I don't usually eat the fat on my steak...but it was to die for. Did I mention I also got garlic butter on it? The amount they gave me was amazing...I almost wished I had more because it was heavenly. I don't think I'm a steak snob, so my opinion on the meat itself isn't very knowledgeable, but I'll tell you that butter and steak combo= excellent. -Tomahawk: This steak was massive and a beauty to look at. The boyfriend got his steak medium rare with lemon pepper and garlic butter. I wished they put more garlic butter on his, but I had some to spare so I gave him some of mine. Again, we are not steak snobs, but he thoroughly enjoyed it. Sides:-Mac and Cheese: This was probably the most below averaged mac and cheese I have ever had. Usually steak venues have amazing mac and cheese...I can almost say that the mac and cheese that use to be served in my high school cafeteria was better than this mac and cheese. DON'T GET IT.-Steak Fries: Nothing special. At all. Dessert:The sample trio: Such a deal. We got key lime pie,  vanilla bean creme brûlée and snicker cheesecake. Desserts were awesome and I advice everyone to try it. Creme Brûlée was my favorite. Overall, besides the sides being a huge disappointment, steaks were delicious. Would I come back? Yes, for a special occasion I definitely would! I was recommended some other entrees that I will definitely look into.
Tomahawk Ribeye was so normal. The steak was under seasoned. The asparagus with hollendaise sauce was also under seasoned. The meat itself was good, perfectly cooked med rare. No wow factor.

The service is awesome.  Everyone is so nice and very helpful. Our waiter was amazing.  My husband and I ordered the New York Strip. This was our first time here and  we had high expectations of this place.  We were so disappointed.  The steaks we not all that great and the sides were not all that tasty either.  Safe to say we will never be back again

Always gotten the tomahawk.  Great steaks and awesome salad bar included.  Price and service are excellent for what you get as well.  Wish they take reservations because this place can be a very long wait especially nights and weekends.

Underwhelmed. Let me explain....I have been wanting to come here for a while and just haven't for one reason or another.  I love eating out but am not a big steak eater even though I do it from time to time. Normally when I go out to eat my first or second or third thought is not where can I go for a good steak. An opportunity presented itself last week that made me think of going here and I did. It was a Tuesday night and was pleased that the wait for a table was only about 5 minutes because I had read other reviews about waiting...I like the decor of this place. It looks like a Texas steakhouse and is nicely decorated in that vein. After reviewing the menu and even though they offer other entrees than steak I decided to go with the NY Strip with a side of mushrooms. Looking forward to the salad I was very pleased with what I saw and ate. It is one of the better salad bars that I have visited in a while with all of the extras that you would want (5). Also their bread options were very good too. I really liked the salad and bread. About 15-20 minutes after ordering the steak and shrooms showed up and looked very good. A big 16 oz piece of meat. I started with that first and after eating a couple of bites thought it was average. Actually as I continued to eat it I though that it was a little tough and in some cases extra chewy due to some sinew and or pieces of fat. I hate to say this but the steak underwhelmed me. Had I been at a inexpensive steak house I would have understood but this was a $43 steak and should have been better. I have to give it a 2.5 because a 3 would not be fair for a place like this. The mushrooms were very good with a lot of flavor with a beef accent (4). Also my service was very good and professional (4).As you can see everything was very good or better except for the most important part--the steak. Perhaps I just got unlucky but I have to report what I experienced. That's why I am going to average everything out to a 3.  I would go back one more time for another chance  though i don't know how soon.
The wait staff, food and atmosphere was fantastic! Definitely returning! Thank you so much for having a high standard for customer service! :-)

Don't go on a holiday like valentine or something else unless you ready to wait for more than an hour. It has the best customer service, best steaks for the steak lovers, clean restrooms and so much more. I was satisfied with the whole experience and will be back soon.
This was far and away the best steak of my life! Salad bar was great too. Something special about getting to pick out your steak before they cook it.
Excellent salad bar, steak, salmon, and desserts!!  We were in town visiting and we're so glad we decided on this steakhouse.  Thanks to yelp, we found this amazing restaurant!!

While the restaurant doesn't take reservations, the waiting room with free drinks & snacks made the wait go by fast. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. Our table ordered the cowboy & the prime rib. Both were excellent. The salad bar was extremely impressive. Barely had room left for our steak after 2 trips to the salad bar.

Unfortunately, I am not a meat eater but a Texan friend brought me here just to get a taste of Texas. The service was great! Super friendly waiters. The salmon was OK, but I tasted better at home (PNW). The portions are huge. A nice place to visit if you are visiting Texas. Definitely an experience.

Hands down, the absolute best!!! The service is wonderful!! The food is incredible!! The salad bar and dessert menu are all made in house and fresh daily!!! My first time coming here and I will certainly be back!!! It's a tad pricey, but the food is very, very,good!

definitely shoud be the best steakhouse in TX. my sister come to visit me from another country and she said she would come to houston again because of this restaurant. t-bone is my favoriate?so amazing?haha I did not care about the calories...top one recommendation.

After years of hearing that T of T is the best steak in town I finally made it by for lunch today. Pretty disappointing actually. I had the 10 oz Oscar Filet. The crab meat was delicious. The only real highlight of the meal. The steak was flat out mediocre, maybe even weak. Nothing special - on par with Saltgrass or Texas Land and Cattle frankly, which is sad for a "best in the city" steak house.  The potatoes au gratin was lousy.  Almost flavorless. Admittedly I hate onions and wasn't expecting them (don't think it was on the menu, which isn't right). But even just eating the potato and cheese was bland and needed salt to be palatable. I don't mind spending $60+ on a lunch if it's delicious.  This wasn't. The service was just mediocre too. There are a lot of better places to get a steak in Houston. Brenners destroys this place in my experience, on every level, and it's only a mile or two down the road. Hopefully this was just a fluke - I may try it again for dinner some time, but it's pretty unlikely I'll drive past Brenners to get to Taste of Texas.

If I could give this place more than 5 stars, I would.My wife and I first came here in 2011. We kept coming back.We just returned for the first time in 3 years but only because we moved away. We happen to be in Houston for a day and so we HAD to have lunch here. It's as great as I remember.I have nothing I can say that is bad. Every single element of a fine restaurant/steakhouse is present and with tons of bravado. It's not a cheap restaurant - but you get what you pay for. And for their dishes I think they are bargains!In about a dozen trips, not a single bad experience. I don't think I've had that good luck with any restaurant anywhere.The food is awesome. The service is great. The ambience is perfect. The portions are too much for my wife and I. What else do you want?!
No better steak house in Houston. The service is always great. Expensive but worth it. And their desserts are legendary.

Went there with my parents for my dad's birthday. The salad bar was clean and well prepared with fresh veggies. The bread that they had tasted amazing! We ordered the 14 oz. Ribeye and the New York Strip Sirloin. We asked them to make it medium and steaks were perfectly cooked. I had my New York cooked with garlic butter and it tasted great! Even though we only ordered two steaks to share amongst three people we had left overs because the portions were so big. They gave us a dessert on the house for my dad's birthday, and took complementary pictures. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Overall it was a great experience!

It was that time of the year when a gal wants to celebrate her birthday and wanted it all to be a surprise. My fiance did a wonderful job by selecting Taste of Texas. He has been to this restaurant a number of times with his co-workers, but it was my first time and it was all a surprise. As we were pulling up, he said "we are going to pappadeux for your birthday!" which I was fine with as well, but he tricked me and he pulled into the Taste of Texas parking lot instead. He asked me to get off and get a number, since he was aware that there was a wait time. I did not expect to wait an hour and thirty minutes to an hour and forty five minutes BUT they have a great waiting area, with complimentary sodas, water, chips & salsa, and popcorn (and a BAR). The outside wait area also had cooling systems, which I thought was very neat. I actually dressed up for my birthday and had a ton of makeup on (lol) so I did not want to wait outside. We decided to wait inside, and have some drinks, okay- only one drink lol (did not want to get too full with alcohol and chips.)We did wait about 1 1/2 hours, but it was worth it. Salad bar was amazing, bread was delicious (about four different types available) and our dinner was great. I have had better steak, BUT it was not bad. It was a ribeye, med-rare. I know my cuts of meat, and I knew it was going to be fatty- but I still enjoyed it, mainly because my fiance went out of his way for me. Taste of Texas gave me my dessert for free, so thank you all for that!  I got the snickers cake, which was topped with a sparkler, that matched my mood :)  Hopefully we will be back soon!

I have been coming here all my life and must say this is still one of the best steakhouses I've ever been to. You get a great bang for your buck. Their Christmas decorations are up too now and are just simply beautiful. I am writing this review now because I was really blown away by my last dining experience. I felt my cowboy steak was a little undercooked (bf and I were sharing) and the waiter took my half back. I felt when it came back it was now slightly over cooked and the manager said he would get me an entire new 16 oz ribeye steak! I was shocked. And each time my steak (my half) came out, they brought me a new side dish. The staff just went so above and beyond what I would have even imagined to make sure I was happy! They sure know how to make you feel special.

I came here for my father in laws birthday dinner and have never been before. It's a little weird because it reminds me of that Lauberge because it's dark with no windows and everything is pricey. We walked in on a Tuesday night at about 8 oclock and there was no wait. They placed us in a back corner which I guess was good because our family is a little loud. A few of us split meals (huge portions). My husband and I got the tbone with garlic butter. We ordered well done but it was still a little pink. My sister in law's which was also supposed to be well done was VERY pink but we didn't send it back because there was plenty of other food. The salad bar is ok. I wasn't as blown away with it as people on here rave. It reminds me of Jason's Deli to be honest. And the bread warmer is interesting so you get to choose the type of bread and butter/sauce you want. The cheese bread is good but if it cools down then the melted cheese hardens and isn't very apppetizing. The place did take our picture and bring out a free dessert which made the evening nice.This place is fancy but it's more of a special occasion place rather than a every weekend thing. In total for all 6 of us it was $246 (Plus more for tip). It's nice for those who have never been but coming a lot can probably make it lose that charm.

Took my friend from Switzerland who was visiting, wanted to impress her "Texas style" and succeeded!!! Great service, good food and fantastic ambiance. Houstonians have a real representative with this place, all the best flavored of Texas. Huge fan. Will be bringing back all my "non" Texas friends. Great great place to impress.

I have been lucky enough to enjoy this amazing restaurant since I was just a little girl! The owners, managers and all staff are truly exceptional people and make the dining experience incredible.  The food is always delicious.  We actually enjoy the wait on the weekends with free sodas and snacks.  We always run into old friends there and get to catch up while waiting for our table.  Fun time always!

Taste of Texas...we'll keep it brief because it really speaks for itself.- Food: Eat steak. Order from the right side of the menu to have unlimited salad bar access and a free side with your steak. I recommend the cowboy steak (about 18 oz of meat) or the ribeye (16 oz minimum, priced by the oz). They were delicious, not ridiculously overpriced like I've had at other high-end steak houses, and cooked to a perfect medium rare. You have the choice of an optional seasoning on each steak as well; the garlic butter was incredible and also entails your steak coming out on a hot platter. You can even go into the back room and pick out the steak you want by looking at the display case and they'll tag it with a number to make sure it gets onto your plate. I tried the brussel sprouts and mushroom sides and they were both excellent.- Service: Phenomenal. Truly. My mom was dining with us and she tends to give waitstaff a hard time but our waiter (I think his name was Anthony) was a true professional. I can't say enough good things about him. I am pretty sure that when I stepped away from the table for a minute, I left my rumpled napkin behind on my chair and when I came back, I found it neatly folded on the table. Not only was he an exceptional waiter, he is also apparently a ninja. - Price: Each steak costs anywhere from $40-60ish. This includes the unlimited salad bar and a side dish. Really quite a deal. The salad bar is stocked full of delicious fancy veggies/nuts, cheeses, breads, and spreads. Oh, and there's complimentary cinnamon coffee (which also happens to be decaf) that everyone should try! It's quite good.If you're from Texas and you've never been to Taste of Texas, please go. You don't regret it...and you'll definitely be craving it for a few weeks afterward.

BEST IN HOUSTON! I am a native and TOT is a no-brainer for perfection of food, service, menu selection. Yes, it's pricey and often very crowded. There is a reason!! Amazing food quality with stellar service. The Hendee family is a Lord loving family and treat everyone with same welcoming atmosphere. This is the birthday, anniversary, special out of town guest best of the best!!

Five stars ! Very good restaurant .This place is very generous, chips and salsa while you wait for a table. Popcorn and free drinks too!Salad bar was top notch, service was great!Now for the steaks! The best steak I have had in a long time. Definitely worth the big price tag.

This is exactly what my husband and I wanted to find in Texas...a one of a kind Steakhouse that's feels, well, like Texas. We picked out our own steaks and took a picture with the bear and everything. It was very touristy of us. The server was very sweet. The food was very good. The portions were large.

Went here for my sons 16th Birthday by recommendation of several co-workers. What can I say but absolutely amazing meal. The filet with garlic butter sauce you could cut with a butter knife. Our server Matt, was absolutely attentive to our every need.  Thank you Taste of Texas for making my Sons 16th Birthday dinner so special.

Weeknights=Excuses...My family eats at Taste of Texas several times a month.  I've found weeknights are generally their weakest performances and tonight proved no different.  The service has been spotty, the food mediocre and inconsistent for the level of expectation, and managements response was on the side of helpless.  If Saltgrass and Outback is your top rung steakhouse experience, this won't ever disappoint.  But if you dine at the city's top steakhouses, Taste of Texas may be slipping from their rank at the top of the list.

I went to this place years ago when I was a kid. Our family went last Friday and it was a complete blast from the past. So much looked exactly the same. My parents informed me that I used to get the cheeseburger when I was a kid, but I ordered the New York strip this time with the asparagus and au gratin potatoes. I was absolutely impressed. Houston has a reputation for chewing up and spitting out restaurants so for this place to be open and continue to have such high standards after so many years is spectacular. I am sure we won't be allowing so many years to pass between visits again!
This is my favorite spot to get a good juicy steak! The salad bar is also great. The place is always clean and the workers are very nice!

Best meal in Houston in terms of both food and service quality. We have two people and ordered the Tomahawk Ribeye Steak. It had an impressive appearance: with a long bone hanging off the plate and 38 ounces of meat. The steak is Angus certified which speaks for its supreme quality. The steak was cooked to medium as suggested by the waiter and the taste and texture were just awesome. Highly recommend it to people who Wang to get a taste of steak with quality.

Took friends from Japan to ToT last night.  I go here about twice a year and am always happy with the experience. My wife enjoys the salad bar and shares the 20 oz Cowboy Ribeye with me.  Most of the time we have leftovers because even knowing how good the steak will be, I cannot skimp on the salad bar.  My friends from Japan had a Filet and a regular sized Ribeye and both made sounds of great enjoyment.  The prices are not bad for a steakhouse of this quality and the experience is far better than at some other, more expensive, places that are considered "better."To top off a great meal experience - the staff are all well trained and friendly, the restaurant recognizes birthdays with a nice dessert and my international friends were loaned cowboy hats and given neckerchiefs and sent home with pictures from a great meal and a great experience.
Wow!! Had the t-bone and it was perfectly cooked. Sides. Who needs them by they were wonderful as well. The wrapped quail appetizer is a big recommend!!

Every now and then someone visits from out of state and wants the Texas steakhouse experience.  You need not look any further than Taste of Texas.They do not take reservations, but that really doesn't matter.  Their bar area is bigger than a lot of restaurants.  There is plenty of room to sit down and enjoy a cocktail while you wait for your table to be ready.  I actually enjoy this more than being ushered straight to a table.When you do get to your table you receive your menu.  You can also get a wine list which comes on an iPad.  I found this interesting, but my guess is this keeps the list really up to date.  We started with the Texas Quail Bites.  You really can't go wrong with bacon wrapped anything, and they were very tasty.  I am not sure I would get an appetizer next time, as the rest of the meal was so big.I ordered the Ribeye steak by the ounce.  It was $2.55 per ounce and I ordered a 20oz steak.  They take you to the back where the butcher area is and let you pick out your steak.  They held up a whole slab of meat and let me pick what I wanted.  It was pretty cool.  If you order a meal the salad bar is free.  This is why I probably would not get an appetizer.  The salad bar was big and lots of options.  You can also make yourself a basket of bread to take back to the table.  Since everything is a la carte, I also ordered some Au Gratin Potatoes.After polishing off the quail and salad my cooked steak and potatoes showed up.  The steak was tender and juicy.  It was well seasoned, and tasty.  I ordered it medium rare, and it was definitely medium.  I didn't mind this and finished every bit of it.  The potatoes were good too, but the hero here really is the steak.  Somehow I managed to order dessert too.  I got the Snickers Pie, which is basically a cheesecake with a big layer of snickers.  I can't believe I managed to eat all of it.  I left Taste of Texas more stuffed then I have been in a long time.  Everything thing I had there was great, and their portions definitely are Texas sized!  The service was friendly and it was a great time.  I will be looking for an excuse to go back!

The place was amazing, it was pricey but completely worth itWent for a birthday dinner and was more than worth it The server was amazing and helpful Ordered the salmon and prime ribBoth tasted great and the entrees came with one trip to salad bar which was great We got a complimentary cake on the house for the birthday celebration, they even take your pics with the cake and print it out for you Its a great place with amazing food

Love this place! There's usually a long wait but you get popcorn and chips with salsa while you wait. The steak is really good. I love getting it with garlic butter. The manager is usually walking around making sure everyone is happy. I would have given it 5 stars but it lost 1 star because they changed their tradition. For all first timers, they used to take a photo of them in cowboys hats and a bandanna and give them a copy. Last time we went they said they only do it for new international visitors and they don't do the bandana. I felt like this was why I always took out of town visitors here. That and they let  you choose your meat.

Meat! Vegetarians stay at home. Yes, they do have non-beef dinners but not half as much fun as MEAT! She enjoyed the Prime Rib and I had a 24oz Rib Eye. Very satisfying. Also we did the baked sweet potatoes with cinnamon butter and pecans ... oh yeah, some green beans. After all, we must eat "healthy". Had a demi bottle of Duck Horn Cabernet and of course a martini and some quail bites to start the meal. Great service. If you want a bit of piece and quiet away from the main dining room, ask for a table in one of the side dining rooms.

Great place to go for steaks!Great spot for getting a good quality steak!Salad bar is humongous with plenty to choose from and they have cheeses you slice yourself and breads to choose from. Steaks are amazing and are always consistent in their temperatures. Delicious and definitely will melt in your mouth. Only thing that's a bit of a downer is that they do not take reservations, but they do have a great waiting area with free soft drinks, popcorn and chips & salsa to much on while you wait. But don't get too full off of those! The best part is coming!Desserts.....Oh good god. They have a lot. And they all look delicious! I love Creme Brulee, and that's usually what I go for.Enjoy!

Taste of Texas is all about letting you select what you would like to put inside your body. Start with one of the best salad bars I have ever experienced - YOU choose what you want on your salad - all fresh and delicious. Want a steak? YOU get to go back to the kitchen and select the meat you would like the restaurant to cook for you. I love their filet, but the well-marbled Ribeye, T-bone, and Porterhouse are all absolutely amazing. Then, for you bread lovers, they have fresh baked rolls to die for - great with both your meal and salad. Try not to stuff yourself because they also have great appetizers and deserts - love, love love Taste of Texas!!! One last tip - you HAVE to go during the Christmas Season when they decorate the place with thousands of lights and classic Christmas decorations. Great for Special Occasions!!!

Went there for Father's Day. Outstanding prime rib and my wife's medallions were fantastic. Salad bar is one of the best in Houston. Mimi took great care of us and cant wait to come back. This is a must see if you want a true Texas steak.

If you plan to eat at Taste of Texas prepare to wait for at least two episodes of American Ninja Warrior! Relax its not that bad..but definitely bring something to keep you occupied! If you're on a date, it's the perfect time to sit by the bar and get to know your gal :)! The restaurant had complimentary soft drinks, chips and salsa, and popcorn in the waiting room which are bombbb. Chips and salsa are my weakness. Most of the entrees come with the salad bar. The salad bar is very nice! Have to get your micros in before the main course. For our entree we ordered the Tomahawk Steak with a side of mashed potatoes and a steamed lobster tail. We also ordered a side of baked potato soup. The tomahawk steak is HUGE. Everything is truly bigger in Texas. It was topped with herb-garlic butter on top cooked perfectly (medium-rare). I honestly believe it can be shared between two or even three. This is personal preference but it is a fatty piece of beef..a little too much marbling for me..I guess I'm not man enough to hang with this steak :( 8/10The lobster  tail was good too. I think it was a little over cooked so it was a little chewy. It came with melted butter kept warm by a candle fire. 7/10The baked potato soup was very thick and hearty! Went down easy and my girlfriend added cheese into the soup which made it cheesy and delicious. My girlfriend thought it was okay but I liked it. 7/10For dessert we picked out the snickers cake which was dangerously sweet but it was delicious. I could imagine my next dentist appointment already bite after bite but I just could not stop!  9/10Overall the service was great, food was good, and it was a great experience. Would come again, great place for celebrating a special occasion, Texas forever, and HOOK EM \m/

Well...I want to give this place 5 stars but I just can't. Start from the beginning. This place NEEDS to take reservations. There is no reason on a Saturday night we have to wait two hours. It's STUPID! They give you popcorn and pop while you wait but do you REALLY want to eat or drink that and fill up so you arent hungry for your expensive steak?! The inside of the resturant is dark, dank, uninviting, and slightly creepy. Not what I would expect. Reminded me of the Cheesecake Factory but much worse. The salad bar always has a line and I don't understand why this place doesnt have Italian dressing?? Seriously! Then there's the cheese block...as your standing there struggling to get WARM cheese off a block while there is people behind you waiting to do the same thing giving you dirty looks! They need to hire someone JUST to put cheese on your salad...keep the line moving and save me from blisters! The rolls and butter are good and love how you can take a basket back to your table!! I didnt notice that little perk until our last trip. The service SUCKS! The prime rib I always get medium and is cooked PICTURE PERFECT! Worth every penny! The chocolate cake is AMAZING! Especially with extra chocolate sauce!!! YUMMMMMM! Everytime we come here there is a birthday nearby and the candle/sparkler they use is SO GROSS! The smell makes me want to throw up! GET A NEW KIND OF CANDLE! When I was pregnant I actually had to take a break eating because the smell was TOO much for me. I would like to give this place a 5 star rating but I have "beef" with this place. HAHAHA!

I loved the waiting area! They don't take reservations, but the waiting area is worth it! Free chips & salsa, popcorn, and soda/water while you wait, with plenty of tables to sit at. There is also a dedicated bar in that area as well.The salad bar was great, as was the food! We got a steak, and it was enough to share. One of my favorite steak houses in Houston!

One of my favorite restaurants.  Never had a bad meal there, and service is always good.  It's not cheap, but I would still say that it is one of the better values out there for a good steak house.  The only reason that I did not give 5 stars is because they don't take reservations, and there is always at least an hour wait on the weekends.

I enjoy steak, I love a great tasting steak, so in turn, I love this place.  I have to say, if this place is a "Taste of Texas", then these Texans know how to make some good food!  The idea that everything is big in Texas goes well here!  Let me start by saying that while waiting for our table, we were able to help ourselves to some chips with salsa, popcorn, and even fountain soft drinks, which were all complementary!!  What a nice touch.. but also.. a bad way to spoil your appetite.  You want to be hungry for the food here! (Though I couldn't resist the "free" because of that "Asian" in me!)Once we sat down, I gazed at the menu... specifically the steak page.  They got your styles of sirloin and rib-eye steaks to choose from.  Let me just say that their largest in-menu item steak is called a Tomahawk Ribeye, a 38oz steak made for a caveman!  This steak has a bone which I would say is at least 1 foot, hanging OFF the steak.  So if you were in the Stone Age and had some really strong teeth, you could hold this 38oz steak by the BONE and just eat it without utensils.  Now do I recommend you to do this.. I do not, but if time travel was created and you bring a caveman here, I'm sure he would be happy to eat the steak this way!Another nice touch here is that you can order rib-eye steak by the ounce.  So is a 38oz steak not enough for you?!? Then ORDER MORE!!  Personally for me, a nice 24oz Cowboy steak was my choice.  Also, they give you an option for sauces/seasoning on the steak, and I choose the option of lemon pepper, along with herb butter garlic sauce.  FYI the other option of sauce they have here is a blue cheese butter.  After my friends and I picked our steaks, we were given the option to go to the back and PICK our cuts of steak.  Nice this was a nice touch!  Of course.. I picked one of the fattest cuts, which I did not regret one bit due to the flavorful steak I was about to eat!  After we picked our steaks, we helped ourselves to the unlimited salad bar that comes with my order.  The salad bar was a nice appetizing start to the meal, with some good bread to munch on as well.So once the steak comes, I have to say this was one of the best cuts of steak I've eaten.  The combination of lemon pepper and herb garlic sauce work very well for me, and this steak was just full of flavor, juiciness, and deliciousness!  There is not enough descriptive words I can say about this steak.  In essence, it was just, GREAT!  I was also able to get a bide of my friend's Tomahawk steaks, which were also great as well.  There was a point during dinner that all my friends and I were just so quiet at the table due to all of us enjoying the steaks!If you can take the prices here (it is a high-end, pricy place), then definitely check out Taste of Texas.  I also noticed they asked us if anyone was from out of the country visiting.  Apparently, if you are visiting from another country, they dress you up with a cowboy hat to show everyone you are a foreigner.  In addition, if they have it, they will provide you with a menu in your home-language, which is a very nice souvenir to have, so you can remember that cut of steak you ate.. that GOOD cut of steak!

I have enjoyed eating here for many years.  We were customers before they even moved to this location. However while dining there in mid December we were celebrating two friends birthdays which we have done several times there.  The waiter, and I wish I could remember his name, kept asking questions about their birthdays.  After we received the bill and we were charged for 2 usually complimentary birthday desserts, I asked him why and he said the birthday policy was they needed to be within two weeks.  My complaint is he never told us that, never confirmed the actual date of the birthdays and should not have charged and additional $20 without communicating that.  As to not make a scene with my friends, I paid the bill and left.  My history of lovely meals at T. of T. is done.

Taste of Texas is overwhelmingly incredible. This is more than a restaurant. I truly felt I was at Disneyland. It's Big Thunder Ranch with a great salad bar and amazing steaks. The service, food and overall experience exude happiness. I can't wait to return.

Not sure what I could say that hasn't been said already. Service: always amazing and attentive. Great recommendations and never pushy. Food: Um, duh. It's why you come! Make sure to be really hungry though. I tend to fill up on the salad bar because it's amazing. There's also a few bread choices, some cheese blocks you can shave yourself.Atmosphere: You're definitely in Texas. I haven't had the opportunity to come during Christmas to see the decorations, but it's a nice large space so you don't feel crowded. Make sure to let them know it's your first time there, they'll take you to the back to choose your own steak. Even if it's not your first time, you'll be able to go back there if you want. They also don't take reservations but this hasn't ever been an issue. I've come by with a large group for lunch before and we had to wait possibly 5-10 minutes. Otherwise, we've always been seated immediately.

Fantastic food and service -- can't get any better than this!Juicy, tender steaks cooked to perfection, and incredible salad bar, great appetizers (quail skewers, crab cakes, stuffed shrimp, and more), and the best deserts!  Finish it off with cappuccino!

I don't even like steak, but even I get excited about a trip to Taste of Texas!  My boyfriend loves steak in general, so I begrudgingly tried TOT with him a few months ago.  It goes without saying that the steak is delicious, but the salad and bread bar is what really sold me.  They have lots of fresh options on the bar and the honey, cinnamon butter that you get with the fresh bread is ADDICTIVE!  Don't leave without trying it.Other recommendations:  Jalapeno Stuffed Shrimp and the Ribeye or Center Cut Filet with Lemon Pepper Seasoning.Warning: They do not take reservations, so you may end up waiting an hour if you come in during the weekend.  That being said, they have an entire waiting area with a bar, popcorn, and self-serve chips and salsa to make the wait bearable.

How anyone could rate this restaurant with any less than 4 Stars confounds me. I have given it a 5 on this particular occasion because after being seated and waiting 10 minutes for water or a server the manager (at our behest) stepped in and began to act as a server until he could get coverage for our table. He later comp'd us desserts on top of his attentiveness. We had been seated just as the restaurant was beginning service (it was about 5:15 PM) hence either the waiter did not understand he had our table or he had simply not yet been assigned. In any case when he showed up and took over for the manager he continued the incredible service. Let me however step back for a moment and begin to describe the meal which for me started with a very dry martini which was excellent. The salad bar was typically stocked with a variety of fresh vegetables and toppings as well as cheese and my personal favorite Jalapeno Corn Bread. Because we were an early seating we did not suffer from the oftentimes long wait which is as a result of the quality and service of this restaurant. Although the wait can be detracting from the experience, if you take into consideration why it occurs (because the steaks are amazing) it's popularity is really not reason to be critical of the restaurant. Make it a point to leave work early or get there at 5:00 PM and that problem goes away. Now onto my Cowboy Ribeye, rare...it was perfect. Cooked perfectly, well marbled, just the proper amount of char which I have made every attempt to duplicate for about 20 years or more, moist and hot. This is clearly my favorite steak and of all the steak restaurants I have gone to is probably one of the best. Mushrooms were my chosen vegetable and coffee topped off the meal although my guests had desserts compliment of the manager. Given yesterday evenings service and the steak which is always dependable, of high quality and well portioned for the cost I had to give the experience 5 Stars.

I ate here today (8-25-16).  The service was great.  The salad bar was great.   I ordered the grilled tuna, which I know is kind of weird to get at a steak place.  It was served a bit overdone for me; however I'm not the type to send stuff back so I ate it, and for the most part, enjoyed it anyway.  My biggest complaint is that it was very obvious that the lemon placed in my glass of water was cut with the same knife that was used to slice onions because my water, as well as everyone's water or tea (any drink with a lemon) at our table had a very strong onion smell and taste.  I like onions, just not in my drinks.  After figuring that out, I couldn't help but wonder what other shortcuts are happening in the kitchen.  I really expect more from a place that is as pricey as this place is.

We came here to celebrate my birthday during our Texas trip in March. The overall experience was pleasant, from the refreshment at waiting area, to free salad and the service. We were invited to the kitchen and choose our steak, which was a nice touch. However, the steaks did not wow me. Both of us ordered rib eyes, one medium rare and the other medium. They tasted not much different from the ones you would order at somewhere like Texas Roadhouse. Our friend  recommended Taste of Texas as if it's THE place to eat steak but I was left unimpressed.
It is worth every dollar! Leftover steak is good for at least 2 reheats in the microwave - still tender and juicy! And those asiago cheese rolls!!!

Really over priced for the quality of steak I recieved. Tough and full of grisle.  I was Soulja disappointed.  Very cold in resturant and this caused my food (potatoes) to get cold fast.   Not sure I'm up to try it again.

The three stars are based on past visits.  I didn't want to lower the overall rating based on one experience as most times I would rate Taste of Texas 5+ stars....That being said tonight's experience was more like a 1 star. I'm not going to complain about the wait or price, as both are fine for the environment and do not reflect the rating for me. Tonight my husband and I went out to celebrate my birthday. My filet was delicious, cooked perfectly medium/well. My husband ordered the 16oz NY strip, well done, also stated he wanted it grey all the way through. Try #1, medium. Try #2, medium/well(ish). The manager was very polite and understanding (Norman) as was the waitress. They offered to start a new steak, which my husband was happy to hear at that point-as a third attempt would most likely mean a rubbery steak. (Well done steak can be cooked juicy if done right-as he has had the same steak cooked the same way several times there)  Try #3, medium-blood pooling on top and on the bottom of the steak. That killed his appetite and he just asked for the check. The manager assured him the meal was on him and to order a desert.  My husband asked for it to go as he could not eat after the 3 attempts at his meal had failed. Our evening away from kids was pretty much a loss, while the wait was the best part of the evening. Of course my husband did not pay for his meal, as he should not have-he did not eat it, and waited for 3 attempts to cook his steak properly. We did pay for my meal, which honestly at that point I think wasn't very good customer service. We use to frequent Taste of Texas somewhat often, but I am not sure when/if my husband will want to return his business there.
Fantastic place to take newbies to the city! True Texas dining large delicious portions and friendly warm service must try the bread and cornbread! Tasty tasty!

We came here for our chrismas company party and let me tell you this plase is AWSOME. Its expensive but awsome. From the atmosphere in the restaurant to the service we received. The waitress was really attentive and anwer any question we had. They have a salad bar and their bread. What i love also was their diffrent tyoe of desert . Just great food

I haven't been here in over a year, and we used to frequent this place more often. I don't what changed but today we were taking one of our co workers to lunch before he gets married this weekend.Our HR person had called ahead and reserved he tables as we had 9 people that were going to be attending.The service was excellent, our waiter's name was Corey and he was on point. He took care of us from the time we walked in to the time we left. We all mostly ordered the salad bar, which is excellent and soup. Corey did not screw up our orders and he made sure that we had adequate amounts of ice tea, water and lemons on our table. He even let us do separate tickets, I know that must have been a headache for him but I think he got a larger tip because of his service. I will have to put them back into m y lunch rotation.

We celebrated our wedding anniversary this week by going to Taste of Texas.  We had heard nothing but great things about it so decided to finally try it. I was for-warned to get there early because it gets packed.  We got there at 4:40pm and our wait time was like 15 min.  However, when we were finally leaving there looked like there was well over 50 people waiting for a table.If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would.  I had the Cowboy Ribeye steak cooked medium.  They had 3 choices of ways to cook your steak: garlic butter, blue cheese, and lemon pepper.  We went with the garlic butter and when I say this was the best steak I've ever had, I completely mean it.  The flavor was amazing, it was cooked perfectly, and it was huge!!!! 24 oz to be exact!  I pretty much had 2 meals off that 1 steak (leftovers).  With purchase of the steak we got a free trip to the salad bar.  There was nothing too amazing about it but that didn't take away from the experience. I will say that I really enjoyed the jalapeno corn bread and the dinner rolls with the cinnamon butter.  They had some type of cheese bread that looks like a cinnamon roll that was not good at all. It must be an acquired taste that I clearly have not acquired. We also ordered an appetizer of Quail bites that came with Jalapeno poppers.  The entire thing was delicious!  The bbq sauce was amazing!!To my surprise before we got our tab, our waitress came out with a tray of desserts and asked us which one we wanted.  She said because it was our anniversary, they were going to give us our choice of any dessert on the house.  She also took a picture of my husband and I when our dessert came out and gave us a copy of it in a card with the Taste of Texas's logo on it.  I was thoroughly impressed.Everything we ordered came out to about $135 for 2 steaks and an appetizer and 2 drinks.  That wasn't bad at all.  I will definitely be back.  I LOVED TASTE OF TEXAS!!!

This place is phenomenal!!! The food is to die for and the service is amazing! Everyone is so polite. Our server delivered the best service we have ever received. I got the single cut filet 6oz with asparagus the salad bar. We also order the slice of heaven for dessert! Our waiters name was Mike F. Definitely the best service we have ever had, we will definitely be returning. The food is worth the money by far!!!
Everyone should try this place at least once or twenty times.  The steak is always cooked perfectly and the salad bar is top notch. And the service is consistently great!

This place is second to none!  Got the 16oz NY strip w asparagus and hollandaise sauce.   The salad bar rocks!  Hand crumbled fresh bacon, I think I must have eaten the equivalent of 8 pieces w other amazing toppings.When you arrive have plenty of money in your pocket, it is worth it.
Although the wait is long, it is definitely worth it! The steak was perfectly cooked and it was juicy inside. I personally love the Tomahawk Ribeye Steak the most.

Amazing restaurant experience here.  Crab cakes were the best I've ever had! Get the desserts- you will not regret it.Erin was one of the best servers I've had.  Thank you Erin for being so attentive and giving us a one of a kind experience.  Love this restaurant!
Waiting for a table took about 2 hours, which is fine except when the food is mediocre at best.

Hey there Cowgirls and Cowboys, you might want to saddle up and head over here....this isn't just a ordinary steakhouse, this is THE STEAKHOUSE!!! For first timers expect to be offered a big ole' Stetson and a bandana, and make sure that when they ask you to pick out your steak you accept........just follow me your waiter will say......A few steps across the dining room, and the beautiful smell hits you like a Chuck Norris Fist.  POW!  This is a man cave disguised as a restaurant.  I can feel the testosterone flowing through the floorboards.  ...So now your feeling a bit strange as your waiter has taken you in the back of the building and into the kitchen.  Inside a counter is set up and you can select your specific steak.  I was having a ribeye, so I was shown a handful of sides of beef and selected the marbling of my choice.  He cut it perfectly to my specifications.  A silver tag was clipped to my steak #61.  I was told when it arrives at the table to make sure it was the steak with my number.  I asked for it with Garlic butter and it arrived sizzling on a iron plate.  It was cooked to perfection and a side dish of au gratin potatoes finished me off.  I can do this, I can do this.... Come on man! Eat!  The Duke never took home a doggie bag!!!! Don't even think about looking at that dessert tray unless you are a grizzled veteran or a competitive eater.....this is my advice.  I had the handmade ice cream sunday and I feel like I need to upgrade my seat as I write this on the plane home....Texans really know how to eat.This is a must stop in Houston.
Usually, I bring the guests from other states, countries there. Today was a family event and the food and the service was excellent. Really appreciate Tina for the wonderful service!

It's not as if Taste of Texas really needs another 5 star review but they definitely do deserve it.  The only thing that bugged me is that they don't take reservations and the wait was about 1.5 hours for a party of 2 on a Saturday evening.  Aside from that, service is impeccable. The salad bar here is so so. Just a regular salad bar with nothing special. The cinnamon butter for bread is so delicious!  Let's get to what really matters-- the meat!  I had the porterhouse steak medium rare with garlic butter. So good and so much flavor!  Portions are obviously huge. I definitely had leftovers. My boyfriend had the tomahawk which was very flavorful but we both agreed the porterhouse was the winner. I would definitely come back here. I like that it's a delicious steakhouse with a more casual ambiance. I wouldn't feel underdressed if I came here in jeans with a nice top and the fellas can do the same.

Love this place. I can't believe I am just now reviewing it! It never disappoints. I usually get the center cut filet Oscar style which is when they put crab lumps on top with béarnaise sauce. My dad had the cowboy steak. 24 oz of juicy deliciousness. Oh. My. Goodness. And you get a salad bar with your meal which is to die for. It is so huge and such great selections including a section where you can shave off slices of cheese from a huge block! The first time I came here I could have died! Then they bring out this dessert tray display that just takes you over the edge because it all looks so great and it tastes good too. The price is higher than your average steakhouse but the portion sizes, quality, and customer service are worth the money. Trust me, it's in the top three steakhouse restaurants in Houston I have found. Some of the others may be more fancy but this is the real deal!Perfect for taking visiting friends and family members to give them a real "taste of Texas"!

Best steak in town. The price is reasonable. Salad bar is awesome . Cheese, free fruits, crispy greens and endless of toppings  I love the corn breads. Deserts also are so good. This is one of the best steak house, the service is so wonderful. Nice thing about this restaurant is that you can dress casual and enjoy your diner. Would come back again.
Aside from their great food and attention, they have the best salad bar in town.

I love this Texan steakhouse. It's not too fancy where you feel like you must dress up to enjoy your dinner here, and even if you're dressed a little down you don't feel out of place. but its great quality. This is one of my favorite places to get steak here in Houston. We always have a great dinner experience here. Arrived at 9:30PM for dinner last night (they close at 10) and not once did we feel rushed through dinner. Our waiter Jason was very attentive, but not buggin through dinner. We ordered dessert around 10:30PM and he did not make us feel like he was in a rush to go home. I ordered the 6oz center cut filet topped with garlic herb butter. It was delicious. So tender & flavorful! The Atlantic salmon is a very great portion size.. my boyfriend ordered that since he doesn't steak much and he said it was cooked perfectly. Highly recommend starting with the grilled quail! All entrees come with the salad bar which was awesomeeee!

Had my birthday lunch here on 5/21. Carlos was our waiter. The service was wonderful. Never had to ask for refills on our drinks. Table was cleared without being intrusive. Our food was delicious. Carlos took a group picture of us and then returned later with the 2 copies of the printed picture for me to keep. I loved it!

Steak was great ambiance and atmosphere was not .Definitely not worth the price  feels like Golden Corral a do it yourself salad bar at a supposedly upscale pricey restaurant  just feels so strange .  The steak though was pretty great !
One of the best steaks I have ever had in Houston. Fun atmosphere and although it is high class and quality, it isn't stuffy. Great experience and I guarantee I will have many more here to come!!

I've been here twice, once when I was much younger and again just a few days ago for my brother's graduation. We arrived at nearly 9PM and didn't eat till 10 (thanks to poor planning by the group). I was exhausted & ready to really just hate that we were here. But I had a good time anyway. The very long wait doesn't seem long at all in the large & exceptionally nice waiting room with free sodas, chips & salsa, & popcorn. There is also a bar where you can order drinks there.The steak was excellent & flavorful (I got the New York Strip) and my baked potato was good. My mother among others rave about the salad bar excessively, while it is a good salad bar with many choices, it's not that exceptional. Salad was crisp and fresh, the bacon bits are actually real chunks of bacon. There are giant bricks of cheese that you can slice pieces off of, but there is no grater which makes it largely useless for salad unless you can crumble chunks yourself.Also, the waitress spent WAY too much time trying to sell appetizers and explaining the easy-to-understand menu. I'm sure it was required for her to do but it just took up time and not really applicable to a large 9+ person group. The place is also extremely dark, the older folks in our group had to bring out the cellphone flashlights just to read the menu.Overall, I would visit again, but probably just with my fiancee at a reasonable hour and not a large group at 9PM

Went here after church with my mom and a friend girl. Salad bar was good but it seems like they have scaled it back some. We had the most rudest server ever. He asked my friend only if she would like some wine as if my mom and I were invisible. I hate complaining about my food but I had the sliders and the were dry so I sent it back. And the manager was very nice about it.  But in the end the server charged me 32$ for something I didn't have in addition to what I did have. Then comes back to the table and says oh it'll take 2-3 business days to go back to your account. Then throws his business card down and says if you have any problem call me.  I was livid by the end of the night. Uhhhh I hate bad service and this was horrible. My friend, my mom and I were in disbelief about the incredibly bad service. Luckily I just came from church so I'm just gonna pray for him and ask GOD to have favor over the situation. But my goodness I have never.......??

The absolute best steak I've ever had.   When I was done I almost cried because I wish I had more.  The tomahawk is killer and it comes out on a silver platter covered in a garlic herb butter seared with a perfect char.  It comes with a trip to the salad bar and a side.  I was feeling brave so I added the quail skewers and they were good, but the steak is the true hero here.  Great atmosphere and a must go if your visiting West Houston.

I was willing to give them a two star review, but after the way my boyfriend and his sister were treated, (including my overall experience) I decided there had to be better options out there.If we look at the positives the novelty of choosing your own steak, the salad bar, the waiting room (which I didn't experience) and the clientele make it an interesting venue. It carries a refined elite ambiance, but the service and food don't really match up with it.My party was there at 6 and got a table around 7:55/8:00. I didn't experience the wait room or the wait time as mentioned previously, because I was working out in Richmond, Texas at the time. The wait is long and they wouldn't allow a reservation to be made. The whole point of this stupid restaurant was to celebrate Texas Independence Day, albeit a few days late. The BF kept talking this place up as if it were the most magical, tasty, steak and meat loving place ever. Unfortunately, it was not. (Alright, the restaurant isn't stupid...just woefully ignorant of basic restaurant service.)I got in maybe five minutes after my party and had never been there before. The waiter didn't take the time to explain the salad bar to me (hey those plates are hidden and when you're hungry you don't want to read open compartment to find cold plates- you feel stupid!), the waiter also didn't offer me pepper for the salad, and rushed me for my drink order. You would have thought I arrived 30 minutes after the rest of the party. They had only ordered drinks and retrieved their salad. Later, I decide to share a meal with the BF's sister as I don't want to eat a huge steak by myself. I wanted it cooked a specific way as I'm not a fan of the rare, medium rare meats. Hey sorry, I need my cows cooked all the way. The food I received was under-cooked. I was visibly annoyed and upset. It's about 8:30/8:45 at this time and it's late. (I have to be at work early, so 9 pm is late for me unfortunately) I could either throw a big fuss, have to wait another 30 minutes to send my food back and have it cooked or I can go home and pay the check and tip the waiter. I chose to go home. One bite was enough. Other little annoyances: They took my silverware away without letting me save it, so I had to ask for another set and it took a while to get it. I had to remind the waiter,  "Hey need silverware.' (Insert sad emo face at this point.) Any of the toast cream cheese/fruit spreads were taken away without giving me a chance to ask them to leave it. As if this wasn't enough, the guy took way to long to get me a to go box. I wanted out ASAP.So the meat was eh. The side dish- mash potatoes tasted flavorless, which was really disappointing. They only highlight was probably the salad bar and the bread/toast served at the table, which I wasn't even allowed to enjoy. Now, with all that, I could have said, okay, maybe it was a bad night. My BF and his  sister had a similar experience with under-cooked food after I left and even spoke to a hostess about it. She in turn gives them the manager number and while he's apologetic he keeps insisting they should have alerted him to their complaints earlier. Well...if the hostess knows there is a problem and gives you a number isn't that more of a management problem than a customer problem? Tell your hostess to get a manager if customers are complaining. It's that simple. The owner claims he'll make it right next time, but I don't think it's worth the time or effort. I much rather just go to a Salt Grass or Outback Steakhouse. I know steak lovers everywhere are groaning, but at least Salt Grass and Outback have trained waiters to look for visible cues that something is wrong and hostesses will use common sense in approaching a manager after a complaint if there's a policy to only fix things and issue complaints at the time of service. Maybe it's (Salt Grass/Outback) is not  a $60 steak, but they actually cook things the way you tell them too and the managers and waiters are only too happy to fix screw ups before, during, and after the dining experience. If I'm going to fork over $60+ in food, then well you need to be awesome. If I wanted mediocre service there's a place called Taco Bell and even they probably serve better steak tacos....Final thoughts: If you must try it for the experience and bragging rights, then go eat there, but you're not allowed to be cranky if you didn't heed my advice. Apparently the service has gone down since the last time my BF went, so I'm in no rush to go back to see if things improve. Maybe I'll be dragged back next Texas Independence Day, but I'm not looking forward to it after this dining experience. It does at least remind me that cooking my own food isn't a bad option and that simply being expensive doesn't mean you're tasty...it just means you're expensive. Lesson learned.

First time visiting this weekend and it was great. Our server Robbie was a pleasant server, not over bearing and very respectful. We had the baked Brie appetizer. Delicious. I had the pecan crusted chicken and my husband had the prime rib. We had the key lime pie for dessert which is homemade. We love that this isn't a chain restaurant and right now the restaurant has Christmas decor and it's beautiful. Would love to bring my family when they're visiting for their  holidays

I Love  Taste of Texas. I had my Bday dinner here , the service was number one,  the manager Michael assured me the best steak in town. AMANDA got me the BEST service along with her beautiful smile and friendly welcome.  I SURE love to come back and recommend to all my friends.  Well done job. TATES OF TEXAS.  Sera

The staff and service is very professional. Steaks melt in your mouth and made to perfection. The salad bar is amazing with fresh vegetables, fruits, cheeses, and homemade breads. This is the best steakhouse in Texas!

SHAME ON THEM! The owners of this establishment have promoted hate mongering against the LGBT community. In front of the restaurant entrance they posted a "Vote No on the Bathroom Bill". A bill that ultimately was proposed to help workers from being discriminated based on race, gender, and sexual orientation. BEWARE! By supporting this business you are supporting fear and hate.

Always excellent and the best quality.  We come here every week to celebrate birthdays!!!  The steaks are amazing and the salad bar is amazing.  Excellent service, attention to detail, and a fantastic privately owned place.

Love this place.... a little pricey but worth it!  If you're a fan of steaks this place is for you!! They have a variety of options and a kids menu that will satisfy picky eaters.  They have 2 really good salad bars and a variety of baked breads. I had the bone in filet.... unfortunately it came out a little over cooked but they quickly replaced it with a perfect steak along with fresh sides.I highly recommend this place, but they're really popular and you have to come in early or else you can expect at least an hour wait..... regardless it will be well worth the wait!

My husband and I dined here on a Tuesday evening.  I ordered the NY strip medium well and it came out medium so I sent it back. The plate came back so sizzling hot I had to back my chair up the butter was splattering everywhere. The steak was well done but I didn't want to send it back again. It was ok but over cooked. We got mac n cheese and mashed potatoes as sides and they were very good. I wanted to take my leftovers (sides, meat, rolls) home and to my great disappointment when I opened my to go box there was only meat, fat, and rolls.  What happened to my sides?!? Overall service was good and attentive but disappointed in my steak and the leftovers pack up.

Taste of Texas - If you looking to experience one of the best steaks on the planet this may be the place to find it. It's not surprising to most that Texans pride themselves in doing things on a grander scale than most and Taste of Texas is just one example that proves this theory. This "Steak House" has been serving up "Certified Angus Beef" since 1977 and if you don't understand the difference you will have to experience it, no description will do the steaks here justice.As you would expect Taste of Texas offers giant steaks amidst western decor, it should be no surprise to anyone that when a place serves up legendary steaks the atmosphere must equal the quality of the food, especially in Texas and this place will exceed your expectations if you truly appreciate this level of dining. If this is your first attempt at getting a table here and you want to avoid the frustration of a extended wait there are ways to accomplish this since they don't take reservations for parties less that four. It's pretty simple on weekdays arrive here no later than 6:00 PM our wait on this Wednesday evening was less than 10 minutes this restaurant is huge and its staffed to accommodate the masses within reason. As for the weekends good luck I've never experience it but from reading the other reviews and speaking with the locals it can be nearly impossible to avoid some type of wait but well worth it in my opinion.As you know quality always comes with a price you should expect to pay between $40 - $60 for a choice steak with that price comes a few perks, if you choose to participate you will be taken into the kitchen and allowed to pick your steak so if you prefer a leaner cut over a amazingly marbled cut its your choice, all the servers are trained to guide you to the perfect cut to suit your taste. Once you pick your steak it will be tagged with a metal badge numbered so you are sure to get the steak you picked cooked to the exact temperature of your liking. Your next stop after exiting the kitchen will be the dual salad bar, although the offerings are plentiful I must admit it's falls short of the infamous salad bars at the well known Brazilian Steak Houses but this place is about the steak and you really don't want or need to fill up on the salad here, you will want to enjoy the entree trust me on this one. Your steak comes with a single trip to the salad bar and one side, the sides are all premium but almost went unnoticed once the steaks were served. Tomahawk Ribeye (I had to try this on my first visit)Serious steak for a serious steak lover. Impressive 38 ounces with a 14" bone hanging off the plate. You will never forget your first Tomahawk! Wow is not a very impressive description but this giant steak turns head when being delivered to the table. Don't let the 38 ounces scare you away the huge Fred Flintstone bone-in ribeye nets about 22 - 24 oz of succulent tender juicy steak I'm guessing.The steaks are aged between 35 - 42 days this fact along separates this place from everyone else. This was one of the best steaks I've every eaten just a suggestion please don't order this more than medium this was cooked medium rare and was absolutely heaven. Our neighboring table was just as impressed with this mammoth steak and commented on the14" bone hanging off the plate and how much her dog would love it, so of course I donated it to the pup knowing she would enjoy the bone as much as I enjoyed this steak. ($57.95)Cowboy SteakThis 24 oz. "bone-in" ribeye steak brings you the famous rich flavor of ribeye enhanced with aging on the bone. This was also a beautify steak marbled perfectly and from the looks of it when my friend was finish equaled any he had eaten anywhere. (49.95)New York Strip SirloinThe steak lover's choice and the house specialty. The 16 oz. Certified Angus Beef boneless strip sirloin is the finest steak money can buy. I never considered this cut as being the best steak offered here but by the look of the empty plate apparently it lived up to its reputation  ($41.95)

I've been going to Taste of Texas now for 30 years.  I've never had a bad experience.  For lunch I usually get the Soup and salad bar.  They have an excellent salad bar.  Quail bites are my favorite appetizer.  I purchased a set of their steak knives about 20 years ago and they are high quality and will certainly last another 20 years

I've been to taste of Texas on several occasions over the last five years. I can honestly say the best thing it had going for it is the salad bar. I'm a huge fan of unlimited trips to a gourmet salad bar, but I also quite enjoy a serving of protein with my meal. At taste of Texas can order the salad bar and a grilled chicken breast. They just bring you the chicken on a plate and you add it to your salad or eat it alone. Perfect. Back to the salad bar offerings. They have all the standard makings of a good salad bar, but they also offer unlimited fresh bread. In Texas, that includes cornbread. And here it's filled with actual corn and jalapeños. If you go, make sure you eat at least one slice. But be warned, stopping at one is quite difficult.
Best steaks and buffet appetizer ever! They've got a nice alcohol menu too! If you haven't been yet this place is a must try!

The place is very nice, salad bar is amazing with so much variety. The staff is very friendly but I do not think that they know what they are doing. I had the bone in felt and asked for medium well. It came rare, when talked to the manager he said as you get close to the bone it will be like this. That is not the answer I was looking for. I should have been told when asked for medium well that to expect to be rare al the way. You can see the redness and blood and taste cold flesh.

Mann Taste of Texas was amazing went here for the first time tonight and I got it say everything was amazing...I'm talking about like the place the food service and especially the food! Everything was awesome basically the salad bar is unlimited you can go as many times as you want they even have breads! But the best part was the food...me and my bro had the tomahawk steak and omg it was amazing! Another best part was that you get to pick out your own steak which ever piece you want I thought that was really cool and one of a kind! Def recommend it...and I promise once the tomahawk steak is brought to your table you are gonna attract a lot of attention around you!
2.5hrs wait. I don't care how good the food is. Life is way too short to wait 2.5for a steak I could get elsewhere that has reservations.

Get the jams and bread at the salad bar. The red jam tastes like Christmas. You'll know what I mean when you try it.I love this place. The decor the food everything. A little pricey but worth it. Soooo good

Bday dinner planned by my wonderful sisters Janice and Thuy. Right when you walk through the doors....There is complimentary sodas, chips and salsa, popcorn, etc. Compensates for the 45- 1 hr wait. Typically the normal wait time for many popular places on the weekends. Party of 12 and we sat down in 40 mins. Service was amazing!!!! Loved our waitress Melissa! Mgr's were very accommodating and wonderful as well. Even the staff members just passing by us!We ordered two kids plate to split among four children. The best part of this,is the time the waiters/waitress took to cut the meat for the kids. Very sweet and such a warm hospitality feeling.I ordered the cowboy steak w Brussels sprouts w bacon Jam and Mac and cheese. No steak sauce was needed. Garlic butter was all the sauce needed to complete the flavor of the steak. 49.95 with one side and complimentary salad bar buffet style. The rest of my family got the ribeye w the marble cut side. $2.55/oz There seems to be a deal that was given if you ordered a large portion as family style but it seems to not exist anymore. In the end , our waitress Melissa took plenty of pictures  to last for a long time of memories. On top of it! They put it in a nice card to thank us for celebrating our special occasion w Taste of Texas. We had three kinds of dessert. The tremendously tall chocolate cake, snickers cheesecake, and keylime cake. All were very delish! My fave would be the snickers cheesecake. A memorable birthday I can't forget!
Very good steaks. Nice beef and soft. Clean and friendly. Salad bar is very very delicious. Nothing to complain about this place.

Hands down the best steakhouse Ive ever been too.  Amazing food.  Amazing staff.  Amazing experience every visit.  Make sure you arrive early as they DO NOT accept reservations.  We have been there for a 2hour wait...trust me, its worth it.

My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary here yesterday. We got there just before opening and there was already a line. The manager greeted us and we asked about the wait and mentioned our anniversary. He said to mention it to the server. Our server was Valentina and she was very friendly and knowledgeable. I had the medallions and my husband had the porterhouse. Everything we had was excellent but the asparagus could've been cooked a bit longer . The salad bar was excellent as always . For our anniversary, we were allowed to pick one complimentary dessert to share and we chose the snickers cheesecake which did not disappoint. The cinnamon coffee was also complimentary and is a must try. They even took our picture and let us keep it as a souvenir . We will be back!

I'm sad that I didn't really enjoy my steak here. I got the filet mignon and it was just okay. I got sautéed mushrooms on the side and those were so good but this place is known for their steaks and I left disappointed. I'm giving it 3 stars because the service was great and everyone was so nice. Very clean and professional. Though I feel like I've made a better filet mignon myself than the one I had here so I probably won't come back. I came here with my friend and he wasn't too impressed with his steak either.

It had been awhile since our last visit. After all the superlative reviews, my son and I decided it was time to go back. Although the steak was good, it didn't quite live up to all the hype. (We both ordered center cut filets.) Maybe it was an off-night, maybe we should have ordered something different but the steaks were just ok. I kind of expected more given the price tag.

This review is for lunch, although dinner is great as well! I have to say this is place has the very best salad bar in the city. The service is always impeccable and quality is always top notch. There are several options for lunch depending on how hungry you are. I prefer either just the salad bar or soup/salad combo. The fresh baked breads (included with salad bar) are so awesome. You can get in and out in about 45 min during lunch with no wait generally. The salad bar with water will cost around $12 but you definitely can feel the value. I highly recommend!!

This is a must try place if you live in Houston or just visiting. Their salad bar is amazing...nobody can match their salad bar. The main entrees are very good, fresh and quality food prepared by an experienced chef. This is a great place to take clients if you are looking to impress.

Best Steakhouse EVER! Only downside is the long wait just to get a table as they don't do reservations. Food is amazing, from steak to salad bar and if its your birthday you get a free dessert and picture taken by staff. Great experience every time.

If you're a steak lover like me then this is the place for you. Prepare to arrive super early because this place gets packed quick. Please note that this place does not take reservations. However, while waiting they have soda, chips/salsa, popcorn and sometimes appetizers for people waiting... all for free!while waiting, grab a menu and look over what you're going to order so when you get seated you can order asap. If you order an entree (Center cut medium rare is my preferred choice) the salad bar comes along with your meal & is probably the most FRESH salad that I've ever tasted in my life. Everything from the onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, different assortment of cheeses & breads that they have available (OMG!!! Just go try it because you won't regret it) The steak took about 20 mins to come out and when it did, it looked like a beast. I ordered a 23 oz steak and when it came out, it looked like a beast. I asked for medium rare and it came out just perfect. The lemon garlic butter was on point. The steak was juicy and tender.  the steak also came with 1 side. I decided on the potato au gratin. It was a very delicious choice.Complimentary desserts for special occasions!So make room for the Snickers cheescake & Creme Brulee

I've been here four times and every time it's been an amazing experience. The atmosphere is so warm, cozy, yet classy and sophisticated. I always order the filet, which is always super tender, juicy, and flavorful.I'm a huge fan of steak sauce, but I never allow myself to use it with filet from here because it's just so flavorful already. I always add the garlic butter on top which I highly recommend doing because it adds great flavor. This is the only steakhouse I've been to that actually cooks the steak exactly medium-well. Every time my steak is cooked perfectly, and never fatty at all.I always get the sweet potato fries on the side which are always tasty. I'm not a salad lover AT ALL, but I always get excited for the salad bar here. They have amazing salad choices, every salad dressing you can think of, and so many amazing toppings! And everything is super fresh and clean.I love how they have different types of breads, and different butters! The cinnamon butter is my favorite. The corn bread is amazing too! The service here is always top notch. Everyone is so professional, friendly, and welcoming. The desserts are to die for too. The creme brûlée is delicious, the strawberry cheesecake is amazing, and their snickers cake is really good. Over all this is my favorite steakhouse.

My server Greg was extremely attentive to all my steak needs It's really difficult to make a steak rare medium and their chef nailed it. Bravo...they let me in the back look over the cuts... Also had to take a call and waiter was super patient. The chef pesonally came to my table and I cut into the end of the 32 oz porterhouse...I initially thought it was medium and told this to the chef. He showed me that actually they managed through most of the steak to make it a true rare medium!

I echo the other reviews that feel that while Taste of Texas used to be a go-to place for a nice evening out for steaks, it isn't any more. My husband and I went Saturday evening for our anniversary dinner; we hadn't been here in quite a while, and were a bit shocked at the overall decline in atmosphere. The good:We were seated in about an hour and 15 minutes, which was within the stated wait time when we arrived. We ordered a spinach artichoke dip to start, which was very good. We both went to the salad bar, which was enjoyable as always. I ordered the 10 oz. filet with garlic butter with a loaded potato, and my husband ordered a 16 oz. ribeye with a loaded potato. My filet was very good, cooked as requested, and very flavorful. Our waiter brought us a complimentary Snickers cheesecake for dessert for our anniversary, which is delicious (am eating the leftovers as I type this). Finally, our server, Kevin, was lovely. He took great care of us without being overbearing, and we enjoyed his personality and sense of humor. If the restaurant watches these reviews, please know Kevin does a great job. The bad:My husband ordered his ribeye medium rare, and it came out medium. Even more surprising, it was chewy and a little tough. For roughly $50 a steak, you do not expect a tough or chewy ribeye. The really bad: The atmosphere (or the complete lack thereof).
