As we walked up to the front doors, standing literally in front of the permanently posted "Proper attire required" sign was a group of people waiting for a table, all wearing t-shirts, shorts, and flip flops. During our visit, we saw people in baseball hats, white undershirts, gym shorts, sports jerseys, cut-off shorts with butt cheeks hanging out...you name it, it was there - except for appropriately dressed patrons. I don't quite know how to describe what the scene looked liked; if the $50/plate prices hadn't told me otherwise, I could have been sitting at an Applebee's on a Saturday night, not Taste of Texas. I completely agree with another reviewer that while this used to be a nice place for a date or special evening, for the money I'll go somewhere else that provides some ambience along with the higher price tag. Such a shame to see the restaurant has permitted this to become the new standard.

Everything was amazing, I had the Quail skewers as an appetiser,  and got a lovely looking piece of sirloin that I had chosen from their butchery in the kitchen. However, I had discovered that it wasn't the steak I had chosen because the numbers didn't match on the tag, so my waiter Quinton expressed how sorry they were and offered for me to chose a new steak. They made it up beautifully and quickly. The manager then personally apologised and insisted that desert was on him. We got the apple dumplings which were amazing and beautiful presented. Though I may not be in Texas for a while, I'll never forget the great food and service at Taste of Texas.

LOOOONG WAIT!!!My friend and I visited at 8pm on a Tuesday and there was 90 minute wait. However, the waiting area provides free popcorn, chips/salsa, and soda, which made it bearable. All the other reviews here state how awesome the food is, so I don't feel like I need to go into it more. Rest assured your food will come out perfectly. I just wanted to comment on the service provided here:This is a place where the servers eye your table like a hawk. A carafe of iced tea was on the table, and the server would constantly come by and fill my cup with tea, even if it was 80% full! When my friend went to the bathroom, the server came by and folded his napkin for him. I'm not accustomed to restaurants with this level of service, so I was definitely pleasantly surprised.

We took our out-of-state guests here and it was perfection! They had prime rib and our friends said it was the best they've ever had. Customer service is also exceptional. Their salad bar is also the best in the Houston area with tons of options and even warm breads and blocks of cheese. Yummmm! The ambiance is warm and neighborly with interesting Texas artifacts. We will definitely will be back! Thank you Taste of Texas for a great experience!

Prime rib is amazing here. The rib eye also. They don't take reservations but the wait, if there happens to be one, is worth it! They let you select your piece of meat if you wish to and the salad bar is pretty darn great. this has to be my favorite steak house in Houston.

Ok. I'm not a complainer, but I've had a LOT of fine steaks in my time, from various restaurants across america.  This place came HIGHLY recommended to me by colleagues, clients and my parents. For the price, I was given a pretty awful, quite tough and almost inedible rib-eye steak, that soon after eating (while I was still at the restaurant) made me ill with a bad stomach ache.  I was SO  hungry that I ate it despite my intuition to send it back.  As I was eating it, my wife said her steak was too tough to eat, as well.  She noticed there was globules of tough, flavorless fat and gristle.  Not the good, properly cooked fat of a properly cooked and high quality rib-eye that we're used to.  This thing was  shoe leather tough.  Her teeth and jaw were hurting from trying to chew on this steak, so that should give you an indication of how it was.  She had enough and she complained.  After that steak, they brought her another one which was equality horrible, but additionally undercooked this time.  She sent it back AGAIN, then finally they gave her a half-decent steak (She was pretty starved at this point, so it was kind of like a "This is still totally not worth it, but I'm starving so I don't care anymore" feeling is what she described).  Honestly, it just wasn't   as good as another steak in that price range.  Very disappointed...Sad really,  because it came so highly recommended.  My wife advised me to stop eating and ask for another steak or a different cut.  In the end, I was too hungry and  now regret not having asked for my meal to be taken off the bill.  They tried to manage the situation and I was trying to be nice and so asked for a free dessert, but the fact is that the meat was so rough and tasteless, that it just felt overpriced.  Seriously, Saltgrass' Pat's Rib-eye is phenomenal next to the steak that my wife and I were served.  At a joint like this, We should've never had this kind of problem.  It's just unacceptable.  I spent the same amount (if the deserts weren't comp'd, it would have been more) as I would have at Chama Gaucho or Fogo de Chao, but got terrible value in return.  Salad bar was meh (my in-laws, who were dining with us, compared it to Sizzler's salad bar, which is where they eat at least once a week.  Sides were OK.  The best part was the artichoke dip and the asparagus.  Those were good.  The potatoes au gratin were OK.  My Mother-in-law wasn't crazy about the baked potato...I'm very disappointed and displeased overall. They should've offered to comp our meals, at least.  I should've spoken up, too.  But honestly, this type of thing shouldn't have happened to begin with.  I came here for quality and good service, I left with none of the first and some of the latter.  In conclusion: 1 star for having good appetizer and for decent service.1 star because my in-laws were happy with their steaks for the most part (Well-done rib-eyes).Recommendation: Go to Fogo, Chama Gaucho, Texas de Brazil or Salt Grass for rib-eye.For a truly top notch steak: Go to Pappas Bros Steakhouse or The Capital Grille.Cheers!

Something for everyone!What a great concept! In business over 35yrs... we now know why!Great family environment! Great for parties or groups... Great food & great options for vegetarians as well!Warm interior, decorated w lots of wood... homey feel. Very friendly staff!Rafael, our server, was well versed in all the offerings and very kind. Make it your business to visit a Taste of Texas - you will not be disappointed! your constant companion,~deirdra

Always a treat. I love the steaks, the atmosphere and salad bar. The staff are very professional and very attentive. I've been here at least 20 times and have never been disappointed. The owners and management have hit the nail on the head every time since they opened. Great job
I've been there so many times in all occasions and had all kinds of steak (tomahawk, cowboy, bone in etc)  but sill craving for their steak every once a while. Waiting time is expected but worth it
Awesome service or my 31st anniversary. See you next year! Service was excellent. Food was perfectly prepared.

Prepare to wait a looooong time, unless you get here at 3pm on a Sunday (right when it opens) like I did & get seated right away :) It got packed extremely quick. Salad bar (5/5) all you can eat if you order steak! Idk what it is about the salad here, but best salad I've ever had, hands down! Center cut steak (4.5/5) I wouldn't say it's the best ever, but it's pretty up there! Medium rare, cooked to perfection. So juicy... *drool Complimentary desserts for special occasions!Great food, GREAT service!! I devoured my steak so fast that the manager actually came up to me, apologized for having to "wait so long" for my food to come out (my family was still eating), and asked what I had ordered so he could end my wait. HAHA now that's great service!! Maybe I should actually chew my food... it's so hard to be patient with the steak!I'd say you're missing out if you've never been.

It's been awhile since we been here, so we decided to have dinner here last night . Waited almost 2 hours to get a table, but the food last night was a disappointment. The bf ordered New York and I ordered a ribeye and a crab cake. His steak tasted like it's been defrosted a couple times, and mine was overcooked. We were too hungry to wait another 30 minutes for our steaks. Their standard seemed to have drop from the last time we went. I'm not sure if it's because they were super busy last night or something changed in the kitchen, but I'm sure they should be used to handle a big volume of people by now.

Wow! Worth the hype. The salad bar is wonderful and I had the prime rib, cooked perfectly medium rare and absolutely melt in your mouth delicious. Portobello mushroom cap side was huge and again cooked perfectly. This is the perfect spot to take out of state guests to show some of the best steak that Houston has to offer.

I love their veggie plate. The fried avocado was great. Bread was served warm. There were crowded . The salad bar I love it, they added the quinoa there so you can add it to your salad. Overall I loved the food!

So its my grand parents 60th anniversary and we wanted to do something special. Fortunate for us it was also Valentines Day so they are super busy. We call ahead and the excellent staff allow us to bring in decorations flowers, all that jazz. Long story short, while we were setting up, one of the helium balloons escaped and we thought we were doomed. Lucky for us our server came in and saved the day, with long lamp stick. We were forever grateful. It was one of those things when we thought all hope was lost, then out of nowhere the golden opportunity strikes! Aaron Rogers Hail MARY!Anyways our server was amazing, and although I forget his name, (maybe ill update it later) I will always remember his kind deed! 10/10 will come back to this place.O also food is yummy.

I would say these are the best steaks in Houston. I've tried Perry's, Flemmings, Morton's and all the other high end steakhouses and I prefer Taste of Texas. The service is awesome the managers stop by and make sure everything is exactly to your liking and staff is also top notch. They'll even let you pick your steak if you like. I can't say enough good things about the service.I have eaten here for years and they are very consistent; if you order medium rare it will ALWAYS be medium rare. The steaks are great. You can't go wrong with any choice: My favorite is the T-bone or the NY strip, but I've seen a lot of folks order the filet. If you awant a giant steak order the porterhouse or the tomahawk ribeye. Definitely augment your steak with the lemon pepper and garlic butter. My favorite side is the Texas Au Grautin potatoesThey have a great salad bar everything is fresh including bread and house made dressings. They have a delicious cinnamon butter that goes well with the yeast rolls.If you love steak and great service make sure to try Taste of Texas.Come early! They don't take reservations and it gets packed fast and you quickly run into a 1+hour wait.

Salad bar still amazing! They added a kale salad and quinoa to their salad bar. Both were lightly seasoned and tasted great with the salad dressing I used (cilantro vinaigrette). Service was amazing as always.

Excellent service! Awesome steaks and fun atmosphere.  Brought my family here based on recommendations and wow what a great time.  The food was fresh and prepared as promised.  Can be busy as we waited 40 minutes but well worth the wait!

The service here tonight was outstanding.  Friendly and fast.  Drinks were refilled, and dishes were cleared away quickly.  Very attentive.  Truely 5 star service.My center cut filet ranked in my top 3.  Very tender and cooked perfectly.  Flavorful due to the aging.  You can get garlic butter on top, or bacon wrapped (or both) at no additional charge.  Just do it.My side was broccoli with hollendaise sauce.  This is a perfect combination, the buttery lemon flavored sauce is delicious and the broccoli was cooked just right.  The best side dish of the night was the grilled portabella mushroom.  I would get this next time.The thing that always pushes me past my limit is the salad bar.  So fresh with so many choices.  It is impossible to walk away with a small salad.  By the time I put a small spoonful of this and that, I walk away with a plate piled high.  The Texas Caviar (black eyed peas) is so good, as is the  black bean and corn salad,.  The jalapeno cornbread is amazing.  Hard to stop eating it.I love that you can dine here in casual clothes.The wait on Friday or Saturday night can exceed an hour and a half.  Get here early, or late.  They do not take reservations.

To be honest, I don't even know why I'm reviewing this place. Taste of Texas is an institution and one of the best steak houses in town and you don't need to read more than one or two reviews to figure that out. It's our go-to for all our important celebrations. The service is amazing and the food is always prepared to perfection. The only complaint I could ever have is that they don't take reservations. I figure they must have their reasons though. Just take my advice and go. Try to save room for desert because they're incredible, but if you don't I won't blame you. Just get it to go ;)
Valentina was great!! The service exceptional!!!love their salad bar and potato soup!!!

Taste of Texas is one of the two or three restaurants in Houston that I will miss the most, now that I've moved away.  The steaks there were always done to perfection, and the food really was not that pricy given the quality.  The restaurant's no reservations policy makes eating there a little inconvenient, at least if you don't want to eat dinner at 3 p.m.  But if you do go at 3 p.m., there are plenty of open seats.Food-wise, the only thing I found disappointing at Taste of Texas was the bread.  I just was not a fan of their rolls.  My wife liked them a lot, though.The salad bar is great.

We eat here a few times a year; generally when someone visits from out of town and they ask for great steak.From the service to the meals, everything is top notch. Be warned, parking may be a challenge based on the night of the week. We have had waits of up to 30 minutes, and we have just used that time to grab a drink and catch up.Tip: do not fill up on the salad or bread because you will do yourself a disservice by not having room for dessert.I would pass on the prime rib because they have so many other cuts of steak that are out of this world. Have a big boy eater visiting? The tomahawk will present a worthy challenge. Picky eater, the center cut filet. Add the oscar, lump crab meat, its worth it. Veggies, have the brussel sprouts with bacon jam. I do not like vegetables and have ordered this twice. Yes, it is a p Ivey visit, but worth the cost.Regarding attire, we have seen people in suits, blue jeans and shorts. In fact, I have visited the restaurant in each of the above.

Salad bar here is good and bread is plus Order to go last Sunday when I got there everything was ready my appetizer and my soup, baked potatoes etc.. Except my filet mignon  first they bought out to bar where I was waiting and they took it back bought it out in to go box so I went home star eating my filet is so cold, dry, hard it was not even worth what I paid for I'm mad!! And I live in memorial which is right down of street from restaurant my steak shouldn't be that cold  anyway I call back spoke to manager what happen he put me on hold for good almost 10min and phone got hung up some reason and I call back! Manager answer still no apologize whatsoever took my name number, and he will talk to owner and get back to me! Haven't heard from them! I'm pretty sure they can care less, but I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to any of my friend family co worker or anybody that I know

This is one of my favorite steakhouses in Houston.the beef cuts are fantastic and you can go to the butcher shop and pick your cut of choice.  I normally go with the filet mignon or the bone-in filet mignon (if very hungry).  Make sure to ask for a bacon wrapped filet and some garlic butter on top.  Also, the salad bar is outstanding, all kind of fresh items to create your very own signature salad.  You also have the option to pick some freshly baked dinner rolls, cheese bread and jalapeño corn bread.  The wait staff is very friendly.  You may end up waiting for a table, but it will be totally worth it.

We ate here on a Tuesday night and the place does very well for an early weeknight. Upon entering we were unable to find our party but we had several management staff trying to help us locate them. It turns out they were in the secret waiting room ,which is quite awesome; it has a popcorn machine, chips and salsa, and a soda machine in which you can help yourself. This definitely occupied and satisfied the 8 year old and the toddler in our group.As for dinner, I had a 6 oz fillet, a side of shrimp, a side of potatoes au gratin and a side of spinach. They invited everyone back to pick their cut, to which I was surprised, but I sent my husband while I watched our toddler. The filet was good, but the shrimp didn't taste fresh at all. I couldn't even eat it. The potatoes were fantastic and the spinach was decent.Our server was alright, I could tell he was busy, but he'd disappear for a little too long. Perhaps I notice these things more with an active toddler. I like to get in and out, however our party wasn't necessarily in any rush and that's fine.The salad bar was fine, but I certainly don't think it compares to that of Fogo de Chao, or anything like that. There were options, but not as many options, such as artichoke hearts or hearts of palm, which are things I really love to see at a salad bar.

This place is really what everyone raves about! So delicious.I got spinach artichoke dip- SO GOOD.We got the special steak wrapped in bacon with the special sauce (can't remember the name) I couldn't even believe how phenomenal it was!! So good I want to go back and get it again! :)Service was great & friendly. The environment was not too loud and comfortable. Definitely a must go to. Make your hubby or boyfriend take you here for a special occasion!

Get there early!  We got there at 3:00 when they opened and were immediately seated. Our waiter Kevin was very professional and explained everything. He even took us on the mini tour of the back where you select your steak. My 9 year old daughter thought it was the coolest thing!  The salad bar is awesome, but don't go overboard  because you still have to eat your steak!  Ordered the Tomahawk with garlic mashed potatoes and was not disappointed. My Wife had the filet and she liked hers as well. We will definitely be back.

My old time classmate took my family to get a taste of real Texas steaks. I had a tomahawk and my wife had a salmon, it's so nice and juicy and the flavor is one of a kind for both a steak and the salmon, I have to share the steak with my son because it's so huge. The homemade bread tasted so wonderful and the service is too notched. We waited for 2.5 hours but it's worth the wait!
I just love this place, the service and the food are fantastic. From the salad bar to the desert and everything in-between the experience is just 1st class

I give this place 3 stars because the quality of meat is great and and our waiter was good but at the end of the day, I wouldn't come back. As soon as you walk in, you get this cabin feel which i love and As every one else says, expect to wait at least 30mins depending upon your time of arrival. We got there around 7:45 so our expected wait was 45mins-1hour.. But as you read, there is complimentary popcorn, beverages, and chips&salsa along with 2 bars. After almost an hour, a Hostess sat us down where we were greeted by our waiter, he was very nice, knowledgable, and attentive! Salad bar was yummy as well cus they give u plenty of options to add to your salad. We ordered the mushroom caps stuffed with crab to start off with which came right after we finished our salads. You get 6 for about $14.. It was ok, I thought they were average.. It wasn't suuuper delicious but it wasn't bad... I ordered the Oscar filet (about $40ish) 6 oz which was super tasty and soft since i eat it rare and my boyfriend got the ribeye 16oz (I think it was 2.95/oz and minimum of 16oz) which he finished! Make sure you get the garlic butter on top of your steak if you're a garlic lover like me! I got the green beans with bacon as my side, it was ok (super delicious tho if u add the garlic butter into it) but the Mac and cheese is BOMB! Overall this restaurant was great for its quality of meat but I can enjoy a cheaper steak at home. The staff and our waiter was nice and the food came out quit fast. Since it was so busy and there was quit a few large parties, it wasn't very romantic and loud. Waiters can be heard talking/shouting to one another across the room. Def an experience but I wouldn't crave it to come back.

May the odds be in your favor!!! That's how I decided the parking! !! Omg it's like the hunger games!! It took us 30 minutes to park on top of the 45 minute wait!! The service is outstanding! The waiter was extremely welcoming and knowledgeable. The steaks in my opinion are just a bit more then average. Not seasoned at all if it had not been for the blue cheese butter my steak would have been hard to finish. I suggest you also pass on the win a little over priced about  $25 per bottle over retail for grocery store wines like Kendall kendall-jackson....

Went there with my girlfriend for a early valentines day dinner and wow am i a satisfied customer. Server Jon O. made this experience even better and was very knowledgeable about everything we needed to know about the menu. I got the tomahawk steak med rare 38 Oz of juicy well aged goodness. It really was the best steak I've ever had and on top of it all they let you pick out the steak you want, and even make suggestions of how much marble or not you should have or not depending on your taste. If you have a special occasion and are a steak lover do your and your loved ones a favor and make a trip down. It is pretty pricy but well worth it. Just be ready to wait and be seated I'm sure it varies depending on times of day/week.

Right when you walk in through the doors, the mesmerizing decor and ambience hit you. This place is like a museum! Everywhere you look there's amazing information and decor all related to Texas. Service was great. Getting the chance to pick my own steak and having a salad bar was pretty cool. Everything was perfect til I tasted the steaks. For a place that's so popular and expensive I expected so much more than the mediocre filet & tomahawk steaks that my boyfriend and I got. It's honestly not worth the price. I was incredibly disappointed

Excuse me as I drag myself out of this food coma and see what I can remember from last night...Jumbo Lump Crab Cake- possibly one of the best I've ever tasted. It was served w/ a horseradish dip and perfect for splitting between 2.Texas Pecan Crusted Chicken- stuffed w/ a spinach & artichoke blend and came with sides of green beans & rice pilaf. We shared this entree and they split it up for us on separate plates. Normally this would warrant an additional charge at other restaurants (big pet peeve!) but not here. The rice had a weird rubbery taste so I left it mostly untouched. This turned out to be a good thing since I did not need any more carbs after a trip to their bread station. The chicken was good, but I would probably order a steak next time since steaks are their specialty. Salad Bar- this turned out to be my favorite part of the meal. They had a great fresh selection of greens, veggies, pasta salads, dressings, and fresh fruit. Next to that was the bread station with jalapeno cornbread, buttery rolls, and cheese bread. Spreads included butter, jams, and the best honey cinnamon butter that tasted exactly like a churro! As a meal itself, it only cost $9.95 which is definitely a steal.Atmosphere- It's hard to imagine a place being fancy and casual at the same time, but this place is it. It's not somewhere you need to get all dressed up for (jeans & a nice top/casual dress will do). As for the decorations, I don't know how else to describe them other than "Texas." Service- cups were always filled, menu items were explained, suggestions were made, dishes were delivered smoothly, and the waiters were a good amount of talkative. I will be back for a next time once I have a bigger wallet & more self-control to face the bread station!

Number one rule: GET THERE EARLY! If you are going for dinner, I would suggest getting there around 5:45pm on a weekday and around 5pm on a weekend if you want to have dinner at a reasonable time. Any time after that, and the wait will be between 1-2 hours. (so bring something to entertain yourself with if you end up going late) Food: The food is delicious, as expected. The salad bar has a great variety and yummy breads to try, including your traditional rolls, cheesy bread, and jalapeno cornbread. You get to pick your own cut of meat in their kitchen which is also a great experience, and their servers are very well informed about their meats. The one thing I would warn you about is that they may slightly overcook your steak, so if you normally get your steak medium well, I would suggest telling them medium, or if you like it medium, ask for medium rare.        Sides: I would suggest getting the Mac and Cheese, Au Gratin, or sweet potatoes. *side note* If you get the ribeye, you can choose what size you want it, anywhere from 16oz to your heart's desire. We had a friend who got a 64oz steak (but sadly didn't finish it in one sitting =(.  ) Service: The service is great and the servers are definitely friendly and attentive. They're all very cordial and welcoming and really easy to talk to and actually seem to care how you are enjoying your experience. The manager also goes around from table to table to talk to you and make sure everything is ok. Your food comes out all at once (which is always nice so you don't have to wait on each other), and is also cooked in a reasonable time.They have a waiting area for you as well, and you can order wine and cocktails, and snack on their complimentary nachos, popcorn, and soft drinks. Price: This is definitely on the pricier side of things, so if you want to impress, this is a great place to bring someone. On average, the cost for one person is around $40. Also, if you go in a group, I would suggest bringing cash because they will only do 4 split checks maximum. Overall, definitely a great experience, especially if you have visitors from out of town. Take a look at the pictures so you get an idea of the types of meats they have, and get there early, lest you want to walk far and wait for hours.

A Texas style (as the name suggests) steak house that is great for large parties but isn't the romantic setting you'd want for an intimate date. So if you're in town for business or hanging out with your friends and want to grab some great steak, this is your place. It is a large restaurant with lots of sports decor. It's great for large groups. Unlike most high end restaurants they offer a buffet style salad bar. It's hardy so you may not need appetizers. Try the cornbread!Now, to the most important part of a steak joint... The meat. All of the cuts you'd expect are here. And you can select your own cut of meat if you want to. There are several seasoning options, including butter and garlic. I got both with a bacon wrap - I don't think you can clog your arteries faster if you try. But man was it good!!!'

First don't let the sign that you can barely see from the freeway fool ya! Yes, they need the letter lit better so it's viewable but every single other part of this place from the good to the service and on down to the ambiance is on point!Took the wife here for our 3 yr and had a great time. It is pricey but hey, you get what you pay for!As a fella RR owner myself great service and good food is priceless. 5 stars!And the fact they play subtle Christian music makes it even more of a home run!

At some point in life, men must eat steak. A Man's Steak. Thick, juicy, and hand-cut. The ribeye at Taste of Texas is such a beast. Order by the ounce, 16 oz minumum, I had 24 oz. I suppose I could have ordered more, but it was lunch, and I'd already eaten an appetizer of Quail Bites: Jalapeno stuffed Quail wrapped in bacon. Delicious, but then isn't anything wrapped in bacon? Service was superb.

Meat is very good however without the garlic butter they put on top they really don't have much seasoning to them. They were cooked to perfection. The mac n cheese is amazing. Salad bar is great and the toast with cream cheese/salsa they bring out is addicting. Pretty cool that while you wait they offer free soft drinks/tea and popcorn/chips & salsa.

What an excellent dining experience!I came here for my birthday with my parents on a Saturday night. I must say we were caught a bit off guard by the wait time (We arrived at 6:00pm, and were told there was an hour to an hour and half wait), however we decided that would be pretty standard anywhere we went, so instead of getting mad and walking out, we decided to wait outside and enjoy the nice fall weather. It went by quickly, and free delicious appetizer samples were brought outside to all those waiting. We were seated by 7:05, which isn't bad at all for Houston on a Saturday night. Our server was Kevin, and he was excellent. Funny, prompt, and attentive. I ordered the 6oz. filet, with a side of 4 jumbo grilled shrimp and mac and cheese. The filet was so beautifully cooked I was sad to finish it. It was cooked to a perfect medium and so tender. The garlic butter on top was a decadent touch. The shrimp was actually jumbo and they were worth the $9.95 they cost. The mac and cheese was a revelation. It was baked, with breadcrumbs on top, and as for the flavor, it had a slight kick to it with some kind of pepper baked in. Absolutely delicious.Dessert was a gem. I had the snickers cake, my mom had the key lime pie, and my dad had the cinnamon ice cream (a Blue Bell specialty only sold at Taste of Texas). My cake was superb, as well as the key lime pie, but be advised that it's VERY sweet compared to other key lime pies, but it was still delicious nonetheless.This was a perfect meal to celebrate my birthday and I will absolutely be back.

I came here for a coworker reunion, and I was definitely looking forward to it as other coworkers raved about the steaks and the salad bar.Unfortunately, I was not too hungry by the time I got here.  Of the French dip sliders I ordered, I only ate 1.5 of 3!  Alas...Steaks definitely seem to be the way to go  The dinner prices for steaks begin at $35 and go up to around $60.  Once you put in your order, they will take you to the butcher shop so you can pick out your own meat.  (Notably, all cuts are Certified Angus Beef.)The steaks come with choices of three sauces / rubs, and you can pick any combination of these three:1.  Lemon pepper2.  Garlic herb butter3.  Bleu cheeseIt also comes with a choice of one side and an all-you-can-eat salad bar.Most importantly, we had some Kazakhs with us.  The server was able to provide a menu in Russian.  She also brought out cowboy hats and red kerchiefs to take a picture of them having fun at Taste of Texas.  She then brought out cards with a 4x6" of the picture (of them in their hats and kerchiefs) for each of them.  I thought that was a really nice touch and makes Taste of Texas a fun place to take your international guests.
Excellent steak. Helpful staff. Fun atmosphere. Kid friendly. Only thing I did not enjoy was paying $60 for an $18 bottle of wine.

Taste of Texas is a really hard place for me to review. The food is fabulous - definitely really, really delicious steaks and desserts. But the ambiance is so confusing to me. If you're waiting for a table, you can go to the bar and enjoy some free chips and salsa, or popcorn, or sodas. I'm assuming this is to keep the kiddos from screaming because they're hungry. But if you're in the bar, be ready to listen to some Christian music. I'm not religious and it made me really uncomfortable to have to listen to it. I would have preferred some instrumental soft music rather than the soft-rock Christian. The mushroom caps are yummy. They're stuffed with crab meat, and topped with brie. They were rich and I really loved every bite that I had. I thought the crackers served with them were a bit odd and didn't contribute to the meal.I got a 6 oz center cut steak with a side of spinach. My steak was cooked perfectly and was tender - almost melt in your mouth. When you're in the main dining hall, you won't hear the music over the chatter from other groups of people, plus if you add a few drinks you're going to have a grand time. We got the pecan pie for dessert, and it was pretty good. I wasn't particularly a fan of the consistency of the center of the pecan pie (y'know, the super unhealthy corn syrup part) because it kind of broke down in a weird way. But mixed with the cinnamon ice cream... Whatever. Yummy. If you're a first timer, or visiting for a special occasion, you can be sure that you'll get the bandanna and cowboy hat to take a picture with. Would I go back? Probably not. If one of my friends insisted that we eat there, I'd say okay, but it's not a place that I'll quickly recommend to others.
Asked for a steak to be med well ( that cost 50) that came out burned :( hope not everyone get this when they go here

I've been maybe 6 or 7 times and I honestly don't understand what all the hoopla is about. I much prefer the salad bar over any of their steaks. The meat is tender, I'll give them that, but it is flavorless. It tastes as if it was never seasoned.

Really great steak spot with a killer salad bar!  The steaks were prepared perfectly and the servers are very attentive.  I got a NY Strip and it was juicy and flavorful!The dessert tray is amazing but the 4 layer chocolate cake is so entirely crazy huge that you owe yourself a taste since it will last a long time!

Best place I've ever eaten at. Service was flawless, you get to pick out your own cut of meat in the kitchen, salad bar was perfect, dessert was amazing, and did I mention the incredible service? Our waitress was a true master of her craft.   I ordered the Tomahawk Ribeye which was 36 ounces with a comically larger bone (14") protruding from the side. It was cooked EXACTLY how it should be and was hilarious to see brought out to the table.   There is too much other stuff to mention here but it's all good.

Great place to bring visitors to.  During Christmas a lot of their Texas decorations are removed which sucks.  The steaks here are so good and the service here is top notch.  We were given complimentary champagne when I got married.  Also, the wait is a bit long but you get free nachos, popcorn, and sodas.

Pros:Steaks taste great.Service is always professional and on point.Menu is varied.Décor is true Texas.Salad bar is great.Waiting room is nice, complete with cash bar and free snacks and sodas.  Nice touch.Cons:The wait!  The wait is often over and hour and I wish they had some sort of reservation system.  I'll come here when I have time, but when I don't have time, I must go elsewhere for dinner.The wine list seems a little on the short side for a steak house.Parking is sometimes crazy.  There is no valet. All said, the steaks are good here and that's what keeps me coming back.

The wife and I went here Feb 14th, and knowing how busy this restaurant is any night but on Valentines it can get nuts.  So we cheated and went at two pm, no line no wait!  The steaks were great, wonderful salad bar, the wait staff was perfect.

OH MY GOODNESS! What a great restaurant. The food was outstanding, there was great service, extensive wine list, and a comfortably elegant atmosphere. Expect to be treated well by the friendly waitstaff, they are sure to go above and beyond. You can order a delicious steak, chicken or a some delicious seafood cooked just how you like it. The side dishes are just as pleasing!! The main entrees come with the salad bar and it is definitely worth it. It was very clean, well stocked and it's definitely no Ruby Tuesday salad bar!! I'll definitely be back.

Homestead and Peter Luger Steakhouse has nothing on this place!Why I Love Taste of Texas:1. Ambiance is beautiful 2. They have a nicely sized waiting area with a bar and complimentary snacks3. Awesome salad bar is included with the steak dinner4. Option to choose your own steak! (First time for me)5. Everything from the steak to the sides were all so delicious!6. Decently priced7. Lastly, the staff is very friendly =)I've been to places where you have to pay $200 just for a damn steak but here we had a wonderful steak dinner for about $100, this place is definitely worth going to!

The salad bar is pretty awesome with great choice. We waited about 30 minutes before being seated, which is the norm here because it's just so busy.  The Carmel martini was great. The only down sides was the slight mix up on side order but more importantly my steak was rare not medium.A really nice touch was that the owner, who without question is a millionaire, went around to each table to introduce herself and see how we were doing.

I have to echo the sentiments of other reviewers as to the service - it was top notch!!  The food was fantastic.  We were having a corporate party so we all got put into the Wine Room which was great for a group our size (probably about 40 - 45 people).  The staff were gracious and were diligent with their follow up.  The food came out at appropriate intervals so that it was hot and fresh when it arrived.  The beer selection is weak, but the wine was wonderful.  All in all, it was a very good experience and it felt like the food was priced appropriately for the portions and quality.

Wow what a night. We arrived at 6:04pm someone jump out of the car to get on the list due to line being long out of the door. After circling parking lot twice for parking we parked in the Bed, Bath, and Beyond lot next door. This was our first time here my boyfriend and I. We had date night with 2 other couples. The plan eat and go to Dave and Busters to hang out. Tap our inner kids as we are all over 40. Anyway, we go in, there are people every where waiting MUCH more than outside. There is a nice waiting area with chips, popcorn, and TV's. Our waiting card had 6:04p card #174. After getting settled and found the monitor with the numbers on it we knew this was going to be a dinner only night. The monitor has #91, 102, and l06 on it. Oh boy, the saving grace I needed something from BB and B next door.  So we women had to go find it and leave the men folk waiting. OK let's get to the food I will just say. It was alright .  It is now 8:45pm we are called _____party of 6 your take is ready repeat from a young lady. Two count two seconds later last call for ____party of 6 by a rough sounding man. WTH? For two and a half hours I didn't hear a male voice at all. No appetizers due to drinks and chips we had while waiting. We ordered the T-Bone steak med well ($47.95) with a lobster tail ($19.95) baked potato loaded and a Wedge salad.  The steak was covered with garlic herb butter and was med rare. For the cost of the food I was not impressed with experience or the food. It was just OK. I have had steak spoon cutting tender before but this steak required a good knife. Not much flavor and far from the best steak I ever had. The lobster tail was an oversized shrimp. This was the smallest tail for $20. At least add the ounce size to the menu to prevent the look of disappointment when it gets to the table. For nonalcohol drinkers beware there are no flavored tea made here just some bottled stuff that was horrible. Taste of Texas should be on point when it comes to tea this is a Texas staple. Needless to say, we will not be returning to this place. OK time update it is 10:04p as we get into the car wondering what happened and not feeling satisfied. I hate those kind of dining experiences as I am a self proclaimed foodie. I want to end on a high note. The staff was very nice.

We LOVE this place!! Excellent service, prices, and food quality. The salad bar is amazing! This is our go to place for a quick and healthy lunch or a nice steak dinner. I usually just get the salad bar at dinner and add a soup for a few dollars and it fills me up quite well. The bread at the salad bar is great as well.
Dined here last night for my daughter's graduation. We were treated like royalty! Food and service was  exceptional! It was worth every penny!
Had a wonderful experience here for my birthday. Our waitress was very attentive, helpful with suggestions, and the food was amazing as always. Love this place!

My wife and I have been here many times over the past 8-9 years and it is our 'go to' place when we have something to celebrate, or if we just need a 'pick-me-up' evening dinner.  The food is always excellent, the service is unsurpassed in my experience, and it is such an interesting place with all the Texas artifacts.
Took 2hrs to get seated on New Year's Eve.. However the service and food were worth the wait.
It's the best steak in town.. Best crab cake ever... Chunk of crab meat... Love it... Nice decoration for Christmas during holiday season...

Very good...simply put. The service was top shelf Fo-Shizzle. That salad bar is epic. The Long wait spoke volumes about the longevity of its success obviously...hated waiting but who doesn't?  My steak, the t-bone was perfect. A lot of large high-end steak houses, not to mention any names but they start with an "m" and an "r" are just so-so... Which is a shame after dropping $50+ on a piece of beef. The Taste of Texas delivered however.  The only thing I'd recommend is that they add bacon to their Mac-n-cheese. I know I could have nabbed more for myself from that killer salad bar - my bad - but it's better if it's cooked in with the dish.

This is a full dining experience . We out of towners got to experience real Texas hospitality, and the food was excellent! We chose our own steaks, tried the quail appetizer, and polished everything off with the snickers cheesecake. Then we didn't eat for 24h we were so full!

Great place to go to.Steak here is great and you can even choose your own cut of meat too.Try the filet wrapped in bacon.  Great flavor and tenderness.Gotta love the salad bar that you can visit and the bread you can get.Love the atmosphere because it can be loud but its not too overpowering.You got to get here early because they do not take reservations and the lines can be long and sometimes 2+ hours.  The staff and service here is good as well. Friendly faces.I would recommend one of the steaks since they are all good but I had the filet.  Try it with the mac n cheese and get the quail skewers for appetizer.All good flavors and good food.

Food and service is absolutely amazing. The wait is definitely nothing to look forward to but once you have your meal you can almost understand why the wait is so crazy. I have never had a better filet. The manager Stephen was amazing as well. Came over and chatted with my husband and I regarding where he was from and then treated our whole table to dessert and thank us for waiting. I recommend going whenever you can!!!!!!!!!

Houston is riddled with steak houses. During a recent business trip, I wanted to try the best steak around and was instantly pointed to Taste of Texas. Sounds legit enough. Like everything in Texas, this restaurant is HUGE. It's also very popular, so expect to wait at least an hour for a table, especially during a weekend evening. Thankfully, they have two bars, with the one in the back being much more accessible. They have your regular selection of beers and wine, along with a few local microbrews. Patrick D. suggested to the Karbach IPA and gave us a good history lesson on Houston's developing microbrew scene. He's a wonderful bartender and also poured me my first pint of Shiner Bock. Once seated, we headed straight for the salad bar, which is included with steak purchase. Typical selection of fresh veggies, dressings and toppings. HUGE blocks of cheese that will satisfy cravings of any cheese lover like me. To top that off, the cheese buns are mindblowing. The oversized dishes:- Texas Quail Bites ($15.95): Four skewers of grilled quail wrapped in bacon and served with jalapeno poppers. I'm a big fan of quail, and these were prepared perfectly. Very tender and flavorful. If you've never had quail before, this is a must!- Stuffed Mushroom Caps ($13.95): Six hollowed out mushroom caps stuffed with crab meat and brie. Absolutely outstanding. This is one of my favorite concoctions in general, but when you throw crab meat in there and use jumbo mushrooms, it's out of this world. - Center Cut Filet - 10 oz ($45.95): Tagged with a tracking number, labeled with a "Certified Angus Beef" pin, and served with creamy béarnaise sauce and your choice of side. This is not your average steak. I'm typically not a fan of steak, but this was top notch. I asked for medium well, which they got spot on. Not too red inside, yet still tender, juicy, and flavorful. A perfect choice if you want to try other items and get a medium sized steak. Of course, in Texas, this would be considered minuscule. - Steamed Lobster Tail ($19.95 as add-on): Delicately boiled and fresh out of the shell, topped with various herbs and served with a lemon and butter. When you have room to splurge, why not add it on? Makes for the perfect steak & lobster dinner.As if that wasn't enough, the server came out with the mammoth dessert platter, which featured 10 diabetes-infusing selections. I refused, but the sheer concept and size of a dessert platter made me drop my jaw. At the end of the night, I was incapable of doing anything but sleeping. The massive food coma that set on was unprecedented. Taste of Texas definitely let me indulge to the extent of my capacity.

This place is pretty good, but I would rank it under both Pappas Bros and Ruth's Chris. I can understand the allure of picking out your own steak in theory, but in practice this took away from the feeling of a high class steak restaurant.In fact, the folks I went with commented more on the salad bar than the steak. It was also a little noisy and crowded for the price tag. Soft pass.

By Far the best steak I have had in my life. The wait is long, but with their drinks, popcorn, and chips it went by quickly. Our waitress was a bit on the odd side, but I think she had too much going on. Once things calmed down, the service was good, and we couldn't have asked for a better 5 year anniversary dinner.

Steak wasn't as good as I remembered from a year ago, I ordered the rib 16 oz. not bad. I brought back more than half my food for lunch the next day. But found fluffy white stuff in the stem of myBroccoli, pretty sure it's mold...so definitely not happy about spending so much on an establishment that did not properly clean the prepared dish...thoroughly disappointed

The food was Honestly delicious, I had slow roasted prime rib and it was so good,but the service was so poor. What happened is we asked for a paper napkin and we got it wet by "CANDLE OILE" I noticed that after I wiped  My daughter hands and mouth, so told the waitress, Then she brought us a dirty hot towel, I refused to use it.They did not apologize about all that.

So apparently, they cater to alcohol intolerant people... I always order doubles, but because my mom blessed me with good skin, they will not allow me to drink anymore drinks. I'm sitting here with no drinks...
I love this place. Best steak I've ever had. It's a little pricy but well worth it. The salad bar and the bread...!

One of the best restaurants in Houston, the food is to die for. We have been to quite of few restaurants in 22 different countries and I would say this is the best steak I have ever had.  Excellent desert.

Amazing!  After being born & raised in Houston, TX, I finally went to Taste of Texas.  I went at 3:30 pm on a Sunday.  Country and very Texas decor.  Our waiter was amazing and let us choose our steaks and showed us the kitchen.  The salad bar, which included traditional yeast rolls, jalapeño cornbread and a cheese roll also had fruit and big blocks of cheese.  It was hearty and tough to not overeat while waiting for our steaks.  My husband and I both ordered filets.  Mine was so tender and delicious covered in garlic butter.  One of the top 3 steaks I've ever had.  The sides were ok (garlic mashed potatoes and mac n cheese).  We also enjoyed ice cream in a carmel cookie basket. Have to mention the spiked Arnold Palmer from the bar was perfection. The manager stopped by and was very genuine in his interaction.  Top notch customer experience and food to rave about.  I will be back!

Amazing! Amazing everything...food, service, hospitality, all of it. Absolutely the best steak anywhere around. Melissa was our waitress, and she couldn't have been better. Thanks for a great evening!
Great service. Steak is excellent. A nice salad bar that comes with the steaks. Bread basket is delicious. Go hungry!

Whenever I have family or friends visit from out of town that want a "Texas Steak", I take them to Taste of Texas. Because, like the name implies, they have some really great, really Texan steaks. The establishment is beautiful with plenty of parking; it is a mix of Texas lodge house and classy restaurant with dim lighting and an overall private but lively atmosphere. My favorite part about ToT is their unlimited salad bar with any purchase of a steak! They keep the salad plates and vegetables ice cold so that they stay crisp and fresh; there is such a huge variety of toppings that you can add to the salad to make it into your own (sun-dried tomatoes, slightly sweetened crushed walnuts, different types of pasta salads etc.). They also have unlimited bread: jalapeno cornbread, a cheesy swirl bread, and regular dinner roll. Along with these breads comes a variety of spreads: Cinnamon butter, fruit jams, regular butter, and more. And, I cannot reiterate this enough, the bread is SO GOOD. It is fluffy, it is delicious, it is everything that bread should be, and when you add the cinnamon butter spread to the dinner roll? It's just heaven on your tongue. The reason why I give ToT 4 stars instead of 5 though is that their steaks, although fantastic, just aren't as fantastic as other steak-focused restaurants in Houston. Personally, i think they under-season their steaks a bit so that the flavor just isn't all there. The steak itself is cooked really well and the meat is always very juicy, but I just feel like it's missing something (I assume because they do not marinate their steaks beforehand, since they let you pick which steak you want). However, you can definitely taste the firewood grill that they may or may not use to cook the steaks, and it definitely is a Texan taste, which is why I continue to bring my friends and family here. Just don't expect the best steak of your life.
Would have to be the best steak we have ever eaten! Excellent service to match. Def no need to fill up on salad or bread for starters!

Taste of Texas might have the best value in any steakhouse I've been to.To start off, there's a salad and bread bar where you can get as much as you like.  Salad options are great and the breads are always warm and soft.  Grab a roll with some cinnamon butter or honey butter.... Great way to start off the meal.As for the steaks, everything here is wet aged, which is a bummer, but the prices are nice.  The boo ordered a 16 ounce ribeye which was 37 dollars while i got the 24 ounce cowboy ribeye for 40.  These are good prices for a steakhouse that's considered near the upper end of steak houses.  Each order comes with a side so i got the asparagus with hollandaise sauce while the boo got sweet potato fries.  Each steak was cooked to order....... but with wet aged steaks, it's hard to get any great flavor.  Wet aged steaks are juicy.... but very bland.  It's unfortunate that Taste of Texas doesn't offer any dry aged steaks but pretty much only very few do.Taste of Texas felt like Texas Roadhouse if it was an upgrade.  I'll stick to Pappas Bros for my steaks in texas...... until i get my mini fridge and dry age my own steaks :-D

I love this place. It is a great dining experience and the food is always amazing.But explain to me why a restaurant that is so nice it has a dress code doesn't accept reservations? I was so excited to come here for my 21st birthday dinner, only to find that we could not make a reservation in advance and then got to the restaurant and was told it would be an hour wait. On a Wednesday evening. Consider me one very disappointed birthday girl.

Pros- great buffet salad bar with a variety of dressings and warm breads- love the intimate interior with dim lights- service is GREAT! Our waitress continued filling our waters even after we paid. Normally servers forget about you after you've paid....- the meat is definitely the best of the best! I love that they provide various sauces to go with your meat- very clean restroom! They even have those nice thick napkins :) Cons- we felt a bit rushed out of the restaurant. Our waitress gave us the check without us asking for it- when we sat and talked for awhile after the meal I felt like the servers were surrounding our table and giving us a strong hint of "okay you're done, can you get out now so we can seat others?"- very popular restaurant so it's quite loud and the front of the restaurant is crowded because of all the people waiting. Wish they had a clearer and bigger designated waiting area- parking is quite limited...had to park on the street
Can't go wrong with Taste of Texas. Consistently good service and quality. Best steakhouse in Houston.

This place will not disappoint - not only is the food great, but the ambiance as well. The salad bar is good enough to make the primary meal - it's just that good. The steak is cooked perfectly EVERYTIME, as is the chicken (gotten this on more than one occasion). The veggie plate is also a perfect meal. We have never eaten anything here we didn't enjoy. But, it has to be the steak that keeps me coming back (OK, that and the rolls). You are allowed to go to the back and pick your steak, which we like so we can pick just the right size. The desserts are fantastic; the pecan pie one of the best I have ever had!The service is great; and we usually have a good time. Unfortunately, we usually have a bit of a long wait, but it is not that unusual at a nice restaurant on the weekend in the  evenings.But, the BEST time of the year to go to eat at Taste of Texas has to be the Holiday Season - the Christmas decorations are fun and colorful. Warning, they don't do reservation during this time of year, so plan for a long wait.

Best steaks in Houston and an outstanding salad bar to boot. They have a huge block of cheese and fresh, warm rolls and various flavored butters as well.  They have a wonderful collection of historic Texas items around the restaurant. For years, they have invited school children for a lunch and tour. Very generous & memorable. This is a great place for a special meal. If on a budget, you can order the salad bar and a grilled chicken breast on the side. It's delicious as well.

The One Where Sandy Witness a Guy Choking on his Dinner. No joke... that really happened and the hemlic was performed and the ambulance showed up.  So yeah, a pretty dramatic dinner that night.  Or like my brother puts it "a very expensive dinner for that guy."Anyway, my mom loves Taste of Texas and we try to take her here for any special occasions like Mother's Day to be exact.  The atmosphere here is casual country.  For a high-end dining place, one can come in with jeans and boots and not feel out of place.  Yes, yes, I'm guilty of that for sure.Food wise - we always start off with their crab cake and they only serve one per order.  The one crab cake is actually enough to go around because you must keep in mind that their salad/bread bar is coming up next.  Their crab cake is very meaty with very little breading.  The salad/bread bar is amazing!  In fact, it's my favorite thing here.  You get to make your own salad, get a plate of fresh fruit with cheese (and they have two huge blocks of cheese for you to slice) and grab as many bread baskets as you like.  They also serve three different types of bread: regular roll, cheese roll, and jalapeno cornbread.  Now, FTW - their cinnamon butter.  Oh... yumm.... I can eat that with their regular roll all day, every day.  It's an awesome treat. Their unlimited salad bar comes with your entree.  If you're like my sister and brother-in-law, they add on a salad bar because they end up sharing a huge steak (16 oz ribeye to be exact).  Entree wise - Taste of Texas is rumored to be known for their ribeye.  In fact, everyone at my table always order that except for me.  I always end up with their prime rib (if they still have medium rare available) or their filet.  Regardless, their steaks are very good.  Do note that they do not take reservations and only seat complete (and I mean complete) parties.
Pretty good! Ordered a medium rare t-bone with mashed potatoes and it was a little tougher than I would have liked, but not bad. The mashed potatoes were mashed potatoes. Overall, 4/5.

Tonight was our 2nd time back since my last review.  We went in early May when my Inlaws visited, and tonight when my hubby's old boss came to town.  Our server was amazing, I had our 3mth old on my lap and was waiting for his daddy to finish his salad so I could trade out and get mine - and she offered to go get me a plate of salad!!! I've found my new fave dish 6oz bacon wrapped center cut filet with garlic butter and au gratin potatoes.  Totally shamazeballs.I absolutely love this place and will find any/every excuse to return!!
I had the cowboy steak and it was excellent.  I have eaten at many top steak houses in Houston.  This place has the best steak hands down..
Every time when im in town for business, this is where i go. Not once, i didnt have a good meal. Service is awesome, price is tight. Highly recommend to everyone.

This is my new old favorite no-frills steakhouse. The salad bar is ridiculous.  It could be (and actually, it turns out is) a meal in itself.  Lettuces, "salads", pasta salads, bits and pieces, olives, croutons, peppers, onions, fruits, red things, blue things, old things, new things.  GIANT BLOCK OF CHEESE.Yes, these are all items found at the salad bar.  You'll be so confused with the selection (ref: consumer hyper-choice) that you'll think you're at a buffet and want to come back for seconds.Also with the salad bar are their rolls and corn bread.  Now they're kind of the dark-horse of the meal.  You're probably thinking -- no big deal a roll is a roll, but then BLAMMO, they hit you up with their apple butter.Now the apple butter shouldn't be totally unfamiliar because when you sat down, you got a plate of toast rounds with butter and apple butter but BLAMMO, now it's an all you want mistake waiting to happen.And OH SNAP -- you haven't even eaten your steak yet!I've only ever had a problem once with the steak there and it only took them a cowboy minute to fix.  They don't typically go crazy with the seasoning, letting the flavor of the meat shine on it's own.  After the meal they have super nice cinnamon coffee which is a real treat.  It's different and tasty.Taste of Texas is always pretty crowded.  I typically wait 20-30 minutes so it's fun to send an advance party to grab a number and waste some time on their phone or whatnot while the rest of your party gets there.Now, admittedly this isn't The Palm or another legendary steakhouse BUT it is a super good steakhouse serving up consistently good pieces of meat, cooked to order with a HUGE helping of Texas hospitality.

Get serious if you want nothing but the best. Excellent Service. Great Food. Cool Atmosphere. They got the system workin'.  It was good ten years ago, and it's the same quality today. That's hard to do!
Great salad bar and sides! Steak is Golden Corral quality. Not a steak place. Kinda like a bonanza if you remember those places.? Great staff and good service.

The food was amazing but you get so much!   We made the mistake of ordering an appetizer, not knowing that you get the salad bar plus a huge meal... we'll know better for next time!   I found the atmosphere odd.   It was expensive, the "look" of the restaurant you would think it would be more of an upscale restaurant, but when we arrived the wait was more than an hour, there were kids every where, and the wait area was pretty laid back.   Anyway, if I spent that much on food, I expect a bit nicer atmosphere.   Overall, I think we'll be back; we'll just be more prepared on what to expect.   The food was certainly worth the money.

Steak - Porterhouse & Cowboy cooked perfectly and it was delicious.Ambiance is great. Friendly staff & our waiter Brandon was so nice and helpful. Cheese bread 4/5Salad Bar 4/5I think Taste of Texas is the place to enjoy some really perfectly crafted steaks.
Always a long wait for ok food. It could be that they give you so much popcorn and drinks as you wait it's hard to be hungry when you finally do get seated.

Wow this place is REALLY busy! Word of advice, if you want to come here for dinner, come at 3:30pm (right when they open) and put you name on the list so you can get one of those waitlist cards and let them know what time you intend on coming back. So, when you come back at 7pm and the wait is 2hours long, you actually get on the fast pass line and only wait about 30mins. Yep, saved us a TON of time and they do give popcorn and chips while you wait! When we finally got seated and ordered, we went to the salad bar, nothing too special (fogo de chao has much better selection). They had a variety of dressings but as far as salad toppings, they were just the typical salad bar stuff. The rolls were pretty good but the cornbread was kind of old when I had it. The cinnamon butter was delicious, and so was the regular butter. For appetizers, we had the crab cake and the stuffed shrimp. The crab cakes were okay. They were generous with the crab but the flavor wasn't great. It was eggy and tangy for some reason and the tartar sauce that it came with didn't complement the flavor either. The stuffed shrimp was pretty good, they used jumbo shrimp so they were decent portions.For entree, we got the cowboy steak, tomahawk steak, and the grilled tuna. Let me start by saying that all of our food was overcooked. We all requested medium rare and came out with about medium well. This made such a big difference in our food. It's pretty disappointing especially considering how this place is known for their steaks yet they can't cook it right. It was cool that we got to pick our own steaks so you know exactly what you'll be eating. The tuna had a nice smoky taste but it was lacking any other flavor. The french fried onions on top of it was pretty good and was basically the only thing giving it taste. The pineapple salsa that it came with was too tangy and didn't really go well with the tuna. The cowboy steak was pretty good, highly recommend the garlic butter! It made the steak taste a whole lot better. I wish they were more generous with that, or perhaps we could have asked for more because it only touched half of our steak and the other half was a bit plain. The tomahawk steak was HUGE! it was pretty legit, flavor wise it tasted better than the cowboy steak too. (or maybe they just put more garlic butter hah!)Overall, this place was pretty good but it was quite pricey, definitely not a great value. They had a nice huge selection of wines and the one we got went very well with our meal. I don't think I'll be coming back here because I don't think their steaks are THAT good to come back and spend a lot on it again. Oh wells, it was a good meal!

I checked yelp to find out a great steakhouse in the town. I saw their reviews that are many positive recommendations from yelpers. My hubby and I went to try the place right away. Definitely it was right decision. Their steaks are tender and salad bar must be tried without doubt.I had such good experience becuase server was knowledgeable and helpful to recommend their steaks to us. At the meantime, She knew we were celebrated birthday, she gave us a free cake and picture which she took for us. It was amazing service. I will recommend some friends to try this place. You're deserved to get 5 stars.

Never had a bad experience here, for a business luncheon ask to sit in the wine room as it is the most conducive for that, otherwise extremely loud at lunch.  Dinner seems less stressed.  The food is superior to their counterparts, but it is the wait staff that shines every time.  Attentive staff that actually go above and beyond must be their mantra. Lunch for two $60.The baked brie serves two, the crabcakes actually have crab in them, not the imitation stuff and the pecan pie melts in your mouth.Parking a challenge as it fills up to the max early on weekdays.  There is a person riding through the lot on a golf cart, not sure if it is for security purposes or to assist some folks to get to the front door.
Had Robbie Robertson as our server and he gave us perfect service. The steak was the best I've ever had. Can't wait to go back!

Taste of Texas was everything we wished it was. We had a layover on our trip to Costa Rica. Our flight was leaving in Houston so we had 3hrs to kill. We found this place in city and it was amazing. The salad bar is great. They cool the plates and give you a lot of options to build. We ordered the Qual for an appetizer which was so delicious. Than for our Entry I got the 24 oz Cowboy steak cooked medium. I added the home made blu cheese sauce and it was hands down the best steak I've ever tasted in my life. It was cooked perfect. Afterwards my burps smelled like hell. But it was well worth it. My girl got the Filet Mignon with Oscar sauce and a loaded Potato. She said it was the best steak of her life as well. The owner came out chatted to us and bought dessert for us. Such a great experience. We were so stuffed but we couldn't turn down the gesture. I got the Texas traditional Pecan Pie A la mode and she got the Snicker pie. The bill wasn't bad at all. Would love to go back.

As awesome as the steaks are in many cases my family and I find ourselves going just for the salad bar. The best salad bar ever! Three words: fresh, fresh, fresh! The veggies have a good variety, the salad toppings are scrumptious. The whole family goes coo-coo over the fresh breads that you serve yourself with cinnamon butter - not to mention the blocks of cheese. Did I say fresh?

I haven't been throwing around the "5-star" lately because I feel only the very best deserve it. Taste of Texas is worthy. The atmosphere is great, the service is top notch, the salad bar is rivaled by few, and the steaks are spot on. Every time. I've been here 3 times, only for fancy occasions because of the price.  It is expensive, but for those special moments it's worth it.  I've never had a bad meal. I've never had bad service. And I've never left feeling upset. The steaks are amazing. Their drinks are tasty and have just the right amount of alcohol.  Their salad bar is so awesome. Only words. Oh and I need to mention the jalapeño corn bread? Smack yo momma good. Even if you aren't a red meat eater, their chicken is delicious. Really the only negative thing about this place is the lack of intimate dining. It's pretty open and loud, so know that going in. You will enjoy this place.  SYOY

The Weekly Yelp mentioned my "Steak in Cow Country" list (thanks, Farrah A), and I realized I had never reviewed the quintessential Houston steakhouse. Unacceptable! It'll be a quick review, but the bottom line is STEAK + TEXAS = TASTE OF TEXAS.With apologies to Pappas and Killen's, Taste of Texas is the first place that comes to mind when visitors ask for Texas steak. Ambiance is a huge deal here, and if your guests are looking for fine country-western, look no further than Taste of Texas.The salad bar is, well, phenomenal. It's tempting to get full on the cornbread, rolls, honey, and flavored butter alone. The cheese block is incredibly fun. I like fruit on my salads, and you can top to your heart's content here. Plus, the entree can always be taken home should you get too full on filler. Thinking ahead!Steak is solidly good, but not otherworldly, here. One neat part is the ability to choose your own steak. The waiter will take you back to the selection for the day, and you can point and choose.I always get the ribeye, which comes on a sizzling metal platter (in the shape of a cow), doused with garlic butter. It looks drool-worthy but tastes slightly less than divine, which is how I've found all the steaks to be here. It's unexplainable, and unavoidable. My dad loves the prime rib and portabello mushroom; my brother goes T-bone.The one-star ding is for, besides the A- steak, the crazy insane wait times. Do not even attempt to come here during holidays, lest you feel the desire to wait triple-digit minutes. There are no reservations: it's all first-come, first-serve. Though the dining room is huge, the crowds are huge. Free sodas and popcorn are available to tide you over, but it's a frustrating wait.

First time here. Enjoyed every bit of my giant Tomahawk steak. Loved picking the meat myself too. Recommend doing it. Remember you can't go here and nickel and dime the menu. Go when you are ready to splurge.

I used to really really really love coming to Taste of Texas. The food was delicious, the portions were large and the service was excellent. The last couple of times I've been back they have disappointed me in at least one way. Either the food is good and the service mediocre or visa versa. I miss the consistency in both service and food that Taste of Texas once took pride in.

I was away on business and my wife just happened to tag along, so I tried to make it as "fun" as possible for her.  A coworker suggested that I try taste of texas.  We took the trip out there and was happy to see that it was a pretty sizable restaurant.  We entered and were seated immediately.... They have A LOT of friendly employees.They pulled out an iPad and showed us their "virtual" wine list, which was pretty cool.  My wife ordered a filet and i went with the bone in rib eye.  They waiter took me to the back room and allowed me to pick my steak... pretty cool.Included with the steak was access to the salad bar, which had all types of breads, veggies, spreads and etc.... a nice touch.We got our steaks and they were nicely cooked.  Taste wise... they were good for a wet aged steak.  I prefer the dry aging process.  From a service perspective, it is the best experience I ever had with a restaurant this size!

Taste of Texas is really hard to beat. The service was great, the wine is great, the steaks are great, and it's a very unique experience. If you don't know the deal, you pick out your steak on the menu, then you are escorted to the kitchen and you literally pick out your steak from the rows and rows of steaks available! You get a tag number when you pick it out so that upon delivery, you know you've got the right meat ;)The grilled quail bites are delicious, but I wasn't a fan of their stuffed shrimp because they're so deep fried. If you get an appetizer, my advice would be to stick with the quail. The steaks are incredibly tender - I got the 8 oz filet and you could have cut it with a butter knife.Top knotch!

One of the best restaurants in Houston. Every visit has always been perfect. Yes there might be a wait but the waiting area has complimentary drinks and snacks. Now when you do manage to sit down the staff is very well trained and courteous. Then comes the fun part where you go to the back and select your steaks and as always cooked to your choice and perfection. Not once have I ever had a bad experience here and highly recommend at least to try the place out once.

This place is insanely awesome!  I've been to this location approximately 9-10 times over the past 4 years and every visit was a true treat.  The steaks are cooked to perfection, the salad bar is a meal in and of itself, the waitstaff is attentive, professional, and knowledgeable.  The manager always comes by to chat, the ambiance is wonderful.  I have no complaint and I am one picky customer!  Nothin' but love here.  :)

I love love love love love love Taste of Texas. Forever and always. I will always sing its praises and take my out-of-state friends here (when finances are cush). I know that my opinion is biased because I haven't really eaten at other high-quality steak houses in Houston (like Pappas Bros.), but my dumb love for this place will prevent me from going anywhere else for prime rib, as long as I can help it. My stubborn loyalty even made my turn my nose down at the House of Prime Rib in San Francisco, where I constantly sang Taste of Texas' praises in my head. Yeah, I was THAT girl.This is what you can expect when you go, every time:- A long wait during normal meal times. They don't take reservations for... 15(?) people or under, so you'll just have to wait. But they have a large area for waiting, including complimentary soda, popcorn and chips. You must try to resist the temptation of filling up on these, because the best is yet to come- A truly "Texan" experience. From the interior decor to the Southern hospitality, this place has everything Texan to offer (I mean all of the positives, hehe)- Friendly, courteous, knowledgeable waiters. Every time I've been, we've had nothing but excellent service and have been treated kindly and professionally, no matter what the occasion- An incredible salad bar. I know it's just a salad bar, but I would come here to eat the salad alone, and I am NOT a salad junkie. This is the occasion where quality is better than quantity; it may be small, but I love their selection of greens, veggies, pasta salads and beans. Chilled plates, fresh and delicious ingredients, incredible (and fresh) salad dressings (my favorite are the cilantro vinaigrette or the cactus sauce). Add two chunks of cheese that you can carve to your heart's desire, along with freshly-made buns and breads with an assortment of flavored butters and jellies, and you've got yourself an unbeatable salad experience. My favorite salad dressing is the cilantro vinaigrette. When I lived in Cali, I would have dreams of the vinaigrette. Oh CV, how I love thee- The best prime rib you will ever have. I am not kidding. They dry-age the prime rib for 20(?) days, and you have the most flavorful, earthy prime rib flavor. They pair it with au jus and creamy horseradish sauce, along with the unlimited salad bar and a choice of one of their many hand-crafted sides. When I go with someone, we share the smallest size prime rib and walk away stuffed and satisfied- Great for special occasions. If it's your birthday, they will give you a free dessert, as well as a Polaroid picture of the event inserted in their Taste of Texas card. I highly recommend a dessert that includes their Blue Bell cinnamon ice cream, specifically made for Taste of Texas (you cannot buy it retail ANYWHERE)- Reasonably-priced. The last time I went with my mom and the hubbs, I was feeling under the weather so I ordered the salad bar and soup. I believe my meal only cost $12. I mean, really, it's only $2 more than Sweet Tomatoes, and the quality is ten times better. Definitely worth it!!Well, I guess that's all I can say without sounding like a broken record. I am so glad my family and I are going tomorrow. We already ate it last week, and I'm already ready for round two!!

All I can say is wow! Everything about Taste of Texas is top notch, but it's rustic enough to not make you feel like a snob for eating there. The prices are pretty high, but you get a high quality meal...and plenty of it! Any place that has their own exclusive Blue Bell ice cream flavor should be on your radar!

This is our favorite restaurant! We pop in sometimes just for the award winning salad bar, or celebrate special events here, and the the service, quality and total experience is always impeccable! A few favorites: salad bar is a must! Crab cake, Mac & Cheese, Pecan Pie - I'll stop here but I could surely go on.  I love their friendly and professional staff, and manager Norman is simply the best, as well as other managers who I can't call by name. Oh, last thing, prepare to wait. It's a popular spot and they don't take reservations. In the meantime though, there are refreshments and snacks while you wait.The rustic design and Texan relics on the wall make for a very unique, cabin-like ambiance. If you have folks in town, bring them here. Ciao!

This place is 110% overrated. I've had way better steaks. I love the concept and even their process, but the finished product did not knock my socks off and that's what I expect when coughing up that much moolah and from a place with that much hype. No plan to return. My date that evening had no complaints though...that's the only reason you got 3 stars.

There's a lot of hype and great reviews for this place, so we decided to try it out for birthday dinner.  None of us had ever been there, so it was all a new experience for us.  We were seated promptly on a Wednesday evening, so that was fantastic.  While we were waiting for the rest of our party, my husband and I heard the server talking to the table next to us, and one of the questions is if the customer wanted to pick out his own steak - porterhouse. My husband was excited about the possibility of picking out his steak since we thought it would have been pretty neat.  In any case, maybe we went on a bad night because our server, while nice, was very busy.  We waited a while to actually order, which the order was taken by another server (our server was occupied), and we weren't offered the opportunity to choose our meats - husband was disappointed he wasn't offered the opportunity to pick his porterhouse.  We were there for almost 2 hours, and they didn't refill the soda once (soda was about 1/3 left, but it was watered down due to ice, and no offer or mention to refill). The food, overall, was good - excellent salad bar.  Crab cake appetizer opinion was mixed. A member of our party was disappointed in his burger (he's a big burger fan, but only finish half of his burger), but we all agreed the steaks were good, "cowboy" was more favored over porterhouse.  Since we were there for a birthday dinner, we did receive compliment dessert and photo for memory, which was very nice. I'm very big on service, especially at nicer restaurants, and can make or break my entire impression of a restaurant. I'd have to say I was disappointed. While the food was good, service wasn't terrible, but wasn't good either.  Would I come back? I'm not sure - I think Taste of Texas is mostly hype. I still prefer my steaks from Flemings.

My family and I love coming here. The food and service is worth the long wait. While you wait they offer complimentary chips, salsa, sodas and drinks. The service is excellent. Management is great! You can tell because there are more than 2 of them checking and running everything. We went on Fathers Day and the wait was out the door and it was hot.
