They had these huge fans and snacks outside for the people waited. It was packed and they were very organized. That reflects good management. The food is excellent. Our waiter Gus was fantastic. No complaints. The price is right. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because it can't compare to the steaks at Ruth Chris Steakhouse. We will be back.

We came here for a b-day, and a few times after...top notch for steaks especially when you get to choose which one, very tender and juicy. Loved the salad bar though which I think is probably my most favorite.

My favorite steak place, hands down. Impressive wine selection too. The owners love God, promote family, and support our military/veterans. I could spend hours looking at all the Texas-themed memorabilia/antiques/artifacts in Taste of Texas. I've never had a less than perfect meal here.

This is my favorite steak place.  The service is superb and the ranch style decoration just prepares you to enjoy a good steak.Amazingly, the salad bar is also great.  They aren't just about the steak.All the steaks are angus beef and are always cooked exactly as I instructed.  The juices are kept and just using the garlic butter topping lets the meat shine.The meat is high quality and the flavor is good.  There isn't much more you need.Lines can be long on the weekends, so they have a massive waiting area with free drinks and snacks.

I had been to Taste of Texas at least 3 times before last night and most of them had been pretty nice meals. However, I was not very happy with yesterday's visit. We got there and found out the wait was 1:30-2:00 hours- that was fine. When we got seated, we ordered right away. Both my boyfriend and I had salad bar options but we only got half a plate of salad each and shared 3 pieces of bread.  The stuffed mushrooms were great. My boyfriend's New York Strip Sirloin was good but we thought my Grilled Tenderloin Medallions were okay. There was a pinch of flavor but not much else. I did not touch the 6oz medallions and ended up eating the asparagus, tomato and onion strings. My boyfriend did not finish his meal since we both wanted to save room for dessert. I love bread so since my meal was subpar, I got some bread from the Salad Bar and put it on our table. This is what made me the most upset:We asked for 3 to go boxes. The server asked if we wanted everything boxed up.She asked, "Do you want the bread?"We said, "Yes!" to both. I would've packed everything up myself. When I opened the to go boxes up for lunch today... not all of the food was there. Why would you ask if I wanted it all box up and not give it to us?We also ordered a creme brûlée for dessert, which tasted off. I am a huge desserts person and I don't even think I ate 10% of that dish. The strawberries were not sweet either. Since the dessert was eh, I was definitely looking forward to the bread tomorrow (which did not even get packaged up). Overall, I tipped the waitress 25% for packing our food and taking care of us but I regret it now seeing that our food was not even fully packed in and the food was not good.

Love love loved this place!  Found it on yelp and was not disappointed.  Great service. Great food.  Our server was fabulous and showed us everything for a first time visitSalad bar-amazing!  Hot bread, lots of choices and the plates are ice cold.  Steaks-take it all in and pick your own!  How much fun!  Take the tag with you so you have a little memory.  It was a fabulous hand picked steak.  They ask you exactly how you want it seasoned.  Those that say they don't season it enough---well you didn't ask for it!!!!Desert-ah-mah-zing.  So many to pick from but go with their signatures.  You won't be disappointed.  Wine was great-maybe a little overpriced but that's what happens when you buy a bottle in the restaurant.  A great place with a lot of Texas history.  Loved it!  Will visit again

This place is undeniably unique. From the beginning, if you have a wait you will get to sit in their waiting area with free soft drinks, popcorn, and chips and salsa. When you sit down, a complimentary appetizer is given to you. Then, with an entree you get unlimited trips to the salad bar. The center cut filet is always cooked perfectly for me. The pecan pie is delicious. Not only that, the service is always perfect. I love the Texas history artifacts spread throughout the restaurant. Also, they make any event (anniversaries, birthdays) special. I have recommended this place to everyone visiting the Houston area and all of them come back and have said this is their favorite place to go.
bomb.com! If I had the cash flow, I'd be here multiple times to try everything out.Our waiter Carlos was awesome and very helpful.

I have been coming to this restaurant with my family since I was in a baby carrier (over 21 years) and it has been my top pick of restaurants for as long as I can remember. Anytime there is a celebration in our family, Taste of Texas is our go to place. The food is delicious and the service is always exceptional. The prices are on the higher side but the food is worth it in my opinion. Their determination to give guests the best experience possible seems really genuine and the managers are always coming around to make sure everything is running smooth. I look forward to coming here for many more years.

You cannot beat this place for value and the quality is quite high as well.  Great beef, great great service.  They really take care of you here.  The salad bar and it's breads, along w/ desserts (the pecan pie ...!), are also true standouts.

One of our all time favorite restaurants. We LOVE this place; for date night, for special occasions, or just for a good steak! The hospitality is unmatchable. The salad bar is always a hit and I love how they have snacks and drinks set up for self service while you wait. Cannot wait for another Taste of Texas night!!!

Very long wait, no reservation... But worth it... There is a waiting area with soft drink, pop corn, and chips and salsa self serve. Bar area too... Its very welcoming for people visiting Texas. Had the beat mushrooms stuffed crabs. The shrimps too. Our waiter was awesome  very friendly and quick service. Left cellphones on the table and found them. Very uptown upscale place. You et a real the as experience. All beef is Angus certified. Very well cooked, crafted, and filling. Salad bar is simple and not a lot of variety. At champ. Will definitely go back.

If you order a steak from the special steak section, u get unlimited salad and bread that you fix yourself from the salad bar which they kept stocked and boy that cilantro salad dressing was so tasty and the cheese rolls with that cinnamon butter was yummy! The waiter gives you an option to pick your steaks at the butcher area prior. I had a tomahawk steak ($60) and man ... that sucker was huge! Juicy too for medium well. Nice atmosphere. Get there as soon as they open cause they get packed pretty quick especially during the weekend. They start taking customers before they even open. We and couple people got there a couple minutes before 3p and by the time they opened we had already ordered and were eating our salads. Service was great. Waiter was attentive and quick. Desserts were huge ... enough for 2 people. Expect to shell at least $200 for two people.

Came here for a rainy Sunday night steak with the bf and only waited for about 15 minutes to be seated. Even though we only waited for 15 minutes, I definitely hit up some of that free popcorn in the waiting room.The salad bar they have is incredibly fresh. The spinach, tomatoes, and cucumbers that they have are all basically farm-fresh, some of the best veggies I've had. The bread that they have is pretty great, but skip the cornbread, it's super dry. Their cinnamon butter + dinner roll is AMAZING, and yeah I ate way too much bread before eating a pound of steak :|I ordered the 16 oz ribeye, and my bf got the 6 oz center cut. Oh man, that center cut is tiny and that ribeye is huge (we definitely shared). The ribeye was kind of inconsistent; some bites were very tough and some were perfectly tender, some of it was completely unsalted and other parts were very well seasoned. The toughness was a turn-off for me, but overall it was kind of a pretty-good but not perfect steak experience. The center cut is incredibly tender, like melt-in-your-mouth tender. For my side, I got the Texas Au Gratin Potatoes, and they were very creamy and delicious, but definitely heavy. We also had a side of the green beans which were good, fresh, and crisp.Taste of Texas is pretty good, but I know for a fact that there are better steakhouses in Houston, so I'll be trying others before returning here.

yay today is my birthday!TLDR(too long didn't read):Food was 3.5/5, almost borderline above average food, recommend steaks at a steakhouse!Ambience was 3.5/5, texas embodied in a restaurant!Service 3.5/5Price 3.5/5of course I want to go somewhere nice, and after much careful research and great recommendations I picked The Taste of Texas. sounds awesome, right? we arrived around 8:45 pm Tuesday, and surprisingly there was no wait, and we were seated immediately and took our drink orders.the place is very clean and grand with Texan paraphernalia. I got root beer, which came in a bottle by Saint Arnold, I wasn't a fan. I carefully ordered the cowboy steak (who wouldn't want to eat like a cowboy??) with a side of steak fries and macaroni and cheese ( probably not the best combination but who doesn't love starch) you also get access to the huge salad bar in the back (which wasn't advised of the location and I was looking around aimlessly until I was escorted to the salad bar, revealing an assortment of different greens, condiments (tomato+mozzarella, quinoa, vast variety of all the fixins!) and a nice heated drawer filled with cornbread (which was not that great, dry, tasted very odd, as most cornbreads i've had are), a regular dinner roll (which was fantastically traditional) and finally the best one of all a cheesy rolled bun that tasted deliciously succulent! if i didn't know i had 24oz of meat to eat, i would have eaten 2 more of those cheese rolls. they also had little tubs of a whipped honey cinnamon butter, which was nice, and another type of butter, and assortment of honey. i  shamelessly walked back to my table with my crammed basket of bread and overflowing salad plate. about 15 minutes later after stuffing my face of that amazing asiago roll, our entrees come rolling out on heated plates. my steak has a gratuitous dab of bleu cheese butter, melting down the side, curiously touching my steak fries, which were by the way largely average (my expectations shouldn't be high for fries, right?), and next to my humongous rectangular plate, a steaming hot, pale yellowed panko breadcrumb topped macaroni and cheese. of course i go for the steak first! I saw into my steak with the chubby steak knife provided, and my excitement dulls a little as i see my steak has been overcooked into the medium/medium-well temperatures even though i asked for medium rare. juices pour out and i indulge in the first bite. my mouth fills with tangy blue cheese and savory meat juices. this steak is pretty good! but as i worked on it a little more, I realized my meat was unevenly cooked, where the outerparts were more rare, and the fat wasn't as rendered down as i would have liked it. the macaroni and cheese was creamy, cheesy, with the crispy topping, nothing else to be expected! and since it's my birthday, they brought a huge platter of their desserts which included key lime pie, pecan pie, apple dumplings, mousse.. and since i'm a sucker for apple pie, i had to get the apple dumplings !! my favorite flavored vanilla ice cream and a soft biscuit dough topped with pecans blanketing soft apples, it was sinfully comforting. overall the food is leaning against the borderline of average and above average. i would come back only on extremely special occasions, this place is definitely a delightful spoil for your beefy desires.

Everything is bigger in Texas!!! Why is Texas flag so big by the way? lol So I have to travel to Houston, Texas couple weeks ago, and I never been to Taxes before, and one of my goal was hopefully get to see a fat guy eat the 72 oz steak, sadly I didn't see any fat guy wanted to eat the 72 oz steak. lol So now, let's talk about Taste of Texas since I get that out of the way. :0)This place is really Texan, everything is old hardwood, there is a big bear by the front host stand, and a statue of a cowboy standing outside, not sure who it is, maybe some famous cowboy? This place to me is very different, because after you decided to order what type of steak you like on the menu, the waiter brought you back to their kitchen, and you get to pick which size of the meat you like, crazy right? lol I'll gotta tell you, some of the steak are huge, I can't believe is for people, is like a size of the half of the cow. lol I ordered the 24 oz Ribeye, and the reason why I ordered that is because the biggest steak I had ever ordered was 16 oz, and they have 22 oz, 24 oz, 36 oz, 48 oz, and go on and on, and yes, they can cut you as big as you wish!!! So I thought I never order 24 oz before, I will tried it, and to warn you all, unless you can eat a lot, don't do it. lol Because ordering the steak comes with salad bar, which is pretty big, I cannot finish my steak, I came close to, but didn't make it. lol So....good, but I had better in NY, and that is why I'm giving it 4 stars, still high up there tho, will I be back? Of course!!!

I've had steak here several times and it was great. I particularly enjoy the soup and salad bar for lunch. The potato soup is so good that I like to eat it slowly and enjoy every single spoonful. The staff is very hospital. This is a very nice establishment; great for client meetings.
The wait was the usual, 45 to an hour long. The wait wasn't bad because the wait area had free sodas, chips & salsa, and popcorn. The food was amazing. I would post pictures but was too hungry.

About a week or 2 ago, I sent and email on the Taste of Texas website. I was trying to get my gift card redeemed through their store. Unfortunately, the gift cards are only usable through the restaurant.I left a note and left my information. It probably was not more than an hour and I got a call back. I spoke with Lindsay [sp] who was very wonderful!She let me know that my husband can come by the restaurant and use his gift card to get the 4 steaks [ribeye] and garlic sauce that he likes, which would be about the amount in total of our gift card.She said all he needed to do was go to the bar and they would accommodate him. She told me when she would be working and I told hubby to go in those days to give her a special thank you from me for being so patient, courteous, and kind!Thanks again for having superb customer service!Michele Brown

Was referred to this establishment by a few clients and was not disappointed.  First of all its very nice without the upscale foo foo feeling.  Awesome sald bar with very good toppings, great steak selection and they ask if I wanted to pick the piece or the butcher, sides were amazing.
The Steak was nice and tender.. I picked my own steak which was great. I didn't care for the Cream cheese Jam however, The Service was A1.  Meet a Hoosier being from Indiana was great

Amazing.  Their steak is cooked to perfection and their service is top notch.  Not to mention the salad bar; it has everything you need!  The waiting is the only thing that sucks because they don't take reservations (and they're always packed!) but there is a waiting section with a bar as well as free soda/popcorn/nachos.  Absolute favorite steak house in Houston!

We dined here because Texas is supposed to have the best steak. I think this place was average. My husband got their prime rib but felt it tasted okay, probably because it had too much charcoal coating. I couldn't stop eating their cheese bread with their cheese/jam dip! It was something I never had before in NJ! Staff was great. Nothing but a typical steakhouse.
Always amazing. Not surprising everyone in other reviews says the restaurant was recommended to them. You will love the food and the experience.
I love the waiting room! It's such a great idea.My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary ! It was more than perfect . BEST STEAK IN TEXAS !!!!
The best salad bar and steaks in town. Yummy cheese rolls and corn bread.  I could eat the salad bar for lunch or dinner any day.
Not long time to wait, very lucky!!good service and polite everyoneThey don't have wifi is not good for travelerbut meal still perfect!!they give us a picture we were cow boy hat very touch;)

Wonderful food and service! It's a bit pricey at first glance, but trust me, it's worth it.I ordered the center cut filet with garlic butter, and it was the best steak I've ever eaten.Highly recommend this place!

Normally it's a great family steak house. But tonight 4 was in my group and we all ordered steak. We all ordered med rare and rare. The two of us got the order on the steaks right and the other 2 came out well done. They apologized, asst Mgr included but we had someplace else we needed to be so of course couldn't wait nor did we want too.  So with the price and special occasion it didn't end too well. We will give it one more try. And that's it.PattiP

We went here for some serious steak, and we got serious steak! This restaurant has a pretty unique dining experience which I really appreciated. When we walked in we were given a number and led to the "waiting area" which is its own large room with a bar and ample seating. Tea, chips & salsa, and a large popcorn machine are all available free of charge to munch on while you wait. After being seated you can go to their butcher (yes they have their own butcher!) where you can pick out your cut of meat. Any steak order gives you access to their salad bar where they have fresh baked breads with homemade spreads. Their cinnamon butter is marvelous. It makes whatever you spread it on taste just like a Cinnabon roll. No joke.I split a 30 oz Tomahawk (rib-eye with bone in) with a side of Au Gratin potatoes. It. Was. Sublime. The steak was thick cut, well marbled, and perfectly cooked medium rare giving it a very rich and juicy taste. The potatoes were equally fabulous with just the right amount of cheese. Somehow after that feast I found some room for dessert with their Key Lime Pie. As with the rest of the meal it was excellent. The mousse was light and fluffy and the key lime was just tart enough to balance out the sweetness from the graham cracker crust. Really there wasn't a single thing I could complain about even if i wanted to. From the decor to the service to the quality of the food, everything was top shelf. 5 star rating well earned.

Years ago, M would always bring me food back from here, but I have never stepped my foot inside this place until last December. I always pictured the inside of this place as some swanky place, but instead it was like this massive space with separate section throughout the restaurant and just the complete opposite of what I was picturing all those years.Since it was during the holidays, they were loaded up with decorations, I am wondering, where do they store all this stuff....because it was tons of things, including paintings all around that are holiday theme.Anyways, our waitress, can't remember her name, I should check my receipt, but she's super perky, you could tell she was working hard for a good tip. She's helpful and great - totally appreciate those qualities.We had tea, they have a very limited variety of tea, M got a citrus black tea and I got rooibos, since there were only 3 options available. Very limited.M got the salad bar as a meal and I got a medium rare, but closer to the rare side of the Center Cut 6 oz with the optional bacon wrapped and filet oscar.The steak came out in between medium rare to a light medium temperature and the filet oscar, which I got because I was curious about their crab cake, but opted for the steak topper with 2 ounce jumbo crab cake and hollandaise sauce. I have asked for the hollandaise sauce to be on the side. The crab cake was a bit too buttery for my taste, which overpowered the natural sweetness of how a good crab should taste. I ate one bite of the steak and that was enough. Not that it was a bad steak, but I can't eat that much meat in one sitting, especially red meat.I was full on my salad and my fully dressed baked potato. I haven't had a baked potato in ages. The salad bar is really limited, but I want to say I was obsessed with their miniature loaf of bread. Besides it just being cute, it was super fluffy and of course, love how it is kept warm in the bread containment. The jalapeno cornbread was a disappointment, it wasn't as good as I thought it would be.The other round roll was okay, so out of the three, the mini loaf of bread was the best one.M was obsessed with the cinnamon butter.We didn't get any dessert, except we ate fresh fruit from the salad bar.I would come back here for the salad bar, not for the steak.

Let me qualify this post by saying I've been to some very nice five star Steakhouses/Restaurants, Capital Grille, Ruth Chris, Charley's, Shula's,etc.- Taste of Texas isn't at that level, however, the overall experience isn't that far behind.  We visited Houston for the 3rd Annual James Harden ProCamp and after driving back to the hotel after the last day, my wife and I decided to treat my son to a Texas steak, last year we came out here we did the Pappa Trio  experience & left Texas without trying a steak. I'm glad we did not make that mistake twice. As soon as we entered the restaurant everyone was so hospitable, smiling faces, asking if we needed anything while leading us to the complimentary chips & salsa, popcorn, soda, tea room. I'm a big golf fan, so I was pleased to see the final few holes of the PGA on the TV.  The hostess told us the wait time was 25-30 mins. so I was pleasantly surprised when we actually got seated within the specified time. The ambiance is exactly what I would expect from a true Texas Resturant, a lot of historic relics, flags, oversized stuffed bears, classic riffles,  true Texas. The actual dining experience was phenomenal staring with Colby L., our expert wait staff. Colby expertly explained the Taste of Texas dinner experience, starting with "selecting"  your steak, to the salad/bread, to the "free" liter refill of your beverage, and finally the wide variety of deserts that we just couldn't refuse although we where absolutely stuffed.

Taste of Texas, we finally meet again! Years ago, I tried to dine here on a weekend night, and was given a 2 hour wait time for a party of 2. As the wise Sweet Brown said, ain't nobody got time for that!  Since then, people have raved about this place so incessantly that I was like, okay maybe I'm missing out. My BFFL and I planned a dinner and movie date night to spend some much needed QT together. I advised that we go early, around 5 PM, to beat the dinner rush. When we pulled up to the parking lot, it was already entirely full. Really? Who eats at 5 PM?! I guess everyone else had the same exact thought, too. She dropped me off to get on the wait list and proceeded to stalk a family walking to their car. The hostess quoted a reasonable 30-45 minute wait time. They provide sodas, popcorn, and chips+salsa in their large waiting area with seating. I wonder why they don't convert this into more dining space. Anyway, we waited closer to an hour, but the time flew by because we were so immersed in girl talk. By the time we were seated, the average wait time jumped to 90 minutes. Clearly we had to get the steak, but we knew that with our appetites, we'd never finish one on our own. We split a 16 oz ribeye, including one trip to the salad and bread bar. How strict are they on this one-trip rule? Because that was some damn good bread, especially paired with cinnamon butter. The salad bar had a variety of fresh options. I even got a few slices of watermelon for my bestie, since it's her fave. They only put in our steak order after we returned from the salad bar to time our courses appropriately. When the steak came out, they had cut it in half for us already, with whipped mashed potatoes as a side. Mine was perfectly pink and I drizzled garlic butter alllllll over it. This stuff is made of pure bliss and fat. My best friend's steak was cooked medium instead of medium rare. She was disappointed but enjoyed the flavor regardless. I should mention that I only ate half my steak, being so full from the bread/salad, and was saving room for dessert. Our server brought out a huge tray with 10 different kinds of cakes/pies/tarts. What an effective selling tactic - shoving dessert in my face. I'LL TAKE ONE OF EVERYTHING, PLEASE. Just kidding; people around me would've been too judgmental. We got a snickers cheesecake to share, but had to take it to go because we were late for our movie. I'm happy to report that it was heavenly. We had mentioned to our server that we were in a rush to catch a movie, but she still wore her invisibility cloak and was no where to be found whenever we needed her.  Despite missing the first 5 minutes of Despicable Me 2, we enjoyed our meal. I would only return for special occasions though (complimentary dessert of your choice for birthdays!), because the parking, long wait time, and slow service are a bit of a hassle.

We have been here couple of time. This places is pricey however it totally worthy. The staffs are treat you very professional. The food is fantastic. I love the steak here, you can ask to pick your own steak and have it cook what ever style you like. I also love the salad bar here, they have a variety of salad, cheese, and all kind of fruits. This restaurant is very busy on the weekend and the holiday but they have a very nice waiting area, you can order drink while you waiting and chat with your friends, other restaurant just dont have that. Dont forget to order the chocolate cake for the desert they have the best chocolate cake.

Everyone should try the cowboy steak or tomahawk ribeye at least once. You'll probably have to share the tomahawk. If you're disappointed, you probably complain about everything and weren't spanked enough as a child.Here's a fun tip - get the mac n cheese, go the salad bar, scoop up some bacon & jalepenos, and then mix it. Yes, I have no shame.The salad bar is amazing. I'll admit, I've came for lunch and just ate the salad bar. It's really fresh! I like to get bacon, eggs, jalepenos, cheese, and bread. Then I make little breakfast sandwich bites. Again, I really have no shame. I'll admit that the eggs are a little, too cold, but sometimes you can't let the little things stop you from accomplishing big things.There's usually a decent wait time - don't worry though, there's free soda, popcorn, chips & salsa while you wait for dinner. Only free soda for lunchtime though.

This place was everything!!! I was a little apprehensive at first but I definitely have to say it's worth writing home to Mom about!   I would recommend the server Valentina. She's definitely knowledgeable about the menu and very helpful.

Our first time here and we enjoyed it thoroughly! We reached TOT at about 3:00 on Saturday afternoon, and were surprised that the lot wasn't packed, since the Yelp reviews warned about long wait times. Well, turns out that they don't open until 3:30 pm on Saturday's. No worries, though- the hostess was more than happy to take down our names and guide us to the waiting area in the back, which was filling up quickly. The waiting area itself had a bar, and complimentary snacks such as popcorn and soft drinks, which we decided to not partake in, knowing we were about to fill up on steak. As for the food... I had the 6 oz center cut fillet with garlic butter, since I'm into more tender and soft steaks. My friend had the cowboy steak, 24 oz with lemon pepper. Both steaks tasted great, but the cowboy was a bit more rubbery in some parts; however, it was still delicious. The salad bar was loaded with fresh veggies, dressings, and bread. The sides of mashed potatoes and steak fries were perfectly yummy compliments to our steak. The service was also impeccable, from the moment we entered with the hostess, to the guy who led us to our seats, to our wonderful server. He took the time to explain the menu to us since it was our first time, and was always available without hovering. Our cloth napkins were folded, silverware set properly, and old plates removed during our trips to the salad bar. Our beverage glasses were never left empty. We were shown the dessert platter, but were too stuffed- next time, however (yes, there will be a next time), I don't plan on leaving without dessert!

I came around 6:30PM with a party of 8 and luckily beat the dinner rush. Even though it was Tuesday, the place was pretty packed by 8PM. Of course, I had some popcorn and chips and salsa but I made sure not to fill up because I know what I had ahead of me.Service was great as usual. A person in our party new the GM, who stopped by to say hi, and he found that we were celebrating a birthday. We repeatedly told him we did not want anything free and just wanted to say hi. I split the cowboy with my fiancé and it was more than enough food for us. We had a hearty salad and a baked potato. The meat was cooked perfect and the marbling with garlic butter made the steak super juicy. I am a fan of their bone-in cuts because I feel they are more tender than the bone-out cuts.By the end of the meal, the party was stuffed. Then a couple of waiters stopped by and brought out 5 different desserts. Now, I know they usually give out a dessert for a birthday.. but FIVE?! The GM wanted to show his appreciation and let us try their best desserts. My favorite is still the snickers cheesecake. That thing is addicting. Another great experience for me and I will be returning soon.

One of the best steakhouses I have ever been to!I know it sounds crazy, but their salad bar is worth going there for!  Everything is ultra fresh and many, many options.  If you are like me everything in the garden goes on with the lettuce...Don't forget quail bites!The service is excellent and the experience is wonderful!Pricey, but you ought to go at least once!

Probably one of the better steakhouses I've ever been to...period. Great service. The staff is very attentive. Great atmosphere. You have the option to choose your own cut of steak. 100% angus certified beef. My server was on the ball for sure. Always checked in on me to make sure I was doing good. I travel a ton on business always looking for the local hot spots... This is certainly one of them. Clean restrooms. Well managed. Staff can handle traffic really well. They all have the earpieces to communicate. These folks don't fool around. Will highly recommend to my friends and business associates. EC

My wife and I enjoyed our anniversary here.The food was wonderful and the service was even better than that.Thank you staff and management for a wonderful evening!And thank you Rebekah for being such a great server!!!

It's very huge simple texan steak house, very entertaining, if you have visitors out of the city. Steaks are just unbelievable I can't even put in words how tasteful it was. Salad bar was fresh and tasty dressings.

I lived in the Houston area for most of my life and Taste of Texas is a staple. If you're a Texan and want a hunk of meat, along with some pretty killer sides and awesome service, look no further.I've been here as a kid, as a teenager, and as a young adult. I remember coming here as a fourth grader on a field trip and getting to sample their chicken strips. We also got to tour the huge freezer and get locked in there. I mean, it was pretty cool, like, literally.I was taken here on my 21st birthday by my parents and also came here twice with my boyfriend to celebrate anniversaries. Service is amazing each and every time. Depending on the day and time you come, your wait can be 2-3 hours. But, what's awesome, is that they have a ginormous room for those waiting and offer FREE chips and salsa along with water, tea, or soft drinks. So, if you come and don't care about a wait, it's no big deal. You can relax, grab a drink from the bar, and just hang out. Bartenders are always awesome and I was actually introduced to one of my favorite drinks here because it was recommended to me: the Bahama Mama. Yep, that drink is on point.I can't tell you much about the menu because when I find something I like, I usually stick with it. I always get the center cut filet, normally 6 oz ($37) or if I'm super hungry, the 10 oz ($45). With this, you also get a trip to the salad bar which has tons of options. And you can pile that salad as high as you like! I love the variety they offer at the salad bar. You can also grab cornbread or bread with butter or their cinnamon buttery blend that is fantastic. I used to order my steak medium, but have switched to medium rare in the recent years. So much tastier. Every time I have ever been here, the steaks have always been cooked perfectly. One time, however, my steak was extremely overcooked. I ordered medium rare and definitely got medium well. It kind of stunk that everyone else ate while I had to wait another 15 minutes for a steak, but what are you going to do. I had the server apologize numerous times (and I know it wasn't his fault and didn't say it was at all) which was very nice. I also had the floor manager that night come to the table and he apologized as well and made sure the second steak was perfect. It definitely was and I thanked him. I'm really not the type of person to complain and it was certainly hard for me to send a steak back. But, for the price you pay, you should get exactly what you want. I was disappointed in the fact that we weren't comped in any way. I wasn't expecting a free steak, but a little money off would have been appreciated. Then again, I'm not sure how they'd do if everyone who sent a steak back got some type of compensation. I have tried numerous desserts: creme brulee, snickers pie, slice of heaven, the Texas pecan pie a la mode, and the apple dumplings. I know my boy liked the Creme Brulee and the Snickers Pie especially. The Slice of Heaven is a mix of layered white and dark chocolate mousse. It's very yummy, I just don't particularly like white chocolate, so I make sure someone else eats that part. The Pecan Pie and Apple Dumplings are definitely my favorite desserts though. Get those and you won't be disappointed!

Arrived around 6pm tonight, Thursday, and our table of four was sat within 30 mins. The decor is kind of all over the place with moose heads to baseball jerseys on the walls. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive throughout the whole service. I was the only one in our group who hadn't eaten there before so they all came to the back with me to pick out my center cut filet. Stopped by the salad bar on our way back to the table. Decent variety of items to choose from. I liked how there was an employee there to immediately tidy up any fallen pieces of lettuce or dripped dressing to keep the area clean. Our quail bites and jalapeño stuffed shrimp apps were on the table before we got back. I preferred the quail over the shrimp. Tried not to eat a whole roll even though the cinnamon butter was addicting. My steak was cooked to perfection. Really tender and no needed sauce to mask the flavor. The sides (garlic mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, mushrooms) were ok but nothing great. We ordered the dessert sampler where you can choose 3 out of 4 select options. I liked how each dessert wasn't overly sweet. Overall, Taste of Texas is a casual quirky steakhouse with good steak and good service.

What is the big deal about this place? My boyfriend and I have been trying out a lot of new restaurants that have been on our list for months. And to our disappointment, a lot of them have been so-so.We came on a Monday night and they looked packed. Luckily there was no wait (FYI they don't take reservations). Both of us felt just a tiny bit underdressed even though we've heard that this was a "steakhouse where you don't have to get all dressed up for." I got the 16 oz NY strip and he got a 20 oz ribeye - both cooked medium rare plus. We both got our garlic butter on the side along with garlic mashed potatoes and green beans. The steaks were cooked to perfection; the temperature was great. It wasn't too bloody or too tough. We were both very pleased. However, everything needed more salt. The steak was very bland. I practically salted every single bite. I even tried garlic butter and salt. The green beans were overcooked, a bit mushy, and unsalted. The mashed potatoes were decent, but unsalted. We both spent so much time with the cute little salt shaker on the table. By the way, where are they from? We want a set!The salad bar was good, but I thought it would have more variety. I really liked the warm rolls and cilantro vinaigrette. But come on, I'm here for the steak... not the other stuff.

Wow. This place is usually our go to. Unfortunately I brought a friend who had never been for dinner last Monday night May 1st. I was excited to show him one of our favorite spots in town. Most of the experience was positive until it came to our steak. Although we ordered it with garlic butter, it came out bare and not on a hot plate as requested. We had to be the ones to remind the waitress. She immediately recognized the fault and later a floor manager came over to apologize. However nothing was offered to make up for the mistake other than to go get a hot plate after we already started eating. We had to smother cold butter on the steak which made it that much more unenjoyable. I could call out the waitress and a manager by name but choose not to and hope the restaurant will take action accordingly to make sure this experience doesn't happen to others. When you're asking people to spend over $50 for a steak alone that should be better than this.  I know the ownership feels the same way which is why we have had such good experiences in the past.

Extraordinary service!  My husband and I used to eat here at least once a week.  We celebrated my birthday last month and it's good to know that all the floor managers still remembers you and stops by to say hi.  I love the ambiance and how laid back it is.  It's the one place I feel comfortable and at home. Menu items I recommend:  bone in filet, crab cakes, prime rib, and I always get their star cookies and cinnamon ice cream!
GREAT STEAKS.  Prime rib succulent, impressive salad bar, great meal.

Arrived during dinner time on a busy holiday weekend. Wait time was practically 2-3 minutes. We were whisked away to our table, and there on the table sat some crackers with jalapeno jelly and cream cheese. Odd pairing, but the flavors mesh really well. The ambiance is quite nice, dark/earthy colors, dimly lit. There was chatter but it wasn't overly loud. Dress is casual, so this is a perfect spot for a date or family outing. Our waiter was very attentive, so thumbs up for that.Now onto the food - I opted for the salad bar which had FRESH greens. That's always something I look for. There are 2 huge blocks of cheese to pick from and you can grate enough cheese to your heart's content. And the bread selection was really good. Jalapeno corn bread? Yes, please! It's really easy to stuff yourself with just the salad bar/bread alone.I opted for the Filet Mignon as my main dish. It came out HOT with garlic butter melting off the top. First bite melted in my mouth, as was the case until the very last bite. Very delicious. As someone visiting out of town, I wasn't sure what to expect, but I'd highly recommend this place if you're in the area and craving steak!

They have great prime rib, great strip, and amazing ribeye! I'm a steak guy and love it here. When it's busy I try and sneak in at the bar. Management and service is always good. It is a little pricey but if you want good service, good drinks, and even better beef you have to pay up for the best!

As we were waiting for our table, we saw an extremely tall man walking towards the exit and it was Yao Ming!  We knew we were in for a treat if Yao Ming was dining here too.Everything was great from the start.  Our waiter was extremely knowledgable and led us to the back to pick out our steaks.  We did not know much about how to pick steaks but he coached us through it and made sure we chose for our liking (more fat, more taste, etc.)Ordering a steak includes the salad bar which was very fresh and good.  Try not to eat too much salad though and save room for the steak.  We ordered a cowboy steak and center cut filet mignon both medium rare and prepared with lemon pepper and garlic herb butter seasoning as recommended.  Both steaks were extremely flavorful, tender and cooked just to our liking (med rare).  The prices were extrememly reasonable for a high quality steakhouse.For dessert we had a snickers cheesecake and an alcoholic milkshake which were both on point, but we were struggling to find space for the dessert.I would definitely come back to Taste of Texas.

Best steak in houston. A must go to. Anything you order here is delicious! You can pick your steak from the butcher before it's cooked and the stuffed shrimp is great for an appetizer or a meals you can't go wrong with anything- if there is a wait when you go. Stay. Have a drink in the bar, read the history around the restaurant and enjoy complimentary snacks and sodas

Highly reccomend this top notch restaurant!!! When we arrived we wondered why there was a bar with beverages and stuff outside by a beautiful waterfalls and plenty of seatng but not tables. When we left we got it! It was there to make people comfortable while waiting to get a table. Inside the restaurant is beautifully finished. When you wait they offer FREE soda beverages, chips and salsa and popcorn. We where immediately impressed with the professional, friendly, knowledgeabl staff! Now, lets talk about the real star!! The menue! Many choices including not your hum drum salad bar! You cant go wrong with ANYTHING on the menue. I can say my husband and I travel and eat out extensively. The steaks were THE BEST WE HAVE EVER HAD!! SO GO ENJOY AND REMBER TO SAFE ROOM FOR THEIR AMAZUNG DESERTS!!! EPIC FOOD EXPERIENCE! :)

EVERYTHING IS BIGGER AND BETTER IN TEXAS! Taste of Texas is absolutely the best piece of cow you will ever get! Everything from the salad bar to the quail bites to the steak is top notch quality. Restaurant is beautiful and pretty with two full bars. Service is excellent from hostess to wait staff. Manager walked around and asked every table how the food was. Taste of Texas is pretty pricey but well worth it. It was my birthday and I got free dessert which looked amazing too. They took a picture of me and my girlfriend and printed it off for us too. Overall you can't go wrong with this place.
wowzers!!! that was some good eating!!! and our waiter was THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!!

I don't get the hype. Yes it's a steakhouse. Yes it has a dated Texas-y decor. Omg, a salad bar? How exciting!  Service was mediocre at best. The political signs in the grass out front were a bit of a turn off. I've got some money left on the gift card, but probably won't be back to spend it.

My first review here but my second time at this place. I always have my steak WELL-DONE and no others steak house had cooked it right the first time except for Taste of Texas. The waiter/waitress would makes recommendation for the meat that's most suitable to your taste/cook 'rare, medium, well-done, etc.' This time I ordered the Tomahawk which is 38 ounces with a really big bone. As always well-done and you'll get to go pick your own meat. I love the salad bar and their rolls...different varieties...but don't eat too much save your stomach for your delicious mouth watering steak. With a well-done steak this is the only place that cook them moist, topped with their house flavor 'recommended', and very juicy/tender. The price is pricey but for a good steak I would not mind pay that extra $$$ for it. Check them out!!! My tomahawk steak is a little burned outside since it's well-done but very tender and moist... I'm definitely coming back in the near future

I went with my wife twice in the last month. This latest time we were told there would be a 1.5-2 hour wait and this was at 5:30 PM. We went to the inside bar and stood, ordering drinks. The bartender asked if we would like to eat at the bar, which we had done many times previously. When we said yes, he reserved the next 2 open spots at the bar. We were ordering within minutes instead of the long wait. The crab cake was incredible with so much crab, I am surprised it held together. The porterhouse never fails to awe me with its taste, My wife had an 18 OZ rib-eye that was fork tender. Both steaks were cooked exactly as we like them.My wife asks to come here just for the salad bar with the blocks of cheese, and super rolls.I know this place is expensive and crowded, but it is worth saving up to go. I will keep returning until they close it, which I doubt will be for decades

Been here once with my boyfriend,last year on our 1year anniversary, AMAZING! Cant wait to go back and eat their yummy steak and salmon (which we had) and also fell in love with their salad bar lol.Awesome service!

Dined here last night with my father for his birthday, the wait staff was awesome.. The drinks are way too expensive, the parking was horrible.. The food was mediocre at best.. I ordered the pecan crusted chicken, it was tasty yet dry.. I enjoyed the baked Bree as an appetizer.. My dad loved the grilled salmon, and the steak that my aunt had was flavorful but dry..

Man one of my favorite restaurants been coming here for years same great service great food and the salad bar thats the best part with the rolls and the blue cheese dressing man best place to go great atmosphere

My wife and I have eaten here a couple of times for special occasions. In both cases the food was really good. The steak was cooked just as we ordered and the potatoes were tasty. We both loved the salad bar and I have to say that I'd come back more for the salad bar than the steak. Service was ok although not very attentive. The BIG negative that gives the place a 3 star review is that they don't take reservations and the wait can be brutal. They have a large waiting room and put out free drinks, chips, popcorn etc. but we waited well over an hour each time we went. Some families brought cards or board games to make the wait more tolerable.May go back at some point because the food is good but the wait for a table makes me hesitate.

I had ABSOLUTELY NO IDEA what I was getting into when I came here.  I thought it was a simple steak/bbq joint.  But boy was I wrong.  Taste of Texas takes tremendous pride in their meats, and in their salad bar, and in their desserts, and in everything else they do.  They made a near flawless attempt and satiating this lover of fine steak, salad, and dessert.But alas, they tripped right after the start.  The complimentary bread and butter was a pretty good start, but the french dip sliders were not.  The bread was weird.  And it took away from the French dippiness of the sliders.  Anyway, I got the quail bites to help rectify that mishap, and was not disappointed.  The quail bites are the shiznit.  They're delicious.  I'll be making them at home now.  They're wrapped in bacon and stuffed with jalapenos.  And they come with (yes, this APPETIZER comes with sides) jalapeno poppers.  And the Dr. Pepper bbq dipping sauce... just wow.  Amazing stuff.So, after the appetizer rebound, I ordered a 10 oz prime rib.  It was definitely rare, which I'm ok with (would prefer med-rare).  And it came with green beans and the salad bar.  OH MY THE SALAD BAR.  Really the salad bar is nothing crazy.  Typical salad bar.   OH WAIT GIANT HUNKS OF CHEESE!!!  On the salad bar are two blocks of cheese, each literally the size of a small child.  And freshly baked bread - cornbread and dinner rolls - with different types of butter.  Yes, this is all the "salad" bar.I ALMOST FORGOT ABOUT DESSERT! So, after your meal, your server doesn't ask if you would like dessert.  They just bring a giant sampler tray for you to gawk at until you finally give in and order something.  They explain each item, saving the best items for last.  And you inevitably forget how stuffed your are.  And thus, I ordered the largest piece of pecan pie I've ever seen.  It was at least 4 times as deep as a normal pie.  But it was just as delicious.I will come back next time I'm in town.
Went Here For My Bday. Was very pricey but it was delish and loved the service before we got to our tables ; refreshments,  popcorn ect. I would go back for more big occasion nights.

Normally, when my family and I celebrate birthdays, we head to Pappadeaux (the one next to Taste of Texas) since it's the best one in the whole state. However, we decided to go a different route this time to change it up. After checking reviews, we decided on Taste of Texas. They don't accept reservations so we arrived early enough for a shorter wait. Welp! So much for that since the wait was an hour pretty soon after they opened for dinner and it was totally worth it! They have free sodas and water while you wait which was nice since it was so hot outside. The manager came out and chatted for a while to keep us comfortable and walked around to others waiting as well. How awesome is that?! Once inside the restaurant, our waiter (will add his name as soon as I remember) was simply wonderful! Very pleasant and patient for a table of 13. He was funny, organized and just great! The food is awesome! They give you so much that the entire table had a box to take home. The manager came around again to make sure we enjoyed our food and gave us the history of the restaurant and other tid bits.  My mom said that this was the best birthday that she's had in a while. She loved having her complete family there but the restaurant made her day for some reason. Lol! We will be returning quite often now. I highly recommend this place!
Great steak, I got the cowboy and my wife the filet oscar. 3 hour wait sucked, but it is NYE.

Awesome place!!! I ordered the Tomahawk and they allowed me to go back to the kitchen and select the steak I wanted, which made the experience more enjoyable! The food was delicious , the service was great and don't forget to order dessert ...

My husband and I went to Taste of Texas last night to celebrate our one year anniversary. My family has gone here a number of times to celebrate events over the years so it seemed like a great choice as he had never been. Dessert was delicious- Jackie (I believe) did a great job of showing us the options. The Snickers pie was a wonderful way to end our meal. The entrees were perfect. My center cut filet Oscar style was perfectly medium rare and melt in your mouth. I rarely want steak but this was perfection. The garlic mashed potatoes had the perfect amount of flavor and were perfectly creamy. My husband loved his rare prime rib and sweet potato. He didn't say much about it but kept smiling as he was chewing- which I definitely don't see while he eats my cooking. The appetizer- the jumbo lump crab cake- was amazing. Our server, Mark M. (who was also exceptional), recommended this and boy was he right. It was hot, melt in your mouth crab perfection. No fillers, only crab meat held together with cheese. I've been here before and my mother loves to brag about the amazing service and attention to detail here. Now why three stars? The first hostess we saw upon arrival helped us quickly. Our number came up within minutes.  We were lead to our table and upon seeing I would be behind a screaming child, I asked that we be moved to another table. We told her we had no problem waiting for another table to be available. She sighed and said they could move us. The third hostess (who I assume was handling seating) rolled her eyes when she heard we would like another seat and was quite rude about handling our ticket. I would have much rather been asked to wait than to watch the hostesses treat us like a chore. I'm so sorry to have inconvenienced them because I would like a nice dining experience.I read other reviews and saw managers apparently come by and check on the tables. If the gentleman in the suit walking around our table was the manager, he never spoke to us and looked at us like we were eating with our hands. (Relax we weren't- oddly we were some of the few people who were dressed up beyond t-shirts and jeans.) The waitstaff is great- they are caring and knowledgeable. They will guide you through the menu and give great recommendations. The food is amazing. The hostesses and manager (in our section) could use a refresher. I had emailed Taste of Texas earlier today with no response. Not sure we will be returning.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in town and I've been coming here for 20 years. I always bring visitors - and last night was the worst ToT experience I've had there. The waiter (not waitress) Kelly was the worst I've met. He:a) Didn't bother to ask whether it was our first time - so after we ordered, I reminded him. Didn't do anything.b) Made us wait for him at the salad bar before choosing our steaks because he had to go do something.c) Didn't come and ask whether we wanted pepper on our salads. d) Had our steaks brought out - by another waiter no less, who, by the way, literally didn't say a single word. Very awkward - WHILE we were still working on our salads. I'd understand if this is because we had been chomping on salads for half an hour but it was within 15 mins of us sitting down with our salads. e) 20 mins later, and that's being generous, he asked my friend who was pausing whether she was done with her steak. She had eaten half of it. AND, her bf had ordered a porterhouse and had a LONG way to go and I was also working on my fillet. She of course said No. f) As soon as I put down my fork after my last bite, he cleared my plate, but it had an asparagus on it. As he left the table, my friend commented how she had wanted it but he swooped in like a hawk. Overall, I felt rushed on multiple occasions. Then he had the gall to ask whether everything was perfect. We of course said yes - I was treating visitors from out of town, and they were being treated, so what would we say? I then reminded him about them being first time visitors and directly asked for pictures - he said he was sorry he forgot to tell me that that's only for international visitors. That's a load of bull because I brought two visitors from NY and CT within the last couple of months and they all took pictures with the cowboy hats. Kelly took pics but didn't even bother to bring the cowboy hats. I wasn't going to ask the third time so I stayed quiet. Then the bill came. I had gift cards from my cousin so I used that, and he asked me how much tip I was going to put on it. I was dumbfounded that he asked me that so loudly in front of my guests. I was not happy with him and would've done a flat 15% but because he asked in front of my guests, I said 20%. Don't get me wrong. The steak is great. I've had off nights before where the steak isn't the best but last night's was great. It's just that I'm never sitting at Kelly's table ever again. I think there actually is a Kelly that's a woman and if that's the name I'm thinking, she is awesome. But the guy Kelly, never again.

Have very happily and eagerly spent thousands of dollars over the past twenty years or so at ToT, both at company Christmas luncheons and personally for various family/friend celebrations and events, so it truly distressed me to discover that Edd and Nina have decided to post 30.07 signage that leaves me no alternative but to spend my and my company's money elsewhere. Apparently, in this instance, when it came time to walk the walk, the Hendee's weren't quite able to step up to the plate, which is such a shame.

It's easy to forget that you're at a restaurant here with the friendly staff and such a strong feeling of hospitality.  The salad bar is amazing and so are the steaks.  Not much to say negatively on the menu.  Love the cozy, non rushed feel here.  Plan to come early since they don't take reservations, but totally a classic Texan restaurant.

Expensive, average service. We have been here over 5 times and the last three years with guests and experienced things getting progressively worse in terms of food and service. Last night we had to send our overlooked steaks back and therefore our party ate their meal at three different times while the sides got cold. It was our last time at this Houston icon. Sad.....

This is the perfect place to bring Yankee friends and family who want to see what Texas food is all about but are too prissy to get their hands dirty with some local BBQ. The salad bar and bread is phenomenal. My mouthwateringly perfect salad contains fresh spring mix, a sprinkle of parm, slivers of red onion, toasted cinnamon almonds and real bacon bits all smothered in sweet and tangy cilantro vinaigrette. I never thought I'd be so over the moon about a salad, but this will be a salad I crave. The cheesy bread and the jalepeno cornbread are to die for. Make sure you grab extra to take home in your to-go box! And don't forget the cinnamon butter! Yes, cinnamon butter with jalepeno cornbread. DO IT. True to the phrase 'everything is bigger in Texas,' portions are very large here. For my entree I had the pecan crusted chicken breast. This was VERY tasty, and stuffed with what tasted like spinach dip. It was moist and tender but crunchy on the outside. The green beans it was served with were buttery and bacon-y. The wild rice was also good, but just couldn't compete with buttery beans and tender chicken on the plate with it. I got 2 large meals out of this entree.I tried my friend's steak medallions and those were even better than my chicken. Whatever sauce they serve on that plate is magical. My husband ordered the Au Jous sliders and those were also quite good and easily 2 meals.This place could easily be a 5-star joint, but the fact that there is no cheaper lunch menu is quite annoying to me. It definitely didn't seem like they skimped on service or food size or quality at lunch, but nonetheless, a menu of smaller less expensive lunch plates would be nice. If not a full lunch menu, how about weekdays with special promos?

flew through texas and got a recommendation to eat here. one of my best decision in life! the steak is to die for and the salad bar is amazing. the rolls are good too. love the fact you get to pick out the steak by weight. worth every penny. been recommending this place since my first visit.

Got here just before rush hour on a Friday night so we didn't have to wait for a table. The service was good. The place is not fancy. The price is fair. Appetizer - Husband and I both got the salad bar and split the quail with stuffed jalapeño as appetizer. The quail was good. I'm not impressed with the salad bar. Steak - we split the tomahawk. We tried to finish it. We couldn't. Nothing special about the steak, really. It was properly cooked, not tough, taste is just ok.Sides - potato gratin and crab cakes. I love their crab cakes! It's full of lump crab meat! One of the best I've had. Gratin is just ok.

Taste of Texas used to be my favorite place to take guests out for a nice steak dinner.  The steaks are very good.  The salad bar is good.  The service is usually outstanding.  But my last visit was below par and I'm going to air my grievances.Before I go into the unique experiences, let me point out for everyone that there are a couple standing issues with Taste of Texas.  They do not offer valet parking and they do not accept reservations.  That means wait times of two hours are common.  Now - to my recent experience at Taste of Texas ....I brought guests.  One of them made the very bad choice to order a well-done prime rib.  If you like well done meat, don't order prime rib.  I did not hear him order this, or I would have guided him to order something else.   Complaint #1:  I would expect a waiter to make an alternate recommendation to anyone who orders like this.  I know the waiter did not offer a suggestion or this man would have accepted the recommendation. Complaint #2:  When the waiter brought the steak out, he placed it and said in a very condescending and unapproving tone, "Here's your WELL DONE prime rib, sir".   I heard this and wanted to jump up and and yell at the waiter for his extremely rude tone.  This upset me so much I was angry for weeks to follow.   But I chose to not say anything to allow our dinner to remain as pleasant as possible.   I wish I had this guys name though.Complaint #3:  Everyone seemed to feel that their meal was not as good as it used to be.  We've all been to Taste of Texas before many times.  But the steaks just seemed a little more ordinary.  Maybe the quality is different, maybe the seasoning was a little different.  But it was just not quite what we remembered.  It was a shared feeling.Complaint #4:  The prices seems much higher than we recalled.  I know it is not cheat to eat there and that's okay.  It just seemed to be more expensive.  After the entire dinner is done and we've left, I just felt like this was the last time I would go to Taste of Texas.  There are more expensive places and there are less expensive places.  The goal is to find a match between service, quality, and price.  Taste of Texas is moving down on the scale for experience versus cost.

I've been going here 15 years. They are consistently on top of everything - their food and especially service is one of the best in Houston. This is the first restaurant I take out-of-town guests to so that should say something. All first timers are treated to an open tour along with a very brief history of the restaurant and a quick trip to the butcher shop to pick and claim your own piece of steak. Everyone has their own preference in terms of what cut they like but I will say the filet mignon is out of this world. If red meat is not your thing, they have a very good, high quality salad bar that can be paired with a delicious potato soup or chicken breast. Their dinner rolls are highly addicting and out of this world. For dessert, you absolutely MUST try their pecan pie. During weekends and busy hours, there may be a 10-25 minute wait but they have that covered as well. There is a fairly nice sized waiting area with its own bar, tables, complimentary chips, popcorn and drinks.

I came here on my birthday while I was traveling on vacation and this place was recommended by a friend. We knew this place was going to be busy because they do not take reservations. We arrived at 7pm on a weekday and immediately noticed how busy the parking lot was. After parking, we walked inside and was greeted by the hostess and they assigned us a number. We were 86 and they were currently calling numbers in the 50s. The waiting area is extremely nice and big. The wait wasn't too bad as we were called in about 30 minutes. The restaurant is nice and upscale and I was a bit under dressed compared to the majority of the people there. Now, for appetizers, we started with the Jumbo Crab Cakes and they were amazing. For my entree, I went with the Porterhouse Steak, which is 32oz! I shared this with 4 people and we were still full from it. The steak was cooked perfectly to our style and it was really good. The steak also comes with access to the salad bar for 2 people. My gf went there and brought back bread and salad. The salad bar is probably one of the nicer ones because they offer so much stuff. I also tried the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and this was okay for the most part. Definitely enjoyed this place and it definitely compares to some of the more expensive Steakhouse that I have eaten at in the past.

Oh my gosh, this place is SO tacky! They serve the steaks on silver cow shaped plates. I'm positive the same style of plates are used at this Vietnamese steak and eggs place in china town. My steak was smothered in butter. Okay, by now, everyone must know that a top quality steak shouldn't be covered in butter, right?Not impressed! And all of the desserts were boring! The wait was excruciatingly long which defeats the entire purpose of a reservation.

I was visiting from ga and my aunt and uncle took me with my 6 year old! Delish! Perfectly cooked strip with lemon pepper seasoning. For appetizer we got the baked brie. Can you say yum? We got to go to salad bar and they have a great selection with a giant cheese block and a fresh bread. The waiter was so knowledgeable on wine pairings and really catered to my 6 year old. The whole experience was great and I have zero complaints. We went early because apparently if you go Sunday at 6 u will wait over an hour. For dessert we split the key lime pie. Great crust and very fresh. The filling was very good and you can tell it was not a frozen pre maid pie. Very pricey but worth it if you want a good steak.

This place is more than famous in Houston. When you look for high end Steak in Houston, this is a must go place. Food, server, environment is all 5 star, just be patient to wait one hour or more since they do not accept reservations.

Oh wow. This place is the real deal. They are not afraid to cook a steak medium rare and let me tell you.... It was perfect. The cowboy rib eye is to die for and the rib eye by the ounce is amazing. Make sure that you get the cilantro vineagerette on your salad. Awesome.

I absolutely love ToT! Besides the wait (expect up to 2 hours) depending on what time you come especially on the weekends. You have to time it right and just make dinner plans before 530pm on the weekends to avoid the long wait. They don't take reservations but they do offer peanuts, popcorn and free soft drinks in the waiting area. The staff is very professional, serving and nice. I've never encountered a grouchy waiter or staff at ToT. My boyfriend and I usually get the burger and salad bar as a meal and we always leave very satisfied and full. I've had the pecan crusted chicken, baked sweet potato, rib eye steak , baked potato soup, artichoke dip, baked Brie and all have not disappointed my taste buds. We love the breads especially the cheese bread. But we try not to stuff ourselves with that. The desserts we always stick to is the snickers pie. We absolutely love that its rich in chocolate and sweet. I've tried the Creme brûlée before as well and it was delicious.

Recently, to celebrate Father's Day and my birthday, I had the pleasure of attending two special events at Taste of Texas. Their Steak and Texas Beer night was outstanding. The food was amazing and the variety of St. Arnold's beer was great. It was a very fun, enjoyable, entertaining, and informative evening hosted by the restaurant owners and the St. Arnold's representative. Next, I went to Steak School. Again, a very enjoyable and informative morning hosted by the owners, executive chef, and representatives from their beef suppliers. After a morning of information to explain everything from "hoof to table", we enjoyed a very tasty steak lunch. These events - besides promoting their fabulous food and restaurant - also help benefit their scholarship fund for their workers. The owners are very community minded, family oriented, and their Christian values are evident. Great restaurant, great food, great atmosphere, great special events!

We live in CA and we have family and a second home in TX.  This is their favorite steak house.  I will say that the meat is great, it is cooked perfectly and the prices are reasonable.  I also get a kick out of the fact that I can select my own cut in the back.The salad bar is terrific, but as someone else mentioned, the sides are just OK.  My kids love the fact that they can get free soda while you wait.

First of all they get really busy towards the evening! But their steak is amazing!!!! I am always bringing friends to come dine with me. Servers are always so nice. And their salad bar and bread is always good.But their steak I usually order the cowboy steak.It's always cooked perfectly.
THE BEST ANGUS MEAT IN THE HOLE TEXAS... 100% certified... It's really expensive but it's all worth it. You also have a great selection of wines, and a big salad bar.

Every time I walk into this restaurant, I hear the theme of Bonanza playing in my head. Why? Well, between the rustic Texas charm of this place and the lodge décor, it makes me feel like I'm stepping back in time a bit to the old West where men wore cowboy hats and rode around on horses slinging their guns. The décor may feel rustic, but the service and food are far from feeling this way.The only complaint I have about this amazing neighborhood steak restaurant is that they don't take reservations. If you can get past the 2 hour wait, you will enjoy your meal and the service that comes along with it. The lines are long and the parking is tough if you opt to dine here during the busy dinner times on the weekends. Early dinner and lunch time are much easier if you want to be seated immediately and find decent parking.If you decide to dine here during the peak times, you at least have an option of having free popcorn, soda, water, chips & salsa, which are all provided in the waiting area. The downside of this is that you may fill yourself with snacks and then have no room for your steak dinner. The other option is to use my tactic of putting your name on the waitlist and then running home to shower and get ready or run errands; by the time you return, you should be close to being seated.Once seated, you are treated to a big open space full of wood tables, wood chairs, dark carpets, and more than enough wood walls and ceilings adorned with all things lodge looking. The best time to visit here is during the Christmas season when they deck the halls, the walls, and anything else that they can throw decorations on.Once seated, you will be greeted by one of dozens of friendly faces that are more than willing to help or assist in anything and everything in the restaurant. The server will start you off with bringing a complimentary appetizer of cream cheese smothered in salsa and accompanied by toasted bread. Next up, they will thoroughly cover the drink and dining menus to help navigate the potential maze of decisions. The question is not which steak is the best, but which cut you like...you can't go wrong with any cut you get here.I order a different cut each time: filet, prime rib, rib eye, bone-in rib eye, T-bone, and they are all very good. The restaurant even gives you an option to select your own steak in their designated meat display in the kitchen. Once you've selected your steak, the salad bar awaits your presence. Chilled plates, a beautiful selection of salad veggies, cheeses, and dressings are all lined up for you to indulge. If that isn't enough, they have bread warming lockers to keep the bread warm, in addition to a choice of regular or cinnamon butter. Everything is self-service, so feel free to eat as much or as little as you would like.My advice is to try either their cilantro vinaigrette or their creamy cactus salad dressings because these are house specialties. All the dressings are made in-house, so don't feel bad if you want to go with the standard ranch or Italian. If you haven't stuffed yourself on the all-you-can-eat salad bar and bread, your steak will be arriving to ensure that your stomach is more than full.If all this food hasn't filled your stomach, then you'll have more than enough room to devour one of their Texas sized desserts that will be sure to send you into a diabetic coma. What? You mean you don't have a stomach the size of an NFL linebacker? Don't worry, because you can take all your leftovers home that they are always happy to pack up for you, including that dessert that you didn't even have room to finish.Happy trails to you!

Amazing! Our first time here and it was wonderful ! The food is awesome! Brussel sprouts have made a come back! Complimentary cinnamon coffee with my cream brûlée delish this place puts  the sparkle in the holidays with the whole restaurant decked out for the holidays.  I believe this will be a new Christmas tradition.
The best steak house in Houston! They live up to the name!  Cooked to perfection. I've never had to send a steak back. The waiters are friendly. The salad bar is awesome!

Great steaks! Love the salad bar! Seating was a breeze  and service was excellent. Steaks are huge and tru to size. You have the option to choose your own steak from the butcher after you've ordered it and they are cooked exactly how you want. The setting is nice and low lit. Great for couples or adults only, i really wouldn't bring young children here.

Being my first time here I was impressed with the service and quality of food. I do wish we could  have made a reservation but they don't accept then so plan on waiting about 45 minutes depending on the crowd.
Who am I kidding?   This place is great!   I previously left a bad comment, but that's only because their seating policy used to be an issue, but things seem to have gotten better!
The finest steakhouse in Houston. Can't wait to visit again when I'm back from North Carolina   Wait staff are so attentive and prime rib is out of this world.

One of our favorite steakhouses. I recommend the tomahawk ribeye. Excellent cut of meat and it always draws the attention of those sitting around you. We also like how they take care of the patrons waiting for a seat. Nothing better than some complementary popcorn and a soda while you wait.
Great ambiance and tasty steak. I would suggest going as a family dinner or business lunch.

Came here for a birthday dinner with my boyfriends. Hands down the best steak I've had in ages. We were seated really quickly even though we didn't make any reservations, so that was a nice surprise. Our server was very knowledgeable and quite amusing. He knew a lot about the wines, the meat, and menu knowledge. He even let us head to the back to choose our own steaks, which was a really neat experience. My boyfriend has the cowboy steak, and I had an 8 oz. filter mignon. Both were delicious. The filter was very soft and tender, and the cowboy was big and juicy. Very heartful meal. As side items I got the mushrooms, which were very tasteful! Taste of Texas has a full buffet style salad bar that is very fresh. I am not a fan of salads... So my server was kind enough to realize that we weren't taking trips to the salad bar and offered us an extra side option. Very nice of him to do, so we had a little too much food on the table (it was awesome). After finishing our meals we got a complimentary dessert for my birthday. I decided to choose the cheesecake. It was so fluffly and delectable. I love taste of Texas & whenever we have a craving for steaks, I'll definitely come back to have a taste of probably the best steaks in Texas. My experience here with the food, the service, and the atmosphere was phenomal. Also a thanks for the friendly staff members and managers whom constantly are checking on the guests. Being in the restaurant industry and understanding it, means a lot to me and my boyfriend when it comes to service.
The best steak in my opinion.  Service is excellent, nice atmosphere.  Love the chilled salad plate.  Everything is good.  While you are waiting for your seat you can nachos or popcorn.

My wife and I enjoyed our one year anniversary here on Friday night. We arrived around 6:45 and had to wait 1 hr and 35 minutes for a table. Once again, this place reminded me of why we waited that long. The salad bar was amazing as always. The macaroni was also surprisingly delicious. The Tomahawk Ribeye was a little too thick for our preference and was slightly undercooked. Understandable given how thick a cut it is. Still very tasty.Our server was Jonathon, He took GREAT care of us and went above and beyond to make sure we were happy.

Mmm. The steaks here are just wonderful, flavorful tenderness. It's worth the super-expensive price of coming here. Most, if not all, entrees come with a trip to the salad buffet which has so many toppings to try out! You can also get your bread there too. I love the jalapeno cheddar cornbread.The whole restaurant, inside and out, is just beautiful. Pretty enough for groups to take pictures and such. Lol. You can tell the servers here are very knowledgeable about their menu. Ask them anything, they're really helpful and nice! At least, the ones I've seen are.  Make sure you save room for one of their decadent desserts too. I recommend the creme brulee or the snickers pie. Or if you're feeling more on the healthy side, go for the fresh berries in season. Yumm-o!Not much to say about this place except try it out at least once in your life. It's a great place for dates, special occasions, etc. but I wouldn't be able to afford to eat here often.
My dad and I come here a lot for lunch! We're both foodies by nature. We absolutely love the salad bar. Always a great atmosphere and great service

All of these other reviews are telling you what Taste of Texas IS. I will now commence in telling you what Taste of Texas IS NOT.It IS NOT for the faint of heart.It IS NOT for vegetarians.It IS NOT going to be a cheap meal.It IS NOT a restaurant with poor wait service.It IS NOT a place you go to tune out your date.It IS NOT going to leave you hungry.It IS NOT going to disappoint you.Why are you still reading this? If you have $110 to blow on a date then drive to Taste of Texas immediately.

WORST STEAK EVER. I selected the 16 oz sirloin, medium. The steak initially came out rare, when they returned the steak the second time it was well done. They then returned the steak a third time and it was still displeasing. The steak not only was not cooked properly, it was also the toughest steak I have ever eaten. My mother had to send her steak back as well. The server was very pleasant, but the manager only came to speak to us once and did not bother to follow up with us. I am extremely disappointed. I would definitely NOT recommend this place. Flemings is also in City Centre and awesome!

This place is an amazing find. The line is unbearable, but is well worth the wait.The great thing about this place, is while you wait there are free drinks (non-alcoholic) and servers come around with free appetizer bites every 20 or 30 minutes.Well worth the wait though, as you walk inside it reminded me of an old school elk lodge or something, with low lightning and lots of wood accents. Service is excellent here, and I like that a manager tries to stop by every table before they leave. But really, lets talk about the food.The prime rib is delicious to the max, Perfectly cooked, and humongous, with a great side of garlic (super garlic) mashed potatoes, au jou and horseradish sauce. It was melt in your mouth, beefy and delicious. That, and a well made self serve salad bar with many options, fresh ingredients, and build your own bread baskets with amazing cornbread seals the deal. The cheesecake is a solid ending to the meal, and yes, I'm coming back first chance I get.

I was here last night for a business dinner. The food and service are top notch!  Our Server, Mandy, was amazing -great at explaining the menu and the cool way to order steaks. We all overate between the delicious salad bar and moth watering bread. I highly recommend adding bacon to the small filet. Enjoy!
