I AM HEAD OVER HEELS FOR THIS PLACE!I've been to numerous high end restaurants, but this place just blows it out of place! Honestly, I've been back here over 10 times in the past year ... First of all, the salad bar is amazing! Their raspberry vinegrette sauce is like no other and has a unique kick to it. The CHEESE BREAD is on point. It's moist, soft, and crunchy. The cinnamon dipping sauce also compliments the bread perfectly well! && Their crackers and cream cheese -- (I believe it's raspberry chiili suace) are super satisfying!Every time that I've gone, I ALWAYS get the filet mignon. I just can't get over how flavorful, juicy, and fresh the flavors are! I usually get the 8 oz. to save room for dessert. Dessert: I LOVE the SNICKERS cake! If you're a chocolate lover like me, then you're not going to be disappointed. If I don't want something too sweet, I prefer the creme brulee or the boot drink (which has some alcohol) and you get the glass boot to take home! *** SERVICE is 200% better than what you will EVER receive in ANY high end restaurant. It's not those hit or miss places. Every time I come, the service just seems to get better! On special holidays and occasions, this place really takes it to the next level.YOU WON'T REGRET IT. The atmosphere can be casual or romantic!
Can't say enough about this great place. Family owned, wonderful environment, great wine list, celebration location. This is worth the wait.

Took Chinese colleagues here who were visiting from beijing. It was a perfect choice for this occasion ... They loved picking out their own cut of meat, making a salad at the enormous salad bar, and getting their pic taken in cowboy hats and bandanas. For this event, it was a great place, but For all non-Chinese tourist entertainment event, when you just want a great steak, go to the other standard spots (Brenners, Eddie v, Capitol grille, or Ruth's Chris).

My husband and I have been here many times for several different occasions and we have never received anything but excellence in all areas. The whole place is clean with nice waiting areas and snacks/drinks for while you wait. Our service is always spot on with everyone being friendly, attentive and knowledgable of the menu. My husband and I always get a steak and and a side which comes with the salad bar. The salad bar has great salad and hot rolls and the steaks are full of flavor. I would rather come here than some place like Perry's. Taste of Texas is a nice place without being over the top. Sure the food is pricy but you don't have to dress up in a suit and tie to enjoy it. We bring all our out of town guests here when we get the chance and everyone always leaves happy.

I was in town for the weekend and stayed across the street from this place. Saw the reviews on yelp and got excited when I heard we were having dinner here my first night in town! The salad bar is amazing, I loved the cilantro vinaigrette. I chose a marinated steak plate but my friend got the tomahawk and man that is no joke! It was amazing! And huge! We were so pleased with the appetizers and main meals that our jaws dropped when they brought over the dessert plate...yeah not menu, plate! I noticed a yummy one on the corner and the server began to explain it starting with snickers, uh-yeah I'm gonna let you stop right there, bring me that! But if you want a mouth watering dessert to finish up your meal with, ask for the chocolate cake. You won't regret it!I'm so happy I got to check this place out while I was in town, it was amazing!
One of my favorite restaurants in Houston. Everything about this place is great. The bar, service, and the food are outstanding. Best steaks in Houston.

My husband and I waited hours to be seated expecting the wait would be well worth it. We were highly disappointed to say the least. My steak was burnt and flavorless, my husbands food was as bad if not worst! The best thing we had were the dinner rolls. Such a waste of money and time; Never Again!! I suggest you get a great steak from a local butcher and cook it at home, I know my husband has made far better steaks at home.

A Filet mignon that is wrapped in bacon, rubbed in lemon pepper, and topped with garlic butter is the best steak served in Houston. Weekend waits can be about 1-2 hours so go early or drink at the bar. It's worth the wait and pricesI've been coming here for years and will always be coming back.

I don't understand why this restaurant only 4 stars. It is truly spectacular. When arriving it was formal looking. I was a little worried about how we were dressed but the staff were welcoming. We got a table right away. Server was outstanding. Our water glasses were never empty and he always came over without interruption. I believe the meals were very well priced for the service and quality of food being provided. My husband and I shared the tomahawk steak. It was truly amazing. It was extremely tender, perfectly cooked and seasoned very well. Sides were a perfect addition to the steak. Dessert display plate was unbelievable and server was so perfect at explaining everything with great detail. My husband and I shared the sampler dessert plate and everything was incredible. All tasty and sweet and delicious. For 3 people the bill came to $136. That included steaks, sides and desserts. I believe it was more than reasonable.

Our first choice to take our family out to eat a nice meal is Taste of Texas.  Delicious steaks, salad bar is incredible, and the ambiance is very warm.Our 8 and 10 yr old kids love it!  They have their own rhythm  when they go to the salad bar....my son loads up on the healthy greens, cheese, and other toppings....yum!My youngest daughter likes to eat the cinnamon butter straight from the little cup!  Ha!Thank you Taste of Texas for the many many great memories and delicious meals!

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants.  I always pick this one for anniversaries and birthdays.  Yummy! Love their steaks and salad bar.  Their cheese rolls are to die for.  Their waitstaff and other employees are absolutely the best.  They must do a fabulous job of training and it works!
The tomahawk ribeye looks like it ate several other, smaller, steaks on its way out to your table. Great steak- great restaurant.

This place was soooo good! Super pricey though. Like seriously freaking pricey, but everything was delicious. My mom brought me, cuz she's been here before & really liked it. First they brought these little toasts to put this super tasty spread on. It was cream cheeseish with a pepper jelly. I ordered the tenderloin medallions, because they were like half the price of one of the regular steaks, but still came with a trip to the salad bar, which my mom had raved about. I ordered a port, someone's reserve....The waitress was pretty bad, she explained the menu to us after we ordered, even though she had already been to the table a few times. So I don't really do vegetables......cuz there's things like meat & cake in the world, but this salad was like the best I've ever had! There was real bacon! & the ceasar dressing tasted homemade, & there were huge blocks of cheese to take shavings off of. Also there were some wonderful rolls & a jalapeño cornbread. After we were almost done with our salads our waitress offered us pepper for our salads lol, poor thing she was late on everything. She also forgot our wines when she brought our food. The steak was cooked perfectly rare, it was so delicious & it had an amazing sauce that I wanted a whole bowl of. It came with asparagus which was pretty good. I traded my tomato for a baked potato, which was huge. Other than the potato, the portions were not Texas sized, especially for the price. The chocolate cake made up for it though, cuz it was huge. I won't be back often cuz it's so overpriced, & I honestly don't know why more ppl aren't bothered by the price, but it was really good.

Forget the steaks, the salad bar alone is something to rave about! Let me just say, I was extremely hesitant upon our drive when I heard there was a salad bar only to be surprised with delight. I wasn't feeling steak the day we visited but I'll definitely be trying it out in the future. The desserts are presented to you in a huge platter, it's really hard to not take the whole thing. We got the creme brûlée, I can't wait to try more on our next stop into Taste of Texas!!
I took the hostess (who was so sweet) recommendation for a stuffed steak.  It was delicious.  The salad bar was clean, fresh and stocked.  Do not leave without eating steak!!

Taste of Texas is a gem steakhouse in Houston. No, you will not find this steakhouse in any other city in the United States. So if you're in Houston and you want to try non-chain restaurant steak, this is the place to go.The downside as I'm sure has been mentioned on here plenty of times, they don't take reservation. You better come early and you better have the whole party present or they will not sit you. Wait time could be hours. Yes, HOURS! But they do have a waiting area where you can get some chips, salsa, and free drinks (soda and water).Salad bar is great! Their breads are awesome and I especially LOVE their cinnamon butter!! I'm not a big fan of cinnamon, but their cinnamon butter is just to die for! Yum!Steak is not the best I've had. I personally prefer the steak from Ruth's Chris, but for the price and different selections of sauce, and bacon-wrapped filet mignon, I can't complaint. I won't complaint. I'm not saying their steaks aren't good. I'm just saying, they're not the best I've had, ok? I love their steak. The people that I've brought here have normally complimented the taste.Service is awesome! Excellent! Amazing! Can't get any better. Even during the one time I was seated at this waiter's section and he was super busy taking order at a different table with 12 people, I had other waiters coming to help me, taking my drink orders, taking my food orders, and making sure that i had everything I needed.  And when my waiter finally came around, he profusely apologized for not taking good care of me. His service from that point on? Amazing!if they would start taking reservations to cut down the wait time or if they finally decide to expand or open a second location with the same kind of quality and service. Maybe. Just maybe, they'll get a five stars rating from me.
Had the skewers with vegetables and dirty rice, so delicious recommend this dish if you want more food for your money! Also had the golden margarita on the rocks  excellent customer service.
Had a great time celebrating my boyfriend's birthday this week. We went on a Monday night and there was no wait. Food was wonderful and the staff was very attentive.
Excellent service.  On par for fine dining.  Prime rib and brussel sprouts were delicious.  The wait was long, but they try to be as accommodating as possible for the wait.
Order Ribeye steak by the ounce and waiter will lead you to the butcher shop in the back and you can pick the meat and cut your own thickness ! And, Order this comes with their great salad bar !

LOVE Taste of Texas!! This steak house is what a "Texas" steakhouse is supposed to be.. I was there recently celebrating an anniversary. To start off the wonderful evening; I asked the waiter to recommend some wine, since I generally don't drink. Upon hearing the occasion we were there, he offered up "something special" for dessert if we had room.The steaks we ordered were perfect. MUST order the butter sauce & Garlic sauce again!! We decided to plurge; so we went up to the inhouse butcher shop and picked out our steaks.. That was pretty cool.Salad bar was very large. Huge slabs of different cheeses waiting to be sliced into was a neat idea.The atmosphere in this place was TOTALLY TEXAS! Taxidermied(sp) deer heads fill the wall along with other trophies. I thought the owners were big hunters, but the waiter tells me that "friends" of the restaurant donate their trophies for bragging rights.Cannot go wrong with this place. I couldnt say how much the final bill was, but i DIDNT have sticker shock; whatever it was..

If I could give this place 6 starts I would. Today was a very very special day and to celebrate my better half and I decided to go to Taste of Texas.Half of our order wasn't cooked as we had specified. The manager came over and was more than happy to have the steak re-fired. When the steak came out it was wrong again. We were not upset. Things happen sometimes and ya gotta give some slack sometimes.The issue was resolved and we were very pleased. I just want to give a shout out to the stars who made our special meal memorable.Josh was our server, he was very knowledgeable, super friendly and gave superior service. He obviously has been there a while...and his experience shows.Scott was the first Manager we encountered and he was very apologetic and was very seriously trying to make sure we were happy with our dining experience. Scott was as professional and concerned as any Manager should be.Michael was the final Manager to come over and make sure everything was good. His visit to our table was not necessary but sure capped a special evening. Michael, like Scott was professional and concerned that we had a great experience.To the Taste of Texas Team and those we mentioned....Thank you very much for doing a great job providing a superior dining experience. I hope your Boss appreciates your efforts

Wow. What a great experience. I flew in from San Diego and have never been to Houston. My hotel recommended Taste of Texas. I am glad they did. Salad bar amazing. I had the steak medallions. Wow. They were perfect!  It was busy song are at the bar. So glad I did. Bartenders were outstanding!  I will go out of y way to eat here.

The steak is fresh and juicy, and you can even pick the one you like. There is also a salad bar in the back. The salad is pretty delicious. If it's your first time, don't forget to tell them and you'll get a photo taken for free in a cowboy dress, which is awesome

A girl only turns Sweet 16 once but it still surprised me that she wanted to come to ToT since we have never been. I was glad to accomodate but forgot that they do not take reservations for small parties. I get it. So, the wait on a Thursday night was 45 min to an hour and I think we actually waited 30 something. Plenty of room to wait in bar area, foyer or better yet, outside. Once seated in the wine room, Jason our server came by promptly and asked the proverbial question, "Has everyone been here before", or something like that. He was happy to explain the menu. Let us know that one side and salad bar were included with the steaks, then gave us a few minutes to decide on appetizer. Like most steakhouses, they are well trained on the recommendations and upsell for just about everything. We started with spinach dip with tostada chips and it was stellar. Salad bar had great options including fruit, cheese and bread. All of us chose steak. All come with either lemon pepper, garlic butter or blue cheese butter. Service throughout the evening was on point and we never wanted for more of anything that he didnt already anticipate. The angus steaks were perfected cooked and with the exception of the mac and cheese, all the sides were outstanding (asparagus with hollandaise, au gratin potato, baked potato etc.Birthday girl enjoyed a dessert of her choice and it came with a sparkler and a paper framed photo of her blowing it out ( nice touch ). Lets face it. Steakhouses for the most part are not an exceptional value in terms of price. Having said that, the quality of ToT is outstanding while not grandiose in presentation. Its no wonder Edd and Mary Hendee have been in business since 1977. First class operation.

Fantastic experience from start to finish! Melissa was our waitress and it's obvious she loves what she does. She made the whole dinner fun and interesting for our 3 young kids and even cut their steaks up for them (wouldn't let us do it) so we could enjoy eating ourselves. After dinner she took them to the kitchen for complimentary ice cream. The food was great... From the breads to the salad bar to the stuffed Shrimp Jalapeños for an appetizer to Prime Rib and Filet. Cooked perfectly and we are it all! Would definitely come back when we're in Houston again.
Back again for lunch yesterday. I love this place. Delicious food, fantastic service, awesome atmosphere. Taste of Texas is a must visit when in Houston!!

Recommendations:-Cowboy Steak-Mac & Cheese-Rolls with Cinnamon ButterTip:-Put your name on the list at least an hour before time you intend to eat.I've been wanting to go to this place for a while because of my friends who speak highly of this restaurant.  We ended up waiting 45 minutes or so on a Saturday night (not bad at all) and ate the complimentary chips and salsa, which were pretty addicting.  My party came in blocks but the waiter was very patient and didn't rush the ones who came in early to order.  I got the Cowboy Steak with garlic pepper and lemon pepper seasoning paired with a Cabernet and it came out perfect!  I also had the baked potato, but out of the all the sides I tried from my friends (mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, baked potato), I thought the mac and cheese was the best one.  One of my friend's steak wasn't cooked to her liking so they immediately made another one and came back within 10 minutes!  The managers came by personally to make sure everything was great and even offered free dessert and a hot side for the mishap.  I will definitely be coming back again!

I love love love going to the taste of Texas for steak. It's one of my favorite steakhouses in town. I will starve myself a day in advance just so I can have as much of the salad bar and sides as possible. Even then I end up taking home leftovers. The servers are polite and helpful. Parking can sometimes be a challenge and wait times can be long at times but it's totally worth it.

We came for an intimate birthday.  Seems appealing for cowboy types (one man kept his hat on!), rustic charm? lotsa wood and guns.  Very casual - mostly older crowd, Caucasian.  Made me think of Denny's.  Birthday boy loved it.Plus-attentive service-baked brie-rib eye was juicy-asparagus side-cheesecakeAreas off improvement-salad bar - just OK-wilted spinach too garlicky$200 for four with tip - no etoh.  I think overpriced.

We came here for one of my friend's birthdays and it was not a let down. We had to wait a pretty long time, but I guess that's expected for a big party on a Saturday afternoon. I think the wait was about an hour? Possibly longer, but while you wait you can get sodas and popcorn and there's plenty of seating so you don't have to stand. When we got seated out waiter directed us to the salad bar. The cheese bread was delicious! It was warm, moist, soft - everything you want in cheese bread. The steak...was served perfectly. I ordered medium rare and my plate was burning hot and you can instantly smell your steak making your mouth really water.I got asparagus as a side which went well with my steak and my girlfriend got mash potatoes with the New York strip. Some additional notes, the interior is decorated like a cabin, very southern and Texas-y. The birthday girl did get a dessert of her choice but most of us were too full by the end to eat any.
This was the first time with my colleague in Houston. We loved the service quality and the taste of Tomahawk steak. We strongly suggest this restaurant.

By far the best restaurant I have been to. The salad bar is so fresh and the breads are to die for. The steaks are always cooked to perfection. The wait staff is amazing, explain. Exactly what you want and it will happen! Save room for dessert, everything is amazing weather it be rich or light. I always get the 6oz center cut with broccoli and hollondaise, a trip to the salad bar, and I always try a new dessert and  never disappointed.

How good is Taste of Texas?  Let's just say I went there on a SCHOOL FIELD TRIP when I was in elementary school!  Fast forward to today and elementary schools are still going there for field trips.  At my son's elementary school, it is the 4th grade field trip... and you better believe I will try to be a chaperon for that one!Not only does Taste of Texas have amazing food but it's also a Houston legend and rightfully so!  Taste of Texas is our go-to place for birthdays, anniversaries, or just when we are craving a great steak.  Sure this is Houston, you can get a great steak in a handful of places throughout the city but no other restaurant has Taste of Texas's charm and they sure don't have Taste of Texas' salad bar!    My husband and I usually split the Porterhouse for Two which is no longer listed on their menu but they still offer it.  You can't go wrong with half a filet and half a strip.  It also comes with two sides, one for each person and of course the salad bar.  Just a warning though, when ordering the Porterhouse for Two, it looks like they are charging you for an "extra" salad bar but the total price is correct.  They have to do that since it's not technically on the menu.  If you live in Houston, you have to experience Taste of Texas at least once in your life.  If you have friends or family coming in from out of town, this is definitely a great spot to take them especially if they are not from this great state of Texas!  Be prepare to wait since they do not take reservations but it's well worth it!
The salmon dish is absolutely, mouth watering delicious! They have a beautiful salad bar full of colorful vegetables and tasty fruit!

Sorry, but I will not wait 2 hours for anything. ANYTHING! I wish ToT would take reservations. At least for the holidays.Sorry, can't give 5 stars to a place that charges the same price as other reservation accepted places and expects you to wait. And the free soft drinks & popcorn are a crappy bribe to hang around. :P

You simply can't beat this place. It is, by far, my favorite place to get a steak in Houston. (And that is saying a lot.... because I like steak. A lot.) From the food to the service, I've never had a bad experience. They have had a little bit of a menu change recently but, for the most part, you won't even notice the difference. Their salad bar, complete with self-serve bread case is not to be skipped. This is the place I take people who visit from out of town. There may be a bit of a wait because they don't accept reservations, but it is well worth it. Trust me. Jessica approved: the filets, the prime rib, the bacon wrapped quail bites (don't ask questions, just order them), and their wedge salad is beautiful.
I absolutely love this place. Their food and service is always on point. Everyone must their cilantro vinaigrette!

This place is overrated as hell. The steak quality is not that good, think of this as a slightly better Logan's. The best steak I had in a restaurant was at a place called houstons and this place comes nowhere near it. The select your own steak is honestly just a gimmick, it won't change the flavor of your steak. I ordered a steak lovers bread and butter- a large ribeye- that steak lacked in so much flavor it was embarrassing. The only thing Texas about this place is the size

My sister brought me here for my birthday, which doesn't make a whole lot of sense considering she's a vegetarian and I don't eat beef.  The reason she wanted to come here is because apparently the salad bar is something you dream about.On a Thursday evening, there was zero wait for a table.  We were seated and went off to the salad bar.  Uhhhh......who dreams about this??  There was 2 types of salad blends, spring mix and romaine if I remember correctly, a couple of different types of dressing as well as the usuals, the usual toppings (croutons, sesame seeds, bacon), usual veggies, usual everything.  The website even describes the salad bar as "amazing".  What??  They do have fresh bread, which was uh-mazing!  When we got back to the table, I ordered a chicken breast since I knew this salad bar wasn't going to sustain me for the rest of the night.  The chicken was just ok.We ordered raspberry cheesecake for dessert (although NOT complimentary for me)  It was by far the best part if the meal.  It was pretty giant, enough for 2 people to share without fighting about intruding on one's side of the slice.  The coulis was awesome and tangy.  The real stuff, as it should be, not the corn syrupy mess you usually get.

This is my very favorite place to go. Greatest salad bar in town.My dad took me to lunch, he is 82, and the prices had gone up, he could not get a house red wine and the least expensive glass of red was $12.95?? We eat at a lot of nice places and the house merlot is $4-$5.He was very disappointed. I love the staff and decor but the restaurant is just catering to the over paid people working all around them. A split  entree, 2 salad bars and water cost $40 with tip. He said, next time Pappadeux.Also, I went for my birhday and they had the most amazing shrimp appetizer, best shrimp EVER, but no, nest time they have changed it to a few on a glass that is smoking...a real let down...I do appreciate the family and what they do for staff and the community.

The meat is BIG here. But once the novelty wears off, you may realize like me, that the salad bar is one of the real highlights. The steak is ok... not bad, by any means... but it wasn't the best either. The meat was definitely cooked a little more than "med rare" for me, and they drenched it in garlic butter (which tasted alright, but sort of masked the meat). One of the coolest highlights is the free snacks and drinks they offer you when you have to wait an absurdly long time in their waiting area.It's definitely a place you'll want to try at least once.

If only this place was a "hospitality house" or a "salad bar house" instead of a "steak house".  Then it would get 5 stars.So let's get straight to my biggest beef (pun totally intended):  The lack of reservations.  Look, guys, you have to have some pretty freaking amazing beef for me not to wait in line for an hour (or hourS).  On top of that, why are you guys so dang hospitable and friendly... yet you don't want to go to the trouble of having reservations?  Here, let me make it easy for you:  Have half of your restaurant available for reservations.  The other half is first-come first-served.  Once the reservation half is full for the night, you don't make any more reservations and you tell people to just come in.  Thne you institute a severely short grace period for late diners (say, 5 minutes) before their table becomes available for the people waiting.  Voila!  You satisfy those of us who like to plan ahead, and not wait, while also satisfying the people who like a little more "excitement" in their life.See, when it comes right down to it, if you offer the same product - or even one that's slightly inferior - as any other steakhouse in the area, but you make it loads more difficult for me to obtain that product, I just won't frequent you.  What's the point?  My intent on nights out isn't to spend the majority of my time sucking down a generic beer from your terrible draft selection while munching on greasy stale popcorn filler.In case you're wondering, I went to this place because my boyfriend wanted to go here for his birthday.  Had it been my call, once I heard they didn't take reservations, I would have picked any of another 50 excellent steakhouses in the area and been quite happy.  On that note I hope he never reads this review...All right, rant over.  Let's get to the rest of it.  The salad bar:  Pretty darn good.  The bread bar and associated butters and jams and whatnot:  Worth a mention because it's just that good.  Appetizers:  We got the popcorn shrimp.  Thumbs up.The steak:  I got the cowboy steak.  Ribeye, medium rare.  It was... ok.  Not spectacular.  Not write-home-I'm-in-love-now great.  Just ok.  It's telling when the server presses you to include the house's specialty seasonings or butter on your steak - shouldn't the steak speak for itself?  You can choose your own steak cut, by the way.  We did this.  I should have realized right then that my cowboy ribeye wasn't going to be good because none of the cuts looked better than average.The boyfriend got the T-bone, also medium rare.  Now that was pretty good.  Not the best I've ever had, but pretty darn good.Once the waiter found out it was my boyfriend's birthday, he got us dessert (key lime pie, amaaaazing, and I still thought it was delicious despite the fact that I was about to explode from too much food).  Also, he took a picture of us and printed it out before we left.  That's so nice!Sorry, Taste of Texas, you were so hospitable and eager to please - but only once I'd sat down at a table.  And if only I could grade you on everything BUT the steak.  Unfortunately I just can't do that, just as I unfortunately won't be returning.

My favorite steak house, worth the wait that one will inevitably have to go through to be seated.It's not as bad, though, as they have a side waiting area with fountain drinks, chips and salsa, popcorn and a bar. The service is awesome, the servers are always attentive and nice.The steak here is amazing (I always get the center cut filet, rare) but the salad bar is pretty darn awesome, too, with huge cheese blocks one can shave off slices of cheese and fresh bread that's kept warm in a bread warmer cabinet. I also really love the cilantro dressing and the real bacon.Okay, more on the steak. Like I said, I always get the center cut filet, rare, with the garlic butter. It's just omigah melt in your mouth amazing. Never fails to disappoint! The options are to get the steak butterflied and to also get it bacon wrapped. While bacon is awesome, I let the steak sing in my mouth by itself.My brothers and father usually get the prime rib and it's always a winner, also. I've also have tried the new york strip and the porterhouse (other's, not mine) and it's similarly awesome.Okay, everything is awesome. Check it out, be it for a special occasion or if you just want really excellent steak. :D
Love their ribeye-juicy, but the T bone is just Ok. The sautéed mushroom is awesome. Nice restaurant, nice service.

If I were rich, I'd eat here more often. My boyfriend and I usually share an 18oz prime rib. Goodness gracious it was my first time ever eating a prime rib and I immediately fell in love with it at first whiff of it. I don't think I will ever go back to filet mignon... It was soooo goood!!!! Ordering tip: they're scale is off by like a notch, so if you like medium rare, order a medium and it'll come out perfect. Otherwise you might get a little too much blood on your plate.Salad bar: I think enough has been said about their fantastic salad bar.  A mini heating oven for their breads: jalepeno cornbread, jalepeno cheese, and regular dinner rolls (or mini loaves). Salad: spring mix, spinach, lettuce, broccoli, olives, beans, beets, mushroom--ANYTHING you can think of for throwing in your salad. Even nuts and fruits! And cheese that you can personally grate from the block yourself! I wish I could take their dessert platter home with me. My family loves their creme brulee, but I cannot stray away from their pecan pie. Oh my goodness... it's a freaking deep dish pie too. Yet my boyfriend and I couldn't stop eating it even after our 18 oz prime rib and all-you-can-eat salad and dinner rolls... They also have cheesecake, snicker's pie, etc.Decor? Very nice and romantic setting. It's Christmas season so they have lights and seasonal decor on the walls and everything. Beware of 1-hr waits during busy hours on the weekends! They don't take reservation.

What can i say that hasn't been said here already ???Perhaps that I was blown away by the deco, the staff, the attention to detail, the salad bar, the picking of the meat, the tenderness and taste of my porterhouse steak, and, truly, the best "ensemble cast" experience I've had in a long time !

Wow! Just Wow!When I am next in Houston I will be eating at Taste of Texas!!!Good quality beef, cooked perfectly to order.Our wait time on arrival was approx 60mins (arrived at 8pm). The wait was worth it and complimentary refreshments were available.We ate well and bill came to $150. Service was fantastic and the added touches and the way they treat tourists is commendable.Quite deservedly a Houston institution and I look forward to visiting again, whenever that may be.Thank you.

Taste of Texas is the best run restaurant in the Houston area. It is also the quintessential Houston Steakhouse. The steaks are always cooked perfectly and the salad bar is amazing. My wife and I have made this our anniversary spot. I hope Taste of Texas will be open for all of our anniversaries.

This place is absolutely heaven. I still cannot believe they have a waiting room full of snacks - which was worth the 1 hour wait. They have popcorn, nachos and soda, which is something most restaurants don't do. As soon as I walked in, I was very tempted by the garlic smell. Since my family and I were visiting, we got free bandanas, which is a symbol of Texas. This place is so beautiful with the Christmas decorations all over and every meal comes with a salad bar, which is small but very tasty.Forgive me for not being a Texan who doesn't know what a 'genuine' steak tastes like but my t-bone steak was delicious - juicy and tender! At least way better than what I taste back home. And as for the steak fries, yum!

When you think Texas you think steak house, but you haven't eaten at a realTexas restaurant until you've eaten here, it's perfect for any occasion. Delicious food great service and amazing salad bar! But don't full up on just the salad and bread, the food is spectacular! Great to celebrate birthdays and anniversaries every Houstonian has to come here at least once!

Kind of ironic that I would comment on my experience here! I am a vegetarian and this place is completely vegetarian friendly! My sister says that she loves the steaks! The salad bar is excellent and so are their side dishes!! The place is always packed and has a great vibe .. I always visit when I am in town!!

Went to the kitchen and got to choose my own steak which was cooked med rare to perfection. Salad bar was delicious along with the bread, Mac and cheese was really good. Manager treated us with a 50 dollar gift card because guest across from our table were being loud and cursing. One of the best customer service I have experienced. Will be going back soon.
We dine here every Mother's Day and Father's Day and every chance in between! The steaks are flavorful and fresh. The staff members are pleasant. I just love the atmosphere!

EVERYTHING is so delicious! Don't get discouraged if you have a long wait because the waiting area is cozy and has it's own bar service along with complimentary chips and salsa, popcorn, sodas, and iced tea. But don't fill up on the free stuff because the food you're going to pay for is going to be GOOD and there will be a lot of it!Spend the money, get an appetizer. Try the salad bar too, it's outstanding! You cannot come here without getting a steak as your entree, if you get something else, SHAME ON YOU!Ask the waiters questions, they know what they're talking about. They will inform you on anything you need to know.Enjoy!!!
Best place in town. Takes forever to get a table, but always worth it. Not only is the food great, but the service is amazing. They are very accommodating to large groups and children too.

My first time at Taste of Texas was during my 7th grade. Our class took a field trip to learn about Texas history and got a lunch of chicken tenders, which were delicious for my 7th grade palette.Fast forward 10+ years and I was asked if I've ever been to this restaurant. Being me and not doing any research as it was based on my past experience, I exclaimed, "Of course! They have delicious chicken tenders!" And....cue the weird stares I received from people. I probably should have done at least a quick yelp search to realize Taste of Texas was a famous steakhouse. Whoops! No wonder I caused a room of 5+ people to go silent...So one day before Christmas, my boss decided to treat us to Taste of Texas for lunch for a job well done. Of course because he kept it a secret and the restaurant doesn't take reservations, he wasn't able get us to leave for an early lunch. As such we ended up with an hour wait which he had no problem blaming us for. So we entertained ourselves with the free soda and popcorn in the waiting room.Once we finally were able to sit and ordered, I debated getting a steak, but decided against it since I didn't want to end up napping half way through the afternoon. A very poor decision as I ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp, which were just okay. Definitely should have tried their steak! Now I'll definitely have to come back. In addition, the salad bar was great as it provided a lot of fresh options. Overall, I think this is a great restaurant to bring guests as its a very family friendly atmosphere rather than romantic. They also have a lot of Texas items which I think gives this place character. Definitely worth a visit.
food to die for. had a superb time, the salad bar is a big plus.

3.5 stars, for just the salad bar, of which I am definitely a fan! i love love luuuuuv the salad bar, and also the cheese rolls and jalapeno corn bread, of course!  The raspberry vinaigrette dressing is yummy, and it is fun to shred cheese from the big blocks of cheese!  However, the entree that I had last evening, Grilled Tenderloin Medallions, sorta sucked! Included in the entree, the baked Blue cheese stuffed tomato was scrumptious; other than that, everything else, including the fried onion strings, fresh asparagus, and the steak itself in Bordelaise sauce, was just so-so.  Next time I go to Taste to Texas, I will order just the salad bar as a meal, seriously! hahaa :)

Tomahawk steak is all you really need to know. Probably one of the best meals you will never eat in your life. Good stuff!The wait can be long, but its well worth it. You can pick out steaks from the back and that is pretty awesome. It is definitely a formal feel. I eat here with coworkers everytime I am in H-town!

Excellent food and salad bar.  Great ambiance and great service.  A few recommendations:Perry's has you beat on Martinis.  Change your martini glasses and change your blue cheese stuffed olives.  The blue cheese is very hard and not very tasty.  In addition, have your bartenders shake the martinis properly so that ice crystals form when shaken.  Visit Perry's for a better understanding.Fix your parking problem.  I shouldn't have to park over at the little motel across the street to dine at your restaurant.  Build a parking garage if that's what it takes.  You charge your patrons enough to fix your parking issues.Serve all your steaks on the sizzling platters.  The white rectangular plates are not as nice as the sizzling platters.So, everything was not "just perfect" but it was tasty and I did enjoy myself.Thanks
always a great place to go.  Love the decor at Christmas time !  Wish they took reservations though.  That keeps me from going very often.

2 thumbs up for the wonderful foods and excellent services for our Anniversary dinner with a few of our out of country family members.  They were impressed by taste of Texas!  Thank you for the free desserts with our meals to celebrate our 15th Anniversary and many other services including taking our pictures for keepsakes.

We went on a Friday around 8pm and our estimated wait time was 90-120 minutes. They do provide free chips and salsa, popcorn, and sodas on an adjacent lounge/wait area. This definitely helps.Our wait was about 70 minutes to be exact. Not so terrible. We ordered a 16 oz New York strip and the T-bone steak. Entrees come with a salad bar which was very nicely stocked with fresh veggies, cheeses, real bacon bits, and freshly baked sweet rolls. And the cilantro vinaigrette was fantastic.The waiter recommended the lemon pepper seasoning with garlic butter which really enhanced the flavor of the meat. The steaks were both cooked well although mine was leaning a bit more towards medium well...but no harm. We got the steak fries (yay) and  sauteed mushrooms (yawn) for our sides. We were way too full to order dessert but that tray was full of awesomeness. Maybe next time we'll just split one steak and  get something sweet in the end.Yes, the wait is ridiculous, and no it's not cheap. But Taste of Texas is totally worth it.
Our service was very good, but our steaks were over cooked. For the price, we felt like the steaks should've been better. Perry's Steakhouse is better in my opinion  and comparable.

I give this 5 stars because it is just a great Texas steak house experience.  I've been here several times and nothing disappoints except the wait.  Steaks are always good and the salad bar is great.  Potato soup is grand but probably has a few days worth of calories in it... But who's counting so now on to dessert... Bread pudding is delish!  This is a Houston visitor or local must.

This place has a lot of southern flair. Eating here makes me proud to be from Texas, they definitely do steak right!There will most likely be a long wait if you come here on a busy night, but their waiting area is spacious and comfortable, and you can help yourself to complimentary snacks and beverages as you wait. This is a really nice perk for me, because nothing makes me crankier than being hungry and having to deal with a long wait while people are getting served food all around you.I expected a buffet-like salad bar with the basics (some shredded lettuce, tomatoes, bacon, croutons, and cheese) but there are actually some gourmet offerings, and a nice assortment of dressings. I liked their fresh-baked rolls and jalepeno cornbread too, it was difficult not to fill up on those!Oh man, and there is nothing like a dry aged steak here. Fiance and I usually split the porterhouse for two, which is probably the most bang for your buck item on the menu. You can actually choose your own steak for them to prepare too. It is always cooked to medium rare perfection, the fillet has such an amazing melt-in-your-mouth texture. Save room for dessert! BEST PECAN PIE EVER. A generous serving with good pecan/filling/crust ratio. I liked the shortbread crust a lot, it wasn't too sweet and complimeted the filling well. The filling wasn't too gelatin-like, nothing kills a pecan pie like a globby filling.The servers are attentive and really know the menu very well.Love, love, love this place. I wish I could eat here everyday, but my wallet and my midsection would definitely take a hit. Other steakhouses have a lot to learn from Taste of Texas.
Love the environment and that I can choose my cut of meat.  Service was great.  Great location and good for work meetings and or date night.

I was first introduced to Nina and Edd Hendee's Houston landmark as child during an elementary school field trip. Nina took us on a guided tour of the historical artifacts throughout her restaurant. After touring the steakhouse, she feed us what I fondly remember as "the best school lunch EVER". Prior to moving to the Pacific NW, my sister and I would always look forward to our birthdays when our parents would treat us to a fancy dinner at Taste of Texas. It has been 15 years since my last visit to Nina and Edd's steakhouse. I recently had a quick visit home from Portland, Oregon. With only 24 hours in Houston, the only restaurant that I absolutely had to visit was Taste of Texas. The experience was every bit of what I remember growing up. The hostess and server (Bill) were prompt, patient and so very kind. Bill anticipated our every need. The food was simply delicious. We started our dining experience with a trip to their salad bar complete with an assortment of warm, freshly baked bread and cinnamon butter. My Dad and I each ordered their 6 oz. bacon-wrapped and aged to perfection Certified Angus filet topped with melted garlic butter and paired with sautéed mushrooms and grilled shrimp. Everything was cooked to perfection. For dessert we split a slice of warm pecan pie topped with vanilla ice cream. It was to-die-for. Bill overheard how much I loved their bread and cinnamon butter so he packed up a sweet little To-Go box for me to enjoy during my plane ride home. Our experience was everything that I remembered, anticipated and craved. Thank you, Nina and Edd. An evening at your beautiful restaurant never disappoints. I look forward to my next trip home and another delicious meal while back in Houston. #GodBlessTexas

We have eaten here twice. We have yet to wait as long as they say. Visit their room to the right. Complimentary chips and salsa, popcorn, and soft drinks. Celebrating?  Tell them. They will make it special for you. I got soup and their amazing salad bar for 11.95.

Never ever had a bad meal or service here!!They pride themselves on their restaurant and it shows. I always leave this place happy and I honestly always get exactly what I came for. That's exactly how it should be! We eat here once a year with our a huge group of extended family when they come into town and it's always awesome!

I was visiting Houston just for 2 days, and since there was pretty much nothing to do in this city, before leaving the only attraction (the mall), I told my sister: Yelp me the best steak place around here. We were all lucky, we found Taste of Texas and did not have to wait. The service was wonderful. The portion was enormous, we ordered 2 12 oz rib eye plates to share among 3 people and it was more than enough. Our steak was made to order, we could even instruct on how it should be cut. Do they have a butcher on site? Is the farm at the back? We're so clueless, we're Yankee tourists..Other than that, the salad ingredients were very fresh. I had asparagus, which was amazing too. And ever since, steak has only been tasting bland and lame up here in New England. I usually casually reply to "How's everything" from servers with "Great" - but now I often legitimately look disappointed and tell them "It's okay. You know, I just came back from Texas."

Taste of Texas have the best  steaks in Houston and their food are usually good. The only concern I have at the restaurant is that I wish the hospitality was a little better. I'm comparing their service to le peep at woodway where le peep had awesome service. Taste of Texas is still my favorite restaurant and I would still go here.

Very *big* Houston steakhouse. Decent service. Steaks are OK but not as good as Pappas Steakhouse or the Republic in College Station. I think the thing I like best about this place is the salad bar - lots of fresh lettuce, vegetables, and freshly baked bread and cornbread. Worth checking out.

I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this restaurant, the waiter, salad bar, food and wine ALL amazing!!! It is a very classy place, definitely on the pricey side, the wines were extremely marked up. I ordered the grilled tuna and it was so fresh and juicy. My boyfriend ordered the crusted grilled chicken and he loved it! The salad bar has a ton of options to choose from and everything is fresh!! They also offer the option of picking our your own steak if you are into that kind of thing. Right now they have it decorated for Christmas with lights :)

Been going here for years. My grandpa used to take his co-workers here before my parent's met! It's the perfect place to celebrate a birthday, and everyone makes you feel welcome. A guaranteed good meal!

Huge, sizzling, tender, and delectable are some of the words to describe their steak. The Taste of Texas is hands down one of the best steaks I have had in my life (I had the T-bone steak)! The restaurant has a quirky western décor with low lights to create some intimacy. The restaurant is more upscale but the staff and service was friendly and informative. One of the more fascinating features is the option to actually choose your own steak from T-bone to filet mignon. You can actually see and choose the steak before it is cooked, and get to appreciate the beautiful marbelization of your steak. The steak dinner also comes with your standard salad bar which also includes delicious jalapeno cornbread with small cups of honey to be drizzled onto the cornbread. If you're not so much into steak they also have other entrée choices but you're missing out. Overall, steak dinners can range around $50 or more and entrées between $15-25. If you're ever in Houston and you're craving a delicious steak you have to visit Taste of Texas. Side note: If it's your birthday let your server know! You'll get a free dessert and picture compliments of Taste of Texas.

The steak was high quality and huge!! Though it is not marinated or seasoned until cook, all they put was garlic butter on top of the steak. The bacon wrapped quails was just ok. What impressed me the most was the salad bar, variety of fresh vegetable and breads.
Cornbread is perfect and the service is very well trained. I just was not blown away with the prime rib I ordered. maybe next time it will be better.

Great Steaks, Great salad bar, great ambiance Best value for upscale Steak in Houston. I'll pass on Capital grill (way overdone) Ill pass on Tony's (way overpriced) I'll pass on Flemings and the like- for the best Value and a great steak come here. You will get a history lesson about Houston as well. The other food is just ok. Stick with the steak and salad bar. The bread option at the salad bar is great with the spreads they offer.  I also feel the Pecan Pie here is some the best I have ever had.
Nina and Edd Hendee have a class we'll run restaurant that is one of the best in Texas. AND they are wonderful people outside the business
Best steak I've ever had! I keep coming back here, the service is top notch, salad bar is great, and the steaks are amazing! No complaints whatsoever. Can't wait to go back!

My family and I go once a year to Taste of Texas. It's a great experience for us to go and have a great meal together like that. I've gone when we've had to wait for over an hour and I've gone when we've only had to wait about 20 minutes. Would like for them to accept reservations but it isn't bad. They do offer free drinks, popcorn and chips and salsa while you wait. Once seated the waiters are VERY friendly. They ask if you have been there before and really make it special when it's your first time there. Not sure if they still do this but if it's your first time they bring you a bandana and you can wear it if you like, just a nice gesture. I think it's only for international visitors though.The food is spectacular. If you're going to Taste of Texas, you're mainly only going for the steak. You can pick whatever cut you want from the butcher in the back. You can have it plain or add the garlic seasons they have which is great. Most meals come with the salad bar which is filled with great toppings. Bacon, nuts, peppers, whatever you think of they have for your salad. At the end of the marvelous salad bar you find a box full of baked goodies. Small bread loafs, butter croissants and my personal favorite, jalapeño corn bread. Overall just great food, never have tried anything not deserving to be on their menu. Will continue to go to Taste of Texas, they have great service, excellent food and just a great place to go with your family.

This is my all time favorite steak house. Taste of Texas has the best quality food all around-from their produce to their steaks. The salad bar is amazing and the service has always been stellar. Plus they feed you while you wait for a table! Thank you Taste of Texas for setting such a wonderful example of a quality top notch Texas restaurant. Well done! (Pun intended!)
Good service. Nice restaurant to bring your love ones, friends, etc. Restaurant is clean, salad bar is small but delicious.

Okay, the steak was good. The Filet was soft and very moist.The rest of the experience is where I have the issue. I came with a large corporate group and these guys sold the hell out of us.Made us order tons and tons of appetizers and took dessert orders before anything else. I mean, we even said "can we order later" and the waitress said because we're a large crowd blah blah blah.Either way, they cashed out several more G's than they should have.I would definitely return. With one other person for just the steak. Then again, there are other great Steak joints... Well, if I'm in Houston, I'll come back.
This place has the best steaks!!! No other place comes close! The sevice is amazing and the food is just the BEST!  Definitely a place you have to check out if you're in Houston!

Enjoyed dinner for my Father's 90th birthday. The food was good. Service was excellent. Wait time for a large party was 2 hours. May want to consider taking reservations, maybe with a deposit, for large parties to avoid the wait. Overall experience was good. Will return again.

There are many places in Houston that can hanker out a good tender and flavorful piece of steak. There are many backyard pits / grills that could do the same. Thus, I give this place 4 stars not because it has good, tender steak - which it does - but because of the extras. Salad bar - it ain't no Fogo's bar, but it still has a great fresh selection. Greens, fresh fruit, and pasta salads.Bread - jalapeno cornbread, mama's old fashioned buttery rolls, and cheese bread shaped like a cinnamon roll! kept warm and available next to the salad bar. Best part is the honey cinnamon butter and jam that goes with them.Expect a wait, at least an hour during busy times (weekends), since there are no reservations. But fear not, you can stuff yourself with free soda, popcorn, and chips outside as you wait - it'll make the hour feel a lot shorter. Stuffed to your heart's desire after your meal? Even if you tell them you're too full for dessert, they will bring out a platter of all the desserts they offer. In a perfect world, you would be able to look at that platter and say, "no, thanks". But in reality, we are fatties by nature. Plus, dessert goes to another stomach anyway. That being said, when they offer you dessert after you said you don't want any, make sure you try their key lime pie and their Oreo cheesecake! Only thing that I suggest to them: a steakhouse without mac n cheese as a side?! Almost blasphemous. Luckily your cattle make up for it. I'll be back (when I've saved up enough to drop some bill$).

My babe took me here a few months ago for an early dinner simply because he wanted me to share the experience of a new steak house restaurant with him.  His friends and others have recommended it to him. I was looking forward to it.  We arrived early since we knew this place would get packed.  This was a huge steak house with high ceilings.  If you do have to wait, there is a waiting area where you can get  popcorn, beverages, and other free snacks.  We didn't have to wait long but I managed to take along a sprite with me to my table.  Our hostess took us to a seating area far from the salad bar area.As with other steak houses, we got to see our meat prior to ordering.  Instead of bringing it to the table as other steakhouses, we got to go pick out our own meat for ourselves.  This was located next to the salad bar area.  We went with the double porterhouse steak since it was the best deal. It also came with access to the salad bar area.  Keep in mind that you only get one visit to the salad bar area so make it worthwhile.  The salad bar area was very nice.  It had a great selection of salads, dressings, cheese, rolls, etc.  Plates can be a bit small so choose wisely.  This was actually my favorite part of the meal.We weren't sure how long it would take so we ordered some spinach & artichoke dip.  While we were seated, they provided us with some chips along with salsa & cream cheese dip.  This was yummy.  We also got a glass of wine to go along with our steak  Little did we know that our appetizer and steak came out at the same time.  We were overwhelmed with food.  Imagine a small table full of bread, spread, chips, dips, spinach & artichoke dip, huge steak, and drinks.  If the food didn't come out all at once, I would have probably enjoyed it more.  The steak was a bit under seasoned. It wasn't the best steak I've had but it was good.Surprisingly, I was not impress with this particular steak house.  The price for everything including dessert was less than LA fares.  The servers and hostess were very attentive.  I even requested bernaise sauce for my steak.  It wasn't as good as Nick & Stef's in LA.I will probably visit this only for the salad bar or if I wish to bring family/friends visiting Texas.

Such a true Texas steak house.   Nothing beats the southern hospitality you feel walking into this place.I normally order the prime rib, today it was a bit overcooked.  Order it medium rare.Cowboy ribeye amazing!!Key lime pie delicious!  Dessert platter that they display and explain all the desserts is such a rarity now and days with restaurants trying to hustle patrons in and out.  Dining at Taste of Texas, they definitely make I feel at home.If you're visiting for the first time let them know. Dress casual or fancy .... They're still hospitable !

Eh, don't believe the hype: for the $100 my wife and I spent, it was a real disappointment.The service was very good, and the various waiters were attentive; however, it doesn't make up for the bland, unseasoned and fatty steak my wife received, a steak we spent $46 on. For that kind of cash we expect to be blown away... so why is it that the steaks taste better and Texas Roadhouse and are half the cost? No way, never again.

We went here for our 1 year Anniversary and had a WONDERFUL experience!This is definitely THE place to go for a really nice night out without completely busting your boyfriend's bank ;)   (being a girl is rough! hehe)Cons: They DO NOT take reservations, PREPARE TO WAIT.  We waited 1.5 hours for a table, BUT they do have a bar and complimentary fountain drinks, popcorn, chips and salsa in their waiting area (why not just turn this into part of the restaurant? I have no idea)  If you're here with people you actually like and enjoy talking to, this time will fly by right? ;)Pros:The salad bar is crazy good and has a ton of options- including cut up chunks of BACON and the best rolls and cinnamon butter of your life!  We ordered the baked brie as an appetizer- it was wonderful, but then again you can't mess up bake brie right?I ordered a glass of the Robert Mondavi Merlot, a 6 oz filet and the sautéed mushrooms = FOOD ORGASM.  My boyfriend, who is quite the steak guy, ordered the New York strip and mashed potatoes and loved it!Our waiter, who was very helpful in recommendations and gave us great service and was very friendly, had asked us if we were here for a special occasion and we told him that it was our anniversary!  He came out with a huge dessert tray and asked us to pick a dessert and that it would be on the house!  SO COOL!  We picked the cheesecake with raspberry sauce- it was delicious!Now for the BEST part of the Taste of Texas,  for a glass of wine, a beer, an appetizer, an unlimited salad bar, two steaks, two sides, complimentary waiting room snacks and a dessert = $109, which WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE at any other upscale steakhouse that I know of at least!We will definitely be back!!!

Wow after hearing all the stuff about this steakhouse, me and sis finally had the chance to visit the restaurant on a Sunday night. We arrived at the restaurant around 6:15pm, and there's already a line going on. The waitress greeted us and told us it will be a 35-45 minute wait, and of course we expected that already.The waiting area is at the side with chairs and tables, TV, drinks, popcorn and salsa available. If you want to wait outside, there are also benches and drinks available. We waited for ~35 minutes so I have to say it's not bad at all.The food was just awesome and you have a salad bar with dinner rolls/jalapeno corn bread available. My 20-ounce rib eye is cooked to a perfect medium well with little fat. My sister's salmon was also delicious, too bad she is not a fan for steaks. There is a large selections of wines if that's your thing. Yeah the price is on the high side, but nothing beats a great meal with great environment.BTW, there's free WiFi available for you while you wait too!!!

Me and my husband celebrated our 14th year wedding anniversary here. Jason our attendant is very attentive and has exceeded our expectations. Great selection of salad bar, great steak paired up with not so pricey wine + great service (couldn't get any better than that). Salute to Taste of Texas for making our occassion a memorable one.

Well, where do I start? Well I want om here on 12/30/15 I don't usually go here because on how much it cost. But based on how very special the occasion is. So I got here around about 6. Had to wait close to 2 hours for a table of 5. When we got to our table. Boy, was I hungry.  Sat done got my drinks ordered, and attacked the salad bar. I had ordered the ribeye steak choiv d of oz. I had the 18 oz. And the baked sweet potato. Good enough to feel me up.

Best steakhouse in Houston!!! Love love love this place!!! The salad bar is delicious, so much to choose from! The cheese bread is definitely the bread to try. Make sure you save room for the steak. Usually the waiter will offer you to pick out your own steak.. Do it!! It's a great experience because they actually take you in the back and you literally get to choose your lunch/ dinner!!  I like to get mine medium rare and oh my God it comes out amazing!!

Very busy. I was seated in the wine room, which was fine as I was by myself. There was a six top by me that were continually interrupted as a server would get a bottle. I would have asked to be moved, that would so ruin my experience. I ordered a dirty martini to start and a cab with my rib eye. It was correctly prepared. One of the cool features to this restaurant is that you can go to the kitchen to select your steak. It's a neat process. Tons of people come here and it gets even busier as the holidays approach. Nice service and good food. You did it right TOT.

Taste of Texas is good for what it is: a Texas style steakhouse. The quality isn't terrific when compared against some of the higher-end steakhouses IMO. The meat is delicious, but how hard is it to enjoy a giant fllet covered in garlic butter and lump crab meat? The salad bar is fantastic because you can gorge yourself prior to getting your fat steak. As far as ambiance is concerned, it is decent. Texas themed through and through. I will go back for business lunches, but probably won't choose to return on my own accord.

I usually don't drive 45 minutes just for a lunch.  My sister insisted that I should try this place.  We went there yesterday. It turned out to be a wonderful experience for me.  I had Jumbo Grilled Shrimp served over wild rice with grilled vegetables and a trip to the salad bar. I enjoyed the lunch very much.  After we finished eating, the manager came and asked how much we liked the food.  Great food, great service and great environment.

I used to eat in here a lot and I used to think it was five stars.  However, the last couple of times, I ate in there, it just wasn't as good.  However, they do have some great steaks.  They come out sizzling hot and most of the time, they are cooked to perfection, tender and flavored well.  The salad bar and warm bread rack are amazing.  The wine list is good.  The menu has a lot of choices and most of the stuff on it is good.  And save room for dessert, because they have some great choices.  Go on your birthday, you get a free dessert.  It's a great place to take out-of-town clients for business dinners.  Now, the downsides... the parking is terrible.  They don't have enough spaces, so if you go at peak times, you'll have a hard time trying to find parking.  And you'll normally have to wait.  And the owners are big Conservative Republicans and they tend to promote their politics at the restaurant.  As someone who doesn't agree with them politically, I find it difficult to patronize them.  The male owner has a political radio show and has been outspoken against people who share my viewpoints, so I curtailed my visits there after finding out about this.  But, the food and service are good.

First of all, OMG!!!! This is a new fave spot for me. Whenever I am in Houston, which is often, I will be dining here. I was so impressed with the whole experience! The best steak in the world is right there in Houston off Interstate 10 at Taste of Texas. The set up is nice. The service is professional and it is a tad fancy. Right up my alley. With the steaks, you can go to the back to visit with the butcher and pick out which one you want. I opted for the ribeye, which is my fave steak. You can also choose from a few blends of seasonings and tell them how you want yours prepared. They stick a number onto your steak so you will know it's the one you picked once it is delivered to your table. Very cool concept. The salad bar is state of the art and comes with your meal if you order a steak or entree. I was so impressed with the salad bar, the steak, the service, the energy in the place. Can't wait to go back. Also, their drink menu and wine list are on a tablet/Ipad-like device and you order your drinks electronically. Very cool. This is one of my fave places now!
After such good reviews, I decided to come here. This was not a mistake. The server was attentive and catered to our needs. My steak turned out great. I will save this place my next special occasion.

T-bone was really good. The bigger the steak the better. Filet mignon was also really good. Tender and flavorful. It all comes with a salad bar and a side. Mac and cheese is recommended.Save room for dessert!

Half way thru meal, I was informed about the Nurenburg Rally aspect of recent revivification of this place....had enjoyed the Hike to Salad Bar dodging Excess Staff chatting each other up....found jalapeno cornbread fine....but once the RIGHTIST WING NUT leanings of clientele came to the fore....not much good happened after that.Prime Rib was seriously underwhelming- fatty without character-tough to the blade-coating derived from Wild Bird Mix?Ridiculously Deep Dish Pecan Pie was fine........escaped to Neutral Switzerland just in time.

Screaming children at almost every table and mostly large parties of loud people.  If you have children or really large groups and like an overtly Texas version of Steak & Ale... this place is for you!  For the same prices and better quality....there are smaller more intimate Steak Houses relatively close by.

Such a nice experience here at the restaurant "Taste of Texas." You get to see and choose your steak before it's made. I tried the center filet cut and it was delicious and satisfying. Very friendly and professional staff too. I'd highly recommend this restaurant for who wants to experience the great time and stake.

This is one of my mother-in-law's favorite restaurants and the place my husband took me on our first date. I'd be lying if I said I didn't have a certain fondness for it, but I think that fondness has developed over time. The salad bar that comes with just about every meal is decent with a better selection of dressings than most restaurants. They have your standard ranch etc, but my favorite is the cilantro vinaigrette. On this visit my husband got the onion soup - it was HUGE! Lots of cheese and lots of onions. They said they had increased the height of their soup bowls because they tended to slosh around, but that with the increased size of bowl came an increased portion of soup.  So you are warned!The steaks have a good flavor and tenderness - closer to a Del Frisco's steak than Outback.  Everything was cooked consistently this time - we ordered medium and got medium - but there have been other times when it was a bit undercooked.  Of course, we all saved room for dessert. We have tried just about everything on the dessert menu and when we KNOW we are in the mood for a good dessert, then this is one place we set out for.  I love that their key lime pie is actually tart and not overly sweet like at most restaurants.This is a place you can take the family, including some of the older children (like 7+ yrs maybe).  Maybe it is the large ceiling and spacious dining room, but I never get annoyed with children in this restaurant.  The interior is cozy and reminds me of what might be found at a resort lodge more than a steakhouse off a busy freeway in Houston.  I find I don't have to be worried about bumping into other people when getting up from the table here, which is nice.  And last, the service here is great the majority of the time.  I have had a few poor waiters, but the majority have been attentive and friendly.  Our waitress yesterday, Mandy T, was a lot of fun and seemed to enjoy waiting on us as well.

Here's your full report on "A Taste of Texas".Wait time for a table: A+ No waiting. Took us right in.Bar Selection: D Only 4 beers on tap and none of them any good.Salad Bar: C+ Not a large selection of items, but the cilantro vinegerette was very tasty.Steak selection: D Took us back to the "butcher counter" to pick our entree. All their steaks are vacuum packed in plastic. Not a fresh piece of mean to be found.Entree Appearance: A+ Meal looks great.Entree taste: D Lacking any flavor. Should rename the place to "No Taste of Texas" Sauteed Spinach was a little gritty....as if they hadn't washed all the sand off the leaves.Dessert: A- Very good, but didn't get much snickers flavor.Coffee: A+ Very nice large cup of coffee to finish off.Wait staff: A They did a good job of checking on us and keeping the water glasses full and the extra plates removed.Overall experience: C- Nothing special unfortunately. No plans to ever return.

The ambiance is good, and our server was VERY good, so three stars. I had the Tomahawk ribeye which was stringy. I think maybe the regular ribeye is better. I grill FAR better ribeyes at home. Wife had the cold water lobster tails which were good but you can get them anywhere. The child really loved her bone-in filet mignon, but it was 54.00 so I'm glad she liked it.The steak fries were also very good.The knives are those big, heavy, serrated jobs you see at mid-level steakhouses. They didn't go we'll with my medium-rare, gristly ribeye, a sharp, non-serrated steak knife would have worked better for me.Not bad, per se, but not an out-of-this-worldy experience, either. We'll try some more steakhouses before we come back here, which will probably be, um, maybe never? I dunno.
Special place.  Excellent is the only word to describe it.  From food to drinks to service and overall atmosphere!

One of my favorite place for Steak!!!!!! The service is super. The staff are very nice. I like the all you can salad bar that they offer once you order the steak. This is a place where you want to come hungry because their steak is huge. I love it!!!
Great  salad bar...with PECANS! Yum. I've  never seen tortilla chips, popcorn & sodas while you wait in the foyer.

BEST SERVICE EVER.Our waiter was probably the nicest guy ever so it made up for the fact that we had to wait in line for over 90 minutes just to get in. I guess it's much easier to organize when they don't take reservations but it is a pain since you feel like you're waiting forever.As for the food, the Texas Onion Soup was ok and the salad bar is a good deal if you get it with the steak (not sure if it's worth getting alone) but I got the one that you can choose how many oz you like. 20oz + a salad + a soup + bread + drinks + desert was actually a pretty nice price for what we paid for.Our family went here for my little sister's birthday and I love it how she got a free desert and they took a picture for the whole family to be able to take home! Thumbs up for that idea. My dad however was super happy he got to take home the glass boot you get when you order the cinnamon dessert (it's the little things, I guess)Over all, this is a great place to go to if you're celebrating anything special but I don't know if I would want to wait that long for just a normal dinner.

How in the world this place can compete with the heavy weights is beyond me.  The food is not bad, but for the price, you can go to some of the best steakhouses in Houston (Pappas, V&As, Flemings...).  I guess the people that regularly eat here have not figured it out.

Not only were the steaks and salads amazing, but the atmosphere and the service were superb! This place is huge but the ratio of waiters to tables was perfect! The waiters weren't overwhelmed with tables or going around in circles. I HIGHLY recommend!
The steaks, salad bar, and desserts taste great. It's a unique spin for a steak house.  The service is second to none.  The kitchen tour to select your meat is a nice touch.

I've avidly used Yelp for several years already, but this is the first time I've felt compelled to rate a restaurant, which goes to say how impressed I was.Wanting to try a great steakhouse while in Houston, I found this place through Yelp. After reading the reviews, I expected a long wait for a Friday night, but it only turned out to be 35 minutes. This was probably just  luck, but still, it certainly helped give plus points.Service: All the employees, hosts, waiters, salad refillers, etc, were very friendly. My waiter, Ron or Ronald, made the effort to chat, was very attentive, and provided great service. I was sharing a steak with my parents, and he took the initiative to divide it up for us instead of having us do it ourselves. He also remembered that I preferred my steak on the fatty side and made sure to give me the fattier 1/3 of the steak.Food:The food itself was delicious. I am a meat-lover and even more a steak lover, and the cowboy steak I ordered was perfect. I also loved the salad/bread/fruit bar; how unique for a steakhouse! The complimentary snacks (popcorn, soda, and chips & salsa), that you could eat while waiting for a table, were a wonderful addition, too. Atmosphere:The atmosphere was just what I was looking for. The restaurant was beautifully decorated, but I loved that it also was laid back. After a full day of sightseeing, it was nice not having to go out of the way back to the hotel to switch into something dressy. Of course, you could dress up to go here and not look out of place as well. So versatile :)If I'm ever back in Houston, I would go back to this restaurant in a heartbeat.

My family and I have been coming to taste of Texas for years.  The steaks are always incredible and everyone loves the salad bar.  This is a great place to celebrate a special occasion, bring guests, or just to have a great steak.  The sides are great and the dessert selection has something for everyone!  Taste of Texas never disappoints!

Appearance: Great environment for many occasions - dates, family/friend gatherings, business. Service: Of course the wait is the main downfall. But it's worth it if you have the time. They have popcorn/chips&salsa and soda to keep your wait pleasant, but don't fill up on that....After we were seated, I had a young college student waiter. Amazing, friendly, and quick customer service. Always had a genuine smile and had knew the food and wine menu well. Food: ToT is absolutely worth the $$$. You're going to spend $30-40 on the average steak (I've never had anything but the steaks here). A bottle of wine is about $40-50. Your steak comes with access to the Salad Bar - always fresh greens, copious amounts of toppings, fresh rolls w/ must-try cinnamon butter, and some fruit to boot.For my friend's FREE birthday dessert, he chose the pecan pie with blue bell cinnamon ice cream - not too sweet, the ice cream complimented the pie perfectly.My group size: 4 peopleWait time (Friday dinner): 45min - 1hrMy bill: (NY Strip +1/4 of a bottle of wine + tip): ~$70

This place probably has the best prime rib in Houston. Always consistent with this cut of meat. We love the fresh salad bar- huge selection of choices. You can even pick your cut of steak here.The wait is long, but they offer drinks and snacks to pass the time. I appreciate that! And if you have an out of town guest, especially outside of Texas, take them here!

My NEW favorite steak restaurant!!!! Before, we would go to Flemings for a nice steak dinner/celebration. This restaurant takes it to a different level for me! Celebrated my birthday dinner here last night. The server comped me a great snickers cheesecake, snapped a photo of me, & printed it out for me to bring home. As always, the manager (it was Michael last night) stopped by to check on the table.We were quoted an 1.5-2 hrs for a party of 10 on a Saturday night since they do not accept reservations. We ended up waiting less then an hour. There are free popcorn, chips & salsa, & sodas in the waiting room/seating area to accommodate the wait. We always order the Tomahawk steak and split it. The salad bar is the best I've had with lots of varieties & constantly filled. Blocks of cheese and sliced fruit are also available at the salad bar. The price is so reasonable here and the steaks are delicious!!

Taste of Texas is amazing. This was one of the first steakhouses I went to when I first moved to the area. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. They also have an amazing salad bar which provides many many many options which will allow you to make a Super Texas Salad; Big? Yes, Unhealthiest Salad you will probably ever make? Yes , Delicious Yes. I recommend anyone coming to Houston to try this.

We have been coming here for over 20 years.  The food is fantastic as well as the wonderful salad bar.  The service is second to none.  On Friday and Saturday s you will have a wait, but they offer free soft drinks with chips& salsa to hold you over till you get your table.  The desserts are to die food.

We ate here as a celebration dinner for my new job.  I loved it.  We all loved it.  My fiancé and I both started with the salad bar which was fresh and crisp.  I had the 6oz filet wrapped in bacon and drizzled with blue cheese with the asparagus and hollandaise sauce.  My fiancé had the medallions with a broiled tomato with blue cheese on top.  Everything was cooked to perfection and delicious.  We were even admiring the food going to other tables such as the loaded baked potato as big as both of our heads and the Filet Oscar.  I wish I could remember our server's name because he was very good.  He was very knowledgeable about the menu and the pieces of art on the wall!  He was attentive without hovering.  I will definitely return to Taste of Texas and next time I'm going to do the option where you can pick out your own steak!P.S. We went on a Monday night around 5:30/6:00 pm.  We were able to get seated right away with no reservation but it was packed by 615/630 and many people waiting when we left as well.  I'm not sure what the reservation policy is but it'd be wise to call ahead.

I LOVE this place. The salad bar is amazing. I would seriously come just for the salads here. The steaks are always perfectly cooked. The service is always pleasant. Only thing I would warned everyone is the lines on the weekends and holidays are absurd! I been in one of those lines for 2hours so I say from experience. Other than that, food and service here are great!
