Christmas time is the best time to come see all the beautiful decorations inside and themes in each room. Salad bar is amazing and includes fresh baked breads rolls And cornbreads. I don't recommend their chicken dishes-too dry but steaks- awesome!!

I have no real complaints, it was just "whatever."  The service was very good.  Our waiter was knowledgable, friendly and helpful.The salad bar was pretty good.  Everything appeared fresh and there were some interesting items.  I accidentally dumped something on my plate (marinated veggies?) that were full of cilantro, which was my mistake as I find the taste of cilantro to fall somewhere between bath soap and b-hole.  Not your fault, ToT, that was all me.I strayed from my standard (filet) and ordered the T-Bone w/ garlic butter.  I would recommend getting the garlic butter in the future because I found the steak to just be kind of tasteless.  It wasn't bad.   It wasn't good.  It was whatever.  I also thought it was a little more done than medium rare, as I'd requested.  Ah well.  A  little salt and pepper and the aforementioned butter helped the situation.My SO ordered the ribeye which was more flavorful (duh - fats where it's at!)   The sauteed mushrooms were just sort of whatever as were his potatoes au gratin.  My loaded baked potato was on par with everything else.    Suggestion, ToT:  Put that garlic butter on those mushrooms and then let's talk.I'd planned on going out and dropping some $$$$ on grub on this night and kind of wished that I'd stuck with my gut and gone to Ruth's Chris or Vic & Anthony's or Striphouse or a million other places.  This place has been on my radar and while nothing was "bad," for a $45 steak, I would like for something to be "good."

It's our family Resturant for over 20 years now. The  excellent service the great food and awesome service with the managers overseeing everything so close to ensure the best service. I adore you all in taste of texas

I grew up in Houston and for years when it came time to pick my birthday dinner spot I chose Taste of Texas. Actually, all of the kids in my family did. I have been back a few times as an adult and it remains my favorite restaurant in the world.I will start this review with the drawback--Taste of Texas does not offer reservations and it is very popular, so you should expect a 30-60 minute wait during peak hours. Trust me, it's worth it. The ambiance is low-light, refined western. Once seated by the excellent waitstaff you will immediately have the opportunity to help yourself to the salad and bread bar, which I believe is gratis with your meal. I am a carb fanatic, so my first goal is to attempt to restrain myself from too much of the amazing jalapeno cornbread and hot rolls with the cinnamon and apple butters. After that, obviously Taste of Texas is known for their steak, and there's really no limit to the praise I would heap on the quality of the cuts and the skill of their chefs. If you still have room after that, the Texas Pecan Pie a la mode is a sure bet.I have been trying for years to find a steakhouse that can produce a steak that even approaches their quality with no success. If I knew when my last meal was coming, I would fly down to Houston and go to Taste of Texas.

Terrible experience. Only came here because we got a $200 gift certificate from friends. Both native Houstonians, neither of us had been here in over 10 years. Now we remember why. Salad bar...totally underwhelming. Jason's deli puts this salad bar to shame. The addition of a couple of blueberries, strawberries, or nuts could perhaps move this salad bar forward to the 1990's. For the entrees. I ordered a small filet (6 ounces) rare to medium rare. At the small part was correct. Good thing i doubted the ability to judge temperature, because the steak was almost medium. My husband ordered a 14 ounce bone in filet medium rare. It was so raw by the bone that it was cold. He ate not even 1/2 of it. The server said she would tell the manager. We assumed that was why she disappeared for so long. But no. And the steak wasn't even discounted. No manager apologized. The only good thing about this meal is we can laugh about it later. And the $100 bottle of wine we bought. Which we already have at home at cost us $40.

The best steak I ever had and I have been to a few steakhouses in Texas and back home in Palm Beach.  Great ambiance, phenomenal service and a great salad bar.  Had the NY Strip Steak which was cooked perfectly and enjoyed every single bite.  Will definitely come here again.

This is my parent's favorite steak house, and they eat this stuff every other week. Why cant they go to Luby's like everyone else's parents?Steaks- Definition according to the Eeyore - Bible thick raw slabs harvested from fresh catch of bovinae. Should be aged, then marinated and served just well before to the point of heat exhaustion. Aka  "well done".For pre war rationing, where everything is scarce, this place would be the feast hall of kings and emperors. But in a over indulged, buffet driven post war expansion, any lump under an inch would not fall in to the "Steak" category. Especially in Texas.Food:NY Strip- My choice of cut but not size. And in this monolithic establishment, you get only about 3/4 inch thick, not aged, and no pre seasoning. I've seen steaks in local grocery that will make these billets look like a razor. Flemings and Perry's throw cuts like these in the dumpsters. B-Salad bar- Thats what the main meal eats, it's the feed for the lower chain(And Hippies)? This is a Meat House? CBack in the Hoover era, where a Chicken in every pot was the promise.  And apparently my parents has hung on to these ideals, along with sweater vests and tube tv's. So while I crave the variety of Luby's, at least it's quality time with the rents where everyone seems happy and content.

One of my favorite steak houses in Houston!Their steaks are always well cooked and prime cuts! You are even able to select your own cut from their in-house butcher. Their waitstaff are always friendly and attentive and the decor inside is pleasant. They have an extensive wine selection to match their great steaks! They definitely charge a premium for their meals, but its definitely worth it! They also have one of the best salad bars I've ever come across!Perfect place to celebrate a special occasion, or if you just want a good well cooked steak!

Absolutely best steakhouse in Houston! My favorite place to stuff myself with a great meal for a great price.Atmosphere: A mixture of a classy and casual steakhouse. You can dress in shorts and a polo, or dress up in slacks and feel at home either way. Service: Great service every time.Food: Their salad bar is fresh and amazing. Stocked with a variety of fresh bread, and a even larger variety of salad toppings. Their spreads for the bread is to die for. There is also a fruit bar with the best tasting pineapples I've ever had in my life. The steaks are melt-in-your-mouth delicious, nothing much more to say about that. Be sure to add their garlic butter!They DON'T take reservations so come early or you'll be waiting over an hour. They do have a large waiting room with free drinks, popcorn, and chips. They also have a bar in the waiting room. Also come on your birthday for free dessert!Fun fact about Taste of Texas: They refuse to make a chain at a different location because they want ensure the best quality for their restaurant.

I use to think that a steak was just a steak. I use to even claim to cook a better stake then I could buy, which was true for the average steakhouse, and then I ate at Taste Texas. I now understand what a true steakhouse should be.You will have to get in line and wait behind the throngs of people who also enjoy this place, but it is well worth a decent wait. The complementary salad bar and the delicious sides make this my favorite all around steakhouse.

this place is definitely for meat lovers! i love how you are able to choose your steak from a fresh selection, however i think it can be improved...image-wise. -Jalapeno Stuffed Shrimp: their best appetizer, the sauce is probably made with crack. i can eat it with anything! -Jumbo Lump Crab Cake: it was....okayyy. best one i had was still at Eddie V's (surprisingly) -Porterhouse Steak: get this medium-rare drenched in garlic butter and thank me later-Filet mignon: so tender so juicy! loved it!-Cowboy Steak: even at medium-rare..this cowboy was too dry for my taste-Chocolate cake: so deadly delicious!will be trying the the prime rib and tomahawk on my next visit and the awesome looking pecan pie!
Pros: Great Service & Wonderful Salad BarCons: Mediocre Steaks. When I'm paying  for prime steaks, I expect a little more.

so I am a vegetarian reviewing a steak house lolWith that said if you eat steak, Taste of Texas has some of the best cuts of meat and the steaks are quite delicious!They also have a wonderful salad bar that has a great variety of fresh veggies. Definitely a place to eat if your visiting Houston and you are looking to satisfy your inner carnivore :)

This place never ceases to amaze me. Their steaks are great and so is their 10 inch chocolate cake (order this if you are in a party of 4 or more). If you need your steaks to be medium rare then order for medium rare plus as I feel they under cook your order. You cannot go wrong by choosing TOT.

This is an incredible steakhouse that my family and I have enjoyed eating at about an average of once/twice a year, since 1997.  The salad bar is always fresh with a great selection even including delicious breads, spreads and a couple cheeses.   The sides are always good too.  We usually get a baked potato or baked potato soup.   Most importantly their steaks are phenomenal.  They've gone up in price, but so has beef in general. I'm a ribeye fan myself.   I won't order a steak anywhere less than a place like T of T.  Always good quality, good cuts, and grilled just the way I like it.  If we had more money I would come more often; but Taste of Texas is a special occasion indulgence to us.  It's a guaranteed good meal and good experience, many other higher end places I feel like I am taking more of a risk at as far as quality for the price.  Also lots of Texas and cattle history here.  My daughter's class even got to take a very educational field trip to Taste of Texas (not during regular dining hours).  The owners are Texas proud and know their history.  Also the management, hostesses and servers are all friendly and professional.

The Texas Standard for a city with hundreds of steakhouses. So what sets this place apart? First, their waiting area is superb - which is good for a place that does not take reservations and will not seat you until your full party is there. Free sodas, popcorn, and plenty of room while you wait = amazing. But the real reason this place is the best is the food. I normally get the porterhouse for two, which comes with a couple sides and their tremendous salad bar. The greens are fresh and they have warm bread with cinnamon honey butter. You can get your steaks with garlic butter - my favorite - or lemon pepper and you can even pick out your own steak! By far the best steak I've had in Houston.
Absolutely one of the best steak dinners I've ever had. Superb service and awesome food. No complaints and would highly recommend.

For starters, try the quail bites - they are incredible.  Pick any size filet and you will be pleased and you likely won't need a steak knife.  The desserts are HUGE and amazing.  There is something for everyone here.What makes this place special is all of the history.  While you are waiting for your order, take some time and explore all the artifacts on the wall.  Make sure to check in with the host to a guide before taking the walking tour.

It's official...I give this place 5 stars and I will send all my friends here when they are looking for some bada55 Prime Rib and excellent service.  Love it!My SO and I went here for my birthday dinner.  We had the crab cake appetizer to share since we knew we were going to pig out on beef!  I had the prime rib and the hun got the ribeye.  The waiter asked if we wanted to head back to the kitchen to pick out the ribeye, but we were like, "No thanks, I'll let the chef do his job...I trust you guys."We went to the salad bar and enjoyed all the fresh veggies and deliciously decadent breads.Our entrees came out and everything was cooked perfectly medium rare to both of our liking.  We shared a bit of everything and was able to save half of each cut of meat to enjoy the next day.  The waiter asked if we were out for a special occasion and we said it was my birthday AND I was craving some beef!At the end of the meal, homeboy comes out with a huge slice of pecan pie and vanilla ice cream.  You usually get cinnamon ice cream with the pecan pie, but my hun sneaked off and told the waiter I love my classic vanilla ice cream.They took a picture of me and my birthday pie.....not thinking anything of it...then before we left, our waiter came by with a cute TOT card with a picture of me cheesing over my pecan pie..hilarious!!  For a free pie, that thing was delicious...we couldn't even finish that big ol' slice.So I've been here for lunch and dinner...I conclude that everyone should check this place out.

We went here for my boyfriend's cousin's birthday dinner. We didn't make a reservation thinking that it wouldn't be busy on a Tuesday night, but boy.. we were wrong! AND they don't take reservation =/When we arrived, which was around 7-8pm. We were told that they were on a 45 minuted wait.. what?? on a Tuesday night?? the restaurant was packed and the first thing in my head was, "this place must be that good".While waiting, we were told that they serve free drinks, chips and salsa, and pop corn on the waiting area. When we went to grab some snacks, I was actually pretty amaze how comfortable their waiting area was! I liked the fact that you can already snack on something and have some place comfortable to hang out while waiting for a table. When we were called, it was actually a lot faster than we were told. We were sat immediately and was greeted politely by our server. Food was great and the boyfriend loved his steak. I enjoyed my meal and so was the desert! A great steakhouse and it's awesome that you get to actually make your own salad too. No complains, and I had a wonderful experience dining in to Taste of Texas.Downside... they have no valet. My boyfriend was quite disappointed since it was a bit hard finding a parking spot. :P that's just because he's a spoiled brat :DI will definitely come back again!

BEST UNLIMITED SALAD BAR EVERRRRRRRRRRRR!!!   Definitely one of the highlights.  There are gargantuan blocks of cheese that you can shave off and there are no limits.  It comes with the best bread bar (several different kinds) and the best salad spread!  They have cuts of meat to choose from in the back of the restaurant on display and it pretty much looks like a butcher shop.  As you get seated, this is a special treat that they offer, so you can see where the steaks are housed.  New Yorks Strips, tenderloins, t-bones. porterhouses, rib eyes... I'm beginning to drool.  Their steaks are extremely tender even when they are well done!  Btw, let's say your not satisfied with the way your steak is cooked.  They will gladly take it back and recook your steak until you are completely satisfied.  No questions asked!  Be sure to cap the night off with dessert!  You're going to shell out a lot of $$$, but its worth it, especially for any special occasion!The owner has his staff trained well when it comes to top of the line customer service.  They treat everyone like a king or queen.

One of my favorite places for a special occasion, I really don't know what else to say that everyone else hasn't said!  Christmas decorations are beautiful this time of the year, atmosphere is very pleasant, and the service is excellent!  Be ready to wait on the weekends, but it's definitely worth it.  They have popcorn and chips and salsa available in the bar to snack on, but don't fill up, you'll definitely want to leave room for the awesome salad bar and of course, your steak!

The ambiance, the refreshments while you wait and the nobody's more important than the next guest approach is inviting in this "everyone's somebody" day and age. The food is top notch as is the service and so reasonably priced that sometimes I question going elsewhere for steak.
Great place to take out of town visitors for the ambiance .  However better steaks can be had at many other places.

Believe the hype...this is a great place to enjoy a steak!!!Not only do they have a great salad bar, hot baked breads, and allow you to pick your own steak, but they provide free soft drinks and chips and salsa in their waiting room if you find yourself in the midst of a large crowd and you are "on the list."You can only make reservations if you have a party of 6 or larger. Expect to find large crowds on the weekends. My favorite steak is the Rib-Eye, cut to size at $2.00 per ounce (minimum 16 ounces). I always choose from the marbled side of the steak and cooked medium rare. If you can only take your friends to one place for a steak, then you have to go to Taste of Texas!!!

In my humble opinion on of the best places to get a steak!  Meals are a little pricey but well worth it.  It is noisy and a little crowded at times.  But I always enjoy going there.  The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

This place sets the standard for all steakhouses - in Texas and around the world. The Taste of Texas is a legend in Houston. I'm always a fan of the complimentary soft drinks in the waiting area,  not so much a fan of the wait however. Definitely try to make a reservation. I however never hesitate to wait seeming as the food is to die for and always a must stop every trip to Houston. The steaks are perfection and the breads are amazing. Their soft bread and cinnamon butter - to die for. Screw the carbs.Also, the rustic decor is awesome. Probably looks like President Bush's ranch house. They even have their own secret service looking agents who stalk the restaurant and coordinate a smooth dining experience. Nothing but the best in Texas!

I love this place and hate this placeThe wait here is horrendous Please come way earlyWe came on a Friday at 5 pm and we came right in and had a blast. Now when we left the line was two hours long. Our waiter today was Johnny and he was excellent. Patient with us especially since we had kids. definitely get the filet mignon

We had high expectations and were terribly disappointed.  Looking at the photos of the dining areas on line one cannot truly see that the interior of this restaurant is more of a barnyard or chuckwagon style.  There's nothing wrong with that all --  if the food is good and worthy of the prices.  An outdoor picnic table is just fine as long as the food is good!!  And here at the Taste of Texas unfortunately it is not.  We arrived at 6 pm to avoid the 2 hour wait and only had to wait 20 minutes in the barn style bar where popcorn, salsa and chips are complimentary.  Nice touch but would have preferred to be able to make a reservation.  The bone-in filet mignon ($56) was ordered medium rare and came to the table RARE...very RARE.  The sauted spinach was nothing special.  The crab cake was heavily laden with cheese and a total waste of crab meat.  The salad bar was impressive with many options available.  The sound level is quite loud making conversation difficult.  The restaurant was clean and service was efficient without being intrusive.While it appears to be a popular place, if you are looking for a really good PRIME BEEF steak and a nice ambiance while spending the same OR LESS money -- try Pappas Steakhouse, Vic & Anthony's or Ruth Chris.

One of the Best Steakhouse's unique to Houston. I fell in love with this place the first time I came here. It has great food, reasonably priced, and a good atmosphere. I know many people have their preferences on steakhouse, but if you have a first timer to Houston, I think its a great option. People that want a Fancier atmosphere I wouldnt recommend it this location. This place has a great salad bar and this is definitely one of the things I enjoy most along with an excellent selection of desserts!

We went to Taste of Texas with my family and had a helluva time. While there are other options available (chicken, fish), this place is known for their steak so we all had different steaks (filet mignon, prime rib, New York strip) and they were all amazing! Our waiter offered for us to go pick out our own steaks from the butcher shop, but we decided to just trust his judgement. We also got to try a bunch of their different sides, including a baked potato, spinach, mushrooms and Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was particularly good. Any main entree also comes with access to the GIANT salad bar. The selection provided is definitely solid and a great start to the meal. Be sure not to fill up on your salad though, because the steak sizes are HUGE! There is also a wise variety of desserts available but after our huge steaks and salad, we didn't have room for any of it (bummer!). This place is definitely really expensive (about 50 per person), but it's a worthwhile splurge once in a while.
Great food, great service, beautiful place!! I love eating here. Great for special occasions.

Everything here is wonderful! The wait is long, but very tolerable; walk in, put your name on the list, and find seating in a SEATED waiting area. Enjoy complimentary sodas, chips/salsa, and popcorn while you wait! Time will fly by! Honestly, the best part about this place is the salad bar; cheese, cornbread, rolls, and cactus salad dressing on my salad are a must. My only complaint is that the last time my family and I came here, we ordered the stuffed shrimp and as always, it was delicious. This time though, we were all extremely itchy after eating the meal...and none of us have known allergies to anything really, so I thought that was a bit iffy. As for dessert, you can't go wrong with any of the cheesecakes or chocolate mousse. Pass on the creme brulee; it wasn't all that.

This review could easily by a 4 or 5 star, but I actually had a problem with the service.  I will get to that in the end though.  The food was great.  There was a wait of about 30-45 minutes, but I was pleased that the waiting room had lots of room, self serve beverage, warm chips and thick salsa, and popcorn.  Topping that off there was free wifi.  It didn't feel like it took long to get seated.I'm a meat person, but I really liked the salad bar.  It was simple but had the nicer items I like - i.e. sun dried tomatoes.  The balsamic vinegarette was a little thick, but mix that with mushrooms, cheese, red onion, and a spring mix and you have the typical salad served at weddings  The bread was soft and went really well with their cinnamon butter spread.I ordered the prime rib and it was delicious.  Bite for bite.  The crust was not over seasoned.  Juicy and delightful.  They will give you regular horseradish instead of just the cream if you ask for it.  The Texas Au Gratin Potatoes were a little too creamy/soggy for me, but it was ok.  In general, the sides seemed typical.So my only real problem - service.  I got a salad twice.  The 2nd time I got my salad, I had to ask my server for cracked pepper.  I did not think I was rude in asking.  I think she just didn't see me get another serving. She replied - oh yeah, no problem - in a normal tone of voice, BUT she had this really bad scowl on her face.I could live with that, but here's what made the night really weird for me. I ate with 2 friends.  So while they went to get fruit at the end, I was looking for someone to flag down to give my credit card to pay for the entire meal.  A lady comes by, sees me and grabs my card. I tell her, "Thanks. Please make sure the other people don't pay for this."  Later the check comes, I see the total. My card isn't in there.  My friend pays for it, and I just smirk - thinking - hey, they were prob just checking the total and they'd run my card.  The bill comes back, and they ran my friend's card, but my card isn't in there.  I ask the waitress - umm, do you still have my card?  I thought I gave it to you to run.  She looked perplexed and said, "No . . . you gave it to someone?"  I told her I thought it was her or someone that at least looked like her.  She said she's check with the other servers.  We wait 10 minutes, and she gets my card back to me and apologizes.  I didn't want to make a scene, buta) where is the communication with this team?b) what did that other lady think she was going to do with my card?c) why didn't a manager come out and explain/apologizeIf I was in real business meeting, do they realize how embarrassing that looks?a) looks like I didn't care to pay or take care of the situationb) you lost my card and it took a server 10 minutes to check with the different servers to find out?I know I sound like a jerk, but when i pay over $40 for my meal, and if you have managers in suits checking up at tables after the meal is served if everything is alright, I expect that service is one of the important pieces of this restaurant - what else are the guys in jackets getting paid to do? Walk around and ask questions without acting?Do I blame the guys in jackets? Nope.  But if you're wait staff, and there is a problem.  I think fixing it is a little more than just giving you your card back, and it does not leave a good feeling in me wondering what they did with my card.If there is a charge on there, hell will unleash itself.Usually, at pricier restaurants I expect to be able to relax more and for servers to be on their game.  You may need to be more directive and firm with your server here.  I hate having to come off as a jerk when I am at a restaurant.  I don't like to tell people that I need things "drinks refilled, my credit card to be found."  I didn't even have an opportunity for the server to hold on running my friend's card while they looked for mine so I could pay.I will be back for the food, but I will ask for another server if I see the same person.  I will probably kindly ask/get to know the floor manager while I am there next time so there are not any issues

Best steakhouse I have ever been to. Their steaks are certified angus beef (best of the best essentially). I got the new york strip, which was amazing, but I had the taste of the cowboy steak/ribeye and I feel like those were a little more tender and tasty! Also got a tour of the kitchen and it was one of the cleanest kitchens I've been to. Highly recommend going to at least once as it is definitely pricey. You get what you pay for though.

I won't give an opinion on the steak since I am not a steak eater and there are plenty of reviews to read about the steak quality, etc. However, I will review the salad bar:PRO: Quality over quantity. Not as wide of a selection as Fogo BUT it is waaaay better, hence opening statement. A must try is the cilanro vinaigrette and the tomato and mozzarella salad mixture. Mmmmm. Cinnamon butter on the rolls is fantastic and the jalapeno cornbread has a soft sweet taste to it (I picked the jalapenos out and no, no lingering jalapeno taste). CON: WHY DO RESTAURANT STILL SERVE SALAD ON PLATES???? HOW IN THE WORLD DO YOU MIX YOUR SALAD UP??? IT IS IMPOSSIBLE. Really irritates me. Taste of Texas should look into getting deep salad bowls. So annoying when my lettuce leaves are falling off my plate while I am trying to mix everything together.I had to LOL when I asked the waiter about their flavored tea. His repsonse: "We have a fine flavored tea that is specially made in Austin. It's called... Sweet Leaf." Ok give me a break. Don't try to make it sound like it was imported from France. Good grief. I have a huge bottle of the Mint flavor at home that I bought from TARGET. Ridic. Snickers pie is a must for dessert. Delicious. Heavenly. Unhealthy as hell. But then again, it's a steakhouse!
Their salad bar is *gorgeous* crab cake is love and their steak so good. The super plus for me when we went there on valentine's day was that they have sunflower everywhere!!!

Love this place--my husband and I were there for the first time this week. We didn't have to wait very long to be seated since we went during the week. The food was great, we had the stuffed shrimp, New York strip and the pecan chicken (I think, I don't remember the name). What we were most impressed by was the service...our waiter was super attentive and very friendly. We had a great dinner--will definitely be back, soon I hope.

My family and I were on holidays from Australia and were only in houston for a couple of days. We thought while we were in texas might as well try a steak house. We got to this establishment and were greeted and were taken to our tables. Our waitor Jason embodies customer service he was not over the top and was very approachable. Jason took our orders and also asked where we were from, now once Jason had learned we were here for a couple of days and he went and got us neckerchiefs and hats for us to have a photo in. After the photos he let us keep the neckerchiefs and the photos were printed out for us while we waited for our meals. Not only does this establishment have the best customer service i have ever recieved but the food was the best i and my family have ever tasted.The steak i ordered was cooked to perfection and dont get me started on the dessert.Thankyou to Jason for making our trip to your establishment a memorable one

Decided to give this restaurant a try for dinner actually it has been a very long time since I have dined here more 12 years to be precise.  Moving right along3 stars for service, minus 2 due to crowd and unsavory element.  I guess I'm a snob when it comes to steakhouses, Good points you get to visit their butcher shop and pick and choose your steak if you wish.  I went with Ribeye and it was cooked to my liking, salad bar was nice as well.  Bad points I expected too much I guess 12 years ago Houston did not have other great steakhouses like today, I figuredthey would roll with the times instead of letting people with FLIP FLOPS dine in what is considered above average dining.I am sorry to say I will not return.
Had the 10 oz center cut steak and the scallion potatoes. It was amazing. I got to pick the steak I will be eating that night! It also had an all you can eat salad bar!

I've never been a huge red meat fan, now I'm addicted. The steaks (Bone-in filet is my favorite) here are so tender and flavorful. Ask for garlic butter if you don't want the filet oscar. The salad bar has a great variety of options and the breads are amazing. The mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes are also a fav.

Always enjoy coming here. Steaks are fantastic! Salad bar is okay - bigger selection would be nice, but I won't complain. Since I changed my eating habits, I've also had grilled veggie plate here and grilled chicken, both fantastic. Great service - very attentive people. BUT, be sure to get here early or you will be waiting (not the end of the world - free non-alcoholic beverages and snacks).

The food here is not only fantastic but it's mega portions so you definitely get your money's worth. I've been here quite a few times and I have to say for each time it's been top notch. Epic prime rib, filet mignon and NY strip are served up here. Desserts are decadent and will put you in a blissful sugar daze. Another yelper noted that their "done-ness" in cooking your steak is a little off (good tip, btw) and it's true that every steak place will have their own idea of "done-ness". Just be really specific with them and you'll be satisfied. I like my steaks med-rare and my NY strips somewhat rare. So far they've done an A-ok job. The decor is very relaxing in a cozy romantic way. Seats are comfy and you can relax and enjoy the scenery while you wait for your  food. Depending on your time of arrival, wait time can be none to long. Yes, it can be a long wait but the waiting area is comfy and large enough so you don't feel overcrowded. This place also serves some of the best burgers. If you're wanting a good burger for lunch and are in the area then head on in and they'll fix you up. I say give this place a try if you haven't already. You'll be happy you did.

Amazing food will definitely go back.  I had the prime rib cooked to perfection with horseradish  Brussel sprouts with bacon jam were to die for. We also had the bacon wrapped  center cut filet which was amazingly tender. The salad bar is wonderful everything is so fresh and the hot bread is delicious. We also had the apple dumpling absolutely sinful!!!
ribeye steak by 16oz is perfectly fine,jumbo lump crab cake is very tasty.fresh salad all u can eat

I haven't been back here in ages.  We visited a few weeks ago at a busy time...a Saturday night.  You can't make reservations and the wait is about an hour long.  I think the decor is not as nice as I remembered.  The customer service was ok.     I ordered the Tomahawk steak medium rare, and it blew me away.  The display was beautiful, and it tasted like perfection!  The salad and bread bar buffet was good as well. I have been to many upscale steakhouses, and I must say Taste of Texas is spot on when it comes to great taste and reasonably priced.  I will definitely revisit again with my family.  I know now not to come on a Saturday night at 8pm.  I can still taste the Tomahawk steak in my mouth.  Delicious!!!

Salad Bar: 4/5Texas Onion Soup: 4/5Porterhouse Steak: 4/5Cowboy Steak: 4/5 - This was a 24 oz. bone-in ribye.Slice of Heaven: 4/5Service: 5/5 - The service was top notch. All of the staff was very friendly. There was a waiting area w/ several tables & complimentary sodas, chips, & popcorn. There were also 2 bars where people could wait. It's nice that the restaurant had waiting customers in mind.Ambience: 4/5 - It's a steakhouse w/ a family atmostphere

My husband and I were looking for a good date night restaurant. We loved how they have free fountain drinks while you wait for your table. We loved the salad bar, the breads, ambience, the 16 oz. steak we shared, and the mac and cheese. Very lovely dinner. We hope to go back for more date nights!

It's one of the Houston's "Bring Your Guest" locations.  If your guest is international, tell your waiter so they can make your guest wear a bandana and cowboy hat.  They'll take your picture and you can post it on facebook!  lolThe steaks are good, but if you are serious about meat...check out the Tomahawk.  That is caveman dining!
What a great place to come for any reason or a top celebration. We love it. The steaks are always cooked perfectly.

You think eating steak is a game? You better think again my friend.Having only one location (that I know of), Taste of Texas is my favorite steak place to go in Houston. It may not be the best but definitely worth every dollar you spend there. The salad bar (which you can get by itself for around $9-$10) is all you can eat and the filet mignon, bacon wrapped, with salt and pepper butter is THE best.Come early my friends, because this place does NOT take reservations. The wait can get up to almost 2 hours. They have free chips and salsa, drinks, and popcorn when you wait. Also, during the holidays, they have a buy $100 get $25 free in gift cards. Definitely a great gift to give to loved ones.

Food is great, blah blah. Just a note for an unprofessional service experience:Dinner was over and the waiter came with the check. We gave $100 cash for the meal ($65) and gave it to the waiter, who did see the money. His response was "Thanks, I'll go get your change -- unless you don't need it". I'm sorry, but if that was a joke, that is strikingly inappropriate in a restaurant such as this one.

Oh my goshhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Sweet baby jesus this place is probably THE best place place I've eaten in Houston. Went here for birthday dinner (and because we had a giftcard) on a Wednesday night and was greeted by an overflowing parking lot and an hour wait. Really?? On a Wednesday night? It's not like this place is some teeny tiny restaurant, this place is huge and it's packed. Whatever. I'll wait. It's smells really good, I'm enjoying the atmosphere and quite honestly I'm intrigued by what is so special about a place that has an hour wait on a Wednesday night. Now, I'm not much of a steak eater...in fact I cannot remember the last time I ate (let alone ordered) a steak BUT the steaks here literally melt in your mouth. No joke. The best steak I think I've ever had. Not to mention, Taste of Texas, has a fantastic salad bar complete with delicious bread you help yourself to all before your cooked to perfection meal arrives. Now, if the meal alone isn't enough to dazzle you the service is equally as fantastic as the meal.I cannot say enough positive things about this place. Even if your not a steak eater, GO. Even if you look at the menu and think perhaps its a tinch on the pricy side, GO. Even if you have to wait an hour to be seated, GOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!! It's totally worth every penny you pay and every minute you wait.

I brought my bf here for his first Texan steak (to prove that yes, Texas really is cooler than California). He (fittingly) got the Cowboy steak- 24 oz. of pure meatiness- and loved it. I, on the other hand, really enjoyed the salad bar like many other yelpers. My favorites were cheesy bread that looks like a cinnamon roll, jalapeno cheese cornbread where you can actually taste the pepper, cinnamon whipped cream, honey roasted almonds, and the tomato and mozzarella salad. Our waitress was so sweet and took us to the back to see the meats. She was also really patient with us while we took 30 mins just to pick out what we wanted. We came on a Thursday and the wait was around 30 mins. They have free wi-fi so time went by pretty quickly... The restaurant is so cozy and doesn't have that stuffy air that other steak houses have. I'm definitely coming back for the lump crab cake and desserts.

For a first time visit, Taste of Texas was absolutely  disappointing. This establishment is most definitely overrated as for quality, pricing, and experience. Within our group of 5, I myself along with two others requested for our steaks to be prepared as medium while the other two requested medium well. When the steaks had arrived at our table, the inconsistency of how all our steaks were prepared was unacceptable. Some were well done while others had different shades of pink centers. Mind you that these were $40+ steaks prepared at a  highly reviewed steak house, and it was poorly executed to any degree. My $50 cowboy steak was so well done beyond medium, I insisted for another to be prepared. By the time it had arrived, the rest of the group had already completed their meal which completely ruin my experience dining as a  group dinner. Besides the garlic butter flavoring the dish, the steaks were bland as if there were no signs of aging or seasoning. Even Killen's steakhouse in Pearland can present a better tasting steak. The  management staff thought that offering me a free dessert would make everything right which I thought was completely insulting. For the management staff and those who brag great reviews about Taste of Texas, obviously you all have not experienced the best of both worlds with the high price tag that you're paying for. As a  major food critic who traveled and tasted great steaks from many destinations, Texas by far falls to the  bottom of the recommended list. Many steak houses within Chicago and New York city limits would definitely make you reconsider on bragging about Taste of Texas!

This is where you are driving for 12 hours looking to Yelp for help, aka "yelp help" to find the perfect place to relax and have the best steak ever in Houston. Our first time here, so glad we stopped! From our entrance to our exit, superb service. Everyone made us feel like we were special and allowed us the courtesy of taking our time. Drinks, salad bar to die for, steaks cooked to perfection. I had prime rib that was excellent and probably the best ever. Not over spiced or salted, very tender and tasty, also ordered at our table, the filet and New York Strip, perfectly finished. Dessert was Pecan pie.  Loved the suits running around the dining room making sure all is well! The sign of truly excellent customer service.

This is hands down the best steakhouse I have ever eaten at. The service is brilliant and the steaks are the best I've eaten. There is no place in the world that can beat a steak made from American Certified Black Angus Beef. The salad bar is also very great with some good selections. I recommend the quail bites for appetizer and the cowboy ribeye for steak. Best I've ever eaten. Also the filet is so tender you can nearly cut it with your fork.

First visit. We were impressed by the grounds. Ambience is quiet and causual. Love the decor as well. Excellent service. Our waitress Rebekah has excellent customer service. She explained everything to us. She was awsome.  Loved picking out my steak in the butcher area. When our steaks were served they were perfect. Thanks for a delightful experience.

It's really hard to only give TofT 2 out of 5 stars but I couldn't honestly state it was "A-OK. (3 stars)"  I regularly visit steakhouses in Houston and never experienced TofT until this weekend.  I was hesitant to try a new steakhouse just because there are so many that already have so much to offer.  When we came in I instantly realized this wasn't an upscale steakhouse like what we are used to.  In fact, I saw patrons in ball caps, hoodies, etc.  Most nice steakhouses wouldn't allow this--it was more like a group from Golden Corral.  Anyways, we were seated and had a nice server; again, the service doesn't compare to upscale restaurants (you'll understand shortly why I keep comparing them to upscale steakhouses).  The food was great, the wine prices were actually refreshing but the biggest issue came with their ribeye:  it's the price you'd pay at a 4-5 star restaurant but tastes something like you'd get at Golden Corral.  It was perfectly cut and perfectly grilled; however, it had ZERO flavor.  The manager mentioned that their steaks are "supposed" to be enjoyed with one of their sauces but, in my opinion, true steak lovers don't add "garlic butter sauce" on top of a steak.  The manager mentioned also that they don't season the steaks, only using the sauce.  This makes ZERO sense.  Anyways, when it was all said and done you're footed a bill that is comparable to the upscale steakhouses in Houston but you're paying for a Golden Corral atmosphere.  The service is not upscale, the food quality is good, the steaks are definitely not upscale but you're paying a premium.  I would prefer to dine at several different restaurants for the same price.  Two steaks, an appetizer and a decent bottle of wine came out to about $190 for the two of us.  I've never paid more than that at Pappas, Ruth's, Morton's, etc.  Did I mention it has a salad bar?  Another reason to compare it to Golden Corral. I'm always open to try new places but we definitely will not revisit TofT unless the prices decrease 15%-20%.

The taste of Texas really means The Taste of Texas, came here early because I heard there's usually a line or wait so we came before they opened. They have refreshments outside for people the drink for free while waiting which is always a plus. When we went inside the atmosphere was amazing as we were greeted by almost every server inside. We ordered the ribeye and also a prime rib which included some yummy sides and also a visit to the salad bar. The salad bar was amazing as it had many different salads and additional a such as cheeses fruits, different breads and any other things. When our drinks was brought to us they bought a big vase full of soda for us to self pour which was pretty nice. The main meal came and it was just fantastic, meat was so tender and juicy def one of the better places in Houston to get steaks. All this plus the fantastic service provided by them they deserve 5 stars

No one does steak like Taste of Texas!!! It ROCKSSSS my socks off and then some :)This place is usually crowded during prime dining time and weekends. It's first come, first serve and no reservations are accepted. Not to worry though, they have a separate waiting area for you to sip on complimentary beverages (or buy some drinks at the bar), chips & salsa, & popcorn! Although snacking is tempting, try to refrain from it because you need your stomach empty so you can fill up on the MOST FLAVORFUL steak you've ever tasted! You can actually hand-pick your own steak (should you want to) and the servers are always helpful with their menu recommendations. Their salad bar is very fresh and I just can't get enough of their delicious warm bread!!!! (don't forget the specialty butters!)It is indeed steak heaven for all you carnivores out there!
Great service, awesome and fresh salad bar. Their steaks are delicious. I have tried their burger and it was just ok, I wouldnt order it again.
Not a classic Steak House but great meat cuts and good quality service. Decent wine list but you won't get that Classic Steakhouse feeling
This is my first time being to taste of Texas and definitely won't be my last. This place have great steak is so juicy and tender for the price is very reasonable.

Love the steak and service! Had a fantastic dinner with cousins today. Love our dinner starting from the appetizer and bread!i ordered filet mignon for myself and cousins shared tomahawk steak and Ribeye! We all love it. Our awesome server, Danny, was friendly and attentive! He showed us around the "raw meat zone" and you got to choose your own steak! We were all too full to have dessert! Love it! Will go back for sure!

Okay where to start.. taste of Texas is a very appealing place the staff is very friendly, everyone speaks. So when we being seat I just love that about the restaurant.  Our waiter was excellent in explaining the menu, season and other pecks of the restaurant.  So when it came to ordering our steaks we decided to let her pick it. Okay so my steak was supposed to be medium well. No no no it was like totally uncook. Very tough not alot of season. But the mac and cheese 5*... then my husband steak supposed to be well done. Well it was pink. All the way.. uggggghhjhhh he hate to complain he's one those people that doesn't complain just pay and never go back.  But you know I was really disappointed because of the views and my coworkers opinion about how great it was., my experience wasn't at all.

Hands down, my favorite restaurant. This is a great place to treat out-of-towners whether they are family, friends and it is especially great for business dinners as they have a good selection of wine and spirits. Taste of Texas does a great job of creating an atmosphere that can feel relaxed and upscale at the same time.I cannot say they serve the absolute "best" steaks in town (Sullivan's/Perry's, etc.) but they are very close.Huge waiting area with comp popcorn, chips and salsa and soft drinksSalad/Bread bar (included with meal, unbeatable)Steak served on sizzling plate with option of garlic butterGreat selection of desserts (go with snickers cheesecake and/or pecan pie)Consistently friendly staff (In 20 years, I have not experienced an unsatisfactory waiter)Décor filled with Texas historyRibeye is currently $2.35 an ounce, strip is $47.95. Not bad when you consider the comp waiting refreshments, salad bar and side are included.Do not look up any other steak restaurants, just go to the Taste of Texas.

My dad normally gets gift cards to Taste of Texas every year from his company and usually we go as a family around Christmas time. Prior to going I had heard this place was pretty well known for their steaks and that they definitely do get busy.  The wait is definitely no joke, especially during holiday seasons but they make the wait bearable, offering an entire lounge area to hang out in with a full bar. Not to mention the free popcorn, chips and sodas that is at your service while you eagerly wait to be seated. I think their salad bar is one of my favorites as well. Fresh salad, a cheese cutting station and their bread selection is diverse. The cheesy bread and corn bread has to be my favorite and it's always fresh!I always get the Porter House Steak for two with my dad, but change my side between the mashed potatoes, sweet potato fries and steak fries. Taste of Texas is probably my favorite steak place. Their steaks are just the right amount of juicy and moist and absolutely flavorful.  So whatever hype they receive is completely warranted and justifiable. Staff is usually friendly and helpful, which will only make your dining experience worthwhile. I definitely recommend that you should at least give this place a try if you're ever in the mood for a good steak. They are pricey and a little fancy, but if you ever want to treat yourself out or want to celebrate any occasion, then Taste of Texas would be a fine choice.

I have been coming here for years.  My parents always get their special during the holiday season where you can buy like 500 dollar gift certificates for 400.  Our family gets 2 of those a year or more.  We are seasoned vets of the menu and my personal favorites are the Rib eye with both spices, the baked brie with fruit.  The steak has great marbling and it is cooked just right, served on an iron slab that retains heat and juices.  The baked brie is in a puff pastry with pecan and honey glaze served with variety of fruits and crackers.  The salad bar which is included in the price of the steaks is all you can eat and some of the favorite items there are the jalepeno cornbread, the cinnamon butter where you can coat all the rolls with.  And an assortment of cheese and nuts to top your salads with.  The salad bar is high quality and truth be told, my parents are satisfied with just eating the salad bar.  However they usually just split the largest filet and get an extra order of salad bar.  This place is a classic, a must if you are from texas!

Visited some friends in Houston and they took the wife and I there for dinner...fantastic. The orders ranged from T-bone to NY Strip to Filet Mignon. All were cooked perfectly. You can order steaks as big as 45 Oz here and all entrees come with a great salad bar and a couple of sides. Don't expect cheap prices here 'cause you won't find any. But the quality of the food is excellent and the service is wonderful.

I've had their bone-in ribeye, boneless rib-eye, and porter house. All were fantastic. They wet-age their meat, which I believe to be inferior to dry-aging, but their steaks are still tasty. They cook them to the appropriate doneness. The salad bar is a nice compliment to the meal, and their desert selection is solid. The place is very TEXAS, in a very good almost over-the-top stereotypical way.

Oh my gosh, yes. I like to meet my family here for our monthly dinners.  Everything at the salad bar is kept super cold, and the cactus dressing is to die for.  Incredible.  The food is always excellent, and if anything does come out incorrectly, they will replace it or fix in the error in no time.  The waiters are always attentive.  Like any great restaurant, you'll probably wait a little while for a table, but they have popcorn and a bar to hold you over. Casual / Dressy attire.
Mediocre, buffet style (yuck!) For the price, I don't want to have to get up and go to the salad bar. Bring it to me!!I'll admit, the pecan pie is awesome, but I doubt it's homemade.

Had the 6oz filet and it was fabulous.  Salad bars usually freak me out but this one was great and I liked having 3 bread choices. Jalapeno cornbread was yummy. Very pricey and the decor reminds me of a cheaper buffet restaurant ( although they do have some cool authentic Texas memorabilia) but overall was a great experience.

This place has the looks and ambience of a Luby's and for some reason is so busy that the wait is horrendous. The salad bar that everyone seems to rave about was so so, certainly nothing special and the New York Strip steaks had less taste than ones I've bought at Walmart. After 2 bites we were adding salt & pepper and looking for the steak sauce to try and add a bit of flavor. This place is ridiculously overpriced considering the food and atmosphere and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone other than my dogs who might get lucky with the amount of leftovers. Save your money, buy a charcoal grill, a couple of steaks from HEB, a jar of Emeril's steak rub and a bottle of decent red wine (at a 5th of the price), you'll have a much more enjoyable experience.Thanks Yelp for letting me get the bad experience of wasting a couple hundred bucks off my chest!

If love is what you seek then you'll undoubtedly find it after a quick visit to their salad bar. I absolutely LOVE the ginormous cheese block you get to help yourself to. Has a great southern/comfortable atmosphere. You're going to want to make reservations though, this place usually has a huge dinner crowd.Not a planner? Eh, no biggie - while you wait for a table you're treated to complimentary soda and popcorn (kudos Taste of Texas! This keeps your taste buds busy as well as the kiddos)Birthdays--they bring a complimentary dessert with a big ol' flaming sparkler on top! AND they snap a quick polaroid of you and put it in a lil paper frame as a keepsake :))Well done Taste of Texas, well done. (golf clap)

I have known about this steak house since I was in High School As I used to go with my family. I recently began visiting here again in the last couple of years. As it is on the expensive side , it is usually a special occasion when we visit. They have an awesome salad bar with breads fruits and different types of lettuces and greens., eggs, mushrooms, carrots etc. the croutons are also good they just need some kidney beans. I love that they have the salad plates cold. The least expensive steak is about $33. I usually chooses the rib eye. And ask for marbling in it for flavor. I let the cook choose my steak although u can choose your own if you wish. The Snickers chocolate dessert is also good which is one of your free choices if you r celebrating your birthday. Another choice is a smaller sample of 3 choices. The service has always been impeccable! Recently went with a larger group of 13 and it was just as prompt. They had several waiters bring out our food at one time to assist our main waiter. There is definitely no lack of manpower! The decor is also very Texas and sort of antiqueish. At Christmas time they have a nice wagon outside to takee pics at. Will have to return and add pics I took at a later time  by the way, I love the garlic butter on my ribeye. Recently, my dentist recommended to try the bone in ribeye....said the taste was really the best!

The service was amazing. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and they took some photos and gave them to us as a gift and also gave us a free dessert. The meat was great but did not like that much the chicken. The salad bar was not that great but the bread was really good. The only bad thing is the waiting time as they do not accept reservations.

Other than a corporate event, first time dining at Taste of Texas. Arrived 6:15 Saturday night, was given 60 to 90 minute wait time for 2. Very casual, many people dressed in shorts and flip flops. 65 minutes to table, no prob. Of note, same drink ordered at waiting bar was $11, $8.50 at table. Food was okay, steaks a little under seasoned. They tried to give us 2 soups and and a duplicate side, some confusion there. Salad bar was okay. Quite frankly it's little more than a fancy sizzler. So many better steakhouses around, Mo's, Vic and Anthony's, Perry's, Capital Grill, Fleming's, etc. Glad we went, see no reason to return.
Amazing service and wonderful staff. Could not ask for a better establishment to dine at. The food was mouth watering and I had the best steak of my life. I also suggest staying for dessert as well

We celebrated my husband's birthday here and had mixed feelings. We were told that it would be a 1.5-2 hour wait so we were pleasantly surprised when only an hour had passed and our number was called. The popcorn and complimentary drinks were very hospitable! I really like that they are unabashedly Christian, but the music didn't seem to fit the environment...maybe some Texas western music would fit the "Come and Take it!" theme more. Our server was very friendly, but we felt that the service was slow. The food was fantastic--great salad bar and bread (especially the yummy butter!), amazing center cut fillet with garlic butter, really creamy mac and cheese, and the Slice of Heaven, which I had been waiting to try for ages was just as splendid as I was told it would be! Besides the slow service, our only other gripe was that we were asked three times if we were celebrating anything, but when our dessert was brought out, there were no sparkler or fuss made. My husband didn't mind, but we kept on seeing other tables with birthday sparklers and it was kind of a bummer!

We had not been here in quite a while. We felt like prime rib and remembered how good they are. Food and drinks were excellent. I used to go to the first location behind T&C mall. Plan on a little wait. Clean,attentive staff. Would not hesitate to recommend. Plan on a short wait to be seated.
The service was great and the food was delicious. We will be back for sure. The waiting area was extremely awesome.

Taste of Texas more like taste of $h!+. Walked in with 7 people to order a big meal. Hostesses was about to seat us and the old bald manger runs up informing my group that I was not able to sit down due to my Superman shirt. And that they have a strict dress code. I walked away with no problem then I watch them sit people in shorts and flip flops. Yet I am not the dress code. I am in Houston working the Something Wicked festival. Had some platinum selling artist with my group. Good way to turn away people who are now using there social media power to bash your spot. I was cool till we saw them seat other people dressed worse than my superman shirt he didn't like. Or in our minds he just didn't like my look. Which is fine. My money is just as green and the lady in flip flops you seated. Absolutely insane the way he acted towards me. Will be letting everyone I know to never show up here. Now we are at Long Horn Steak House where we were greeted and treated with respect. So if you plan on going here make sure not to where a super hero shirt. Didn't realize an Superman S was so unacceptable for Texas.
LOVED the steak but not so much the salad bar. I know this is a stake house but more options would be best.
Every steak I eat here is the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and melts in my mouth. The service is top notch and the pecan pie is to die for.

Had the 6 oz filet that you can cut with a fork. The grilled portobello mushroom side dish was cooked to perfection. And say what you will about old school salad bars; I love the one at ToT. It rocks. Get there early because you will wait during peak hours. But waiting is cool too, as they have complimentary snacks and drinks plus a great bar.

I ate here last week with my parents.  They flew in from California and wanted to get a "Taste of Texas."  So, I took them here.  I had never ate here prior but read several reviews.  The place looks like the what most people who arent from Texas might think all restaurants in Texas look like... very western.  But it has an upscale feel to it.  The food is very delicious.  I ordered the Cowboy Ribeye, Meduim.  Cooked to perfection.  I believe it was 24 oz. I couldn't finish.  The party consisted of my wife, me, and my two parents. Our bill was over $200 (my mom ordered two beers).  We went home and we all took a good hour long nap!A great place to eat occassionally.  Pretty pricey though.
Totally unexpected.  I figured this to be a chain type steakhouse. Not the case. Delicious!!! Nice cuts of certified angus and a very fresh salad bar. I will most certainly be back.
I live this place... Great food, service and it is laid back... The only downside is they don't allow reservations and since the place is so popular there is usually a long wait.

Got the Tomahawk "medium rare", baked potato and salad. Maybe it's their wet aging process or the lack of flavor but I did not enjoy it, it was rubbery and bland, I've had better steak at Golden Corral and the 38oz. claim includes the weight of the arm length bone. The baked potato was so depressing also but the salad, wow! The salad and cheese rolls definitely stand out. If i ever go back, it'll only be for the salad. Do yourself a favor and go to Saltgrass or Pappas Bros. I'll not be coming back here again unless I'm really craving salad and cheese rolls.
Cowboy bone in rib eye steak and keylime pie!!! Perfection every single time I have been here - southern style :)

First time I visited was on my 30th birthday. I decided to go because of my party size and the reviews. I was NOT disappointed! Food is great! Salad bar is comparable to Fogo de Chao. The wait is a bit long but, well worth it! I don't care for Brie but, if you like Brie, you have to try their baked Brie!

I haven't been here in several years and if possible,  they've gotten BETTER!  We all ordered the filets and they were melt in your mouth wonderful.  Salad bar was always good but they somehow found room to improve it.   Needless to say, we all had "happy" plates when we left.   Thank you TASTE OF TEXAS for a wonderful meal. Decor was beautiful as always. Michael, our server was the best-even talked (just kidding) us into the house speciality,  cinnamon ice cream and it didn't disappoint. Don't know where we put it, but we put it away too!  TALK ABOUT GOOD- we  won't wait so long next time.

I'm not real sure what the hype is about this place. Steaks are not bad but they are not amazing like many reviewers say.  Place is way to busy for average steak.  I would rate Del friscos way above this place and the service is way better as well.

I just visited Taste of Texas for the first time, and I was very impressed. The presentation, the amount of food, the quality and the taste were top notch. You can visit the meat case to choose your steak before it's cooked. They have an expansive salad and bread bar, too. I liked the cow trays the steaks were served on. The service was great, too. Our server was very knowledgeable and entertaining.Come early because the wait can be long. We waited about an hour, but it was worth the experience. The decor is very Texas-lodge.
Great place for date night!!! Love the salad bar, and lot of choices from the drinks to the dessert.  And I didn't know they had a compliementry snack while waiting for your table. Awesome.

First time to Taste of Taxes. The decoration and service was very great. We ordered Tomahawk. Garlic butter was not enough.  The beef was very great and huge, for sure. And since it was the first time, they would had a picture of you as a cow boy, which was quite fun. We were so full after finishing the Tomahawk ribeye that we did not try the dessert. Great place. Great food.
Yeeeeeeiiiiiiiiii! My favorite  steakhouse for Ever :DThe salad bar, steaks,desserts, ambience,service... everything is just perfect.

As a girl who was born and raised in Texas, I love steak. It's my favorite food and I can never turn it down. My boss brought us here for Administrative Professionals Day and I've never been happier to be part of the Administrative Professionals of America. After ordering, we started with the salad bar which is exactly what it sounds like.... on steroids. While you are at the salad bar, you can also stop off for some fresh bread that not only includes your basic rolls, but also jalapeno cornbread. AMAZING. Shortly after finishing our salads and more bread than I'd like to admit, my medium-rare center cut filet arrived on a piping hot platter that was shaped like a cow. It just doesn't get more Texan than that. To say I was in heaven would be an understatement. I tried my damned hardest not to inhale the tender filet, but my inner fat girl took over and it was gone soon after. The asparagus with hollandaise sauce was also delicious.Also noteworthy, obviously, is the rustic and southern decor. It had everything you'd expect to see in a restaurant called Taste of Texas. That's all I'm going to say because you just have to see it for yourself.
Enjoyed a wonderful lunch today on my first visit. Wonderful burger, sides were amazing, don't miss the salad bar was the best! Can't say enough good things.
I keep my reviews short and sweet, who wants to read a book when looking for a restaurant. Not me. Taste of Texas is the best steak I have had in town and I have had them all.

There's a reason why people wait an hour for their table at Taste of Texas. (I don't believe that the restaurant even takes reservations--unless you maybe have a big group, but even then I'm not sure.) People don't come here because they're in a hurry, they come because they know they'll have a nice evening from the time they arrive until the time they waddle out. It's one of my favorite places in the world. Seriously. It's not snobby or pretentious and the food is always on point. I'm actually not much of a steak eater, but Taste of Texas has roped me in. I always get the 6-ounce fillet oscar, which comes topped with a crab cake and bearnaise sauce. (You can always request it wrapped in bacon, but my heart slows down, just thinking about that...) From what I can remember, most entrees come with a visit to the salad bar, too, and let me tell you--this is the grand daddy of salad bars. Remember those annoying sorority girls freshman year that always ate salad, because it was "healthy," but they'd come back to the table with buckets of dressing and croutons and nary a leafy green in sight? That's totally me at Taste of Texas. There's too many tasty toppings to  get caught up in that whole lettuce thing.The salad setup isn't massive like Fogo de Chao or anything, but it's all about the details. Texas caviar, fresh vegetables, dressings and at the end, you get to pick up a basket of just-from-the-oven rolls with (drum roll please) CINNAMON BUUUUTTTTEEERRR! Seriously. I want to slather myself in it. Sidenote: Back by the dual salad bars... yes, there are two... guests can go into the kitchen's butcher shop and actually pick their own steaks. How's that for service? It's also evidence that they aren't hiding anything behind closed doors...Beyond the food, I've learned over the years, after talking with staff, how generous the owners are. Most of the servers are in school, so each semester Edd and Nina draw a couple of employees names at random and pay their tuition. I think they have to keep their GPA at a certain level or something, but apparently the owners tell the staff that they want this to be their last serving job, before they join the corporate world. They also offer history tours to the public and elementary school kids regularly to help pay for the tuition program. As a former server, I really respect that.If you want to experience a true local gem and have a steak to remember, you should definitely check it out.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed Taste of Texas yet.  Good:For meatlovers: you will appreciate being able to choose your steak from a fresh selection of the best cuts of your choice.  You can chose your sauces, spices, anything you like to have your steak prepared to order.  It's quite impressive.The service:  outstanding.  No need goes unattended. We were celebrating a birthday - complimentary dessert and photo of your family (not cheesy).  The salad bar - for me (the vegetarian) this was the BEST.  The salad bar is something you will crave weeks after.  The selection is excellent and creative.  Bread and dressings all homemade and fresh.Tortilla soup - this is a meal in and of itself.  I did the "soup and salad" - i was stuffed.  The soup is delicious.Mac and Cheese side is rich, delicious, and not overly salty.  Collard greens - to die for.Bad:This place gets busy - make a reservation.Not a ton of stuff on the menu for veggie eaters - but boy, that salad bar is enough!In general, this is a special night out kind of place - its fabulous, filling, and a great way to experience a real Texas steak.  Everything is farm fresh and will not disappoint.
Great food and great service. Good wine list with a lot of variety in terms of price and variety. The ambience is cosy and friendly. Will be back

I have been going here for close to 30 years. The beef is always excellent. The staff is attentive. The atmosphere is casual but upscale. I LOVE the salad bar. It is always beautiful and fresh. Their cheesy bread is to die for. The owners, the Hendees, are a great local family. They are active in the community and share generously through charity. The value at TOT is great, and even then, I feel good spending my money there. The only drawback is their no reservation policy. I understand it. But, will never wait 2 hours for a table. We usually time our visits mid-week, or exactly when they open the doors. Great for special family dinners and business meals alike.

Best steak in Houston coupled with the best service in Texas.  I just don't eat there enough.  Thank you for working so hard on training your staff.  Seems like Taste of Texas makes an effort to hire students and veterans for waiter jobs, knowing that the are sometimes short-term employees.  Everything at this place is done RIGHT.

Yet another former favorite that I've grown out of.. Growing up in the Houston area our third grade class took a field trip out to ToT to listen to stories about Texas history and have lunch, it was an awesome experience for an eight year old.. Coming back to ToT every once and awhile over the years it was a meal to look forward to, but in the last five years I honestly think I've just out grown the place.. The salad bar, apps and desserts are just boring and the Prime rib, while roasted well (as in perfectly) just doesn't have much going on to keep me interested. None of the other steaks are graded, other than labeled as "Black Angus", they however are never tough or tasteless. Prices are very affordable considering the location and the size of servings. Service has always been topnotch and welcoming and the wine list is very well priced, while offering wine flights now..   Overall take family and friends from out of town who have never been to a "Texas Steakhouse" before, but pass on ToT if you're looking for steak and potatoes prepared with a bit more finesse.FYI- ToT does NOT take reservations no matter how big or small the party. Wait times on the weekends for dinner will range from 45mins to an hour and a half..

Taste of Texas is the epitome of "Everything is Bigger in Texas". The restaurant is HUGE!!!! I believe there is over at least 50 people working there at a time. There is so much seating around the restaurant. I got lost trying to go to the bathroom. It's impressive how they maintain such a long wait even with a huge restaurant like this. They make your wait easier by offering complimentary popcorn in the waiting room.The food portions are HUGE! They have a 32 ounce porterhouse steak that they specifically have an option to share with another person. If you order some of the larger steaks you get to go to their "butcher shop" in the back and pick your own meat yourself. Most meals come with a trip to the salad bar which is you know the word - HUGE. Tons of options for you to go salad crazy and if you like cheese like me... a HUGE block of cheese to make you feel all tingly on the inside. There is also different breads you can get - a regular yeast roll and a jalapeno cornbread (amazing). There's also regular butter, honey, and cinnamon butter. Oh the options.You MUST get the steak if you come here. I ordered the tenderloin medallions which were good in their own right. It came with a blue cheese baked tomato which is fabulous. I wish I never tasted the bf's center filet. You get the option of lemon pepper or garlic butter on your steak (tip: get both!). The bf got both on his center filet and it tasted amazing. After 1 bite, I dropped my fork, demanded we split the dishes, and quickly regretted ordering my tenderloin medallions.Please grow a second stomach and reserve it for the desserts. There are again, so many options, all so tasty, you want to eat them all but can't since the portion is huge. The waiter brought a dessert platter over an I winced in pain. Just a few hours before, I was stuffing my face with not 1, not 2, but 3 desserts (a red velvet cake, creme brulee, and a napoleon from Hubble and Hudson). The agony! Should I really stuff my face again and eat enough sugar to last me for the entire week? Why not? I had a few bites of "Slice of Heaven" (possibly the best mousse I ever tasted) and a Snickers Pie. Amazing. Fantabulous.  Learn from my mistake. Bring a map to find the bathroom. Order steak. Don't eat 3 desserts before coming here.

What I love the most about the Taste of Texas is that it is a restaurant that lives up to its name. All Texas. All taste!The salad bar might seem an odd thing to highlight about a steakhouse, but the salad bar at this restaurant is huge and full of variety. Make sure you hit it up.The steaks at Taste of Texas are phenomenal. Top quality, prepared to your liking. I enjoy my ribeye with either or both of the lemon or garlic butter sauces. The filet oscar (crab cake topping) is excellent and quickly becoming my new favorite.The appetizers and sides are plentiful and delicious. I've never had one that left me disappointed.The service at Taste of Texas is beyond the norm. I believe this flows down from a great example set by the owners. Last time I ate here my contact lens popped out of my eye. I didn't have any contact solution, but my waiter found some and I was able to put my contact lens back in and enjoy my meal.I enjoy other steak places in Houston, but Taste of Texas is my number one choice.

This place is what makes Texas BIG. Monster cuts of steak - "Yes, DO have a cow." Modest-sized but tasty fresh salad bar - all the Texas touches are nice (to a Yank like me): awesome pecans, raisins, and cut-your-own-cheese from a wedge the size of a recliner. The Cowboy Steak was awesome, as was the prime rib. The baked potato was appropriately football-sized. I was hollerin', "hee-haw" until I saw the prices...EVERYTHING is big in Texas, including the cost of a lunch. Even fancy-shmancy steakhouses in Boston have a lower-cost lunch menu, but not if you want a Taste of Texas.

I really have no complaints for Taste of Texas. Is it the absolute best restaurant in Houston? Well, no, it's not. However, I celebrated many family birthdays and graduations here, growing up. When I go back, it's with my Mom to have those memories. If you want to spend a lot for a decent steak, it's a good place to do that. Be ready to wait, or just go in on a Monday right at 5. I'd say since they expanded their hours during the week, the waits are really not that terrible.

One of the best salad bars I've ever been to!!! Great selection, everything tasted so amazing and so fresh from the veggies/fruit right on down to the delicious viniagrettes -- i grabbed some creamy cactus number for my salad and boy was it finger-licking gooood. I think I'll come back here just for their salad bar (hey they have a salad bar as a meal option for $9.95!) ToT only gets 3 stars from me though b/c ultimately, this is a steak house, and so based on their offerings the steak was just okay to me...its your average decent-tasting steak but for me, it just blends into the masses of other mid-range steakhouses in Houston, but pricier. I'm sure the name alone brings in lots of out-of-towners...its definitely old-school "Texan-themed" inside (I'm told they even give Texas history tours around the restaurant) if you're looking for that kind of atmosphere, and not too picky about your steak, you'll have a decent enough dining experience. Out-of-towners, though, will definitely get a taste of Texas.

After years of visiting steakhouses in and around Houston and Texas at large, we finally had opportunity to try Taste of Texas.  Many friends have indicated this is a 'must try' steakhouse. My wife had the filet (one of our staples we use as a benchmark) and I had the prime rib.  Sides were asparagus (excellent) and garlic mashed potatoes (meh).  The filet might have been pretty good, but it was drenched in a garlic butter that really skewed the taste.  We love garlic butter, but I should be able to taste the steak.  Presentation was excellent though.  I haven't had good luck with prime rib at steakhouses in Texas, but I thought I would give it a try since they claimed "slow roasted".  The prime rib itself was 'good', however, they used a (very) creamy and watered down horseradish as opposed to something with more real horseradish in it (pet peeve with prime rib). Additionally, the gravy didn't come across as being drippings, rather more like a prepared au jus.  Presentation was 'plop on plate' (not even served on toasted french bread).  Overall, it was ok and better than other prime rib experiences I've had in Texas (for whatever that is worth).  We probably should have tried more 'Texas' style cuts.Ambiance, decor and service are a draw as is the salad bar.  We both also enjoyed the jalapeno jelly and cream cheese on toast they serve at the table very much.  However, we have similar fare in our neck of the woods, so there is little need for us to drive down the freeway for a few minutes to Taste of Texas.  If you live nearby or are in the area, this might be a reasonable weekly or special occasion spot (although there is some hot competition in City Center).

Short and simple: Think sizzler with an upscale feel and done right.You get to literally choose your own cut of beef; They tag it from the minute it's cut from the huge slab all the way to the end where you find it on your table sizzling on a platter, cooked to your perfection.The meal also includes a salad bar everyone keeps raving about (hence the sizzler) which provides a wide variety to mix and match. One of my favorite parts of this restaurant is the giant block of cheese you get to shave yourself. White cheddar or American, along with your choice of bread, and your choice of preserve; You basically can't go wrong with that trio combination.Our server was most entertaining and knowledgeable in his scotch. Most importantly he was on point with his explanation of every dish we asked about. Every little detail explained painted perfection in the dish and the dish we ended up ordering turned out to be even more spectacular than already expected.Definitely worth a try if you're in the mood to treat yourself or others out to an upper scale steakhouse.

I wasn't sure about this place since I didn't think they'd have a lot of vegetarian options.  I was right, but they do at least have one vegetarian option -- the salad bar/ with a baked potato (you'll have to ask for them to not place bacon on it).  The salad bar as many have said is really good.  Lots of options.  If you are new to Texas or have friends visiting, this would be a cool place to show others.  Highly reco the butter w/cinnamon flavor.

After having moved from Houston 8 years ago I was thrilled to be invited to one of my favorite standbys for dinner tonight.
