And they didn't let me down.Our waitress was a delight and the service was impeccable.  The salad bar, as I recall, was always outstanding and it didn't disappoint tonight.  I had forgotten about the bread.  Fresh.  Hot.  Bread.  With cinnamon butter that melts upon contact.  If I wasn't such a huge carnivore I could stop with the bread.Tonight I opted for 10 oz prime rib, medium rare, with broccoli.  The prime rib was outstanding and the broccoli fresh and perfectly cooked.  Two glasses of Lehman cabernet (Australia, $9.5 per glass) nicely rounded out my meal.My take on Taste of Texas has always been, and still remains:  you can't go wrong here.  While there are a few superior steak houses in Houston, Taste of Texas never fails to deliver on service, atmosphere, and value for dollar paid.  I highly recommend it.

A very pleasant experience for my mom's birthday today! Oscar was our waiter and made she was treated like a queen! Our food was delicious, but the overall experience is what we are raving about! They let her pick any dessert for free, instead of just bringing a generic "cheap" dessert like most restaurants. They came over to the table with a camera while the little sparkler on top of her dessert of choice was still lit, took a nice picture and then printed it for us and delivered it in an envelop with the check. They even wrote "happy birthday" inside! The kind of dessert my husband ordered came with a special glass boot and Oscar brought us a clean one to take home, without us even asking. The manager visited our table to check on us, which is always nice. I saw him visiting most tables! So, so happy with everything. It's been a LONG time since I've been here and now it's safe to say we will definitely be back!

Great place to bring family and friends who are not from or have never been to Texas, as the food, style etc is about as close as you can get to an authentic Texan experience. Of course, a steak is the way to go (Including the superb salad bar), and make sure that you save room for dessert! My only gripe is that you can't book a table in advance, therefore, you can end up waiting well over an hour during busy periods. Although the complimentary popcorn, nachos and soda found in the bar helps the time pass by a lot quicker!

Salad bar, steaks and a special touch. My husband and I tried out Taste of Texas for our Anniversary and it was a Great Idea! Our server, Rebecca was Excellent!Even though our steaks were not completely done the first time, Rebecca took them back to the kitchen and they came back perfect!  The attention paid to us by all the staff was Outstanding.  There is a lot of teamwork going on at Taste of Texas.The portions were of good size, the salad bar was very nice, I liked the fact that a carafe of tea was placed at our table - nice touch! And, the dessert selection had a nice variety to it.Thanks again Taste of Texas for a Wonderful Anniversary Dinner!

First time at the restaurant with 23 people for a business dinner.   I ordered the "cowboy" rib-eye cooked medium.  The steak came out medium well to well done.  I though this was a steak house?  Service was very slow.  I ordered iced tea and waited 15 minutes before I saw a refill.   I had to flag down the server to explain the condition of the steak.  Overall, I was not impressed especially when all of my colleagues finished their meals and I was waiting for a new steak.  By the time the new steak came out, I simply asked for a to-go box.  What a disappointment for a business dinner.

It's almost not even worth a review: everyone knows its great!! We waited for almost an hour for a seat. I am not sure if they take reservations but I'd check before I went again. I got the fillet which was awesome but my friend got the hamburger and just loved it!It's a wonderful tastes place filled with lots of energy and lots of people.

There's a block of cheese on the salad bar the size of my head. Checkmate.This place is yum, though always a little more crowded for my preference. Yeah, you will wait and when a restaurant plans for this by offering popcorn and drinks, you're not sure whether to be pleased with the planning or frustrated that they know there's a problem and that they need to expand or something (or yeah, reservations!). Go with yay and set expectations accordingly. Wonderful meats, wonderful sides. I won't lie and say it's the high end experience you get at Pappas Steaks or Houstons (you know, dim lighting) since it's all bright and lodgey (did I make that up?), but did I mention the block of cheese? Don't skip dessert either, you're missing out bigtime if you don't take the plunge

I've been waiting to try this place for the longest time and I finally got the chance too. I've heard many good things about taste of Texas so I was excited to try it out! When we got there we were told that there was going to be a wait which was fine. We waited I believe a hour? When we finally got seated the hostess I guess were confused because I guess whoever was running board told the hostess to seat us at a certain table but thy table was already sat.. Then she told me to wait another ten minutes while she finds me another table..which was fine, I guess. I just which they knew what the were doing but I guess they're in high school so I should expect that..when we finally got sat I was greeted almost immediately which was a plus but confusing because I had one guy greet me and tell me that my server was on the way and another guy ask for my drink order then another bring me my drink then FINALLY my actual server comes and greets me and takes my order. He explained how everything worked and how we could pick our meat which I thought was interesting. He asked if we would like him to show us to the meats and of course we said yes. But, when we said yes he looked kinda annoyed.. I guess he was in the weeds or something. But, he could've did a better job at hiding his attitude. Finally we came back from choosing our meats the server came back and informed us that one of the meats we chose was the last cut they had and that they had given it to another customer.. Ten minutes later the manager apologizes for running out of the piece of steak that we ordered. Which I thought was nice.. We ended up ordering the center cut filet and the bone in filet. We ended up enjoying both since we had the butter to accompany the steaks. Our server was okay he wasn't very attentive and he had kinda of an attitude. I would return only if I had a different server and the hostess got the shi* together.

I have been coming here for years.  I've never had something I didn't like and I love that you can pick your own steak!!  How cool is that!  I LOVE the homemade breads and salad bar.  The blocks of cheese are SO good with the homemade bread.  The quail bites are YUMMY!!  The service is FANTASTIC!  You can not go wrong dining here. It's a great restaurant to take out of town guests to!

We ate at Taste of Texas for our anniversary tonight and we thought it was okay.  Spending $170 for just "okay", though, is a bit much.  Fortunately, we got there at 5:00 before the evening rush and the legendary 2 hour long wait for a table began, and were seated immediately.  The service was fine, the restaurant was clean.  The salad bar was small and okay, the Texas caviar was a cute addition, we did like the variety of rolls that you could put in a basket yourself and bring to your table.   When we ordered our steaks they asked if we wanted to choose them, which was a cute gimmick, so we did.  We ordered the stuffed mushrooms appetizer, which wasn't very good, we didn't finish it.  My husband ordered the NY Strip and a side of spinach, both of which he said were average.  I ordered the filet which was better than the NY Strip, they gave me garlic butter to melt on it which elevated the steak to good (which isn't a huge compliment since your steak should be able to stand alone as the star of the show...particularly when it costs $50 by itself).   My side item was the potatoes au gratin...those were delicious.  For dessert, my husband had the ice cream milk shake thing in the souvenir glass which was basically ice cream covered in what tasted like a pound of cinnamon...we couldn't finish it.  I had the snickers pie which, again, was okay, and we didn't finish it.  So, all in all, my review is...eh, I've had better.  And for $170 I've had a LOT better.

The best steakhouse in all of Houston. Conservative Christian family provides a wonderful atmosphere good pricing excellent meals and the service is impeccable.  Many of their Staff have been there for many many years.  They are family centered I cannot recommend any place better to take out-of-town guest.
i ordered the cowboy steak..the taste wasnt that good..the portion was not big but HUGE..the salad bar was good..the staff were friendly too..CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

Went there today to celebrate our 9th wedding anniversary. My wife's center cut 6oz filet was great, I on the other had a horrible experience. My bone-in ribeye was cooked well done. I had asked medium. They took it back. 15 mins later (after my wife was done with her meal) my take 2 on the bone-in ribeye arrived. Cut into the steak and it was medium BUT with 0 seasoning!!! No salt no pepper not even the nice fat shine of a marbled steak cooked at the tight temperature. Took a bite and had to put it down. My home cooked rib-eyes are much better. This was definitely no where near the quality of a $40 ribeye. The grilled vegetables were really tough. They comped the two desserts. My wife could not eat the creme brulee didn't taste like anything. I give then 2 stars because the service was good and they really tried to make it right. Also they have these annoying use of fire sparklers on top of desserts which burn up inside the restaurant constantly and stink up the place with the punching smell of burnt gunpowder.

3rd attempt to go back there. Sick of their stupid and disrespectful "no reservation" policy. With my family for a once-a-year meal and it's a 2-hour wait (again.) Ridiculous. Won't be back. Ruined our evening. Makes no sense whatsoever.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  So far, this is my favorite steakhouse in Houston!  Other than the food (of course), my favorite part of the experience the laid-back ambiance.  Steakhouses of similar caliber (Pappa Bros, Mortons, Ruth Chris, etc) have a more "formal" feel.They don't have reservations, so if you go during peak hours, be ready for a wait.  Another nice thing, though, is that they provide free chips & salsa, popcorn, and fountain drinks while you wait.

Taste of Texas is the best steakhouse in Houston hands down. You can't have a better beef quality than here and I stress on consistency. I dined at Morton's, Papas, Perry's and  loved them, but you can't ave the same thing done twice except at taste of texas. I always start with their out of this world crab cake. It is not your usual crispy crab cake. It is a mix of REAL LUMP CRAB meat and rich cheese cooked to perfection with a side of Remoulade dressing. Squeeze some lemon on it and spread some dressing on tip then dip the spoon into a soft and creamy crab cake. Filet is my favorite and make sure you mix both rubs to have a great tasting steak (lemon and pepper + garlic) Great wine selection if you fancy wine with your steak. One of my favorite restaurants in Houston.

I ALWAYS look forward to eating dinner here. My family tends to come at an earlier time, most often before 5:30pm, so that we don't run into a huge crowd (and a long wait-list!) and we never come on a Friday or Saturday - I came once with a friend on a Friday evening for her birthday, and we ended up waiting an hour and a half for a table for two. Besides the occasionally long wait-time, the steak is CRAZY good. I am a 100% steak person (I'm a Texan all the way) and the Taste never disappoints. In fact, I'm positive that the Taste has the best filet mignon I've ever had. I always order the filet mignon, medium-well, with garlic butter on top (on a hot plate) and a baked potato on the side. The service is excellent for a constantly busy restaurant and the staff are always polite and helpful. The steak prices (because if you come to the Taste, you HAVE to eat steak) are pretty high, but definitely worth it. I never regret spending more than $40 on a steak here!

The place was just good all around!  Good service, good atmosphere & definitely good food!I'm just in town visiting my brother and he told me about the place.  Read up some Yelp reviews before we went, so we expected the 30-45 mins wait.  I'm from LA, so waiting for food is no biggie for me!  Plus you get free soft drinks, popcorns & chips and salsa while you wait!Well I have to be honest, I'm not a fan of steak.  But I had the salmon and it was absolutely delicious!  So for all the people out there like me, don't worry if you don't eat steak, there are more than steaks at the place!On the other hand, my brother LOVED his rib-eye steak, so for all the steak lovers no worries!!

I made a visit to Texas not awhile ago, and this place was recommended by a friend. The experience is truly amazing. We ordered a rib eyes, crab cakes, and apple cinnamon muffin. The steak cooked just perfect (mid-rare) and it is very flavorful and juicy. The crab cakes is just as great as the steak, it is made out the real crab, and it taste like how a real crab cakes should taste like. Then the climax of the lunch is the dessert. The muffin is just an wow in the mouth. Dispute of the good food, good price, complimentary appetizer,  and all-you-can-eat salad bar, Our waiter, Ryan, is truly great and friendly. He greets, chats, and really takes his time to serve the tables. Definitely a most attraction to me in Texas now.

This is as good as a steakhouse in Houston gets! They let you pick out your steak, and tag it so you know you get the one you wanted, then cook it perfectly while you enjoy fresh bread and a good salad bar, but not too much or there won't be room for the steak and potatoes!
Excellent service and steaks. Steaks were cooked perfect, salad was fantastic, and the service was excellent. Best steak in Houston (if not Texas).

This is southern hospitality at its finest!  My husband and I arrived on a Thur night for dinner and waited about 40min for our table. If you arrive hungry, no problem. There's a complimentary bar with snacks and refreshments. For its size, I was expecting chaos, but it's the opposite.  Every employee has their job, and they do it well.   I was very impressed with how well-managed the restaurant was.  If you cross paths with an employee (which is often), they always greet you.  The food was good, but what made it great was the people.  We weren't celebrating a special occasion, but our server still created a wonderful experience for us.  He set the tone for the rest of the night.  It was my first time there.  Our server helped us pick out a steak in the butcher shop and gave us a tour through the kitchen.  From arrival to departure, we were there for almost 3 hours (past closing), and the server was always pleasant.  He was attentive and maintained a relaxed pace all night.  At most restaurants, you're rushed in, fed, and handed the check.  The evening at Taste of Texas was a nice change for us.  We had an opportunity to slow down and enjoy each other's company.
Best Ribeye I've ever tasted. Salad bar excellent. Would have gotten a 5 star rating, BUT........the weekend 2 hour wait is ridiculous. No excuse to wait that long anywhere

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Houston. Atmosphere is rustic (true Texas style) and laid back. They don't take reservations, but it sure is worth the wait! Their steaks are amazing. And yes, they do run a little high price wise (average $40-50 a steak), but it is well worth it. I know there's plenty of great steak houses in Houston, but I don't get service like what I do at Taste of Texas anywhere else. Staff is knowledgeable and attentive. And for those who are very particular about their steak, you can go to the butcher and select the cut that you want. Your meal also includes a salad bar and an assortment of bread. They have a cinnamon butter that just melts in your mouth and complements the food very well. This is the place to go if you just want to sit back and relax. It's a nice break from the hustle and bustle of life :)

After a long day of disappointments (mainly a terrible experience with Comcast costumer service) Eric and I decided to treat ourselves to something awesome!!I had never been to Taste of Texas on a Saturday night, and Eric had never been to taste of Texas before- so imagine our surprise when we get a 90 minute wait time!!! The most surprising thing for Eric though was the amount of people willing to wait for that amount of time.The wait time is easy when you have free popcorn, chips and salsa and complimentary beverages!!There is a bar on the wait area aaaand WIFI!!! They have big plasma screens- one had the Astros and the other had Nascar racing... so we decided to spend our hour and a half trying to "ford the river" playing Oregon trail on the iPad. Taste of Texas, I love you!

Taste of Texas is a pretty great steakhouse. For a steakhouse the ambiance is a bit dated these days, but I think that might be the reason I keep coming back. Prices are on par with most steakhouses and their menu is exactly what you would expect. They have a few appetizers which set the menu apart like the deep fried jalapeño stuffed shrimp and the crab stuffed mushrooms. The steak dishes are traditional to steakhouses and they also have a few fish and chicken options. My personal favorite is their Prime Rib, again it's a fairly traditional recipe but it's executed amazingly well. With your entree they include a fairly extensive salad bar with 3-4 awesome bread choices. They have a cilantro vinaigrette that I found quite tasty during my most recent visit. As far as bread choices go you will find a traditional buttered roll, A cheese stuffed roll that looks similar to what a cinnamon roll might look, traditional cornbread, and a tasty jalapeño cornbread. They offer a wide variety of desserts, and feature a cinnamon ice cream alcoholic shake.I definitely recommend stopping by and giving Taste of Texas a shot especially if you are an out of towner looking for a "Texas" experience.

Years ago, when I was just out of school and coming to Houston a lot for training classes and other business, this was the place to go.  On expense account.  It was amazing, phenomenal, and over-the-top to someone fresh out of college and no longer enjoying the leisurely life of the recently-graduated-unemployed.  *sigh*  Good times.Fast forward a number of years and having had a number of culinary adventures and coming back here, I was a little disappointed.  I don't think the quality has slid, but others I have had just pass it by.What's the Taste of Texas experience?* Large, open, Texany (Texican? Texish? Texassy?  Help me out here) decorated room with a loud, busy vibe.* A decent salad bar with decent toppings.  A block of cheese that wouldn't fit into my MINI.  Various breads including jalapeno cornbread (yum) and apple-cinamon butter.* A reasonably good cut of steak, tender and done to temperature.* Large selection of desserts that are fairly good.  And fairly large.It's kind of 3-star quality food relative to some of the top-notch steakhouses, but it occupies a much needed middle-ground between the more generic Outback/Saltgrass entry-level and the stratospherically (priced at least) of Ruth's Chris, Morton's, Smith & Wollensky, John Thomas.  You can easily get out of Taste of Texas for $30 (salad appetizer, side, steak) + booze.  About half of what you pay at the upscale places.So, price-wise it's at the top of it's niche and I'm pleased with the experience every time I go there.  Maybe it is sentimentality.  That's worth something.
Cattle and southern hospitality. 10 oz center cut filet, grilled medium rare to mother freakin' perfection. People really wait around 2 hours to get a table here? I guess I can understand why now.

#1 Steakhouse in Houston!!!#1 in service - they set the standard!  Friendly, attentive, but not uppity.  PROS - Salad bar is the best in Houston!  Plates are cold, salad is crisp, fresh rolls, fruit, and cheese also available.  Steak is tender, service (again) is unparalleled.  Texas artifacts make it a great and authentic experience.   Kids meals are excellent and the value is great.  Complimentary soft drinks, chips, popcorn while you wait are a nice touch.  Dessert selection is yummy!  Try the snickers cake!CONS - No reservations.  Expensive. $30+/steak, but that includes salad bar, so...  Dining staff are great, hosts, not as friendly.  They don't have that "positive" vibe that the servers have, but it's understandable.GREAT place to take out-of-towners!

I was forced to come eat here with my parents. It was their 32nd anniversary so I didn't want to intrude, but they said I was the "product" of their marriage...WTF? That's technically true...but still..."product?" Where's the tag that says "Made in America" protruding from the back of my neck? Nevertheless, I, as a product, still enjoyed myself to a fantastic steak dinner. When I arrived, it wasn't particularly packed. They require your whole party to be present before you're seated, but that's not so big of an issue since they provide complimentary soft drinks and popcorn to ease the wait. I wish I knew this beforehand since the nicely stacked cans looked particularly enticing; I just didn't want to help myself to one if they turned out not to be. The decor and ambiance is western classy -- not like other more casual steak houses (viz. Texas Roadhouse). Dark wood furniture, framed antique western tools, and the deep meat aroma hints at the gastronomical experience that's about to ensue. Our waitress was extremely professional and attentive and suggested a perfect full bodied, spicy red wine to pair with our steaks. Complimentary salad bar comes with each meal! Who doesn't appreciate free stuff?! An extensive array of different high quality greens and salad toppings quells the meat monger desire for the main course. In addition to the already impressive salad bar, they offer a variety of freshly baked bread! JALAPENO corn bread, cheese rolls, and dinner rolls are free for the masses. I love this place already. I ordered the Cowboy Steak, a 24 oz. bone-in ribeye steak, medium rare, which is, by the way, the only legit way to eat a steak for it's seared on the outside and deep pink in the inside that releases that irresistible raw, deep meat flavor. In my humble opinion, I feel the bone adds a little extra flavor to the meat and that the meat closer to the bone is more tender. What's unique about this place is that they allow you to choose your own individually vacuum packed Angus Beef steak from their butchery in the back. Taking full advantage of this, I chose the most marbled one of the group. More fat = more flavor; just make sure the fat is pretty evenly distributed around the steak and not bunched up in one clump. They'll stake a number in your steak for you to keep track of which one's your baby. When my steak arrived, it was still sizzling in the cow shaped metal plate with a dollop of garlic butter (*droooool*) on top. Perfectly cooked, the steak oozed with juices as I cut off my first bite and sent my taste buds swimming in a symphony of salty, beefy, garlicky flavors as it went in my mouth. Yes, I love steak with all my heart. As for the side dish of sauteed mushrooms, they were delicious too -- salty, herbally, and full of flavor. Since it was my parent's anniversary, we got a free dessert! How awesome is that? It was hard to decide from all their delicious choices, but they finally decided on the snickers cheesecake. The bottom was almost one inch thick of chocolate fudge that was layered with crushed snickers bar and then topped with a layer of cheesecake and a swirl of whipped cream. I was in sugary, chocolaty bliss before my sweet tooth died on me after the third bite. Though the dinner cost $240, the quality of their steaks, the amount of food, and the service is worth the expense. This place arguably served the best steak I've ever had. If it's a special occasion for you, come here for a memorable dinner and a free dessert. It's on me.

Highest compliments to Taste of Texas for going above and beyond. I called the restaurant ahead of my parents arriving there to celebrate a special occasion, hoping to prepay their tab. The manager, Bill, kept his eye on them and made their visit completely memorable. Both my parents recall the service, the crab cake appetizer, the Porterhouse steak and the key lime pie being the best they've ever had in each category (service, crab cake, steak and key lime pie). Would have loved to celebrate with my parents personally, but hearing how well Taste of Texas treated them has really raised my perception of this steak house as the top in Houston.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants. The steaks are delicious and the sides are too. The salad bar items are very high quality. It is absolutely scrumptious and includes unlimited homemade cheese rolls and jalapeño cornbread. The decor is almost a small museum of Texas memorabilia. I have eaten here for years and will continue to!! Ya'll go!!

word of advice to management - do not give tours of your kitchen... if you have a cooler stacked with boxes of prepackaged individually portioned usda CHOICE steaks, its not gonna help you any with your customers... especially when u charge usda PRIME prices... no one wants to see their steak look like the ones at kroger...Hide your cooler... or take a trip to pappas and learn what a real dry aging room looks like.
Pricey, but worth every dime!  Not your everyday run of the meal for sure!  the BEST steak and service in the industry!!!

I have to hide this from my husband because he was excited to take me to this restaurant and it was a total failboat for my birthday.  First off, I made the wrong choice and not ordered the steak.  I really wasn't in a steak mood that day and I really wish I was.  So on Monday, it was my 25th(yes, 25th) birthday and after a doctor's appointment, my husband decided to take me out for a nice lunch at Taste of Texas.  The place had very nice decor and what you would have imagined at a steakhouse.   We had a waiter named Geoff which bless his heart, he recommended the absolute worst french dip I have ever had but I will get back to that later.  He was a good sport and wonderful waiter so bad food does not negate his reputation as a waiter. On the table was a small serving of toasted bread and dip.  It was okay and a nice enter into trying the food of the restaurant.  As a starter, I had a chicken tortilla soup which came out rather quick.  This was very much the "norm" of tortilla soups but the flavor was good.  The thing that turned me off on this soup was there was so much cheese inside the soup, it coated my spoon in the yucky, weird cheese film so that every time you put your spoon in your mouth, it left a horrid amount of yuck on my spoon that I had to dip BACK into my soup.  Very much double dipping grossness here.  Entree: Poor Geoff recommended the French Dip sliders since I wasn't in a steak mood.  I ordered Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Asparagus with Hollandaise sauce.  When they came out, they meat was clammy as if my meal had been sitting out for a while.  Wasn't warm to the touch but just an odd lukewarm.  The au jus was warm but not enough to bring this meat to temp.  I had two bites and called it quits.  The garlic mashed potatoes were alright but nothing too fancy.  The Hollandaise  sauce was incredibly thick like Cheez Whiz before you microwave it or possibly pudding texture. I poked at it like a kid with brussel sprouts and I absolutely love asparagus.  It wasn't the greatest of sauces I have had.  For my birthday dessert, Geoff bought out a plate of pretties.  I went after the Deep Dish Pecan Pie and decided to take it home since I was a lil bummed from this experience on my birthday.  When I got home, I decided to try the pie and the filling was great and so was the pecan toppings. The only thing is they had a layer of what seemed like chocolate ganache  but it was made of pure sugar which overkilled the sweetness.  The pie didn't need that layer AT ALL.  It would have been perfect without it.  Overall, this place will forever stick out in my mind as the worst birthday meal ever.  I hope that others have a better time and better plate of food.

Visited in May 2013.  The saturday night we visited it was college graduation weekend and close to Mother's day so it was pretty busy. We were quoted 1.5 hour wait and it was right on. Not too bad of a wait as the bar has soft drinks and snacks. The service was excellent. Our waiter was a professional in every sense of the word.  The food was good but not great. In my opinion Saltgrass or Texas Land and Cattle have just as good steaks.

Taste of Texas is one hell of a steakhouse. They've got other types of food but most people come here for the steak. It's definitely pricey but the quality of food is excelent. The salad/appetizer bar is pretty well stocked. I had the 16 oz. New York Strip with sauteed mushrooms and it was delicious. I ordered it medium and it was cooked pink throughout. Only a bit of outside fat to trim but it was very thick and far from dry. The mushrooms were also extremely delicious. I didn't have a dessert because I was stuffed but their offerings were almost impossible to turn down. The service is some of the best I've had. Very polite and personalized. Our server asked us our preferences when it came to taste and was more than willing to accomodate any changes to the dishes we decided to make. Overall, the quality and service is excellent but the price is a bit on the high side (only reason it didn't get 5 stars from me). I'd definitely recommend it though

Haven't been here in a good while. We split a 14oz "bone-in filet" because I knew I'd get full on the appatizer of bacon-wrapped quail, rolls, spicy cream cheese, cinnamon-honey butter and the side baked-sweet potato. The bacon wrapped quail was excellent. A couple were burnt but didn't detract too much from the flavor.I only had 1 roll with that awesome cinnamon-honey butter. That stuff rocks!So the filet. She wanted it "medium" and that's just a bit too bloody for me but oh well. Learned not to get the "bone-in" because so much meat stuck to the bone that you couldn't get off.  Asparagus and baked-sweet potato were our sides that were delicious.For desert, New York style cheesecake. Very smooth and very tasty!But honestly, if I want a steak, I think I'd rather go to steak-night at Red Lion Pub and save myself $80; the filets there are better, IMHO.2 drinks each + appatizer + steak + desert = $120
The best filet mignon I've ever had to date! I want to go back to texas just for this restaurant! A bit pricey but definitely worth it!Food: 5Service: 5 Environment: 5Price: 4

I have come here everytime I've visited Houston.  The unlimited bread and salad bar are wonderful.  To be able to pick your cut of meat from the butcher's counter = amazing.  Just the portions and the quality of food is off the charts.  I LOVE THIS PLACE.  The chocolate cake really caps off the meal and puts you into a deep food coma.

After having lunch here with my co-workers I wanted to share the experience with my husband. He is a STEAK and potatoes kind of guy. Everything was perfect. The service was great and the food was even better. The salad bar is the best I've had in any restaurant. The steak melted in my mouth and husband's cowboy cut was gianormous and cooked to perfection. The baked potatoes are huge but the grilled veggies were slightly skimpy. The four layer chocolate cake was the pièce de résistance. Of course, we had leftovers to take home. We went home totally satisfied.
If you want the best stake in Houston this is the place, I have been there quite a few times and always the meat is cocked to perfection and tastes amazing, also the salad bar has a good selection
Best steak restaurant in Houston!  Impeccable service, great food, and good value.  Not to be missed, especially if you have out-of-town guests.
Good salad bar, delicious sirloin steaks. Waiters are nice.. just a tad expensive for its real value. This is the kind of place you should bring your inlaws to impress.Old fashioned.

The wait was horrible. Really bad. But it ended up being totally worthwhile. The hostess told us (a party of three) that our wait would be 60-75 minutes long. It did turn out to be about 75 minutes. The cool thing about the wait (if nothing else) is that Taste of Texas has bottles of water and soft drink set up around the wait area and people can just help themselves with drinks, chips and popcorn while they wait. Why can't all restaurants be like that?From the moment we went inside the service was excellent. Our waiter Dimitri was one of the best, if not THE best waiter I've ever had. Polite, professional, attentive and personal. And then the food was great too. We had some quail bites wrapped in bacon with a touch of jalapeno as appetizer. They were very tasty.All of our steaks were cooked to perfection the way we wanted them - medium rare. They were flavorful but not overly flavored with sauces or spices. My "cowboy" steak was awesome. Although the Hawaian ribeye at Houston's is still the best IMO. At Taste of Texas, you have the option of going into the "butcher shop" area to pick your piece of steak. I totally recommend doing that just for the experience. Dimitri showed us the cuts of the meat that we asked for, and showed us at least three slices of each of the meat. He explained the subtle differences between each of the pieces. And then we got to pick the exact piece of steak we wanted.The salad bar was also good. The veggies were fresh and the area was constantly being cleaned by the staff. I recommend the cilantro vignagrette dressing. The bread was self serve, and located in the salad bar area. There are three types of starch to pick from -- normal dinner roll, a cinammon bun look-a-like thing, and jalapeno cornbread. They were all freshly baked and tasty. And they tasted even better with the cinammon flavored butter spread.It was a very good experience in spite of the long wait. There are very few restaurants that are worth waiting for. This is one of them.

First place i hit up once i moved to Texas... Steak was on point as it should be since this place prides itself on the way it raises its cattle and it even came with a # tag in it, BUT lacked big time on the sides.  it's as if they just didn't care about anything but the meat!Would go again but wasn't as impressed as i thought i would be...Wine list is extensive for you winos...

I don't live in Houston anymore, but every time I come home, I make sure I go to Taste of Texas. This place is AMAZING. First of all, the salad bar is delicious! It is fresh, great selection, and just awesome. This is complementary with your steak. Secondly, the bread is great as well! The jalapeno cornbread is so good! Of course the steak is so tender and delicious. I just had the porterhouse steak for two medium rare. It came out perfect! It is a place where I wish that I can redo that meal all over again. Not only the food is great, but the decor is pretty awesome as well. There is literally a "Texas Museum" inside of it. There are so many pictures, flags, relics, etc. around. It is definitely a neat place. They do not take reservations, which can be bad because it can be a pretty long wait on the weekends, but what is pretty awesome is that they have a room with free soda, chips and dip, nachos, and TVs while you wait. The waiting room itself is pretty great. Sometimes I just want to go there to watch the game. Soda, popcorn, chips and dip. Why not? Lastly, the service I have had there was always top notch. The atmosphere and the people working there is always relax and comfortable. The servers has always been super accommodating to us. You also get a free dessert on your birthday or anniversary. They even take a picture of you and give you a card with the picture in it. It is just little things like that, that will make you want to come back over and over again!
We drove 45 min. to be told we'd have to wait outside in the rain for 1-1/2 hrs.!! I don't think so!! Boo!

I took my girlfriend to Taste of Texas for a nice, fancy dinner and that's just what we got.The salad bar is good and well-stocked, but let's face it:  that's not why you're going to Taste of Texas, am I right?  My girlfriend and I debated our choices before settling on the "porterhouse for two"."Everything's bigger in Texas," they say.  Well, after seeing that porterhouse for two, I am here to tell you that it is absolutely true.  I can also safely say the same thing about price of the wine...and the bill, now that I think of it.There's no denying it; this is an expensive steakhouse.  Entrees are definitely pricey, but you get quite a lot for your money.  Taste of Texas, like the state itself, seems to take its steak as seriously as a heart attack (something hat a few meals there will definitely put you at risk of), to the point that they encourage people to pick out their own steak from their selection in the cold case.Everything was delicious, though I don't know how any couple could possibly finish one of those porterhouses.  But hey, you don't hear me complaining, do you?  I'd much rather get too much for my money than too little. If there's one big drawback to Taste of Texas' "bigger is better" approach, it's that our steak (boy, it's weird to have to say "our steak"; a collective-plural adjective should rarely be next to a singular noun when it comes to entrees) was quite underdone.  We ordered it medium-rare and it came brown on the outside, but extremely rare beyond an eighth of an inch in.  Large steaks need to cook slower and longer than smaller ones and that steak could definitely have used several more minutes, so if you do order something large, be sure to order it at least medium-well.I suppose the size of the bill could be considered a drawback, but I knew what I was getting into when I walked in the door.  Overall, I liked it.  Just be sure to get your steaks a little more well-done than you normally would.

moved here from dallas and my boyfriend and I are always looking for places to eat that are not too fancy but still have that nice service good quality food. so far this is my favorite restaurant so far!.. food was great, service was A+ . great place to celebrate birthdays or a good date with your love one.

I come here a lot and it's all because of the food, service, & the amount of options they have. For starters, they have salsa and chips, popcorn, and sodas for free while waiting in line to be seated. Be prepared for a long wait on weekends and also Monday nights. Service varies from person to person have got a bad experience before. Salad bar is very delicious and to top it off the warm bread. Steak is delightful. Free desert on bdays! Perfect for date nights and special occasions!

I can't even begin to describe how much I love Taste of Texas. Their food is delicious, their service is impeccable, and the atmosphere is lovely. Granted, it is a very pricey restaurant, but if you ignore the price tag you'll have a great time and truly enjoy your meal. With your meal you have unlimited salad bar and bread (the cinnamon butter is to die for!) and that's enough to fill you up before your meal. Even though the prices are high, the quality and portion of the food is worth the money. The center cut filet is fantastic, and the baked potato side is huge! I've been here a few times with my family and we love it every time!

Over price restaurant, service not the best.   I felt that they did not appreciate the customer.  It was like they were doing you a favor by taking your order.   The food, not the best for the price.-----------------------Demasiado caro para el servicio y la calidad de la comida.  Senti que ellos no trataban al cliente con delicadeza.  La comida tampoco fue lo mejor por el precio que hay que pagar.

The best place for all type of steaks, around $150.00 + for 2 depends on what you order, a little expensive, but worth it.  There's always a long ling during the weekend, no call in for reservations.  Even though you might have to wait for hours, there's a wait area with free snacks and drinks.  After you're number's been called, you are seated to your table, the waiter/waitress takes your order and shows you the way to the salad bar (an okay salad bar).  If you're new to the restaurant you get to wear a red bandana and a picture taken for you to take home (free).  If it's your birthday, you just have to tell the waiter/waitress and you get to pick a dessert of choice (free).  I would recomment this place.  Dresscode: Causal or formalPrice: around $60+ per person

Been going HAPPILY  for years .. took a 4 year Hiatus- while living on East Coast and  when we returned..TOT  still held up to my expectations.. I LOVE the STRIP HOUSE downtown and it is a LOT closer to my house.... but my $ goes to TOT when we can get out 1-10 W to enjoy it! We usually go either early or late to dinner as the Wait can be brutal.. Easy to avoid if you adjust your time by 30 mins!
Awesome Steakhouse. Had the Cowboy Steak, it was cooked perfectly, salad bar is top notch and the Cilantro Vinaigrette dressing is awesome.  Cant go wrong eating here!

I have spent my childhood and high school years in Texas, so I have experienced great Texas BBQ as well as steak.Despite what some people may write on Yelp, Taste of Texas is not one of those great steakhouses.I first have issues with that they do not take reservations and set up a waiting area with beverages and snacks. Granted, it is nice (and a little counterintuitive to the eating industry) to do this, but you could solve the wait issue by taking reservations (and a credit card to charge people who do not show up). For the prices they charge, I am surprised they do not take reservations. One lady who was a part of another party saw the waiting area and exclaimed, "It's like a barn in here!" Agreed. If you don't mind waiting and munching on carbs, then it's a good deal.Service here is friendly and well-intentioned but not so efficient. Our waiter was very kind (but a little loud, in a happy kind of way), but when you have 7 adults and 3 kids, efficiency is key at dinner time. We've come before because my dad loves all things steak, and he loves to spend time with the kids. The jury is out as to whether this is a good place for children.Salad bar is pretty good, and the breads and butters are delicious. The steak and meat, however...either you get steak that is raw or cooked bone dry. The kids hamburger which we requested as "well done" was scorched black. Every steak that was requested as "medium well" was rare. I had ordered the lobster tail, and it was essentially eating a seafood chew toy.The horrifying thing was after we had left the restaurant. My sister's "medium well" steak (which we discovered the next day in broad daylight to be rare) caused several unplanned trips to the bathroom and unpleasant indigestion. In the light of day (the restaurant is very dim), we were able to see the actual condition of all the "medium well" steaks.Now I am no chef, but I do know what "medium well" is supposed to look like - shouldn't a steak house that charges 30 dollars and up for its steak?I suppose I would have given Taste of Texas one more star if its prices were more like Outback's, but really given that we spent a pretty penny at the restaurant, meh, I've experienced better.Maybe it was a fluke. Texans looking for a good steak, I've experienced better.

Summary: decent, but not for the money. If you're willing to spend this much you should be headed to a more standard steakhouse.There are two features here that people talk about: the steaks and the salad bar. The steaks are solid - par for the course, nothing to write home about. The fabled salad bar, on the other hand, is kind of underwhelming. They have lettuce, spinach, some dressings, copious amounts of bacon bits and other toppings, and some breads. None of these will knock your socks off.What really brings this place down is the atmosphere. I definitely value food over ambiance, but when you go to a steakhouse you're not just paying for some food - you're paying for an experience. The place just feels a bit white trash. There are many great restaurants with a white trash ambiance, but is that what you want in a steakhouse?

My dad lives in Houston, when my sister and I came to visit him in Texas, this was the place he took us when we arrived.  When my mom said we would be eating here, I wasn't sure if my sister and I would have to change... we just got off an airplane from California.  Upon arrival we saw people who were dressed worse than us, so we didn't feel that bad.  Since it was a Friday night, the restaurant was full, and from reading some of the other reviews, they don't take reservations.  This may be a long wait...  When we got there they gave us a number and we waited until our number was to be called or when it came up on the screen.  This is very high tech and organized if you ask me.  Well our number was 131 and the last number on the screen was 103.  The wait was not that long maybe 30 minutes.  We looked over the menu.  And the prices here compared to California were a lot lower.  My sister ordered a filet, my dad ordered the prime rib, and I got the Texas onion soup.  Our waiter, Joseph let us know that we can actually go to the back and pick the steak for our meal.  Just to explain a little more, note I said the steak and not the cow.  The steaks are portioned and you choose what is portioned out.  We also got the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer.  When you go to Texas, everything is huge in portion.  My Texas onion soup was about $5, but the size was two servings back in California.  The filet my sister got was very tender and seasoned well.  My dad's prime rib needed the au jus because by itself it was dry.  The shrimp cocktail was okay, nothing bad and nothing good.  Another good thing is that with your meal you get the salad bar, which you may need because of all the protein and starch you eat with your steak and potatoes.  At the end of the meal, they took a photo so we can remember the experience.  We definitely left not feeling hungry.The service here is pretty spot on.  You get the southern hospitality that is always here in this part of the country.  Next time, I'm in Houston this maybe a stop for dinner.

I love this place!  I've been there three times now and never been disappointed.   In fact, each time I go back I like them even more. 1.  The food.  Their steak is always cooked exactly how you want it and the appetizers are delicious.  The salad bar is pretty darn awesome too!  You have variety and quality, and the veggies are fresh.  My mother-in-law mentioned that the salad bar and bread used to be even better.2.  The service.  The servers are friendly and attentive.3.  The ambience.  The Christmas decorations were adorable and really made the place feel warm and inviting.  Perfect for a casual night out with the family, or to impress out-of-town guests.One negative is that there is usually a long wait.  My family and I visited the day after Christmas and the wait was about an hour.  The waiting area inside was full so we were freezing our behinds in the cold for a bit.  There was a heat lamp, which helped.I will definitely be back.

AMAZING! This was by far the best steak I have ever tasted.  Along with the great food, the service is is awesome.  Going on a Saturday night, the wait was about 45 minute to an hour in which they serve free soda and popcorn while you wait.  There is a bar area in back as well that you may indulge in.  The prices are expensive, but on the other hand it is worth every penny.  Our server Tyler was awesome and very knowledgeable.  Will be back again without a doubt!

Need to impress some out of towners? This is the place to go! Everything about this place oozes Texas culture, from the decor to the big and juicy steaks! They have one of the better salad bars in town, with a blocks of cheese you can slice from and your pick of  warm, soft bread.For steak they have all the cuts that you can imagine, but I always go for either the bone in filet or the prime ribs! Both are so juicy I am picturing myself there cutting into a steak right now!If you have a large party, I would avoid this place on the weekends as they don't take reservations and you could be waiting a LONG time!

Truly an experience. Food was hot and fresh. Prices are extremely fair. But, the reason for their success is service. Not one detail missed. We had a group of 11 for my mothers birthday. Service was outstanding

I attempted to give up red meat earlier this year and was successful thus far until I ate here last week with my boyfriend's family for his sister's birthday.  We actually came here 2 weeks prior for the dad's birthday and I ordered the Herb Marinated Grilled Chicken and sadly enough EVERYONE at the table found out and gave me a hard time.  Which I don't blame them, we did wait an hour and a half at a STEAK HOUSE and I oddly enough ordered chicken.  The chicken was tender and was an overall great dish.  But yes, even the waiter gave me the look like I was crazy. So fast forward to last Friday, I didn't want to be the weirdo again and fall into peer pressure (the things we do for love, right?) and ordered the T-Bone Steak.  20oz of filet and strip loin.  I hadn't eaten beef in well over 6 months+.  Unfortunately, I ordered it medium well and it came back super well done :(  So it had to be sent back along with my bf's cousin's t-bone which was also well well done.  The manager came out and apologized and we had 2 fresh t-bone as well as new sides to go along.  I had to take the steak off the steel plate so it wouldn't over cook it again.  But the texture and taste was spot on with the garlic butter.  The manager later gave us 4 free desserts.  Yes, 4 desserts for free to make up for the over cooked t-bones.  It's not bad...but for $37.95 for the t-bone, you'd think they would have gotten it right the first time.  So why did I give this place 4stars?  Simple.  Their salad and bread buffet.  YUMMY!  Unlimited fresh salad and their cheesy bread that stays warm in the oven.  DELISH!  Every time I go here, I load up at least 2 plates of salad and pack up to go on their cheese rolls.  Mmm.  Still have 3 in my refrigerator actually.  Aside from that one oppsies last Friday, they have the best service around.  Always greeting you.  Con would be the wait.  Every weekend, it's over an hour wait...you do get free soft drinks and chips/salsa in the waiting room.  The atmosphere is nice, the waiters are extremely courteous...and AWESOME CHEESE BREAD + SALAD BAR!  I've been here probably around 5 or 6 times and have had a wonderful experience each time.

Awesome food.  Great experience.  I loved the salad bar.  Had many fresh options and also many different options for bread.The only thing I would caution you is that they try to UPSELL you on everything.  Add shrimp skewer, add sauce, add bacon wrapped, add sides, etc. etc.  The bill added up quickly.  Now I know exactly what to order for the next time and what to say no to.Great food though.  I ordered the filet Oscar (lump crab meat sauce on top) and it was good.  I was overstuffed at the end.  The desserts looked good but I couldn't swing it.  The steak melted in my mouth.  Yummy.

This place is soooo overrated man. The service is great here but in my opinion the steak just really isn't that good. In fact they try to cover up the lack of taste in their steaks by covering it with lemon pepper seasoning and cooking it in lemon garlic butter. A true steak should just have the flavor of the beef stand out and not be covered up by spices and seasoning. After having the filet mignon at Pappa Bros Steakhouse I seriously couldn't finish the one I ordered at Taste of Texas. It was overly seasoned and the flavor of the beef was just way inferior.Yes this place is packed alot of the time but so is the Aquarium and we all know how horrible that place is.

Ok we went on Saturday night at 7pm and was told 1-2 hours wait time. It took only about 45 minutes so not bad. The décor is nice and the place appears very clean. The staff were all super nice. I really did not have anything to complain about except lack of seasoning on the steaks (they are super huge) BUT this was nothing special when it come to a great steak. The salad bar was nice and the jalapeno cornbread and jelly were good and so were our sides but as far as steak goes I have had better (elsewhere and at home) and at $50  for most steaks on the menu a little pricey for not the best steak. All in all a fun night but not a $400.00 night for 5 people with only 1 bottle of inexpensive wine and no dessert. Also not a very good bar. I asked for a Manhattan with Jack Daniels Honey and they had NO flavored alcohols at all and they used cherry juice and bitters for my Manhattan! WHO does that? Anyway I guess its ok for out of town guest maybe but I won't be back.
Absolutely amazing!  The service and food was exceptional!  Make sure you are ready to eat because portions are Texas sized!

High priced steaks, but they are good.  Blair B. has got it on the mark.  It's casual atmosphere with gourmet food... basically Texas in a nutshell.  The salad bar has nice cheese and choices of fresh breads.  The baked potato soup is great, and the fillet is one of the best I've ever had.  The Gold Burger use to be good, but last time I had one it was lacking.... but it's still the only thing under $10 on the menu.If you go on the weekends, expect to wait up to an hour at some points.  They do give you free popcorn and soda while you wait though.  It's a good place to bring someone to show them Texas steak.It's a good place to take someone but not the place you go to regularly.  There are plenty of other places to get a decent steak in this city.Random Fact:  Owner Edd Hendee is a big GOP supporter and can be found on KSEV talk radio. ksevradio.com/edd_hendee

You will have a long wait if you go on a Saturday night, but it is so worth it.  Great salad bar, Steaks are flavorful and tender, and dessert was to die for!!  They have a nice waiting area and provide drinks and snacks at no charge while you wait.  Great service and fantastic food.
The food is excellent, the service even better. The atmosphere completes the package!
Would always bring non-Texan friends there for a fun and nice dinner.
One of Houston's best!  Food is delicious and the service is great!  Prices are in line with the quality and amount of food that you get.  A true Texas experience that I highly recommend.

I've never had better steak than Taste of Texas. I talk about it so much, I get Taste of Texas gift cards for Christmas. When you mention that they have a salad bar, it sounds (to me) less nice than it is. This isn't a salad bar, but rather a shrine to all things salad. The salad comes in at a close second to the steak, for me. Our favorites are: appetizer-Grilled Quail Skewer, meal - any of the filets, and my girlfriend loves the slice of heaven mouse cake for dessert.

Their steaks were fantastic. Their salad bar was so filthy--it looked like a team of drunken paraplegics had been troughing away at it all night long. I was very dissapointed in my choice of having the salad bar as my meal. Everything was mixed together--chopped hard boiled eggs in the cloudy white tomatoes, all the dressings slung around into each other and all over everything else, the olives filled with chunks of everydamn thing into a sort of rancid looking soup..the prepared salads looked old like theyd been reused for a few days--I took one look at that salad bar and thought about just how filthy the line must be--and the walk-in must be straight out of Kitchen NIghtmares..However, the greens (that were on top...) were fresh and crisp and the huge chunks of cheese and excellent jalapeno cornbread were very, very good together..(which ended up being my meal..)The snickers pie was sooo.o.o good-- I highly recommend it. The table near us ordered a huge whole cake sized piece of chocolate cake--even I could have shared that one=)The service was very good and I mustve had my tea refilled every sip I took=) The manager came by and asked if everything was okay to which I replied that the salad bar was dirty and he handled it perfectly to me..he was so on top of it and polite I expected that it would have been wiped and cleaned a little--but no. Still a pig trough when I went for more jalapeno cornbread (it's his fault!!=)Obviously this place needs someone with balls enough to enforce some standards...And they need to be careful or someone is going to sue them over that big hunka cheese..I wonder how many people have had heart attacks in there=)?

Was in Houston on business and went here on the suggestion of a local.  Amazing steak. That isn't why I'm writing the review.  It's been a couple of months since I was here and I find myself daydreaming about the pecan pie I had that night. I don't know where I can find anything that amazing in my neck of the woods and am fantasizing about flying back there to order one.

Birthday celebration brought us here. As in other reviews, place was packed, does not take reservations. It took approximately 30 minutes to be seated. Husband and I split the 16 oz ribeye. Ordered it medium, it came well done. Sides were baked potato and asparagus. Salad bar comes with steaks. Even though the steak was over cooked, it had good flavor. $2.15 per oz with 16 oz minimum. The extra side of 4 asparagus was $3.99! $1.00 per spear is a little much. Other couple had the 6 oz filet and the sirloin. Filet was cooked correctly, sirloin was under cooked, but the waiter corrected with a smile. Birthday boy received free choice of dessert, apple pie. I had creme brûlée, and other two had snickers pie. All were very good, made in house. Waiter took picture of birthday boy and had it printed by end of dinner. Overall good experience, except for the incorrect cooking of steaks.

I love this place!! They have an awesome salad bar and wide selection of entrees. They add a little umph to their restaurant by letting you pick out your own steak in the back. I come here every year for my birthday. I just wish they opened earlier on the weekends.. and the only negative review is that you cannot make reservations for two people. I like to come here for my birthday with my boyfriend but I hate the wait.
There was absolutely nothing wrong with the food, but if you're going to spend this much money, you might as well go down the street to Perry's!  Just didn't feel like I got my money's worth here.
Steak Paradise !  Great salad bar!    NUFF SAID

Oh, Taste of Texas, how I love thee!  This is probably my favorite steakhouse in Houston.  For starters, I understand there is always a long, long wait when people come here, but who can deny free popcorn, chips & salsa, and soft drinks??  Once you do get seated and open the menu, you are absorbed in many different selections, but the best is definitely their steaks.  In my opinion, their bone-in filet is the best cut.  I have had many others (i.e. prime rib, center cut filet, cowboy, ribeye, etc), but the bone-in filet is a must try.  When you order their entrees, you get to go to the bottomless salad bar (best salad bar in Houston, by far!!), and a side order.  Another great thing about this place is that you can actually pick out the steak that you want them to cook for you.  They will give you this option if you choose to do so.As far as desserts go, I always choose the slice of heaven, and it definitely tastes like heaven!!  This is a dark and white chocolate mousse with a raspberry sauce on the side....probably the best dessert here!  I have also had their crème brulee and that is very delicious as well!  The service here is impeccable...their staff is very well trained and professional.  The décor is very cowboy-like, and being from Texas, we love that stuff!  If you have never been to this place, it's definitely a good place to celebrate an anniversary, birthday, or any type of holiday or party.
I will be back.  I will be back.  I will  be back!

This was a unique restaurant. It has a fine dining feel with a very laid back casual feel. The food was very tasty. When I went with some friends that had been there before, they said the deserts are usually better and are a hit or miss. I was shocked at the salad bar. The good quality ingredients made an excellent salad. I would recommend this restaurant to others and would like to return.

If you're starving then you need to come here to eat because there is no way you leave hungry--- unless you hate the food but that's definitely not going to be a factor.This was my first time here and it was a great experience. First, the decor is fun. It reminds me of a wooden lodge in the middle of some forest. It has old guns, knives, and other artifacts. It's a big place and has very comfortable leather chairs... even in the dining area.The wait/paging system actually makes sense. They actually write the time you've arrived and the "quote" of when you'll be seated and give you a little card with that information and a number. I think all restaurants should do that.The food is so GOOD. There is an open salad bar if you wish to add that to your bill plus you get complimentary very fresh warm bread rolls and cornbread. And I'm talking fresh because they keep it in a warm fridge and you just go over to it and grab as many as you want. They have a good menu although if you're looking for seafood don't come here. They are crab cakes (which are the best I've ever had) and shrimp, but that's about it. You really want their steaks.And I need to mention that the staff are so cool and very friendly. My waitress was so attentive, gave great recommendations and actually looked like she enjoyed her job. We are so coming back here!!Oh the parking lot gets packed fast during prime time so just expect that little delay.

Every time I visit Houston, my family knows to bring me here because it is my favorite restaurant in the city and my favorite steakhouse...anywhere.I have yet to find any place that can beat the filet mignon at Taste of Texas.  I've tried a little bit of other cuts as well, and they've all been delicious.  Everything is always cooked to order and having the option of adding bacon to your steak just makes it all better.In addition to the fabulous slices of cow, the bread rolls are great, the salad bar is fairly extensive for a steakhouse, the side dishes are hearty, and the desserts are very rich.  The entire meal is utterly and completely worth the price range and the shame of unbuttoning your pants afterward.

The COW Bites!So I've been here a couple of times but none since I have joined yelp.  Well today I had the opportunity to come back.  First, this place has a waiting area full of complimentary beverages and popcorn.  Who else gives you free food while you wait?!?!  It makes the wait, even if a short one fly by.Now once we were seated the aweseomeness continued.  All of their entrees come with a complimentary salad bar.  So you expect it to be a pretty lame salad bar since it's free, but NO!  Taste of Texas delivers a mean salad bar.  The spinach was fresh, the toppings were plentiful, and fresh cheese is a must!!!A good steak place to me is defined by their filet.  Well this place outdoes itself.  They served Certified Angus Beef!!!  I always get my steaks medium, and this place served it perfect, brown on the outside with a pink center.  Now with their steaks they offer a free wrap of bacon, lemon pepper rub, or/and a sizzling garlic plate.The bacon is not necessary, but the lemon pepper and the hot garlic plate is a MUST.  It comes out on a metal plate in the shape of a cow.  When the waiter places down the hot plate, they give you a warning of "the cow bites".  These plates are scorching!!! The aroma that resonates from the steak is orgasmic.  As far as the sides go, the sweet potato fries were eh...the asparagus was meh also.  But the steak itself is worth the 5 stars.I was way too stuffed for dessert but they offer more than 9 delicious desserts from what I remember.

My dad had decided that we would be going to Tokyo One for a family friend's graduation/get-together dinner. I found this offensive on many levels. I don't really feel like exploring the depths of my feelings on this, so I'll just say this: Japanese buffet. I also don't feel like explaining this, so, again: Japanese. Buffet. Fortunately, my dad decided upon providing other options--Taste of Texas and graduation boy's place of choice (despite my badgering, he didn't add in the obvious choice--my choice; so what if it's not my graduation, I have excellent taste). Graduation boy chose Taste of Texas.Thank my heavens above the wagon train! Taste of Texas is on the south side of I-10, just inside of Beltway-8. Google maps gives crappy directions, as, if you're going west, you should exit Gessner, not Wilcrest. The interior is a cross between a large log cabin and a steakhouse, with an open waiting area that had nice couches and chairs. I saw various people in polos, sneakers, and one fellow who had the winning combination of cargo khaki shorts and flip flops, and realized changing from jeans to a skirt on my way there was entirely unnecessary.Before your meal, small melba toasts are brought out with butter and jam. After ordering, you trek out to the salad bar, which has your greens and standard toppings, as well as some cheese for you to shave off (probably cheddar and parm), a salad of tiny mozzarella balls and grape tomatoes (I imagine this is so you can display it next to your steak so that it may seem larger), this awesome sweet, cinnamon sliced almonds topping, and the bread, which is in a heated...clear mini-fridge-looking thing. There's a mildly sweet roll, which goes great with the cinnamon butter, honey, and strawberry jam (the cinnamon butter is faaabulous); jalapeno cornbread, which is good, but cornbread isn't at its peak when sitting in a preheated...thing; and a cheesy roll, which looks like a domed cinnamon roll, and is nice in a mildly cheesy way, but can be a little too stiff up top (heated mini-fridge--damn you!).We had the crabcake ($14.95 to start), which is one crabcake about the size of a meaty athletic man's fist (3" in diameter or so). It's nicely jumbo lump crab meaty, with a slight hint of cheese, but, eh, I still like getting more food to share before a meal. The bacon-wrapped quail (~$15 for 4 skewers) came with fried jalapeno poppers (the batter calls to mind panko). I bit into one, got a little bit of cream cheese, and stuffed the entire thing in my mouth, resulting in more cream cheese than I'd bargained for (which is often the case...). My 6oz center-cut filet ($31.95) was pretty disappointing. I'd ordered it medium rare, and it was somewhere between a medium and medium well. Even then, it had no flavor and wasn't particularly tender. I had high expectations for the 16oz. New York strip sirloin ($37.95), which were only mildly met. I actually much preferred the 24-oz. Cowboy steak, which as a ribeye, was more flavorful and tender. Though we were at a steakhouse, I actually liked the Texas pecan-crusted chicken breast, stuffed with herbed goat cheese, pecans, and onions ($17.95), as it was rather tender, and had that panko (or panko-esque) coating. The sides we got were forgettable: potatoes au gratin (all creamy cheese, no melty cheese), sauteed mushrooms (the mushrooms looked of the cold mushroom salad variety), asparagus with hollandaise (thick asparagus stalks, but the hollandaise wasn't anything to write home about), and sweet potato fries (average). For dessert, we had the Snickers pie/cheesecake/cake, which has a layer of cream, a buttery crust layer, cheesecake, a Snickers crust layer, then chocolate. I actually really liked the buttery crust layer, and a Snickers or peanuts lover should like this. We also got the ice cream in a boot (you get to keep the glass boot--or, rather, get a new one), which has cinnamon ice cream with Frangelico, amaretto, creme de cacao, and another liqueur (possibly Bailey's). Others in our party liked it, but I found the thin sweetness of those liqueurs wasn't balanced by the slightly icy-textured ice cream, which would've been better with a buttery texture.There was some confusion when the other servers were dropping off the food, but service was friendly. The level of service wasn't on par with that of a fine dining steakhouse, which isn't what Taste of Texas purports to be anyway. It's a casual place for steak, which is fun. Our server, when we were leaving, adopted the Trekkie salute, and said, "Live long and prosper"--I was rather startled by that, and had to confirm that our party hadn't discussed Star Trek with him. However, if I have to pay steakhouse-level prices, I think I'd rather go to one with a less casual atmosphere. If I want a cheaper steak with a fun atmosphere, I'd just go to steak night at a bar.

Definitely my favorite upscale steakhouse! Steaks are great, salad bar is good, I love the bread & cinnamon butter, desserts are good, & service excellent! There's usually a wait, but it's the only place I know of that gives you free drinks and popcorn or chips & salsa while you wait. And the wait is worth it every time! Prices are a little high, but you get what you pay for. My boyfriend and I usually split a steak since I can't eat much, then we just add on an extra side & salad bar. I've had wine and mixed drinks, all are good. We tried FOGO (the one in Dallas) and it didn't even compare. I would choose TOT every time! Love it!

yeppp prettttty amazing stuff here. i've heard so much about the BBQ and ribs in texas that i thought i was going to be disappointed since my expectations were set so high. nope - not the case at all. the food was aaaaaamaazing - everything from the meat, to the starches, to the sweets. i couldn't button my jeans or even breathe after, but it was nonetheless a great dining experience.
I loved the decor but the customers were dressed down. The jalapeno cornbread was amazing. I really liked how a side order and a salad bar came with a steak, made it a complete meal.

Taste of Texas...just OK.  Not the best steak by far....We have been there a few times...they do not take reservations, which is a problem if you have a big party with kids on a busy night.  They do have a room in the back where you can have sodas and chips while you are waiting, which is a nice thing...but the wait can be so long that by the time you get your table you are full on the chips :-( The staff is very friendly, the quality of the food is just ok....there is nothing extraordinary about it...the servings are texas size..I prefer quality over quantity!

Expensive? yes. Delicious? absolutely. There's something here for everyone. The salad bar is probably one of the best I've seen, with anything you'd want and delicious cheesy bread. Their spreads are also amazing and I wish I could take 'em home. Free drinks and popcorn while you wait outside adds a nice touch.Be ware that a bigger piece of meat may not cook easily to what your preferences are, so take that into consideration. Came here for a bachelor party and a date and was very satisfied both times.

This has to be the best steakhouse in Houston, and I've eaten at many.  Great Texas museum like setting, with many interesting historic documents and artifacts.  Love the food, especially any type of steak - sure to be top quality.  Then - after dessert - you can take pictures wearing a Texas cowboy hat.  Pretty cool atmosphere with unbeatable food.  Family of four eats for $200-$250.

nice environment, currently well decorated for holidays.great service, tasty food. you need to check out when you are in houston. P.S. even had fun at the waiting area, comfortable and good for taking pictures with friends, just for fun!
Awesome salad bar, good tortilla soup, mouth watering steak, and delicious snicker pie plus great service. Overall, awesome experience.

Me gusta mucho!  And I'm not all that into steaks!But when I think I want me a chunk of beef, I head here.Service is A++, decor is relaxing and fancy/casual.  You can't tell whether you should be prim and proper or in flip flops but no matter, the service is exceptional and everyone treats you the same!Salad bar is a must - especially the bread, raspberry vinaigrette dressing, and more recently, the pineapple slices!Their garlic butter which I always ask for on the side is to die for.  I like to taste my steak without the sauce and then dip in the sauce as I go.Desserts are heart attacks on a plates but delicious nevertheless, although I suggest sharing one with the whole table to save your health.Just how good is it?I've changed my boyfriend's mind about the prime rib he swears by at Houston's to becoming a Taste of Texas fan!  He says that even though the prime rib he got at TOT did not have the bone which helps infuse the flavors into the meat, it was still more flavorful and tender than prime rib at Houston's on a good day there!  I can't believe this die-hard Houston's fan is now into Taste of Texas!  You have no idea how much I've tried to convince him there are better places than just Houston's.

I found this restaurant through my girlfriend's iphone via the urbanspoon application. We decided to pay a visit and I must say, we left very satisfied.Want a thick slice of juicy steak? This is as good as it gets. I love the ambiance of this restaurant and the service was excellent here. The menu items are a little on the pricy side, but it is worth every single penny. 3 dollars more also gets you access to the salad bar, but I doubt you would really need it. Come here for the steak and you will leave very satisfied.

Great place! Love the Texas history. Shrimp cocktail, quail bites, and stuffed jalapeños were amazing. String onions.... Not so much. Steaks were all amazing. Salad bar and the cheese blocks were a nice touch

Great service. Occasionally the waiter doesn't come by often enough, but that is unusual. Check the hours if coming for lunch. They don't offer lunch on the weekends. I have forgotten a few times.The steaks are really good, but this is also an excellent steak house for vegetarians. They have a truly fabulous salad bar. (we often just come for salads). They also have a vegetable entree.A darn good cheeseburger and the BEST key lime pie on the planet. A little-known tip- ask for a cup of their Off-the-menu cinnamon coffee with dessert. It is delish, and complimentary. :-) Other freebies: free dessert on your birthday and anniversary.My first visit was 20 years ago as a second-grader on a school field trip. We got a free lunch and a nice tour of the restaurant. I think they still host schools. What a great little contribution to the community.A good choice for out-of-towners. Also, just noisy and casual enough that we have made it through the meal with a toddler and baby. A risky venture, though.
Unbelievably loud. Seating crammed in like cattle. Steaks were equal to Outback. Paying for The Double Tree getting served The Best Western.

having traveled for a living definitely has its advantages. They have some of the best cut meat money can buy. I have eaten at tons of steak houses and I'd have to say this place separates themselves from the rest.  Food and service was great. Came on a Friday w/o reservation and we almost walked away do to the one hour wait; however, I am glad we stayed because it was definitely worth the wait.
Great salad bar. Great steak. Great service. No complaints but be warned that the steaks are not as seasoned so that you taste the quality of the beef. Bring a fat wallet.

I don' t know what the hype is all about... Was the steak good? Yes, very good. But everything else was just... meh.... especially considering the price point.I like that the place is casual but maybe it's just too casual to be a steakhouse. When I dine out, I'm not just going someplace for the food, I'm going for the service, the ambiance, the whole experience. You're telling me I have to make my own salad AND load up my own bread basket? (And by the way, the steak prices are comparable to Fleming's, Vic & Anthony's, Spencer's, et al.)Can't I have this same experience at home?Our server was very friendly and nice... a bit talkative but I'm fairly sociable so I dealt with it. The old fashioned (my standard measuring stick of an establishment's barkeep) was diluted with club soda - fail. The wine was good but a tad lacking on the variety available by the glass. I like the concept but it just doesn't justify the price. I'm far from cheap but when you drop this kind of coin, expectations are higher. I probably won't be back. Not because the food was horrible, because it just isn't worth it with all the other steakhouses out there.A great steak does a great steakhouse not make.

There was so much I loved about Taste of Texas starting the the atmosphere, the service, the bread, and ending with the salad bar.  I say ending with the salad bar, because my steak was underwhelming.  Good, but not great.  The fact that I was so taken with the place up to that point that is made it even a bigger blow.  Even more annoying was the "plate" I was given.  It was some metal contraption surrounded by wood that moved whenever I tried to cut my steak.  It was also small and when combined with the placement of the bone it was nearly impossible to get  angle for cutting.
Best prime rib and salad bar. Stellar customer service/waitstaff. Very clean with a great atmosphere.

I've been going here for years and had celebrated my birthday every single year. As a frequeny customer, I find the steaks and salad bar to be amazing, but in recent years, the new additions and subtle changes seem to be negative. One area is the salad bar, it has gotten smaller with a little less variety, although still plently. I guess the recession hit good old taste of texas. Regardless, this place is still amazing.

This place is absolutely amazing! The food, atmosphere, service, EVERYTHING! You get more than you pay for in my opinion.  I love being able to go back and pick your own steak, the sides are scrumptious, and the service is so wonderful and quick.  I am not a big steak person, but my boyfriend is.  I tasted his steak and it was to die for! This place makes me want to eat steak on a regular basis!

Taste of Texas just keeps getting better and better.  We've been visiting for over 20 years and come away each time so happy with every aspect of the place.  It's Clean, clean, clean.  While wait staff don't stand around often, when they do, they are polishing wine glasses.  The salad bar has the freshest, best selection imaginable, with fresh baked bread in three varieties, butter, flavored or not is so good.  Pick your own cut of meat, always cooked to perfection.  Appetizers are to die for.  Beware only of the cost of alcoholic beverages, it your not careful it will double the size of your bill.  I love the Taste of Texas!  Keep up the good work and if you're visiting Houston, it's a must.
