Excellent service and food. Come casually dressed as this is not a very formal place although I would like it to be. Enjoyed the fact that I was able to go to the kitchen to pick out my porterhouse steak (my first time picking a steak out from the kitchen) The jalapeno cornbread is awesome a long with the salad bar options. The best part was that we were given an option for free dessert for my birthday; we had a choice from all the dessert options. All in all great experience and great food. Our waiter was nice enough to give us some jalapeno corn bread to go too.ps- They took a picture of us and the dessert/printed it and stuck it on a card which I thought was very thoughtful. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

Upon entering the restaurant you see all the reviews of being number one. The wait was 45 mins when we arrived on a Thursday night. I figured, wow it must be good. Anyway, when we got to the bar, I saw this piece of cow hanging off this dude's plate. What? are you serious?? He must want a heart attack. We finally get seated, our waiter was really nice. He actually prided himself on regurgitating Taste of Texas statistical information. "we cook 3,000 steaks a day" and "it takes us 3,000 man hours to put up Christmas decorations" (cough - Loser) Anyway, the group of us ordered 3 appetizers and then found out there was a salad bar. The salad bar was good, lots of variety! The bread.....well, the bread....the BREAD! Was the BOMB!!! Did I tell you the bread was the bomb. the butter was even better. Okay, off of the bread. The appetizers came we ordered, stuffed mushrooms - good! onions strings - good! spinach dip - okay. At that point we had food up to our necks, but we kept going. I ordered the Tbone and the au gratin. the Tbone seemed to be the smallest besides the prime rib or fillet. Everything else on the menu was 10lb or greater. Yeah, a vegan nightmare, you know. The Tbone was good, I had better, but again I had food up to my neck so i think i lost all sense of taste. The waiter gave a tour of the kitchen. That was pretty decent. He was really working for that tip. HMMM, he didn't tell us how much he makes in tips every day. Maybe $3,000 pennies??? When we returned back to the table, we ordered 3 desserts. What?!?!? I am about to die. Anyway, I had the creme brule. It was tasty. Needless to say, when I got home I walked my dog 2 times around the block. I just had to work off the feeling on gluttony. I also surprised him with a juicy bone!! YAY Taste of Texas

It's definitely not one of the top steakhouses but for newcomers and visitors to Houston, its a must!  The ambience is truly TEXAN and first time visitors always receive a red bandana to commemorate the occasion! Don't get me wrong, I love me a mouth-watering steak, but I would have to say that the complimentary salad bar is what keeps me coming back!  Last night, I decided to have the salad as my meal and it Its fresh and has such a diversity of options. Did I mention the cinnamon butter yet?!?!  Quick tip- come early or come late but not during peak dinner times because your wait will be at least 45 minutes to 1.5 hours!

Service was great!  Beyond great.  Other than not so good. For starters I had the hand cut ribeye 20oz.  My opinion for price for the steak they should at least use dry aged steaks.  I have bought same quality of meat local grocery store for about 1/4 of the price granted I had to cook it but still.  I didn't mention noise. Loud!!!

I've lived in New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, St. Louis, and Springfield, MO...without a doubt, this place served the best steak I've ever had!  I've had the New York Strip, T-Bone, and the Center Cut Fillet (16 oz medium rare)!  Although it's pricey, the meat melts/dissolves in your mouth.  I've had some mediums and medium well...and it's nothing like the jerky feeling you get from other steak house!  Whenever my family or friends visit Houston, I proudly take them here!  The salad is amazing too!  They have all sorts of dressings (cilantro dressing is great!) and the bread and butter are awesome too!  They have free complementary drinks (Sprite, Coke, and Diet Coke) while you wait!  There is like an hour+ wait during the weekends, but it's all worth it!  Hands down, this is my favorite steak place I've ever been to!

The service is simply awesome. The waiter made sure my glass was always full and was very attentive. Food came quickly and the delivery timing for each coarse was perfect. Salad bar was fresh and a meal in itself. Had pecan encrusted chicken, simply delicious.  I definitely plan to return.

I took my 2 employees here for a end of the year lunch. After getting used to the mediocre service and the Houston-based chains, I was thinking that this place wouldn't be as good as I heard. Luckily, the service was absolutely fabulous. I don't do salad so I got to watch the waiter fold their napkins everytime they got up. I loved this so I guess I should go to more places that don't have drive-thrus! The food was beyond divine. My steak was absolutely butter! We talked and talked during our lunch and ended up being there for 2-1/2 hours. At no time did I ever feel like they wanted us out of there. They continued to make sure our needs were met. I can tell you that I left the biggest tip because of the amount of time we were there and the impeccable service. I have been to other restaurants for long meals and had the staff try to push me out the door. The service I received here will definitely bring me back. Yes, it is expensive but you get what you pay for.

This is a good steak but not great. Just doesn't compare to the top prime steak houses in Houston. It is still good and I enjoy the salad bar but if you are expecting the steak to blow you away then you will be disappointed.
Does not live up to the hype. Steak was prepared correctly But did not taste aged at all. Great sides. Will not try again.

I like this place even though i dont think the steaks are really that great... I love the salad bar, the fresh bread, and etc. The steaks nice but nothing special about them. I use to be the biggest fan of texas steak but upon moving to NYC i had Peter Luger and NY porter house and i was convinced that my memory still said texas steak was better. SO when i came back home for the first time in about 2 yrs after moving to NYC i stopped by taste of texas for some texas steak. Unfortunately texas steak didnt live up to what i remembered... it was a little bland and not special at all. I was extremely disappointed. BUT thats comparing it to Peter Luger. I still love this place and would come here again but it wasnt as good as i remembered. I like the novelty of picking your own steak but im guessing that the steak here isnt dry aged. since it all looked extremely fresh. I love the cinnamon butter here i really wish they would bring back that steak challenge!! I dont feel like going all the way to  Amarillo for the Big Texan steak challenge. THey need one in Houston!

top notch service and tour of establishment.  they took me and i got to pick the exact cut of meat i wanted.  they cooked it medium rare just right.   the manager was very kind and helpful.  extremely professional and well run restaurant.  will come again.

This may be one of the best places to have a really good meal.  I have been here on many occasions and never been disappointed.  The steaks are great, full of flavor.  You can even pick the exact one you want if need be.  I feel that the atmosphere is family friendly and great for groups.Service is great, all around a good place to go.  Worth the wait and price.

I moved from Houston and I STILL miss this place and talk about it!  They had the best service of any restaurant I've ever been too!   I loved their salad bar such fresh great choices and the pinneapple tasted like sweet tarts!  I always got their pecan crusted chicken that was stuffed with spinach and brie cheese served with wild rice.  When you order a soda they bring it along with a 1/2 caraf so you don't have to waite for them to give you refills!  My friends never complained about their steaks or burgers!  Great atmosphere, awesome service!  I soo miss this place!

The steak itself doesn't beat mama's cooking, but the high-variety high-quality salad and bread bar more than makes up for it. The staff is very friendly and hospitable, and the clean, wood-paneled, candlelit atmosphere is homely and comforting. I see why this place is one of the most prestigious steakhouses in Houston, if not all of Texas.

I LOVE this place! This place is always packed, day or night, weekday or weekend-- bc it is great! FAIR PRICES FOR GREAT FOOD! For around $38, I can get a small filet (absolutely delicious by the way), INCLUDING the wonderful salad bar, bread, and side dishes. I have gone to many other steak places that you pay separately for everything, and then it always adds up to at least $60-70 per person (not including drinks), and sometimes it's not even that great (Perry's, for example).  I think that this place is not only priced right, but the quality is wonderful-- they even have sodas and popcorn while you wait to be seated. I guess if I had any complaint, it would be long wait times, but I guess that is just bc it is so popular- WORTH THE WAIT!

Hands down my absolute favorite special-occasion family restaurant. Great for groups, but as always, when you're coming in with a group of 12, anticipate that your food will suffer. Whenever people come into town, I take them here because it embodies Texas in such a way that is lost in the myriad of chain steakhouses. There is a freakin' stuffed bear in it, for crying out loud! This place is pretty expensive for how casual it can be but the food is just quality. I think they have the best filet in town and certainly one of the best values: $38 for a 10 oz. filet, all-you-can-eat salad bar, and a side. Service is more or less good and helpful. My only gripe about this place is that it is just too damn busy. We often wait an hour and 45 minutes starting at 5:00 on a Saturday. If you get there at 6:00, forget it. You'll be circling the parking lot for the next half and hour and constantly toying with the idea of parking at Fuddruckers and risk getting your car towed. They offer complementary chips, salsa, popcorn and sodas if it is any consolation. But it never is. Also, if, by any chance, they try and sit you at the bar after your two hour wait, speak to someone and they'll fix it. The last time I went, we were sat at the bar. We didn't really care but if it was a different, important situation, it would have mattered a lot more. I strongly recommend this place, and most importantly, order the FILET ONLY. Don't order the rib-eye, t-bone, or porterhouse here. It's been done before-- they are not up to par with the filet.

Taste of Texas is absolutely my favorite restaurant for a quiet dinner special occasions or a quiet lunch.  The salad bar is incredible - especially because of the abundance of fresh fruit, the delicious homemade bread and the many salad toppings including pecans!  Some of the steaks are expensive of course  but if you don't want to spend so much you can have a wonderful meal at a very reasonable price. My son always gets a steak, his wife usually gets the salad bar as a meal, and my husband and I get the marinated steak skewer which includes the salad bar and is delicious and very reasonably priced.  The desserts are heavenly and I love that they bring the dessert tray to the table.   The staff is well trained.  If you don't want to wait you have to plan your visit carefully  - this is a VERY busy place for good reason!  But for instance getting there for lunch at 11 is usually a safe bet.  My son always takes us to Taste of Texas for Mother's Day (a long standing tradition for us) but we now go the week before or after Mother's Day early Saturday or Sunday evening - same wonderful food, service and ambiance without the wait.  The only difference is I don't get a rose. :-) I can live without the rose! :-)  He also takes us there for my birthday which is a few days after Christmas.  Hmmmm.  Christmas is pretty much packed anytime they are open because of the wonderland they turn it in to.  So for my birthday we sometimes just go and happily wait with everyone else!  :-)   Any time we have out-of-town company, Taste of Texas is always in our plans.  I have never been disappointed with anyone's reaction - it is a great place to take family, friends,  guests or business associates.  When there is a wait,  they even make the wait comfortable by providing complimentary popcorn, chips/salsa and soft drinks!  There are great places all around the property to take pictures of your group.  All in all Taste of Texas is my favorite place to dine!

I had a delicious bone-in filet cooked to my delight.  High-quality meat The salad bar and rolls were superb.  Overall the food was better than I expected.  Service was good.  Very large place, so it had a different feel than your typical low-lighting steakhouse

I know there are many more steakhouses in Houston that are probably better than Taste of Texas - but this was the first place I had real steak and I will always love it. My parents felt embarrassed when we brought my uncle (the one with super high expectations) and I mentioned it was the first time I had eaten steak outside of home..this was during either 8th or 9th grade. I've always thought this place offered the best bang for your buck. Salad bar - fresh everything! Bread - umm can't get enough. Filet Mignon wrapped in bacon- medium rare - only way to go. I will only get the Filet here, but I've tried other steaks and just didn't like them as much. The service has always been great here and I love that it's a steakhouse that isn't super stuffy/ semi-formal attire required. However, I could easily do without the 1.5- 2 hour waits during the weekends, so I'd definitely advise going on a weekday or just getting there for an early dinner on the weekend (esp. if you have a big party). I've spent hours waiting - eating popcorn, drinking sodas, watching tv - and in the end, it is always worth it. Can't wait to go back!

This is our "go to" place for celebrations!  It is pricey, but so worth it!  The food is great, and the service is outstanding.  The salad bar is very fresh.  Don't overlook the pineapple slices, which are usually super sweet and juicy.  The breads are tasty, and the cinnamon butter is to die for!  I also love the gigantic blocks of Wisconsin cheddar at the end of the salad bar.  The steaks are very tender and cooked to order.  You can choose your own steaks if you want to.  The vegetables that come with the meals are perfectly cooked... a bit crispy almost!  The waiters are friendly and very attentive.  There is always wait staff around to straighten up your table while you're at the salad bar, bring anything you need, refill drinks, etc.  Other notable items are the pomegranate martinis, cappuccinos (even decaf ones!) and the apple dumplings, which are served with the most delectable Blue Bell cinnamon ice cream.

I went to Taste of Texas not to long ago with my sweet love and it was absolutely perfect!!!I got the filet and my love got the bone-in filet , are streaks couldn't have been any better !!! :) cooked soo perfect!! I got a huge potato fully loaded man sooo freakn good! and green beans with almonds  I LOVED IT ALL!! the waiter was cool as shit!! He took really good care of us! Thanks Taste of Texas! Awesome!

Grilled Salmon with asparagus.  Awesome! As was my husbands 16 oz ribeye.  Forgot how much we loved this place.  Service was outstanding.  Salad bar above average and fresh baked bread was soft hot and delicious.  Wait to be seated was 1 1/2  hours-- yes I said 1 1/2 hours was worth it!

Taste of Texas is a great restaurant!  Wonderful steaks, great service!  The jalapeno shrimp appetizers (along with the baked brie) are just great!  There is a reason that you wait in line to eat there, wait in the bar and have a glass of wine!                                                       review by Vaughan

We picked this restaurant for a company dinner after a day at the office. Parking is a little challenging, but that is just because they obviously fill up (even on a Wednesday). However, the staff seated us very quickly and never missed a beat. The service is exactly what you'd expect from a 1st class steak house, and the food is excellent.

I use to LOVE Taste of Texas... until I discovered Papa's Steakhouse, Vic and Anthony's, or the other 100000 better steakhouses in Houston. The only good thing that I enjoy about Taste of Texas is the salad bar.The past THREE times I have gone there the person I have gone with (boyfriend/friend) have had their steaks incorrectly cooked. My boyfriend ordered it medium rare-medium and it comes out completely RARE. I love eating my steaks medium rare or even a little on the rare side, but this was completely rare in the middle. This happened TWICE! They cooked it correctly the second time, but they should really take the other persons food and recook it also. I don't really enjoy eating by myself when my boyfriend doesn't have his food. They apologized and the waitress was really nice. I wrote on a comment card the second time this happened and they mailed me a 25 gift certificate which was very nice. I decided to take my friend there the next time because she is a taste of texas fan. We went and the SAME thing happened again. She wanted her steak medium well and it came out medium rare. The second time she specified she only wanted a little bit of pink inside and it came back out and was medium rare again. She just told the waitress that she would cook it herself on the hot plate, and she did what she said! haha. I'm definitely never going to come to Taste of Texas ever again. There is no reason to go there when there are steakhouses that are so much better. Try Papas or Vic's and you'll never want to go to Taste of Texas again!

If you are looking to spend quality time, have great Texas steak, and enjoy Christmas then this is the place to be. Do arrive early enough to wait in line. The place is very popular and people are willing to wait for hours, it's just that good. We usually reserve the place in line and go to the "City Center" for an hour, which is located with in the walking distance of the restaurant. This is not the place to visit on a budget, but whatever money you spend will be worth every dollar. The stake is like no other in Houston - I recommend the Cowboy Steak. This was a second year for us to visit the restaurant for Christmas and I think it will be our new tradition. One more thing - bring your camera! The restaurant is decorated with lots of Christmas decorations. You will want to take a picture by the fireplace... Regarding parking: park at "bed bath and beyond" it is closer then the restaurant parking lot.

Love love love Taste of Texas. They don't take reservations, but if you have enough time, it's definitely worth the wait. I take everyone who visits to Taste of Texas. The salad bar is great as well, and well worth it. Love the huge blocks of cheese. Another great thing about Taste of Texas is you can choose your own meat. You can choose how marbled, how thick, etc you want your cut. If you order ribeye, you can order exactly how many oz you want as well and the thickness. Taste of Texas is a wonderful place and a must-have if you've never had it.

BEST STEAK IN HOUSTON. You have to get the sizzling garlic butter, it makes the steak even better. Beautiful cuts of meat, amazing service, great salad bar, perfect bread (that you pick out on your own - regular, jalapeño corn bread or cheese rolls with butter, sweet butter and honey) I honest got too full to try my broccoli but our amazing server boxed it up for me so I'll eat it leftover for lunch tomorrow. Yes, you will have to wait - but it is more than worth it. We arrived at 6:46 on a Friday and were seated by 7:20. They have popcorn, soda and chips and salsa for free while you wait plus a huge bar and waiting area so you can start your evening with pre-dinner drinks. Our server was so great, asked if we had a special occasion, made suggestions, boxed my food, seriously superb service. I can't wait to come back here. My favorite restaurant ever hands down. Oops I ate my food too fast to take pictures

By far the BEST steak I've ever had. I don't think there is any restaurant out there that compares to the steak at Taste of Texas. I ordered the 10oz fillet with the garlic butter topping, medium rare. Steak is aged for 30+days making it melt in your mouth tender. I've never had such tender steak. My brother order the filet mignon topped with crab cake which was also fantastic. Although the salad bar is extensive so there is no need to order an appetizer, we still went ahead and got the jalapeño stuffed shrimp which I highly recommend! The cheese rolls with the cinnamon butter are also amazing -I must have eaten 4 rolls! For dessert we ordered the pecan crust pumpkin cheese cake and which paired with a coffee is a great way to finish a meal. The staff is so friendly and knowledgeable. The wait can be 2+ hours on the weekends but extremely worth it. People come from all over the state and across the country to try the steak here! Tip: if you come in around 4 for an early dinner the wait is more like a half hour.

It always works out that Trevor B. hates a place for no good reason, and then I goad him into going there and it turns out he's right. I hate it when that happens. It was so hard for Taste of Texas to live up to the hype though that I almost can't blame the restaurant. So, for the good: The service is impeccable at ToT. I think their wait staff should train all the other wait staff in Houston and then maybe I could have a decent dining experience everywhere I go. Drinks were refreshed continuously, and our waiter, Justin, was attentive and helpful. The ambiance is nice - mood lighting and a fire cast a warm glow about the place. I almost forgot it was the middle of the afternoon.In terms of taste, the salad bar was really good. Unfortunately, from all the raves I had heard about it, I pictured it to be a vast expanse stretching from one end of the restaurant to another. in reality, it's quite small as far as size, but the pre-made salads were delicious overall and it had fresh yummy bacon. I was not a big fan of the oversized cheese blocks ... something about my cheese being vulnerable and sitting out in the open like that. I did not partake.I could have eaten 10 of the dinner rolls and 10 more pieces of cornbread and rolled away quite happy.The bad: Overall, the food was average. I ordered my cowboy steak medium rare, but by the time I had taken a few bites of it, it had come up to temperature at a solid medium. Normally, I would have sent it back, but I was distracted by a cranky infant and I had already eaten enough of it to be underwhelmed anyway. The meat tasted okay, but it was a bit of ribeye gone wrong, much more fatty than I would expect for the price. (For the record, I know that the attraction of a ribeye is the marbling, but in a well-cooked ribeye, the fat melts into the meat to provide all the flavor so you don't have to contend with ribbons of it in each bite.) The au gratin potatoes that I ordered on the side generally tasted like cream and potatoes. I should've sliced a sliver of cheese from the salad bar to mix in.The ugly: My steak came to me on a ridiculous cow-shaped plate that was exactly the same size as my steak. No room to cut. No room to move the surgically removed fat tendrils to one side. It also wasn't level on the bottom so it rocked and clicked with each knife swipe. I almost slapped my steak onto the table in frustration. Let's not be cute, I just want to eat.Overall, I was really disappointed with the whole experience. Maybe it's because I had such an amazing experience at Fleming's recently. Maybe it's because Trevor B's shrimp so offended him that he ruined my experience overall. Maybe, baby.But there's no maybe about it; I don't think I'll be going back.

Best salad bar in Houston! Delicious jalapeño corn bread.  The service is great and gratuity is never included which means the servers strive to earn it.  Big fan of the chocolate cake; it's gigantic!  Center-cut filet is always my choice but I recommend having them butterfly it so they know it's perfect before you cut into it.  Also love the Christian music in the restrooms.

I think this place represents Texas so well.  It's homey but a just a tad classier than you'd expect.  Large families and groups of friends are accommodated well and that's also pretty Texas.The best appetizer are the crabcakes.  They are to die for.  Large chunks of crab meat with minimal breading.  I would have never known to order these but the people we were with knew about their greatness.The steaks are good, not the best, but good.  They could use a bit more seasoning.  The salad buffet line is overkill.  The bread is so good with all the different butter and spreads you can put on them.  Try to limit yourself at the bar so that you can save room for dessert!The make your own sundae ice cream is fantastic.  Cinnamon ice cream is a lovely treat. You'll leave this place stuffed and it is a bit on the pricey side, but it's so worth it.

We recently went to Taste of Texas to celebrate one of my friend's birthdays for lunch. The birthday girl had the salad bar and a baked potato, while the rest of us had the Grilled Tenderloin Salad. Just thinking of this salad makes my mouth water. The pieces of tenderloin, which is marinated to give it a perfect balance of sweet and salty, sit atop a bed of mixed greens with pieces of grapefruit, avocado, grilled red onions and candied almonds. There is also a fried blue cheese croquette that sits on the top of the salad. All of this is topped with a cilantro vinaigrette that marries everything together.  I usually don't eat the whole piece of fried blue cheese because it is a little pungent for my taste. Our server's name was Steven, who was awesome. He and I engaged in a delightful chat about our favorite wines. Unfortunately, my pregnant state allows me to do more talking about wine, rather than drinking it. He mentioned a Silver Oak vintner's dinner next month, which I wish I could attend. He also suggested that the next time I drink, I should try a pinot noir with a nice filet. One thing that I probably would have never thought of doing.Steven educated us on a few other things that day - apparently they make all of their bread and accompaniments on the premises. Even the delightful little slices of candied almonds that my friends loved are made in house.  Pros: Good salad bar; fresh hot bread; Good place for lunch; Good service; Excellent place to take visiting relativesCons: Somewhat on the pricey side when everyone orders steaks; No reservations so your wait (especially weekend nights) can be long

We waited for about 50 minutes but it was worth the wait.  I came here and the steak was really good.  I had the prime rib and it was very tasty. THe salad was great.  THey have the cuts of meat to choose from in the back of the restaurant on display, like in a butcher shop, which was the first time I had seen in a restaurant....
Taste of Texas may be the premiere dining experience available in the Houston area. Food is of excellent quality, and the service is second to none. Prepare to feast!

I was so excited to come and get a big texas steak from a steak house which was highly recommended to us.  Sadly I was not nearly impressed as I had hoped to be.We came in on Tuesday at about 5pm, thankfully at a time where there is no wait.  Looks like the wait can be super long sometimes though, yikes!We were sat and were introduced to our waiter.  He answered a few questions and seemed really nice, then he was gone and another guy was there to serve us... then another guy trying to swoop on our table.  It became a little confusing.Finally after all the waiter confusion, we ordered.  My mom and I picked the new york steak to share since it was at least twice the size of what I could consume and a glass of wine.Wine was good.  The waiter brought me a taste of two of them which I always find a very nice gesture.  The pour on the wine was also a nice size.We went to the salad bar.  I will give this place props on their salad bar it was pretty awesome.  The downfall of it though is our table felt so far from it, if you wanted something again, it felt like such a journey to go back.The steak and sides came and were nothing spectacular.  The steak seemed a little odd in texture and the mushrooms were terrible.  The veggie was so unmemorable I order, I don't even know what it was now...Especially for the price of this place, I won't go out of my way to go back!
baked brie = goodfilet migon = juicy & tender! salad bar & bread = yummmy!snickers cheesecake = heaven :)

The true Taste of Texas is meatAnd beef lovers crave some to eat.   So, serve a filet   With which she can playThen smile as she downs that thick treat. Playing with your food might best be done in a private setting, but Taste of Texas certainly isn't lacking in thick slabs of beef that can whet any appetite for meat. In the December 2007 Texas Monthly Magazine, ToT was designated as one of the eight best steakhouses in Houston. It undoubtedly deserves this recognition. ToT has always delivered for me whether I was in a small party or a large group. I don't believe its quality ranks up there with Pappas Bros. but it will consistently provide you with a top quartile dining experience. This place is great for large parties whether they be corporate or friends from out of town. Be prepared to wait at least 1/2 hour when your group is large (they don't take reservations). On their website, they simply state, "Guests are seated in order of arrival." ToT does accommodate you with a waiting area that features TV screens, free popcorn and drinks.Before you dive into your main entree, you can sample their decent salad bar (note: it doesn't compare with Fogo de Chao's), bread and self-cut slices from massive hunks of cheese.The wait staff are friendly and very entertaining when you're with a large party.Their steaks are very good, but not great. The price for most of the steak entrees is around $35 which raises one's expectations. ToT is a major league steakhouse, but like that minor league pretender, Outback, they have a tendency to over-season the beef. I really like their prime rib (served voluptuously rare). Their 18 oz cut is a carnal delight. I'll also admit to having finished off their gargantuan 32 oz Porterhouse on a few occasions and then hibernated for the rest of the week.

Great place for lunch.  The salad bar was awesome!!!! The Waite staff was very attentive to your needs, made suggestions, and very knowledgeable of the menu.  I will definitely return for additional meals.

Whenever people ask me for my favorite Houston restaurant, I say Taste of Texas.  Why?  Because it's a steakhouse where you can go in jeans, slice yourself a chunk of cheese and enjoy really good food.  It's not exactly a place for a cheap date, but hey - you're getting REALLY good steak and you definitely get what you pay for.  They start you off with really good butter/jam and toasted morsels (I can't help but ask for more) and the waitstaff has always been friendly and helpful.  The salad bar is wonderful - you get fresh veggies, dressings, and you can end your trip to the salad bar with a basket of bread.Be sure not to stuff yourself with too much at first - I've made that mistake before.The filets are tender, but I prefer the soft and moist prime rib above the other slabs of meat I have had there.  At Christmas time, they deck out the place with garland, nutcrackers, and lights - and it's nice to chill out by the waiting area or massive fireplace.I would definitely recommend this place for someone looking for a relaxed way to spoil a significant other - or a trip with some friends and family for some good food and conversation.I want to go back right now....

One of the best places to eat in Houston Texas. I have been here many time for special occasions as well as for the better-than-usual steak. Dress up a little to eat here or you will feel out of place. The restaurant has a great salad bar featuring some really good cheeses, everything is extremely fresh, hot bread and a variety of butters, and a great produce selection. You have the option of choosing your piece of steak, and they will cook your meat exactly the way you ask for it  delicious. A very nice treat if you're in town!
Best Steaks EVER! the wait is worth it... love it! try it! We go when ever we can
Save your money. If you want a great steak - try Ruth's Chris. Ruth's serves aged beef and it's unbelievable! Once you try their steaks you'll be dissapointed with pretty much any other beef place.

This restaurant was a blast to eat in. As we were leaving new orleans it was an estimated six hours to get here. We left at 4 pm which may have meant we got there right before or right after they close. Even if we got there just befire they closed the kitchen might have shutdown for the night. We call the place and they said just get here before 10 and ur good. Long story short we made it there at 945. We got immediate seating and looked at their menu. Its VERY pricey but its worth it. I got the center cut filet which was the most expensive cut they had. It was tender,juicy and moist. The steak was done a brilliant medium rare. The others had prime rib or ribeye steak. Each were fantastic. With sides and trip to salad bar it was about 200 for the 4 of us. Lemme say each of us agree it was a great way to end this icon trip. Service was top notch always attentive, but maybe it was because we were like one of two or three parties there. I may check this place out again when I'm in Houston in the future. Ambience was classy but casual wear was accepted.

ADIDOS TASTE OF TEXASI will not return to this restaurant. I took my son Saturday evening, celebrating his 15th birthday. We are used to waiting 1 1/2- 2 hrs. for a table as we did Saturday evening. Once we were seated we placed our orders. I ordered my steak and told the waiter- please extra well and went on to tell him- we have been here before and most times I have to return my steak because there is red when I cut into it, so please ask them to grill it extra well. Of course was his response. Our meal arrives, my son's steak was fine, I cut into my steak and red blood spills out. Really? I asked the waiter to please throw it back on the grill. As I wait..........and wait.......25 minutes later, my son is completely finished eating his meal, here comes my steak. So....we wait almost 2 hours to be seated, so my son can eat his meal ALONE, and then I can eat my steak a half hour later. I asked the waiter to take it away, I have lost my appetite. A manager comes over and offers me his card, so I can look for him next time we come so we don't have this problem again- are you kidding me? I should come here again...place my order...then try to find this idiot and tell him to see to it they cook my steak the way I ordered it. I don't want this jerk's card. And I agree with another review about the guy at the front- dark hair, thinks he is Mr. Buff in his suit- he was as rude as heck to me when I asked what number they were up to. What a POS to have at the front door greeting patrons. Adidos Taste of Texas- you have left a bad taste in my mouth.

went there on a field trip in 4th grade, from what i remember it was a nice place. It was cute since they showed us kids the freezer and then closed us in there for like 3 seconds. We got so scared! My 4th grader mind recalls that the chicken nuggets were good.

OMG Becky, this steak is so good!  I am a steak fanatic and this is THE BEST STEAK I have ever had.  The filet is so juicy and melts in your mouth.  It was well worth the 90 minute wait.  If you get a chance, go during Christmas time to get in the spirit with all of the Christmas decor.  The salad bar is yummy too, but don't get full before your steak comes.  Heaven in your mouth!
Outstanding atmosphere, food, and service. Salad bar is the best in Houston. Steaks are fantastic, not the very best I've ever had, but very close. Definitely in my top two or three steakhouses.

Great steakhouse. I love being able to choose my own cut of beef. The salad bar is amazing and the wine selection is pretty diverse as well. Be warned the wine per glass price is a little ridiculous. The best time to go is at Christmas when it's all done up. They also have a great waiting area with free sodas and popcorn for the kids. Try it out!!

Welcome to Texas, where the appetites are big and the helpin's even bigger.  If you're ever in (arguably) the "other" armpit of America and you're not borderline atherosclerotic, make it a point to stop here for certified angus beef (aged 30-35 days). This restaurant is always bustling; you'd think it was a tourist attraction. That being said, take a number and be prepared to wait.  Well-equipped for the crowds, they have an entire section with tables, chairs, tvs, free popcorn, chips & salsa and soda dedicated to those patiently, eagerly waiting to get their grub on.  Oh, and did I mention the towering, stuffed grizzly bear in the lobby?  At any moment, you'll witness kids, bachelor and bachelorette groups hanging on the poor fella for photo ops. All steak, prime rib, and lobster dinners are served as a complete meal (NOT a la carte!  Bravo!) with your choice of all-you-can-eat salad from the bar, freshly baked (and I mean right out of the oven), warm varietal breads and a side order. I have to consciously cut myself off the salad/bread bar as I suffer from the tendency to get full prematurely.  My strong (*emphasis*) recommendation is the center cut filet mignon (request that it be bacon-wrapped) flavored with the house-speciality lemon pepper seasoning and garlic butter. It comes out on a sizzling cast iron skillet, and it's just SO so juicy. My friend's husband and his buddies always jest about breaking the published Taste of Texas records. Allegedly, the restaurant's best is 120-some oz in one sitting. Siiiick.
Food was Ok but service by our waiter Bobby was excellent. This guy is top of the line... First class all the way. Rarely have I had such incredible service. Shouts out to Bobby!

Don't get me wrong, when I have out-of-Texas guests come to visit, and they want an "authentic" Texas experience, this is one of the first places I go, but it isn't the first place I go with friends who live here.The service is excellent, the salad bar fresh, and the steaks are good, but for me they aren't always worth the high price tag.  There are other steak houses in Houston that serve as good a steak at a better, more reasonable price tag.It is a great experience, worth an every once and a while go, but not someplace I would go to every week.
Excellent steak with a few Texas signatures. Service is top notch; you even get to pick your own steak!

Let me start by saying that I don't really like steak all that much.  I do, however, love prime rib!  And Taste of Texas has THE BEST prime rib I have ever had.  Not only is the meat tender and cooked to your liking, but all the sides and the salad bar round out your meal perfectly.  I wish I had a "last supper" here before I moved out of Houston!

My family and I came here to have dinner for my birthday. Since they don't take reservations (only parties of 10 or more), I told my bf, who got there first to get a table because I know we would be waiting. There were four adults and one child. The wait was about 25 minutes. Before getting our table, we enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa, popcorn for the little one and drinks. I tried not eating so much chips and salsa so I wouldn't get full, but the salsa is darn good! Our table was finally ready...seemed like forever because I was hungry. Our waiter was friendly and very accommodating. We wanted to get a bottle of wine but wasn't sure what kind.  The waiter brought over two samples of red wine that everyone might like. It was a good choice because we decided to go with that type. We picked out a bottle of red wine that was highly rated on the wine menu. The waiter brought out the wine and let us try a little before he started serving everyone. We liked it very much....it was very smooth and not too strong and not too dry. It was now time for the salad bar...one of my favorite things about this restaurant. I got some romaine lettuce with caesar dressing topped with cheese, crumbled egg and bacon. I also scraped me up a few slices of cheese from the big blocks they have. The salad was great, as expected. The cornbread is also really good. We got the jalapeno stuffed shrimp for the appetizer...it was okay.  A little too cheesy for me.  I plan on trying the skewers of quail next time.  All four of us got the new york strip sirloin, cooked differently. It's a huge 16 oz. of meat to finish! My steak was cooked just right. It was tasty, juicy and scrumptious!  I probably ate only half of it.  It was just too much for me to finish with all the extra things I ate before the steak.  For my side, I got the gratin potatoes.  I was not disappointed.  They give you a choice to pick out your steak...kind of cool!  My daughter got the junior burger.  It came with a huge cheeseburger, steak fries and a huge pickle.  She could barely finish it...I would be stuffed finishing that meal.  The kids entrees are enormous. Since it was my birthday, the restaurant gave me a dessert of my choice which was on the house. They brought a creme brulee (my favorite!) with a sparkling candle out.  The waiter also had a camera to take a picture.  Moments later, he brought out a printed photo inside a little card for us to take with us.  That was real cute.  I don't know any other restaurants that do that.  Overall, I had a really great time with my loved ones.  The waiter was friendly and even gave me some oxi clean spray after splatting some steak juice on my white shirt.  The restaurant feels so welcoming, this place is always great to go with family or friends.
Best salad bar ever!  Great steaks and service.

I went to Taste of Texas one evening around 8pm (full disclosure -- I think it was New Year's Eve), went to put a name on the wait list (note, this was for two, not ten) and was told with a straight face "The wait is over three hours.  Here's the movie listing for the theater over there.  If you want to go see a movie, let  us know and we'll hold your table."True story.  We didn't wait.  Or see a movie.  But that experience sort of sums up Taste of Texas:  There IS going to be a wait (unless you show up at like 4pm...or maybe on a weeknight) BUT they will try to make you as comfortable as possible during that wait.  They have a very large waiting room with tables that still over flow on a busy night -- a two hour plus wait is not untypical on a weekend.  And while you are waiting there are at least two bars where you can order a drink.  You are also welcome to help yourself to sodas, tea, popcorn and chips and salsa.  If it's a nice night, there is also seating outside. Is the wait worth it?  Eh.  Depends on your tolerance for waiting.  I am MUCH happier when I have a diet coke and some popcorn to munch on.The food is good -- they make a really big deal about their steaks and you can even go pick out your own.  Not the best steak I've ever had, but certainly very good.  And seems to be good for the price which also includes salad bar, my favorite -- the cheese blocks (really), bread (their breads are very very tasty), and a veggie side.  While I've never been there with a large group, they seem to be able to handle them quite well.  Taste of Texas is a fun place to go -- I enjoy it.  Just go early or expect to wait.  But they'll take good care of you.Oh, and their desserts are fabulous!  Save room!

This place is amazing.  A must go to during Christmas time.  They really spend a lot of time getting that place to feel like a country home Christmas.  The food is amazing along with the service.  Just the salad bar is worth a trip.  Go when you are hungry, because portion size is big along with the price.  The meat selection is big and all the cuts are the best and aged to perfection.  The only downside is the price.  But if you are looking for a nice fancy meal that taste great... Here is your place

Ok, the food is outstanding.  The salad bar is an experience in and of itself.  Don't pass on the salad bar.  The steak selection is second to none as well.  So, why three stars?  The arrogance of the waiter and his lack of attention to our group was indefensible.  He was bragging about how there is no finer steak prepared in all of Houston--that's debatable, but perhaps he should focus a little more on being at least an average waiter by Houston standards.  In my book this dude has a ways to go to make it to "average".

i have always loved the taste of texas.  i went to this restaurant all the time growing up.  it was one of my dad's favorite steakhouses, if not his favorite.  so whenever we had a special occasion, we came here.  their salad bar has always been really one of my favorites. from the various but typical toppings to put on your leaves of choice to the fresh bread over with their selections of butters and not to mention their huge cheese blocks.  their bread and butter definitely melt in your mouth.  it's a great appetizer.  i've always had the 20 oz. t-bone steak when i've gone and it's always been more than i could ever handle.  the flavor is great and i like my steak medium and i like the right amount of red that they've brought everytime i've gotten my steak.  if they aren't running too busy, they sometimes even give you a tour of the kitchen and let you pick out your steak so you know what you're getting.  it's usually done mainly for first timers.their sides definitely support the dish.  i usually go for the baked potato but the wild mushrooms are great as well.  i'm a meat and tators kinda guy so you gotta fill that craving when you can.  did i also mention that IF there is a wait, that they have sort of a complimentary concession stand with free soft drinks, popcorn, and chips and salsa to curb the hunger pains if you have any while you wait.  i like it because it's a steakhouse that isn't stuffy so you can get the high quality without feeling like you should be wearing a suit and tie but you definitely can do so if you'd like.  definitely a houston staple for good steak.

I am a long time customer, but will never go back after the way I was insulted by the manager for taking popcorn to eat at my table. I was told the popcorn was only for people waiting for a table. I said the popcorn is free and why do you feel the need to have "popcorn police" for what amounts to about 10 cents worth of food? On top of this he was so loud, everyone around us heard him scold us for eating the popcorn. I said that if the popcorn isn't for people to eat, then lock it up. We pay around $200 per meal and are outraged to be treated this way. I said you are willing to loose a long time customer over this and he walked away. Will they now ask for ID for people who claim to have birthday celebrations and get a free dessert? There are so many fine steak restaurants in Houston, I will never ever go back to Taste of Texas.
Rumored to have been visited by foreign envoys at some point in time, Taste of Texas serves up memory-searing, sweet, juicy steaks that meat-eaters will always love. Go for dinner. Eat up. Enjoy!
Not worth the time and money. Extremely long wait! Food had no (0) flavor. Please save you time and taste buds and go somewhere else!
The best steaks & salad bar in Houston without a doubt. The wait is 2 hours for a reason, but they do have free snacks & drinks while you wait.

Went here bc the husband is always raving about it. It's good fresh steaks and their sides and salad bar are really good too. Everyone raves about the bread but I didn't think there was anything special about it. I was really impressed they bake it in house though. I don't like waiting more than an hour to eat though.
Go to Texas roadhouse, pay 1/3 the price and get same quality

Went here for a banquet around lunch. Service was great but a little laid back for a restaurant like this. Food was excellent. I had steak medallions with onion strings, brown gravy on the side, aspargus spears,  and a bleu cheese stuffed tomato. The steak was ordered medium rare and came out perfectly. It was juicy with perfect grill marks on the tops. Flavorful enough on it's own to not need the gravy on the side which only added to the flavor rather than cover it. The tomato was not too great, but I don't care much for tomatos anyway. The salad bar was what I would say is only slightly better than average but fresh with a few interesting choices like sundried tomatos and shelled walnuts thrown in there. Desert was rich. I had the tower of a piece of chocolate cake which was so tall they had to prop it up with chocolate straws! It was very moist and satisfying. Overall the restaurant tries hard to be in the five star category but doesn't quite take itself seriously enough to get the extra star.
You know the place is good when you forget that you waited an hr + to get a table and all you remember was the food!!!!!!!  EVERYTHING is good! SERIOUSLY!
The best salad bar!  I get Prime Rib and my wife gets the Filet and have always been very satisfied.  Deserts are superb too.

Disappointing. If you want a good steak, go to Del Frisco Double Eagle, Pappas Brothers or Nick and Sam's. If you want a good salad bar, head over to Fogo de Chao. If you want mediocrity, run to Taste of Texas.
I would really give them ten stars but they only have five. This is the best steakhouse ever no complaints. Service is great and steak is even better. Love the salad bar even though i hate salad.

The BEST salad bar.  The cilantro dressing leaves you craving for more!  But... I don't come for the sald.  I come for the steak.  The first time I dined here was a good dining experience- despite the long wait.  However, my most recent visit was last February for Valentine's.  We had reservations for 6- my recommendation.  We all ordered the prime rib, and it was bleh.  I returned mine for a filet mignon, which was very good.  I was so dissapointed bc the other two couples were hoping for good food...

This place wasn't all it was cracked up to be by other reviews.  I think people in Texas need to get out more to see what a GOOD steakhouse is.  The food wasn't bad, but a 2 hour wait?  Really?  It's certainly not worth that!  The salad bar was alright.  The fresh baked bread was awesome.  Service was mediocre.  Definitely not all it's cracked up to be though!

Best steak restaurant in my life. Of course, there are more expensive but higher quality steak house in US, but Taste of Texas represents the heart of Texas food which I love so much. The #1 restaurant I recommend when I need to accommodate a visitor from Japan.

I have been there a total of 4 times in the past 8 months. It is GREAT. I love it! Every time I go there to eat, the staff is great. I mean they are awesome. Best waiters and waitresses in town. They are friendly and informative, and they also with make sure you have a great dining experience. All four times I have gone to eat there, I always get the slow roasted prime rib. It is superb. Best prime rib I have eaten. I'll just leave it at that. They're salad bar is great. A nice large choice of different things to choose from, but what stood out to me the most was the cilantro vinaigrette. If I knew the recipe for that, I'd eat salad everyday and would never get tired of it. I could eat here every week, but I'd go broke. Great place to eat at for special occasions. There might be a long wait though, but don't worry. They offer free sodas, nachos, and other goods as you wait. Don't fill up though; the main course is the best part!

We arrived about 7:00 on a Thursday. The wait was estimated at about 15 to 30 minutes - we waited a little over 20 minutes. They have free self-serve soft drinks, tea, popcorn & chips while you wait. Would have preferred  a bar with waitress. We were seated and our drink order taken immediately. However it took almost 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive and our order to be taken. To munch on, they brought croutons with cream cheese and sweet salsa. It was outstanding, however they only brought 4 tiny croutons - not much bigger than a silver dollar. More of a tease than anything else.After our order was taken, we went to the salad bar. Other reviews have mentioned a dirty salad bar but this was not the case. It was very clean and all the items were very fresh and appealing. I got a cilantro vinaigrette dressing - it was fantastic. The fresh bread was hot but not anything to write home about.We both ordered prime rib medium rare. Our side was asparagus w/ hollandaise sauce. There meat was cooked properly and very delicious. It came with horseradish sauce and au jus as well as a small cup of miniature fries onions. The horseradish sauce was good but could have used a little punch. The au jus tasted like it came from a packet. It was very salty and institutional tasting. The fried onions were a waste of time. Nevertheless, we both enjoyed the beef so much, the minor imperfections in the other items were tolerable.As for the asparagus, it was too al dente for me but my sister liked it cooked that way. The Hollandaise was fair. Could have been tangier.Overall, I would recommend this place to you.

The Taste of Texas is a good place.  If you live in the Memorial area, you need to try it.  There are better steak places in Houston, but if you want a good steak in a relaxed environment Taste of Texas is worth trying.
in fact.the service is better than the food.the steak is so so.not so special.but the dessert is really good~especially the lime cheesecake~better than in chicago~

Great salad bar (lots of hot, fresh bread)Quite pricey though...I recommend ordering a larger cut of steak and splitting it with your dining companion, rather than ordering a steak each.I ordered a steak medium well, and it came out medium rare... I hope this isn't typicalService was attentive and courteousThey play Christian music throughout the restaurant (which I like)

I went there on a Thursday night and found the wait to be pretty reasonable. They have a separate bar area with drinks and snacks which is a nice touch. Be sure and get the salad bar with your meal, it's awesome. I had the 10 oz filet which was good but not great. Overall it was a good experience and I would go back.

It all starts with the salad bar...that comes with every meal.  That alone could feed me for days.  But I made room for the grilled tenderloin medallions...pure goodness!  And THE best stuffed tomato I've ever had.  This place is just great...great service, food, and ambience!

One of my favorite steak restaurants EVARRR!Why do I love this place so much??  Read below:1) You can wear your nikes and baseball cap and still be able to sit down and enjoy a great piece of steak without anyone giving you the evil eye.2) The salad bar is AWESOME BLOSSOM!  Also includes different types of bread, cheese, and fruit.3) The employees are all so polite... always greeting you when you walk in and when you leave.4) A very extensive wine list at reasonable prices.5) Free popcorn while you wait for your table.6) One of THE BEST prime rib I've ever had.  So juicy, so tender, so perfect!7) Free dessert and picture for your birthday.8) You can pick your own piece of steak if you want.  I've always had them pick my meat for me and have never been disappointed.9) The servers are outstanding!  Always cleaning the table and folding your napkins for you when while you're at the salad bar.10) They give you a caraffe of whatever you're drinking (water, iced tea, coke, etc) so you can fill your own cup when you want.  Of course they'll still come by and refill for you if they notice your cup is emptly.This place is just about perfect.  The only complaint I have is that they do not take reservations, so expect over an hour wait during the weekends because this place gets PACKED!

Always celebrate my birthday here every year, but this year and last have left us with a bad taste in our mouths.  This year, our waitress Melissa, was really lacking in being personable, my daughter and I both felt like she was doing us a service by serving us.  Steaks were good, asparagus tough, much smaller portions of the potatoes au gratin and I've never had creme brulee that didn't have a burnt sugar top on it.   Will definitely think twice about going again back...so sad it use to be the best.
For me, this is a great spot for special occasions. The steaks are always perfect, the salads are amazing and the staff are so friendly. If you can afford it, once a week, if not whenever you can!

I have always had a negative opinion of ToT despite never having eaten there.  Why?  I have no clue, honestly.  I do this quite often.  So I went.  Why?  Well, I have a wife who likes steak and has been really wanting to eat here (and basically every other steak place in the city) for some time.  I kind of like her so I agreed to go along (and by agreed I mean I understood that I had no choice).The ambiance is giant Texas hunting lodge or something.  The service is mucho friendly and attentive.  We both ordered tea and not only did a carafe arrive with our two full glasses, but the waiter would come by and pour me more tea from said carafe before I even realized I might want some.  The clientele was a little scary in just how country so many of them seemed.  Oh yeah, we went at 4:30 and the place wasn't packed but it was busy.Now to food.  I, of course, don't eat steak.  So many of you can now feel free to check out of this review.  All of my life I have disliked steak and especially now that I don't eat any red meat I...uh...don't eat steak.  Usually we are fine because most decent steak restaurants will have a sizable salad or fish (salmon or tuna being most common) offering.  Connie and I have a running joke about this because anytime we go to a restaurant and she orders a big medium rare steak and I get something light or fish-like the waiter or other helper will often bring out our entrees and put hers in front of me and mine in front of her.  Connie loves this because I am like a little girl.  Oh yeah, ToT - they have no fish selection as I prefer but instead have lobster, shrimp, and a veggie plate.  Lobster - no thanks, overpriced and I don't trust strange new restaurants with a difficult protein as most places make it bland and almost tasteless.  Veggie plate - described as consisting of portobello  mushrooms and bell peppers?  Uh, that is not a vegetable plate.  More like unwanted scraps.  No thanks.  Shrimp - I am very picky about these guys because I am sensitive to that "shrimpy" taste of either the not fresh or low quality selection.  They offer grilled and stuffed.  I went for the stuffed because it had jalapenos and was described as lightly fried.  I love jalapenos and thought that could work.  For me that was the first mistake.  The second was that the waiter said it only came with six and I could round it out to ten if I added a shrimp side.  I hadn't eaten all day so I asked how big they are and he made a finger gesture that suggested they were fairly small.  So, sure, supersize me.  HUGE mistake.  Maybe the actual shrimp was a small as he showed but the "pieces of shrimp" were giant because they were colossally breaded to be six inch diameter behemoths.  Of the four I ate (yes, I ordered ten) two were decent but had no real taste other than breading and some mild jalapeno, one was a bit "shrimpy", and one was badly "shrimpy".  I was sad.  I went back to the salad bar rather than eat any more of that garbage.Speaking of the salad bar, I expected a grand spectacle of vegetation and a cold cut colosseum after hearing so much about it.  Eh, it was fine.  DIY lettuces with a smallish selection of add-ons and a big selection of dressings.  The black and black-eyed bean salads were great a were most of the other pre-made mini-salads.  I didn't feel like bothering with the giant cheese blocks because they were nothing special and felt so exposed with everybody touching them to slice some pieces off.  Two of the three breads were great - cornbread and the round one - and the cinnamon butter sent me to happy land.I am sure Connie will weigh in eventually but her steak was not good and it was on a stupid, tiny cow plate that made eating difficult.I will not go back but they don't need me to with the traffic they get.

I was disappointed when we went for our 1 year anniversary. We were seated by a table where 2 different families with screaming kids were seated. It was the least romantic dinner (but one of the most expensive) I've ever had. The server was good, but he wasn't very hospitable. He seemed a little distant. The food was excellent; some of the best steak I've ever had. Make sure you ask for a quiet section. And if you bring kids with you, please be sure you're considerate of other diners.

HOLY COW, no pun intended! I was in Houston for a work conference on a quick trip and was recommended this restaurant by the rent-a-car place near Houston Hobby airport. I had my speculation that this restaurant was not going to be good, maybe another chain restaurant in the city. Boy was I wrong. The restaurant was near the highway which made it pretty simple to find. Once I found the place I was thrown back to a different era. The place is like a cabin up in the mountains with plenty of ceiling space so you don't feel claustrophobic. On a Wednesday the wait was 45 minutes to sit down. I opted instead for the bar with a full menu. The guy at the rental car place told me to try the quail bits. At 17 dollars for an appetizer I thought it was kinda steep but thought I might as well try it. It was deep fried quail wrapped with bacon. It was good. I could of done with out the glorified jalapeno poppers on the same plate though, but that is what cuts the price. I then had the prime-rib for dinner. A 16 ounce cut of beef that was awesome. This ribeye was one of the best tasting that I have had in a long time. Great deep beef flavor and my side dish was Texas scallop potatoes. Everything was great here. If I am ever in the city and want some steak I will head to this place. Awesome place. Steep on price, but well worth it.
Excellent steaks, salad bar, and warm roll selection.  One of our favorites in Houston.

The BF and I came here for his birthday since he is a big beef lover. I wouldn't call this a romantic restaurant, it felt more of a family friendly restaurant. So parents feel free to bring your kids! My BF LOVED our waiter. He was really nice, and friendly, and took us on a tour of the kitchen which was pretty cool. I let the BF order for us since it was his birthday. We started out with the stuffed mushrooms since the BF loves mushrooms. The mushrooms were okay. I don't think I would order them again since there were more yummy looking appetizers on the menu. The BF ordered a 16 oz steak for us to share. The steak came with either a salad or a trip to the salad bar. Since the BF does not like salad, he got a plain Cesar salad. I was a bit disappointed he didn't want a trip to the salad bar since I love salad bars due to the plethora of delicious choices. When the Cesar salad come out, it come in a cool cheese bowl that was delicious. I got a Baked Potato Soup while the BF ate his salad. The soup was okay; I wouldn't order it again. We shared a 16 oz steak. It was too bad that I was not too hungry because the steak here was delicious. For dessert, they let the BF order anything off of the dessert menu except for the chocolate cake, which was the one thing that he really wanted. Apparently, they don't make the cake at the restaurant and order it from another place. When the dessert come out with sparklers, the waiter took our picture with a Polaroid camera, put it in a paper Taste of Texas frame, and gave it to us. I thought that the picture was a really nice touch and a great marketing strategy. Unfortunately due to the price, the BF and I will be coming back here on special occasions...like our upcoming 1 year and 6 month anniversary!

I took 4 co-workers from out of town here last week, and couldn't have had a better experience.  From the first person who greeted us at the door to the server and salad bar guy, everyone was very gracious, efficient and obviously very well trained. The food was excellent. Too bad they don't take reservations.

Cool presentation and unique set up (at least it used to be). The steak is good but not great, plus they have a lot of competition in the area now days. So they need to step it up. The staff is always nice.

The high priced steaks are totally worth it due to the amazing salad bar. Fresh hot bread... sliced cheeses.  and fresh veggies galore. Honestly one of my favorites in Houston. I also like how they ask you how you want your steak flavored, and the casual atmosphere is great. Sucks they don't take reservations.

I love this place...Why???Great wait staff to begin with ... they know their menus and can explain anything you ask..Great Wine List...was even lsited in Wine Spectator this year as having a terrific wine list...And ... of course ... mmmmmm great steaks cut to your personal thickness..OOO did I mention dessert????LOL

Sometimes I wake up singing... "I wanna be a billionaire and eat at Taste of Texas... SO FREAKIN BAD!!"  lol! No but really.. this place is exceptionally good. Their salad bar is amazing: they have a plethora of salad options as well as two huge blocks of cheese (white and yellow)!! I love cheese and you have no idea how great this is.. you can put it on your salad, in your soup, eat it by itself. Anything your heart desires. They also have lots of breads on the salad bar, one of which being cheese bread! Baller. Did I mention the best part?? Salad bar comes free with any entree. Extra legit. The menu itself is even better, they have juicy steaks and chicken dishes as well as lobster for the expensive tastes! I personally love the cheesy potatoes (ok, you get it now I assume, I love cheese). The center cut filet is always juicy and cooked to perfection. If you can imagine this restaurant getting better, it does when you get to the desserts. Great selection and free dessert for every birthday/anniversary with a sparkler!! The waitstaff is ALWAYS very accomodating which really puts the cherry on top of this restaurant for me :)

If you are in the mood for some meat, this is the place.  The only reason that you would ever come to this restaurant is for a big hunk of meat, and there is nothing wrong with that.  The portions here are huge, you can get a 32 oz steak if you please!  Other than the meat everything else was just OK.  The service was very good here, and the ambiance was good too (not too Texan for me).  A meal here can get pricey, but I would say it is worth the price.

one thing you've gotta know about texas:  they love to eat... and they don't quite care about portion control! man, the fact that this place is packed every single day of the week, almost all day and that  they made this place HUGE so it could accomodate, i don't know, a few hundred people, was impressive enough.  then there's about a 1:5 ratio of servers to partrons... it says a lot about how texans know how to chow down!  i must have seen 6 huge groups of people celebrating in the main dining room and then the rest of us... families, couples, singles, just there for the meat, meat, meat!  i mean, they even let you chose your own cut if you want to!   the portions are huge;  the salad bar selection, very impressive;  and  there's gargantuan blocks of cheese that you can shave hunks off of... hunks!!   and the range of prices accomodates everyone... $6-$8 for burgers, salads and sandwiches.  $25-$35 for the steaks.... cooked to order or you're welcome to send it back.  when it comes to steak, there's no room for error, ya hear? yeah, and loved the fact that they have a popcorn machine and drinks for those that wait.  they think of everything when it comes to the art of eating, those texans... i left the place, discretely hiding my unbuttoned jeans with my doggy bag.

I'm a bit of a traditionalist. For example I believe scotch should only be served neat, on the rocks, and only cut with water. I also believe that steaks should never be served more than medium-rare and only seasoned with salt, pepper and garlic. But every now and then I'll come across something that blows my mind and turns my world upside down. So on my first visit, when I decided to try the lemon pepper and garlic butter on my bone-in filet, I was a bit apprehensive. I got the butter garlic on the side, so I didn't use that much of it, but I'm confident in declaring this was pretty much the best steak I've ever had....ever. In fact, everything I eat now pales in comparison. All of a sudden other foods feel uninspired and taste bland. The day seems a little bit grayer and drags on into perpetuity.  I never knew I could feel this way about steak. If I was capable of shedding tears, I would have cried. This is the kind of steak that makes me feel bad for vegetarians, because they'll never know this kind of unbridled bliss. I'm salivating now just thinking about the steak. I can't wait to go back and add color back into my world.

Simply amazing. This place provides great tasting food and large portions for reasonable prices. It is a little difficult to find and easy to miss the entry driveway but is a definite must if you come to Houston. Their salad bar is so huge that you will probably get stuffed before touching your steak. All meat is fresh not frozen. My favorites are always the prime rib, filet migeon, and their apple butter. All melt in your mouth! They do not take reservations, and we waited over two hours for a large table one Christmas weekend, but it was well worth the wait.

WORTH EVERY DIME!  They have steaks, cut your own steak from the in house butcher, great sides, great atmosphere and drinks.  This place is worth the extra cost for a great date night or family night.
my kids love this place, school took them here and thats all they talk about!!!!!

I am from California and whenever in Houston make it a point to go here. Been going here for almost 20 years. Food/quality / service is so good I would make the move for this Restaurant. -----The best part I am a total vegetarian when in California break all rules when at the Taste of Texas.--- Prefer the older location.
Other than the wait, primarily on weekends, this is one of the best steaks in town.  Ambience is more casual, good place to take kiddos.  Food ranks up there with Pappas Bros and Del Friscos.

Hands down the best filet mignon I have ever eaten in my life.  I'm gonna go out on a limb, but even without the steak, the salad bar and bread alone would justify the high prices and long wait time.  If you're in the Houston area and looking for a high class dinner and great dining experience, you've got to try this place.

Taste of Blandness?  After reading all the hype about Taste of Texas I was looking forward to trying it out.  First of all, the parking lot is a disaster, it is almost always pretty much full (came here two times and the lot was so full, wait so long that we left...finally came early enough on a Sunday to park way at the end of the lot) and there is no valet option. Oh, and they don't take reservations so show up early for dinner. The decor made me feel like I was inside a big log cabin, which was a good feeling.  The salad bar is buffett style and there are plenty of options including fresh fruit and bread, I'd give the salad bar a solid A-.   Now onto the wine menu, they go out of their way to publish their wine prices versus some other expensive steak houses in Houston, amusing, if a bit tacky.  For the main course, I figured a porterhouse steak would be a good way to try two of their steaks since a porterhouse is a strip on one side and filet on the other.  Asked for it medium rare, which they seemed to nail.  The steak had the restaurant's trademark grill marks on it, for whatever reason that gave me a bad impression and reminded me of a Sizzler steak, alas my initial instinct was correct.  The filet side was tender, but lacked flavor and seemed a bit chewy at times.  The strip side was very tough and also had no flavor and at times I thought maybe I was chewing a piece of cardboard. So aside from the flavor, a bad cut as well. Perhaps one of the worst porterhouses I've ever had, although I consider Peter Luger in New York to be the benchmark for porterhouse steak.  There are far better steakhouses in Houston (Del Frisco's, Capital Grille, Pappa's, Vic & Anthony's), if you love salad bars then Taste of Texas is for you, but if you love steak, then try another place.
Great atmosphere, steaks and wine. 32 ounce steak was insane. Definitely recommended. Much much much better than any chain.

so back in August when i went for a visit to see my man our last meal befoer i left back to cali was here..."The Taste of Texas"...how fitting...we had a reservation and we asked to have a drink at the bar first so we did and then let the hostess know that we were ready to be seated. she took us to this table that was right next to some type of bachleorette party..uhhh NO....i asked to be resat and she looked at me like i was crazy...so i should technically take off a star for that but the rest of the night made up for her ignorance...(little hostess)...anywho we were reseated and the server came us to us and asked for our drink order...i started with a glass of chardonnay and the bf had a beer lol....the only thing that i didnt care for was the fact that they had a salad bar instead of bring you a salad...for the money that you pay i dont think that i should have to get up and go make my own salad...of course russell loved this part LoL...must go along with the "everythings bigger in texas"...anywho i ordered the 16oz.new york strip with the herb rub or whatever they recommended and butter and all that jazz...also i got a side of au gratin potatoes...super cheesy and garlic-y...i also had a wonderful glass of pinot noir with my steak...i only ate half it was so big and cooked to a perfect Mid Rare just how i ordered it...the bf took the other half home (to have with an egg for breakfast the next morning!)...i talked russ into having the prime rib since he had never had it before and its one of my favorites...he asked for it to be Medium and thats just how it came...man he like devoured the whole thing...he loved it (woohoo)...we passed on dessert b/c we had ice cream at the house...service was great (minus the hostess)...salad bar (get rid of it, its really tacky in such a nice place)....food (A +++)
